ndmXf7FlFoLTS3sj_sUxxw.text: I've eaten at Hash a few times and each time both the food quality and level of service have been best in class.

cDP-GPQaJhrGuntePV3hRQ.text: Omg!!! 5 out of 5! I highly recommend this place! So so so yummy and cute! As soon as you walk in you see the cutest Bloody Mary bar where you can make your own Bloody Marys. We got the mimosa flights, so good! And started out with the breakfast bruschetta (get It). Our server Lona is outstanding! So sweet and helpful. Everything about this place is great and will forsure be back!

SawJas__4vMQXfbTJajDQA.text: Amazing experience! Fun, relaxing and friendly place. Lots of hash at our table, but I had the Coconut Encrusted French Toast with caramelized bananas. Yum! hvBI8VcJDp7YDWMjmp1Hkg.text: BEST brunch in AZ! Great customer service! The staff is super friendly, informative, and continue to check and make sure you have everything to your liking! The lady up front is the sweetest and cutest! The Amazing Bloody Mary bar is to die for with anything and everything you can think of including oyster! I had the lump crab sweet potato hash which was SO freakin delicious! Thinking about it right now is making my mouth water!!! My husband had pork Benedict and I ate half of that too! Yum! Kids had biscuits and gravy, pancakes, eggs and bacon. They LOVED it and it's all great portions!! This is definitely my favorite place for brunch! I can't wait till next weekend to come back!!!!

zhi-1UPiB4Nx04cnuvpeZQ.text: This place is amazing, great food and great ambience.  I had chicken & waffle....it was delish. I went with a group of friends, they all enjoyed there entrees.    The owner is very friendly and outgoing......she was dancing the entire time we were there!   Will definitely go back.

rBaJyZT3ndRxFY3TuEGcdg.text: Quickly, coz I don't like to dwell in bad emotions. I will never go back to this place.    Our favorite breakfast restaurant had a one-hour wait time on the Saturday morning of Memorial Weekend so we decided try The Hash instead. What a mistake!  They had a DJ who played really loud music. Annoyingly loud club music...and this is a breakfast restaurant. What's disconnect! So we asked to be seated outside where it was quieter. That's how the experience started. Bad omen! We ordered a frittata and a waffle. Both of which were very blend and completely lack taste. The service was lackluster.   On a good note, the food was served really warm and the tea was fantastic. But, with dozen of breakfast location choices around the area, it's not going to be enough to bring me back.

V1Khd1F8BQdfTG-XPjLeMQ.text: My girlfriend and I have been going to Hash regularly over the past year and every time Bonnie welcomes us like we're family and makes sure everything is perfect. Might be because my girlfriend is from Cleveland and Bonnie is from Akron and both of them love the Cavs, but I digress.  Every time we're there the service is amazing and the food is incredible. I don't know if we've ever had the same thing twice from their menu. Whether it's couples' brunch, friends visiting, or a nice place for a family meal you can't go wrong with Hash Kitchen.

0Cy3wkyyxheToVpmX4Hc6Q.text: I recently took my mother here whilst she was visiting from out of town. She loved the food, as did I. I don't remember what she ordered but I believe I had the crab fritata, which was excellent. They even sealed the rest of our San Pellegrino to-go for us. The service was above and beyond despite the restaurant being incredibly busy. I look forward to returning here with my wife.

1FACIRFMGFn1vlLbP4xQEQ.text: Super fun place for brunch, food was delicious and the Bloody Mary Bar is an added bonus.(My advise... Get the Lump crab with sweet potato hash...simply yummness) Def. recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My masterpiece... I was feeling artsy and hungry...Meal and drink in one glass.

nm3L6RiJ0FRZfuMWpxOpKQ.text: Love this place! Lona provided us with great service and recommended some really good meals! There are so many mimosa choices and each one was delicious  We will definitely be coming back for brunch soon!

ICHzShwfbdAAq0KRdrwJkA.text: Having come from out of state the reviews and allure of a Bloody Mary bar and mimosas grabbed our attention. The food was very tasty and the drinks held their own. However, the service left much to be desired. After waiting less than 10 minutes for a table we waited 15 minutes for a server to arrive. Another 10 minutes to get menus and waters, and another 10 before we were asked if we would like to order. Our waitress kept forgetting we were in her section and acted as if we were an inconvenience. Definitely will not be returning.

CWWvp6eAXSrIdRNxCJDVIA.text: The happiest place on Scottsdale road!!! Friendliest staff and most delicious food!  From cocktails to bottomless mimosas this place knows how to party. The DJ on Sunday kept the vibe alive as Nana Bonnie and Aunt Linda were the hostess with the mostess.  Evan was just heaven with his prompt service and world class personality!!  We will definitely be coming back!! Did I mention the Bloody Mary bar?!!!

fjsr-0vhsDzk-XdmOqbw_w.text: The food and the ambience is amazing! We ordered the chilaquiles and the breakfast cannoli and everything was so good! The breakfast cannoli was my favorite! We met Bonnie, she was very friendly and made us feel welcomed!

-x7BLhCs5iSa_MQOKFZY9g.text: Stopped in very early for breakfast, had an amazing time especially for Friday morning. Our waiter/server was amazingly funny and very helpful with the menu. DhOGHedGsr46D5JLyrLhCQ.text: My fiance and I went to hash kitchen on a Thursday so we didn't get the weekend experience , which the owner told us is completely different from a week day due to the fact of a DJ who comes and amount of younger people that come there . She also said if you're trying to go on a weekend it's reservations only . The bloody bar was very good with plenty of quality  ingredients to choose from .  I ordered the breakfast burrito which was phenomenal and my fiance had  their pancakes with berries. She's a fan of sugar free syrup, but she had one taste of their homemade syrup and loved it. If you have children bringing them on a weekday would be easy , I probably wouldn't try it on a weekend though. All in all it's a very good place to eat and would definitely return.

You HAVE to try the breakfast Popsicles. Biscuits are freshly made from scratch and taste like little nuggets of heaven when you add their berry jam. FAd1sIDr7EXYEgcNRmlLcg.text: We had a weird experience here. First off, the staff doesn't seem to answer the phone, so we were unable to call ahead. The wait was 45 minutes so we walked around the shopping center for a while.  The environment inside is LOUD. If we'd known how bad it would be, we probably wouldn't have gone. I've been at concerts that hurt my ears less, but the place was packed so we figured it would be good. When we were seated on the patio, we were placed next to some very loud and increasingly drunk individuals, which was a bit irritating. The wait staff seemed totally flustered-- several different people attended to us throughout the visit.  While the food was pretty good (and so were the drinks), the fact that we waited almost an hour for the food was ridiculous. We were "placated" by a random woman bringing over cannoli on the house, while apologizing for the wait. I think they did this for a lot of people. Ironically, our food arrived just as she left. We were also given drinks on the house as well.  Our server was okay, a little over the top with a Pauly D personality. I would have preferred if he'd just apologized sincerely for the wait instead of bringing out food and drinks we really didn't need.  Definitely won't go back. Too expensive, too loud, and too much of a wait.

uRmQiUhIoW9RuoWkajmKXQ.text: we are here from Oregon celebrating a bachelorette party and had such amazing service and food! Patrick was our server he was so wonderful and fun!

ziHCw6wi5h2W4zAPUyHS_g.text: Wow! Such an amazing place with the largest servings. Best service. Beyond impressed! I shared the Avocado Hash Toast!

QQKS8xRs3_jwAJb4O4rpFA.text: The food here is beautiful and SOOOO good! Prices are really good for the quality of the food. The atmosphere of there area is happy or uplifting. Employees are nice too! The layout of the place is really cool! Smells a little bit like bleach though. Otherwise Awesome!!!!!

i4EivBApPs4mBiVoQIfj6g.text: Ordered the huevos rancheros hash and it was sooooo good. Would definitely come back and order the exact same thing. It's huge though...I couldn't finish even close to all the potatoes so make sure to come hungry!!  I went fairly early on a Saturday..maybe around 9:15 or 9:30 and I think about an hour into our meal a DJ set up and started playing really loud dance music. I didn't mind it at all, but just a heads up that it's not chill breakfast spot once the rowdy brunch crowd comes in!  Taking one star off because they ran out of coffee mugs and served us coffee in to-go mugs LOL. They came back with real mugs later, it's just a little odd...although the waiter assured us they were getting a shipment of more mugs on Monday.

pXRm5ge0XdvL8B4wahM0SQ.text: If nothing else, get yourself one of the Build Your Own Bloody Mary's. It's customizable with their house infused flavored vodkas, regular, medium, or hot tomato juice, and all the different add-ons (read: bacon, slim jims, stuffed olives, and ohemgee fried raviolis). The wait for a table is long, definitely not the 25 minutes we were promised, but their bloody mary definitely made it a little more tolerable.  To be honest, the wait, insane crowd, and mediocre service largely attributed to this average rating. People were cutting lines left and right, be it trying to get your name in to get a table, or getting yourself a bloody mary, customers often were oblivious or deliberately ignoring the lines the rest of us had formed and the wait staff did nothing to provide service to the people who had been patiently waiting in line. That in itself was my first disappointment.  At the table, I'll cut my waiter some slack since the restaurant was basically at the point of chaos. We got the huevos rancheros hash, which was delish, but the apple pie pancakes were just okay. It was a stack of four plain pancakes with apple pie fillings and crumbs on the top. However, the bottom three pancakes were pretty dry and I found my little cup of syrup empty in no time at all. I do really appreciate that our waiter noticed this and offered to bring more syrup, though unfortunately, I was basically done at this point.  All in all, decent experience but I'm in no hurry to stop by for a weekend brunch since the crowd is just off-putting.

CfK2TUJAfoHRa3LMVE5x7w.text: This place is trying to hard to be - something. The fact that it doesn't really know what it wants to be is part of the problem. The food is decent. Large portions of diner type food. But nothing fabulous. The bar offering is large. And the make your own Bloody Mary bar is a fun idea. But the best part of the bar is the menu and ordering - certainly not drinking the "meh" concoctions. And the scene - if this place is trying to be the "after club" scene with the loud music and surely front desk staff - then you got those two things down. But what would need to be an "after the club" hang out is to be actually cool - and not located in a strip mall serving brunch to first date match.com clientele. Turn down the volume, build on the decent food offering and learn how to execute a drink - and own the fact that you are in a strip mall.

YmKoQYfe5LIGAtnn0hRDNQ.text: I really love this restaurant and the food and drinks are great, but every time I come, they give me different answers on what is gluten free. It makes enjoying this place very difficult. I wish they'd train the staff better and mark the menus.

s7oLRn5ImgdXsT2yrMyksg.text: This place is the place to see and be seen in Scottsdale. There are multiple locations, but I'm assuming they're all busy for brunch. They have a crazy large bloody mary bar. It was a cold and windy day in scottsdale and we waited 30-40 min for an outside table for just two people on a Saturday for brunch around 11ish. There's a live DJ inside. If you were hoping to talk to people inside, the music is pretty loud, so that probably won't happen. However, the bloody mary bar has the most toppings i've ever seen. The food was ok not fantastic but for how busy they were I was pretty surprised with how quickly it all came out. I think you definitely go here for the experience and people watching. Seems to be really popular for bachelorette parties as well.

P94ZHR845HYpkpAgVZY7Xw.text: Unique breakfasts at these chains .Attractive inside.Prices slightly higher than a breakfast joint but not out of site.The coffee was good and the waitress was great.They do offer cocktails.Worth a visit.

lG1Mus3txT9Nv_CNuhrjhg.text: Great fun place. Bloody Mary bar was legit and fun. My skillet did have a crap ton of potatoes but the rest of it was really good. Wife had some salmon thing that was great. Service was quick and enjoyable. Cheers. Solid place.

ZKWDe30ayRJqQnM9hlwnug.text: This place is poppin' on Sundays for brunch. Was in Scottsdale for a tournament this past weekend and after playing and reffing kickball in the rain for 9 hours straight, let's just say my friends and I went hard Saturday night. We were pretty much dying for food Sunday morning. We didn't get out to this place til around 12 and we had to wait an hour before we could get seated.   There's indoor and outdoor seating, along with small tables and a huge bar. Right at the entrance, there's a Bloody Mary station where you can make your own Bloody Mary. The line for that was longggg.   It has a decent sized menu with SO MANY AMAZING THINGS to choose from. Everything sounded delicious, I really couldn't decide, but I went with the Lump Crab & Sweet Potato Hash. It was reallyyy good, but I thought it was going to be like corned beef hash with the lump crab and sweet potato on top. I was sortaaaa disappointed, but it was really good nonetheless.   Service was good for the most part. Our server was nice, but I could tell he was busy and we sort of just asked for all the things we needed at once because we weren't sure when we'd see him next. Prices are decent -- $12-16 but you get a HUGE amount. I definitely want to come back to try more things, but maybe come in earlier so we don't have to wait as long. Definitely worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab and sweet potato hash!

PfPnI4JNUox92inooDUDQw.text: Too loud!  I love the food and the Bloody Mary bar, but cannot go anymore. Music is way above the level needed to create buzz or vibe. Cannot talk to or hear dining companions. And they won't turn it down. Oh, well. If you don't mind a very loud atmosphere, then you'll enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

GYdLXVW-XxqezhTlnqP90w.text: My husband and I enjoyed a pre-hike brunch at this spot during our recent vacation to Scottsdale. The decor is trendy and the music is moderately-loud but we didn't feel overwhelmingly so (though if you're looking for a quiet, intimate brunch experience, this may not be the place for you). Our waiter was friendly, attentive and visited often. The menu was expansive and included all the brunch classics. Although our waiter advised us the avocado toast was enough to feed both of us, we were indecisive and ultimately ended up ordering both the "HK style" avocado toast and the salmon eggs benedict. The Benedict was delicious, from the warm biscuit on the bottom to the light, fresh, and perfectly cooked salmon. Between the two of us, my husband and I easily polished this off. The Avocado Toast, which you can see by other user-submitted photos is nothing like normal avocado toast. It's huge, with fresh brioche that is delicious but slightly too thick, in our opinion. The bread is warm and soft, not toasted to give the satisfying crunch of a typical avocado toast, and while the pork and chili topping was delicious, the avocado was a bit lost beneath it. This may just be a matter of personal preference, since many other reviewers seemed to like it. It's definitely a meal for two people, so take that into account before you order. All the other food coming out of the kitchen looked great as well, as did the build your own Bloody Mary bar, and the place was busy with several parties waiting for tables around 10am on a weekday.  Overall, delicious food and great atmosphere. If we're back in town, we will return.

fnQ6-Q_a86ksfmcCXl3xBQ.text: OMG!!!  Bloody Mary bar - The Best!!!  So much fun, reasonable prices, DJ (added coolness)!!! If you get Debbie, you've lucked out even more!!!

Ym9rAQejLKCf9nSx4MiFow.text: Had a birthday brunch at Hash for my friend's mom. They said it would be a 20-60 min wait but we ended up getting in right away! It was Sunday midday so it was packed.   The restaurant is one big room, very open and loud. There's not a lot of decor but the atmosphere is bright and lively.   I started with a Bloody Mary from the Bloody Mary bar. You get to choose your salt rim, vodka and mix flavors, in addition to like FORTY skewer options!   To eat I had the Oreo pancakes. The stack was massive and had good taste, but I thought they were a little dry and cakey.   Overall it was a really cool place but for such a crowded and expensive place I wasn't too impressed.

CoT3hVdtHcHALNXfbA2KiQ.text: We had flat iron steak hash and I think my husband had carnitas hash, it was all pretty mediocre and we thought underwhelming for their prices.. lots of the dry little square cut (similar to French fries) hash..this is what they call hash, disappointing! I counted two small squares of green pepper in mine and a tiny bit of onion.. I wouldn't go back.

V-HGCqxPVkkwWGsoQp8IXw.text: Came for lunch at around 11:30am; the service was sooooo slowwwww and nobody that worked there looked happy at all. We ordered the Benedict fries and they were good, but not that impressive. My friend ordered the shrimp salad, and I had the mesquite salmon salad. Yooooo I had no idea I was getting smoked salmon. There's a big difference. My salmon was jiggly squishy and while full of smoke flavor, was seriously disturbing. Her plate had like 6 shrimp on it. My salad had big slimy chunks of oranges with tomatoes and crumbly goat cheese (I think). Someone is high down there because those really all together just don't go! I did go to a breakfast/brunch spot and ordered a salad, so I digress...

h1Zs19W_w9ltHf_Pp2_07A.text: (Lyrics - Weezer - Hash Pipe)  I can't help my hunger, I'll go out of my mind This kitchens got it going cause I like their breakfast I can't love my singing if I can't get a drink Down some Bloody Mary's at a bar that I make  Ohhh, come on and make me Ohhh, come on and make me Whoa...! Come on and make me Whoa...! You've got some olives Whoa...! I want some peppers Whoa...! You've got some big pours Right at the Hash Kitchen  A former seafood restaurant The Hash Kitchen is now a head on Breakfast/Brunch restaurant with some fun flares!  I came here after a hike; my friend had her pup so we requested to be sat outside on the patio.  Needless to say, they were happy to oblige....yah!  As we walked pass the restaurant the place was hoping; I'm not sure if it was because of the PHX Open, but there were a lot of patrons along with a live DJ.  One thing noticeable about this place is the round Bloody Mary Table -- it's a MIY Bloody Mary bar!    To start I ordered the French Press coffee with the Smoked Sliced Brisket & Corn Beef Hash.  Of course I had to do the Bloody Mary bar!  I selected the Siracha Bloody Mary with Vodka; stuffing it with celery, baby corn, carrots, peppercini peppers, jalapenos, olives, bacon, and beef jerky.  I couldn't stuff it anymore at some point cause I would have!  Needless to say, it was fun and yum at the same time.  Moreover, I got the entire canister of the French Press coffee!  My hash came with green peppers and a poached egg on top.  I thought it was pretty basic, but still good.  I wanted some texture hoping the hash would be somewhat crunchy.    In the end, I gave this place my best because the ambiance was popping and the service was impeccable!  The place catered to my friends pup and our server kept coming out to serve him water too!  We were constantly asked if we need more of this or that and our waters kept full!  We had one main server, but managers and bussers came to our attention without a hitch.  Definitely my new favorite spot for breakfast! - Enjoy!

VSQRlx56YCTOUymo50W3Xw.text: Super fun atmosphere, really good drinks, and suchhh good food. Definitely have a return costumer from me

1IypaRSRIQvHCfKiGhirBQ.text: I drove from Goodyear for this...  As I walked in I noticed all 3 hostesses looked stressed and did not smile will greeting us. One hostess had a skirt on that I'm sure was made for a Barbie. Food was good but I wasn't like "WOW". Did I step into a restaurant or night club? Music was way to loud to enjoy a conversation without yelling at 10am, let alone hear the waitress! All I could hear were people at tables near me shouting because of the loud music. I sat and watched as a manager would only cater to large groups and not address tables of 4 or less. My waitress was nice but I could hardly hear her speak. She took our order, came by to see if all was well and then to hand over the check. I could've used another cup of coffee but I guess not. Overall.... meh! Idk if I'd make that drive again for an overpriced meal and a headache.

uk1M5kS2O6lln_WGfChRiA.text: Our waitress, Lona, was simply the best. What a sweetheart. Definitely will come back because of her and the great food. Amazing all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

q0yRkpa4BKQncOAMRye9Iw.text: Our 1st visit here and totally loved it! The service was great, fast, and the food was amazing. Ingredients were fresh and the RUMCHATA iced coffee was soooo perfect for brunch. The Bloody Mary bar was way beyond my expectations and kept the flow moving: it was kinda like watching kids in a candy store, all the adults were having a great time! It was a nice, refreshing atmosphere. Music playing in the background, but not so loud that you could barely have a conversation. The manager even greeted us, asking about our experience and wished us well. It was overall a great experience and I look forward to coming back here time and time again.

IHHIn3-m8K3maxcWXkAR0Q.text: I'm here again to this wonderful establishment with the cousins and as always, crazy wonderful drinks are amazing the Bloody Mary Bar is legit and no joke, food is wonderful and taste is phenomenal. But most of all the atmosphere with the servers, hostess, manager is on point. Much appreciation to Linda and Bonnie. Say hello to Lisa at the Bloody Mary bar she knows how to whip it up. Evan was out server.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WuNDxyYw2lCXF7XmoLONwQ.text: What a great place to have a bloody Mary... The staff is wonderful and Sarah our server was the best! Definitely coming here again!

rjOeBh89riHyiqEVh22TQA.text: Hash kitchen was awesome. They have a wide open space a very comfortable atmosphere and great vibes with the dj. Would 10/10 recommend to a friend. Diane also lead my down the yellow brick road to a very taste Bloody Mary bar.

GlmNSW9Ln6m7SS60Lo_8hQ.text: I truly love this place.  I don't live in Phoenix but I have visited twice in two months and I always want to go here.  The atmosphere for a True brunch is totally there.  I love making my own bloody mary and loading it up.  The chicken and waffles are awesome and seriously the DJ is always on point.  The service can be slow at times but totally worth the wait.  The servers are always helpful and super nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love love this place! DJ is killing it! Service is great... and the good doesn&#39;t disappoint! If you don&#39;t get a Bloody Mary...you&#39;re wrong!

snNu3MHTRDXZh1BnPSM_cQ.text: I went here after my wedding this past Saturday and the service was amazing!!! We had a party of 30 and it did take a little while to get everyone seated but Bonnie was a sweetheart the entire time we were there. We did not make reservations so we understood and were very patient. She kept checking in on us and making sure that we were ok while we waited and some of us sat at the bar until a bigger table was ready. The red grapefruit mimosas were SO good! The French toast and poached eggs were excellent! The food was excellent overall, the music kept us entertained and my family and friends had a ball!!! Bonnie, we love you and we will be back! Thank you for everything! Xoxo

yQ22iMBYGEBDqb7tkslH4Q.text: This place is the bomb. The food is extraordinary. The Bloody Mary bar is so rich and delicious. The banana split French toast is to die for. We keep coming back. Alec has served us twice already here and we just love him. We love his energy, his sense of humor and his service is top-notch. This place hands down is the best brunch place in Scottsdale.

PNeAEa3tXxg_VMtRnSXnSQ.text: So glad I found this place!  Went there 2 of 3 days I was in Scottsdale.  Had the pleasure of being served by Alec on both days who was super cool and gave great recs.  We had the carnitas hash, crab benedict, apple pie pancakes and crab roll.  Our favorites were the pancakes and crab roll.  The pancakes were super fluffy and with the apple and pie crush paired with ice cream was soooooo freaking good.  The crab roll was superb.  We also paired it with 2 bloody marys and loaded it with oyster, bacon, pickles, slim jims, beef jerky, celery, blue cheese olives...need I say more?    Next time I am in Scottsdale I will definitely be back here.

g7xd9V3f6h-sHzQ5ip6kEw.text: This restaurant was everything we were looking for this morning! The most amazing Bloody Mary bar and the food was off the charts! I had the chicken and waffles which were amazing! We also enjoyed the chicken benedict, the carnitas hash and the avocado, tomato and mozzarella scrambler, all excellent choices! The kiwi mimosas were awesome!!! Amy was a great host and made us out-of-towners feel like we were at home. And if you get Gino as your waiter, you're in for a treat!!! We need one of these in both Pittsburgh and DC!!!!!

ItMIB2SI181Ghmp-m-2dTw.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING !  Food was incredible, Bloody Mary bar a must and the service was impeccable. Todd, Mgr walked by and checked on us made us feel special.  Will definitely be back this month.

VekeHDiq1EafohmpdnjjPw.text: Wow!!! Hash Kitchen has quickly become my favorite breakfast/brunch spot in AZ!! Lona always treats me like family and goes out of her way to make sure my dining experience is perfect. The chicken and waffles is the best I've ever had!! So thankful to have found this gem!

SlLysIO0bcaUysed_kF30w.text: Amazing flavor and options!  We had the Salmon egg Benedict and the Americano scrambler. Enjoyed both.

70Z7mVKF0IgJI-TomgJ-Ig.text: Awesome hash, great atmosphere and that bloody mary bar is no joke. Fun for a group or even just a couple of people enjoying brunch. Always busy, but wait times have always been reasonable.

Ssm2wk1lLE1LSrZsgGFI1A.text: So many delicious menu items to choose from. It was hard to make a decision... It was a seafood kind of day so we ended up trying the crab roll and crab Benedict. The Benedict was very good, but could have used a little something more to top it (aside from the usual). The crispy potatoes/hash were also good. The roll was tasty and it was served as 2 rolls - perfect for sharing. The fries were perfectly crisp yet tender and nicely salted.   On another occasion tried the pancake flight- yum!! A variety of sweet treats, also great to share with a dining companion.   The indoor dining is a bit loud for my taste (trying a bit too hard in my opinion with a DJ and all), however we always enjoy our time on the patio.

ZExjzi1DjsEFD7TH8C3cKg.text: I love this place - so fun, beautiful space and the DJ  makes we want to stand up and shake it! LOL! Seriously, the Bloody Mary bar is to die for and there is the cute lady, Bonnie, that totally makes the party. She is so fun and if you are looking for he best brunch spot in Scottsdale, this place should top your list!!!

-daJuM-0mF1E3M6HwvTikA.text: It was amazing. Best server! Lona was amazing!!!!!  The service was great! Love the vibe and mimosas were great.

aS_27H074erP4MpfSGkhKw.text: The BEST place for brunch! Right when we walked in, Linda greeted us with fresh squeezed orange juice mimosas! Bonnie grabbed us right away and said have a seat at the bar so the boys can watch the football game and we wouldn't have to wait!Lona was so nice and took our order right away!Adrian made the Best Bloody Mary EVER!

sgh9FqY8bdj5512ir_9rgg.text: Awesome bloody mary bar. The service was great. Good size portions with the french toast and hash skillet.

8iiIKpvlsBO5jSfpoIfOyw.text: The food here is pretty tasty ... if they did it correctly. This three star is for my lump crab sweet potato hash or should I say lack there of. Where the hell was my crab?! No crab flavor at all but I gave them the benefit of the doubt that maybe the sweet potato was cooked in crab... but after looking at other photos... yep.... my dish was definitely a crabless dish.   On the bright side I still did enjoy the Bloody Mary bar and a bite of my boyfriends chicken and waffles wth fried leeks. He got all the ingredients in his dish ....

5FqH7oPrGIBz0_cx5vMIAA.text: Holy waffles, this place is good!  While going on a staycation in Scottsdale, we came to this place for breakfast and the food was phenomenal.  We definitely got more than we needed and that is a lesson for us to know the size of our eyes to our stomach.  I wish it was closer to us because we would go here more often.  Great food, great people, great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash and s&#39;mores pancakes

VFBX3VfFliKGYcF2qkioaA.text: Absolutely amazing food! They put a fun twist on all your favorite bfast items. The "avocado toast" is obnoxious (in the best way possible). We came on a Sunday and got seated right away. Service is great and quick! Come hungry because portions are huge!! I high recommend the breakfast bagel sliders!!!

9eiHjlvOWNkt4N33ZQJNZQ.text: Huge portions. Active and loud here. DJ on Sundays. Build your own Bloody Mary bar was one of the best we have been to. Steph was an incredible server. This is a place to bring a lot of people and share dishes. So many great things to try. Two dishes will feed 3 or 4 people. Lots of kids here too.  If you are looking for a quiet place to have breakfast, this is probably not where you want to go.

TDFiRHMeI_28NUAxIaLzmg.text: Great Bloody Mary bar and such a huge selection from breakfast/brunch! Our table each got an entree but we all had bites of each other's and everything was delicious. An entree is definitely enough to feed 2 people if you wanted to share!I order the almond French toast and it was huge, such strong rich flavor! A definite must in Phoenix!

yOkwOTK8bEN7zEn_chOeag.text: Great atmosphere, food was pretty good, the DJ was dope. When we arrived the host said it would be a hour wait for 6 but we only waited 20 minutes. Not too bad for brunch on a Saturday.   My coffee glass had lipstick on it and a water glass had a smeared berry on it. The water wasn't great tasting either..but who goes to brunch to drink water lol   I got the mimosa flight. The flavors of the day were pineapple, blueberry, strawberry and orange. Blueberry and pineapple are my absolute favorites!   Food- We tried several things. Chilaquiles  with an over medium egg. Delicious! Only thing is the green chili sauce was a little cold. Other than that it was a good dish. Carne Assad's Tostada. That was hella bomb!! Very flavorful.   Must Try: If you love coconut and French toast, try this...Coconut Almond Encrusted French Toast! It was my ABSOLUTE favorite!! Thick french toast with coconut in every bite, topped with fresh bananas. Super Yummy!!

phhVaocjWodhcKuSWbfPVA.text: Great service, huge portions, HUGE variety of options on the menu.  Outstanding option for brunch any day of the week.  Lona was great!

4rcXHKdJJg9Y7QRB5iSrzA.text: In town for a wedding and had to try this place! Very busy... but got sat on the patio within 5 min. We were recommended by our server Sasha to do the Bloody Mary bar and it did not disappoint! Everything was on point including the food and service was attentive and so friendly and knowledgeable. We may need to come back tomorrow! Our favorite dish was the poutine hash and for sure the S'mores pancakes!

ySFRuwllipX0_NuWcabWBg.text: Best breakfast I have had in a while. The service was friendly and fast and the ambiance was clean and very fun and trendy. The menu was so unique, it was so hard to choose what I wanted to order. I ended up picking the Herb Fried Benedict (a tasty twist on one of my favorite breakfast items) and was quite blown away! The portion, the flavor, the quality was all exceptional and mouth-watering. My sister-in-law ordered the Huevos Ranchero hash and said the flavor was very unique and delicious. Both menu items were filling (we could hardly finish them). I would definitely reccomend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Ranchero Hash

puQPym4dH5QxKAS7sa5Nyg.text: I've been to Hash Kitchen a few times now.  It is a great breakfast place to go before an outing with friends.  They make great breakfast drinks and have a Bloody Mary bar!   My most recent visit, I ordered the Herb Fried Chicken.  It was exactly what I wanted! The chicken was great, the potatoes were good, and I opted for a fried egg instead of poached, which was the perfect topper.   When visiting Hash Kitchen on a weekend, expect to wait a decent amount of time before getting a table.  I don't want to be "that guy" who complains about the music being to loud, but its pretty loud and hard to have a conversation with the people at your own table..

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

L6Ip_WVj1KuCjGAJjcRu7g.text: Good food, but way too busy for their own good.  I went on St Patricks day and the place had a 1.5 hour wait and also it was wayy to loud.  I did enjoy the food a lot but the server was constantly running around. I had to get my own untensils and napkins after food was brought, etc.

KAIvo-bGgdTeQwG2aigE9g.text: Wow we're from Palm Springs and I had such a great time here I would recommend to anyone that comes to Scottsdale to come here great food great drinks great everything here in the house kitchen

rA0uKxeu347Yl9m0HJkISw.text: DJ and Bloody Mary bar? Already 5 stars there, but the food was also amazing. Very cute setting for any occasion, kids are welcome and still very lively place.   Went with some girlfriends and had a great time, wish they had some of these up where I live

_qM9LCJrWfngAWG9bGOVIg.text: Is there anything better than brunch? Nope. And Hash Kitchen, with a dog-friendly patio, great mimosas, and some fantastic food puts out a spectacular brunch.  I mean, come on, Fruity Pebbles pancakes? How can you not? The lemon & ricotta pancakes are light and refreshing. But if you want some protein, the fritattas are awesome.  There's nothing more Scottsdale than Hash Kitchen, and I say that with love and affection for my hometown.

Or1KRzZ7hFj6V2H5ulx6Pw.text: Brunch Heaven!! Best Breakfast I have had in like ( Ever)!! Love the music, staff, food and most of all the Bloody Mary Bar!! Definitely a must experience a foodie should try!! I had the steak and eggs and it was so good and the portion was huge I even shared!!  P.S The brunch bruschetta is such a great concept and tasted delicious. Definitely in my plans to return!!

V7coS4YzpAVwezwPa4OLpA.text: Great food and even better atmosphere. Donuts were delicious but would have wanted even more cannoli cream.

WzifmORv2pVIcn5ayv_4XA.text: I absolutely love this place!!  I've been going twice a month since being referred!   The food is AWESOME and the  older lady who works there, dances to the loud music and makes it feel like a hip and groovy night club!   The atmosphere is very upbeat!! I loved the Lemon Ricotta pancakes and the flight of Mimosa's  Definitely recommend going here for breakfast especially if you have visiting guest in town!   I noticed that they are building this establishment in Chandler but due to the dancing older lady, I'll continue going out to the Scottsdale location

xhCZCD3o_9Nb0ahz2RrooA.text: Sub par at best, but totally the hoppin spot in the area! Felt like we were in a club. The scene was young, music was loud, and there was a DJ! Say what? Spinning pretty good beats too.   That being said, the food was bland and warm and the drinks were overpriced.   Pros? Bloody mary bar is huge Cool environment  Good music  Cons? I didn't realize the end of the Bloody Mary bar has the hot stuff in tubs (like meat balls!) so I missed that! Had our server been more helpful when I told him I wasn't super hungry, I'd totally have just done what half the people in the place were doing and had a couple Bloody Mary's piled high with food! Had the server not come by a couple times quickly asking our order, I'd also have observed that was the go to on my own! The food was super super super super... super... bland. Like, no flavor. The biscuits and gravy tasted like hot dogs with milk. The huevos was basically hard tortillas with stale onions and canned black beans....

zv5wzeCsn2rK0Ss3k_OpeA.text: True let down. I was excited to brunch at Hash with my friends on a Sunday and it was the worst decision possible.  The service and the food was subpar.  The only good thing about our brunch was the music. There is a Bloody Mary bar located directly across the entrance which may be the worst location. It truly congests the area making minimal room space around when its busy.  The counter where you put your name in was unorganized and they said they didn't take reservations... but it seemed like some people were allowed 'reservations'... To not help the situation, we waited much longer than they had anticipated for us - almost double.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich with fries and the one thing I was looking forward to (since we were waiting for close to 2 hrs) came out COLD! This sandwich has a lot going on, maybe too much for a breakfast meal. Made with bacon & onion jam, piled high smoked ham, avocado, 2 fried eggs, pepper jack cheese on brioche texas toast.  I really tried to enjoy but I just couldn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

mNsUY4kpDEERRzFJTunKSw.text: All I can say is.. JUST WOW! Make certain you don't miss checking this place out! The food is outstanding; not your typical fare. We ordered the Avocado Toast and the Monte Cristo. Once you experience their Bloody Mary Bar, you will definitely want to return to outdo your, masterpiece" the next time!  THANK YOU to our Server, Lona for making is feel more than welcome! She made us feel as if we were a guest in her home. We truly appreciate her fine service! We had the opportunity to meet the Manager on duty. He was extremely friendly, and made us feel that the entire staff was appreciative for our patronage.  VERY GLAD that we included Hash Kitchen in our choices of dining experiences on this trip to the Tempe/Phoenix/Scottsdale area! And.. GO DEVILS!!!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JchufBmFsbSG23RzmUD2Iw.text: Best service and great food. It's busy on the weekend but it's worth the wait! They allow dogs on their outdoor patio, and their breakfast drinks and flights are amazing. Definitely worth trying this place a least once.

k9yW0U8feifVP8jSkD3WKg.text: First time at this location! Had Amy as our server and she was so amazing! Rachel and Gino stopped by to make sure our food was good and were so great! Definitely going to recommend this to all my friends and family!

ptIXmI1a4gAnP0iZNg2C9g.text: What a great place for brunch. If I wasn't such a wimp, I would've ordered the mega mimosa with Boba.  It is an entire bottle of champagne in one glass for 25.00.  We tried the boring eggs Benedict, the American scramble and the French toast. Everything was excellent. There was a small snafu with the order in the French toast didn't arrive for quite a while and they graciously comped for us. I would go back there every day if I could. What a wonderful place to eat, visit and enjoy a lovely meal. Plus, the beautiful people of Scottsdale add to the ambiance.

PRsp1U0jROYQxPEEK7NncQ.text: This place is awful. I ordered a pox plate with mini bagels. No bagels but instead rolls. But even grosser was they put tons of olive oil all over the plate. Oil in cream cheese, lox capers everything. Plate had so much grease. I asked about it they said, "that's our recipe" really? Aunt ordered French toast. Syrup was crappy and cheap stuff.  Not going back. Stick with first watch

uzhRGkHi9NQSX4WF6pu76w.text: One star for TERRIBLE front desk service. The front desk girl was super rude. We waited an hour to be seated. The least you can do is be nice.

F9tz8Lx9UhXyWH3-W2Gsrw.text: The manager Gino was very rude to my friend and insinuated that he was not of age to sit at the bar and after checking only his ID of the group, told him to grow a beard to appear older. Was very disappointed but otherwise the rest of the experience was great

WoFwrZnzZ8PPKuQMo1tDVg.text: Love this breakfast spot! The wait can be a bit long on Saturday/Sunday mornings but the food is good and the service is friendly. Grab a mimosa as this restaurant is worth the wait. Cheers!

9vJey3pAV1qZT8reZKUVEg.text: The drinks are solid. Sadly, I ordered the bacon and Brie bruschetta and then got a sampler platter instead with sweet ones that had Nutella and fruits in addition to the one I ordered. I'm sure they were great but just not what I like or ordered. I asked the waitress about it and she said she was sorry she didn't mention they only sold this variety bruschetta plate. She was very nice and went back to ask the kitchen to make me a full order with just the bacon and Brie, which was very nice. Then they brought it out and it was just some sad bacon on bread without Brie... this was probably a one off experience. I won't come back but I won't deter others. Just clarify your order... a few times.  Hi Joe

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TGPTc_UyB1oZCI2wszFDSA.text: I had a pleasant first experience at Hash Kitchen! Went around 9 am on a Sunday and was lucky enough to be seated out in the patio on a beautiful morning before it got too warm. The menu is EXTENSIVE and there is a bit of everything for everyone, which I really appreciated.   We got the cannoli donuts, herb fried chicken hash, and smoked salmon eggs benedict. The cannoli donuts came out warm and so tasty!! Seriously the best way to start out our breakfast. The chicken hash came came in a large serving size with a side of biscuit and man... I DEVOURED it. The fried chicken was cooked well and the poached eggs were done perfectly! The smoked salmon's poached eggs were perfect and the hollandaise sauce completed the dish.  Around 10 am, a live DJ came and played some tunes. There is also a bloody mary bar which seems to be a staple here. Our server was attentive and our overall experience was wonderful! I'd definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Indoors to the right from the main entrance
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Indoors to the left from the main entrance
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

qxxq2drlvvANTgZsZ2YliQ.text: I was really hoping for something special. We walked in and there wasn't anyone to sit us for a good 3 minutes. (I know. But it's a me thing). Finally got sat and waitress asked for the usual can I get you anything to drink and asked if we were interested in a self made drink. While sitting and looking over the menu I saw the one thing that drives me crazy. A dirty cloth is being used to "clean" tables. Omg. Please stop this. It's disgusting. The floors were dirty and had liquid stains all over. The bathroom was nice except no paper towels. Service was ok. A bit slow for a place that seemed not busy. The food was ok. I ordered a corn beef sandwich with coleslaw. The slaw was dry. I'm use to the more tasty wet slaw. The bread was good but overwhelmed the sandwich.

8DFrAc3Wsy0DRlALMGXBGw.text: We were pretty excited to come here while on vacation. The experience began great! But went south as far as the service goes. It felt as though we were forgotten; waiter was not very attentive and they failed to put our order in. Ended up being there for almost 2 hours because of this. Good was amazing and fantastic, as far as the brunch goes though. I would definitely give Hash another show because the food was delicious!

Ao3DujylTtkIXH4FJBJrGA.text: Aside from forgetting my meal and bringing it late, and the same thing happening to the table next to us, the food was just okay. None of our party of 4 were particularly happy with our meals. The potatoes in the hash were warm to cool and not hot. For a hash kitchen they don't do hash incredibly well. The service was friendly but the feel of the place was corporate or chain. That didn't stop people from packing into it and waiting in line to get in, but this place isn't worth all that. You can find better options all over town. It's like they put all of their energy into their impressive Bloody Mary bar and there wasn't much left for the food. I won't return.

AGYaVQtPIEZWVaK3AkG-GA.text: Excellent breakfast! The wait was slightly longer than I would have wished. Biscuits and gravy were exceptional. Lona was our server, and was fantastic. Her customer service skills were on point. She was very friendly. Overall, really great food and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Wn7JrjConba3_SQZEoOoSw.text: Love the mimosas great food and Awesome waitress, my girlfriend and I fall in love with this place we order the avocado toast (recomendable) and Tinga frittata (recomendable). We will definitely come back to try more different dishes

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZfA0qekiNFVqoEbYvHQjtQ.text: Such an awesome find!! This place is super fun and the food is amazing. The menu has a little bit of everything, and being gluten free I really appreciated the gf waffles and pancakes.  Definitely get the chiliquiles, AMAZING!

Aof0bBkE0nFPd0OIhPoMMQ.text: Was in town for the weekend and my BFFs birthday. We wanted a yummy brunch and bloody marys and this place looked to have both. Bonus, it was a Bloody Mary bar with tons of fixings!  There was a bit of a wait, but it wasn't bad. Maybe 10 minutes. We ordered the Bloody Mary bar right away. It was fun to add all the extra goodies in there. There were lots of pickled vegetables, bacon, olives, and even meatballs and fried ravioli. The actual drink was very good too.  Then we ordered the Hash Monkey for a starter. It was soooo yummy. Buttery and gooyey and sweet and warm.   We were sort of full-ish due to all the extras in our Bloody Marys, so we decided to share an entree. We asked our server for some recommendations and he said he always orders the Carnitas Hash. It was one of the items we were eyeing so we decided to get that. Oh my goodness. It was delicious! The carnitas were so tender and flavorful, the green chili sauce was amazing! I love a good green chili sauce and Hash does it right! The avocados, the cojita, I mean, it was perfect.   We then decided we had to have a mimosa too and we each chose a different one. They were equally divine. If I'm ever back in Scottsdale, this place is on the list to go back to.

gEMQQ_Cy3DhWxtK3BRg6MA.text: The food is delicious.  The tamale cakes eggs benny was...i dont have words for it.  Our server was amazing! Talented DJ.  Music was on point.  The manager checked in with us. Overall was a very pleasant experience. I would definitely come here again.

4aDqKPdXg13oKmBwKUCv3g.text: Such a nice place for brunch, easy parking nice friendly faces as you walk in and nice comfy booths. I ordered the veggie frittata and coffee. It was really good and HuGE I couldn't finish it with the side of potato and a biscuit with jam. The biscuit was a little hard but man was it good lol  The server was super attentive and the host who gave us our cards back was a doll, so friendly and personable. I will come back to try some bloody mary's mmm. My friend mentioned they were the best she has ever had at this restaurant.

klBjuis64v0kBFsOSvR3Hg.text: The breakfast here was excellent!! I definitely recommend the coffee and carne hash! The coffee may be the best I have ever had (I drink mine black)

7mI6myiksvYI5XIz9qQMvg.text: When you walk in, you're greeted by a massive Bloody Mary bar, complete with bacon, veggies, and other cool treats. Bloody Mary's not your thing? That's okay, I'm not a huge fan either. They have all kinds of mimosas- and you can get a tasting flight to try them all. If you're not wanting to inbibe, their coffee is fantastic. I suggest getting the French press coffee.  It was a tough choice but I went with the herb fried chicken skillet. The chicken isn't overly breaded but is thin and crispy. It's served with fried leeks- like onion straws. This is served on top of potato hash and drizzled with a hint maple syrup. Usually it's topped with poached eggs. I got my eggs on the side, eggs in general are not my favorite. But if you like eggs, the salty sweet combo isn't heavy but is crispy and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. french press coffee
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. herb fried chicken skillet
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. herb fried chicken skillet

aaz9Ya3TudAPUFKWc7nK3A.text: Stay in your lane Hash Kitchen!!! Why you gotta do me like that?! All you had to do was make a normal brunch but instead you had to go and make way too many incredible dishes I want to try. Now I'll have to book flights out from Denver just for brunch. Hands down the best brunch my friends and I have ever had. Will definitely be back one way or another.

q990jLva_YB3KZyHguUGkw.text: Super good food and the BEST service from Jessica! One of the best servers I've ever had :-)

r-Y0UU0b4v0s3TCD62gskw.text: Definitely nice presentation of breakfast entrees. Service was very friendly but very slow on Sunday morning. Took 45 minutes to get our order. Blasting music inside appears to be standard and the place was packed with millennials.  Luckily we were sitting outside. We would NOT have been happy sitting inside

mbdFHeHh-KvSR2Gd-KRNpA.text: This place is sooo cool!  All the wait staff seems to love their jobs -everyone smiles even though the it was hopping busy.  I ordered a skillet breakfast and a Mimosa.  There was a DJ playing retro music and the atmosphere was upbeat.  I came here with a group -and they were not dissapointed

jvg0eoH89xMfvhM4yzHmPg.text: LOVED this place! Would highly suggest this restaurant to anyone. Great place, it is really nice. The food is AMAZING. The owner of the restaurant really makes the place, she is a great soul! Can't wait to come back!

R1uTz7Oz0KE9vopzS8vFZg.text: Absolutely love this place. Bonnie is an amazing individual that brings such happiness to the building. Will definitely come back, in love!

Roki7eDfqg7mjuIL04KWDA.text: Tried this cute spot for our weekly brunch with friends last Sunday. Great ambience- bigger size than a lot of other local brunch spots that can get stuffy and overcrowded at busy rush times. The Bloody Mary bar has so many options for toppings, a bit intimidating for a first timer but the staff was very friendly and helpful. It turns out I'm an excellent Bloody Mary designer :) the food was delicious- we had the smoked salmon Benedict, Mexican chorizo omelet, biscuits and gravy and the breakfast burrito at our table- everything was very tasty! The biscuits were sweet, buttery and flakey. I can't wait to go back and try the lump crab Benedict next! Its also nice that they have TVs with the games on so the boys don't rush us home :)

WdJlbn9BdYJFty-GahdRWQ.text: Totally worth the drive here from our hotel. Lemon ricotta pancakes and banana French toast were amazing. Not to mention the $3.00 mimosas (on weekdays) and their Bloody Mary Bar is a dream if you like Bloody Mary's. My boyfriend loved it. We sat at the bar and Lona was our bartender, would defiantly come back to have her take care of us again. Thank you Lona!!!

T426Rh2GjHApUxhSOff7pw.text: I am definitely a fan of this place.  Found it on yelp and i was surprised that this place was not more busy when I had arrived.  It apparently used to be Cuttlefish, but the inside was very modern with white marble and the staff was very friendly.  My lady and I sat at the bar and was pleased to see there was a DJ there (keep in mind this was at 11am in the morning).  The DJ created a very nice atmosphere and again I was just surprised there was no insane wait for brunch like I feel like all of Scottsdale always is.  The bartender was very friendly and was outgoing and struck up a conversation with us throughout the whole meal.  I got the Chicken & Waffles which were fantastic.  They were topped with fried leeks.  My girlfriend got the chicken hash which was absolutely fantastic.  I think first off the think you'll notice is that they use boneless chicken which makes for the perfect chicken-to-waffle ratio.  Also they make in-house biscuits which are  delicious!  Selfishly I hope they don't get TOO big b/c I don't want to have to wait for great food, but I guess it's hard to keep a lid on something this great!  Definitely wanting to try again!  Cheers!

WlwI6FqdaEd-ffW4XsBjZA.text: When are first come bar seats not really first come bar seats?  When the bartender shows favorites.  We had a bit of a wait at Hash.  The food and atmosphere are worth it.  Free mimosas while you wait is awesome.  We decided to grab bar seats after 45 minutes but a prissy bartender told us she was holding them for someone else.  Hmmmm.  So it's not open seating at the bar I guess.  I mentioned this to the owner, an incredibly hard working, entrepreneur woman and she sat us immediately at a table.  Kudos to mom for her prompt recognition of her employees error.  Good times and good food.  No thanks to a bartender who thinks she controls the bar seats.  You just cost Hash a 5 star review.

n77NoZ-Ogy6nlzZvKq2Pwg.text: This was the best place EVER!! Great music, great Bloody Mary Bar, Amazing food! Music/DJ off the hook! Ask for Bonnie - she's awesome, great energy and knows her NBA!!!! LeBron and AI

7XyvOek1a7wsQVos_aZYpg.text: Just went in for the first time!  Music is way too loud and the hostess stand is totally clueless.  There were 7 empty tables on the patio during our 25 minute wait, and we said we WANTED an outside table.  She claimed they were for reservations, but in the 25 minutes, no one ever came and she ended up seating us at the empty table we stared at the whole time.  Then the waitress was completely unfriendly once she heard us say we did not want a breakfast cocktail.  She literally just walked away, said nothing and came back with water.  We asked questions about the menu and she shrugged and gave one word answers.  When we did a build your own option she was annoyed with the brief debate over which ingredients.  The food did come fast and the biscuits are delicious.  The food was good, but the poor service convinced me there are enough other breakfast spots to go with good service!

6QKWsqup-w70SatxrQ5npw.text: I worked with Erno to set up a farewell brunch for my book club retreat. He was absolutely awesome. He accommodated our party recommended a custom menu. The Hash Kitchen provided a reasonable price with 5 options to choose from. The restaurant accommodated our vegetarian and gluten free members with multiple options. The food was fantastic!!! I have never been a fan of bloody Marys, but since they were included I tried them. AMAZING! The mix there is not like any other place I have tried. Our server Chris worked his tail off. He provided excellent customer service. We were a large loud group, and The Hash accommodated us quickly and extremely well. I would recommend this place to anybody who wants great food, with great service. Thank you from BookTini.

O7xBu7nmkN8K1Yk20TnBgA.text: Great service and food. The lump crab eggs benedict was delicious; it was perfectly seasoned with old bay and complimented with a side of potatoes.

9R5MnHRrqtrWYTb7U4La0g.text: Maybe everyone that wrote a five star review had a great experience, or maybe they just buy into the pretentious Scottsdale BS that this place has down to a science. I get that they took a high-end restaurant and turned it into a brunch spot but honestly the decor prices DJ the whole scene was totally over-the-top and they seem much more concerned about appearances then actual quality of service and food.  What's right: - Great Diverse Menu  - Great Drinks - Awesome Bloody Mary Bar - Clean  What's wrong: - Overpriced- we each had one drink and an entree and the bill was $90 for 4 people. For BREAKFAST - Awful staff - the manager is a total ass. I saw him yell at staff in a completely derogatory and condescending manner multiple times. He did literally nothing except try to look important when clearly his staff needs coaching on service. And the hostess had on booty jorts and a 2.99 tank top from forever 21. Not knocking that outfit in general but it seems kind of tacky considering the image they're trying to portray. Plus the gross manager was all brushing up on her. - No specials - not everyplace has to have unlimited mimosas but some sort of deal would be nice, like 2 for ten or something  - THE FREAKIN HASH! - i'm going to go out on a limb here but if you're going to put the word hash into the name of your business your hash should probably be pretty decent right? I ordered a hash with fresh lump crab on it and was pretty excited to try it. Unfortunately the sweet potatoes in the hash were completely undercooked and disgusting. So I sent back the hash and it came back out with cooked yet flavorless potatoes but now there is no egg on it. So by the time I got my food everyone was done eating and finally I got my complete meal about 40 minutes after I ordered. My sister ordered another hash with regular potatoes and was equally unimpressed. You just need to do something special if you're going to base your menu around something.  And the cardinal sin of all breakfast places as well as number one indicator a breakfast place will go out of business..... Drumroll please... They did not keep our coffee cups full. Each of us had coffee and it was only refilled one time and that was after sitting empty for at least 10 minutes. The server brought the check and never asked if we wanted more but we did so we asked for more which turned out to be a good idea because we waited about another 15 minutes for our credit card to be run.   I give points for the menus creativity but the execution is bad and the service worse. I give this place 2 stars and 6 months!

QgNWBM6D6ADMmyw171EOhw.text: The food is a nice deviation from typical breakfast options. (Although not as scrumptious as Cuttlefish was). Where they are slipping is their service which , at best, is inconsistent. Also frowned at the servers who brought out hot plates with their sleeves stretched. Ick. Get a napkin or some potholders. Overall, a nice attempt. I'll give it another go, but the finesse is missing.

_3VpZBAII3Wz-vGplndLvA.text: Girlfriends took me here for birthday brunch treat. This was chosen for the fun of having to experience the Bloody Mary bar. It was a hit. It is a nice, casual place for friends' meet up over bloody mary which could be as good or weird as you want it :-) Staff was very good although food is very slow. For that latter and the food itself, giving it a 3.

ljcl3mi7FjuAKpRXexka1w.text: Loved the ambiance of this place. Classy and comfortable. Unfortunately, wasn't impressed with the food. Our table started with the donut and Nutella appetizer which looked amazing and our friends said it was delicious. But my main course of the gluten free pancakes was unimpressive. Over cooked on the bottom and really hard. I had to dip them in my coffee to soften them. No Bueno. In addition, my white scramble was only ok. Nothing special and kinda bland. For a $20 meal, was hoping for better. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere is 5 star, too bad the food isn't up to snuff. Haven't found a place yet to compete with Butters down the street for eggs and gf pancakes at a great price.

TLpND06fkKNTZTvuf-O_jA.text: Three of us had breakfast this morning and were disappointed at best.  Service was slow and unorganized.  When we asked Server about the differences between the on-line menu and the copy given to us, he informed us that on-line menus were "enhanced." Friend #1 had a waffle which came plain, uncrisp,  and without any garnishes.  Friend #2 had the veggie scramble.  All three of us commented that it looked dirty.  I had the brisket with cornbread hash.  The poached eggs were too well done, the cornbread hash was dry and too sweet.  While the two strips of brisket were acceptable, they were added on top of the skillet making them look like an after-thought.  Bottom line...service and presentation receive F's all around.  The one good feature was the floor was carpeted so the noise level was very tolerable.

HrksKS-nN5k4cvwnlAsLTw.text: Wonderful customer service and great food, it was my first time here and very impressed! I loved the Guava Mimosas

qmZ3GXWJjxSpzdrG3NyYow.text: this place is good it used to be cuddle fish back in the day and it was good back then too. now they specialize in preparing different dishes involving hash my favorite is the leg of lamb hash but they are all good and i recommend all of them, they have good desserts and drinks like mimosa for a nice Sunday morning brunch. don't forget to check in on yelp to receive 5% off your entire bill.

LhQcasW7LVwRqcTvxyCi9w.text: Bonnie is awesome. I love love love this place!  Can't wait to visit again really soon.

r5h_1r1ZIAv3oOvD5k69jw.text: Great Service, Yummy food,  Try the Chilaquiles!!! Love this place.. I will be back for sure!

UsA04QJXwMrRgMXLXiFNHw.text: Eemmm,,, acutely  Eeemm this is the first time I've been there,, we seated outside,,I ordered something like lazania i like my waffle friens too lool i ate some of her parts, but I can't get 5 stars for them

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I ordered something like lazania i like my waffle friens too lool i ate some of her parts, but I can&#39;t get 5 stars for them

WhcuiMLrhAXedbf1OPLuPg.text: So not my scene, I was a little concerned when my husband and I walked in as it was more of an Old Town Scottsdale Sunday Funday vibe with a loud "untzy" DJ. We were just looking to have a casual brunch and the food and service totally made up for the ambiance. I can't turn down a good bloody mary bar, so I started with that and my husband had the Prosecco smash. The bloody mary bar is one of the best, there's a ton of options starting with different flavored vodkas from cilantro lime to bacon, flavored salt, pickled veggies galore, fried ravioli and even oysters! Since a bloody mary is pretty much a meal in a glass I chose the quinoa and couscous salad which was a perfect accompaniment. My husband went the other route and ordered the breakfast lasagna which was to die for! Our server was fantastic and very attentive, the bloody mary bar was amazing, and the food was delicious, all factors that make up for the super loud DJ. I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own Bloody Mary
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quinoa &amp; couscous salad
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast lasagna

lzwKet3Zp1TgiJPZU7S40w.text: Came to Hash Kitchen on a Sunday (Valentine's Day) for brunch. Really nice ambient. They had a DJ playing which was nice. We had regular coffee which tasted really good black. I ordered the smoked sliced brisket cornbread hash, with green chile. It was delicious! We also tried the chicken and waffles. The the texture and flavor of the chicken was perfect. For dessert we had sugar and cinnamon covered doughnuts (foreplay doughnuts) Sooo good  Didn't try the Bloody Mary's this time but the bar was legit and everyone who had one in hand seemed to be enjoying it.   Customer service was AWESOME! Everyone from the greeter to our server  was so genuine and welcoming.  I am definitely a fan of Hash Kitchen and will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked sliced brisket and cornbread hash with 2 eggs.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Foreplay doughnuts

YC6khdIKnM6aPh2l2i9S5Q.text: WOW!  I've been wanting to check this place out, as many friends have given glowing recommendations about it.  Today was the day.  First I should say that we hit The Hash Kitchen around 10:00 a.m. on a Wednesday.  There was no wait, yet the restaurant was bustling with patrons, servers and other staff.  What struck me from the beginning was the wide open space.  Tables nicely spaced, set with cutlery and nice cotton napkins.  Great acoustics, too.  A conversation can be had and heard.  Our waiter, Gino, stepped in prompty, exuding his friendly mannerisms and immediately made us feel like a member of the family.  It was obvious that he would accomidate any request or change of established order.  It came across as if it was his life's mission to make sure we had everything we needed.  A rarity in today's ever impersonal society.  Our order came very quickly.  It was hot and appealing to the eye. I had the Lump Crab Eggs Benedict and it was seasoned perfectly.  I had not experienced crab with hollandaise sauce before...it may be in my dreams from now on.  Mom had classic Eggs Benedict, with special requests.  There was not the blink of an eye as it was served.  She ate well and seemed to enjoy each bite.  She was a little miffed that I didn't order her a Bloody Mary instead of the hot tea that is her normal morning beverage.  A mistake I won't make again.  When ordering, I was offered fresh O.J., a mimosa or a bloody mary.  This surprised me, as they are normally brunch type drinks. How wonderful to be able to have a brunch kind-of-meal 7 days a week.  This place rivals some of the best in the Valley for ambiance, cleanliness, generous portions, truly personal service and prices that will not break the bank.  It's a winner!  Many thank to the hostess, Aimee, for her smile, sense of humor and the menu to take home.  We will most definately be back/

Q5yKzUcEcW9llgkEjeOJkg.text: The food here is amazing and Lona provided fabulous service!!!!!! My mom ordered the eggs Benedict and I ordered the biscuits and gravy!! 2 thumbs up :)

v5P3-tNnc26oEFr-Fwcfcg.text: Best breakfast spot in Arizona hands down. The paella hash is basically perf. On top of that the mimosa flight and Bloody Mary bar are crazy good. Like amazing good and worth visiting just for that

qr7335vZr-bCoPBLew121w.text: Really fun place for brunch. Love the area and the atmosphere is amazing! So fun and trendy. I didn't get it, but the Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar looks so good. Hash Kitchen has a super diverse menu that I haven't seen before with menu items like Banana Split French Toast (delicious!) and Fruity Pebble Pancakes. The fresh coffee is really good too. Lona was our server and she took super good care of us and made sure our experience was outstanding. So glad to have a new place for brunch!

wem-LWe8qGmX-55XNEEBuQ.text: Danielle was awesome and the food was great! the bloody Mary's and latte was delicious!

kkr6vfgaP69cguvg4CCNsA.text: Stunningly disappointing food. Namesake hash was lukewarm and appeared extruded from a can...and remarkably flavorless.  Staff was inattentive during a very slow time of day. Atmosphere was cool and not inviting.   Nevertheless, a lot of food, albeit plain, for the price.

dvlxOBi2GRz_ZkMvQ1zB4A.text: Came here for breakfast and had Lona as our server, she was fantastic and food was great too! Highly recommend

W5Dj7UMdu6dnLP_MWP3JAw.text: Hash Kitchen is for the trendy crowd. Interesting dishes but they are mostly pushing their bar/alcohol.   Food was fine but nothing special.  For those who want the basic, this is not the place for you.  Call me cheap but biscuits and gravy with 2 eggs should not be $13.   At Butters, it's only $9 and the service is much more efficient.

flQKjJXzp-YBYmTQ273tXQ.text: My husband was crazy happy when I told him about the opening of the Hash Kitchen. Hash is his favorite breakfast dish by far and he's eaten it from coast to coast. Plus, this one is near our home and the reviews said that they are dog friendly so there are a lot of reasons for us to frequent it.   Admittedly, we got there in the last hour before they were closing. The hostess was terrific and friendly and we opted to sit at the bar. The menu has a lot of great options. My husband ordered a beer which apparently they didn't have on tap. They told him that he could go over next door and get one (they must also own that space) but since we were seated, he didn't really want to walk to the other bar to retrieve his beer.   The food was okay. It was good but there were cleaning up around us like crazy. My water glass never got refilled. I get it - they wanted to go home but if they want it that bad, they should change their hours.   They do have a nice space and a good looking bloody mary bar. We may give it another try some time in the future.

cSoqoE6b102M8hSaIAkWzQ.text: Wait was stupidly long, but once we were seated the service was amazing.  The food is really good but the portions are ridiculously huge-one meal would have fed all four of us.  My daughter had the watermelon lemonade and it was not only delicious, but possibly the prettiest drink I have ever seen.  She also ordered the "child's waffles with bacon "-I kid you not, it would've been enough for all four of us, there's no difference in portion size for kids.  My husband had one of the hash dishes, ate half of it, my son had two eggs and waffles, and I had the scrambled eggs with sundries tomatoes, goat cheese and basil-yummy. I only ate the eggs, never got to the potatoes or biscuit.  Except the wait, great dining experience, but a place you would only do once or twice.

2dgnzkx6yqSDvx38FHeT1w.text: So I absolutely adored The Hash! I went for the first time on my birthday and I have to say they get an A++ for customer service!!!   They brought out the incorrect dish for my friend but immediately resolved it by being remorseful , offering to remake it, and brought out some additional items to make up for it! We appreciated that!!!   The lovely lady that is hosting is absolutely a hoot! She was so friendly and funny and kept checking on us!! She was great and shared many stories and photos! I'll go back just to chat with her!   The staff came and sang me happy birthday and brought a delicious fresh donut for me as a birthday treat!!   The drinks were great! And the Bloody Mary bar is a sight to see!! The place was packed and that's always a great sign!! So excited for our return trip to The Hash!! Best breakfast experience in AZ by far!   Thank you The Hash!!!

GoeNHsBx40u9AGarZjZLDA.text: My Direst Bonnie,  I fell in love with you on first site. The moment you sang R-E-S-P-E-C-T not only took my breath away but began a new love in my heart for life.  Now the herb hash chicken in itself fufilled my appetite however your mimosas flight of Mango, Blueberry, Strawberry and Original took my tablet (and my blood alcohol) to a whole nother level.  We all love you and the 20 minute wait was worth it because your worth it. Never change and ill see you soon.

V388I7jFG8M8X-CWGW26yw.text: This was perhaps the worst dining experience I have had in a long time. The menu, the venue and the concept is brilliant!  The staff, the manager and the food were horrible. The staff looked like it was completely disorganized, no one seemed to have any sense of urgency. Our food took so long, my sons eggs were raw, the chips with the huevos ranchero hash were inedible, like leather. Of the 10 tables being served while we were in there, all 10 had issue with their food, the lengthy wait or the lack of service from the staff. What a complete and total disappointment.

wl8quEKK7Zc9dayjkwfsqg.text: Came here for a wonderful breakfast and thats exactly what we recieved.  We had such a great time with the bartendar and the lady that we believed own the place.  She was a hoot!  We were greeted with smiles and hellos instantly.  We choose to sit inside out of the heat.  Then the ladies orderd flights of flavored mirmosas and we orderd bloody mary's.  They had an entire buffet table of condiments to choose from to add to your bloody.  Im not even going to attempt to describe the 60+ things you could add to your bloody.  What I will say is what an amazing concept.   For our food I had the Huevos Rancheros with carna asada hash.  My wife had the bannana split french toast with fresh fruit and whipped cream.  Oh my word was this an out of body experience.   The resturant is clean, the employees are friendly, the food is to die for, the handcrafted drinks and homemade vodkas make the bar an exciting...... What more could you ask for!  This place needs to be a stop for any family if traveling through Scottsdale area.  You and the kids will not be dissapointed I can guarantee. Words of wisdom.....  the owner is from Ohio and a big sports fan, so dont talk bad about Lebron James or any of Ohio's sports teams.  Lol

exZN24QHh39iAwT1rLU6mA.text: Fun and delicious brunch spot... I tried the carnitas hash and the cannoli pancakes which are both delicious, full of flavor...my sister and I wanted to try both so we shared (portions  are big enough to do so. The customer service is outstanding.. if you go on the weekend they have a dj and makes the ambiance more fun.
