Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash

NJxTaYar2cUVYrj6WHZTkw.text: 1) I love a good Bloody Mary bar and love that they have a virgin option  2) mimosa flights? Smart!! 3) pancake flights? Genius !! Really good quality and interesting smart unique options  Atmosphere is loud but really energetic with a live DJ . Leaving full n happy

xpq4HSmxHeseN5wuDFHu1g.text: Fun Breakfast spot! Food was fantastic, and the Bloody Mary Bar is insane with endless options. The live DJ is a cool addition to the already nice atmosphere! Will continue to recommend this place, and will absolutely return ourselves :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. It&#39;s a meal in a glass, awesome Bloody Mary bar options!

X0wmGgupr4KcTm-DamsTXQ.text: This was such a great experience.  It started with Bonnie greeting us.  She's so fantastic.  The DJ and music had me dancing in my seat the whole time.  I was blown away by the Bloody Mary bar and the Mimosa flight we had.  Then the food was creative and amazing. My sister and I sat at the bar, and Tatum was so much fun. I had the Benedict Fries, which she said I'd love.  She was right.  Who thought of that? Hollandaise on fries?  Just Bae.  We will be back!

kxNk1p4L64ru4QFPwcElqw.text: Great breakfast place, the food was amazing, I had the brisket which was a special for the Memorial Day holiday weekend. The Bloody Mary bar was a great touch worth checking out.

b7bSxZx8y-n_aFFAmBXBkA.text: 5-star presentation, but this place is lacking on flavor and atmosphere. I have been here 3 times, twice for the chicken and waffles (which really are amazing!) and most recently for the chicken verde. The latter was a bit of a disappointment- soggy chips and way too much verde sauce...I should've known to stick with what I knew. My boyfriend has gotten a few of the hash entrees and none were anything to write home about. Atmosphere is...confusing. Don't get me wrong I am all for trendy and upbeat, but IMO it's kinda weird to have a DJ blasting in the middle of breakfast. In south Scottsdale/old town they get away with it being that it's a BAR scene, but that's not at all the vibe up here. Service was okay, they were swamped every time I went so slow service was expected- just don't expect to be in/out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa Bar- it&#39;s huge
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Perfect Chicken &amp; Waffles (seriously, try them)

BM9Dn40lQYoqyCR-BMW7-A.text: New place not many customers. Way over priced. If you drink alcohol they have a 'bloody Mary 'bar. Without alcohol way over priced FYI

bPJI3fuW4Sx0zq-mAXgPRw.text: Tried breakfast here recently and thought it was just ok. Been reading reviews about the best breakfast being here, and unfortunately I disagree.  Met some friends for brunch with high hopes. Nothing was bad, but nothing was great either. Won't need to return.

aFagjlmWAFwpLAO5yy5MPA.text: Hash Kitchen is great. Nice location, big portions, and fantastic staff (Gino was awesome!). Not only is the food top-shelf, but the music is wonderful - lots of 90s jams. Would absolutely go back 5/5.

vmONqL7ISi3VJ6J7LzduaA.text: There is a special place in my heart for Hash Kitchen. Generally there is a wait for brunch, obvi. But it is so worth it. The mimosa flights are so yummy. The chicken and waffles is to die for. The atmosphere is lively and fun. One of my favorite brunch spots!

RInruxE6qxEd1G1QcgqViA.text: Wanted to come here because of the pictures I've seen with their bloody mary's. The bloody mary bar was cool, had a lot of options, but at the end of the day, it was a bloody mary. Their mimosas are pretty good however. The food here was average and I expected better. Tried their huevos hash which was blah and I didn't finish it as well as their lump crab benedict. The crab was excellent, but the portion was tiny. The rest of the benedict was very dry because they use dry biscuits for the base of the benedict. Their pancakes were just average, IHop is better honestly for pancakes. The second time I came here during the middle of brunch it turned into a club and they were blaring Spice Girls and other jams, which hey I love the Spice Girls, but you could barely have a conversation because it was so loud.

7S_eWGfyQjWpvLdBci-YsA.text: First time here and the vibe was very friendly.  We were warmly greeted by Bonnie who was so welcoming.  I had to try the bloody mary bar and it was quite the trip.  More items that you could possibly add to one glass but lots of variety in both the rim salt, infused vodkas and toppings!  We started with these yummy fresh baked little donut holes that were on a bed of Nutella AND served with a syringe full of Nutella to inject into each of the donut holes...OMG!  We ended up splitting one of the THK Hashes and which was more than enough to share.  Great place, great service, great people and great food!  Definitely going back to try more!

a6tDoCJkjYC4tW_VwOlS2g.text: Absolutely one of the best places in the Phoenix metro area! Food is incredible, Bloody Mary bar is top notch! Lona our waitress was super awesome! Adrian the manager has this place running on full cylinders! Just simple fantastic!!!

GJCvq-UQ8Ehn-RLzDCdQdw.text: Came in for a quick brunch after landing from a long flight and stumbled upon Hash! What a great choice! Our server Lona was outstanding!! Great service!! What a great time we had! Bloody Mary bar and flights are a must!! Will be back before we head home.

z9qrifhu1GKLprtLYnyNng.text: Bonne & Linda were amazing hosts.  Bonne is always lively and energetic when we see her. She is the perfect host to greet you when you arrive.   Jen was our server and she was attentive and helpful. She made an excellent recommendation for the Carnita's. We will definitely be back again soon.

uwa6NOftjvQv4YjsEcwRng.text: My good friend Gino is the best. Forget about it! No one better. And what a take on Mexican breakfast. Highly recommended!

immEjZ0B0i7eBGlOfpT1yw.text: A-ma-zing Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar! ANY type of hash is awesome. Run...don't walk... To try it. Sunday morning early before the crowd gets there!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BYOBMB!!!!

uPD5pqgXcCAkeD4vXQa6Lw.text: Best place to go for brunch with your girlfriends. Bloody Mary bar is top notch and atmosphere makes it fun. Will definitely come back.

DFoFapNQrByxgFkSMj1lXA.text: Fabulous, fun restaurant!!! The food is amazing! The staff is even more amazing, especially Bonnie and Chris....they were so friendly and so funny!! I will for sure be returning with even more friends and family!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Selfie!!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bonnie is the best!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun with friends!

S85cmpZ6Q6R1y4wjpHm4ug.text: Went here while visiting Scottsdale. Food and drinks were average, wait staff very friendly. Great concept.

Bx_Hmj0OhBH8_tNzxlQUFA.text: This is a place you must go. They have one of the best Bloody Mary bars. There's usually always a line but great atmosphere and depending on the time live DJ.

c-N3MehFAp6-ur40-h-54Q.text: Crab and sweet potato hash was amazing!  A little bit too many bell peppers but tasty.  Corned beef hash was good too, but I like mine shredded and cooked more.  My 12 year old took on the stack of 4 pancakes, but food won.  Bloody Mary bar looked interesting but no hangovers in our party.  Dance music was a little loud but conversation was not impossible.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XFcHKe1S6wG4K-1FrTiGpA.text: First and last time there.  Had a 930 reservation. Checked in at 915. At 1030 we asked when we would be seated. They had no record of us checking in, even though they gave us a buzzer.  We finally got seated at 11. I had ham hash. It was all fatty meat.  Disgusting.  Over priced Bloody Mary, that was not even that good.

z27KfmGZYD41LHKZ4DigVg.text: Hands down, the BEST breakfast/brunch place. The customer service is by far the best I had, and it only continues to get better with each visit.

RcS7eX0J0BThjouyAzWJJA.text: Primitive place they do not even have bottled water... seriously...???...in Gainey Village in Scottsdale...???...it is a glorified IHOP with even worse service...servers are completely clueless

T5QPha0JCduasJfonstX5A.text: Delicious food and great service! While you're waiting for your table you can grab a drink at the full service Bloody Mary bar. The bartender mixes your drink base and you can add your own fixings to your drink. So many options and so yummy. Best Bloody Mary I've had! Really unique place! Overall great service and food.

gYDHLgZnQeOwxMu7tqA07g.text: How have I never been here before! Seriously my new favorite breakfast spot, soooo delicious and its freakin adorable. I had the brisket hash and my daughter had the French toast. Both were the best we have ever had. Check this place out you won't be disappointed. The staff were really friendly and attentive as well.

l-I6-xCJOZrgC4jjULiwbQ.text: Loved my first visit to The Hash Kitchen!  I was planning on meeting a friend at Panera, but wanted a more substantial breakfast after a boot camp work out before work.  As a newcomer to the area, I wandered in just to see what it was about.... the staff was exceptional in greeting me, encouraging me to try it ~ guaranteeing I would like it better than Panera.  They convinced me, they did not pressure me.  It was everything they claimed and more.  Healthy, fresh, warm, made to order with out complaint for any substitutions, aimed to please and then some. I have told others to check it out. When I wanted to go again this weekend, the line was out the door!  Service, atmosphere, fresh & healthy choices, value - priced eating out is what i look for. Family owned is even better... and they meet all of this.  #Iwillbebacksoon!

jEz44eZMdvsQIOaoE5hdLw.text: Wonderful brunch at The Hash Kitchen. Had the mimosa flight which included very generous pours of four different mimosa flavors. Definitely a great deal. Also had a frittata which was amazing. The atmosphere was great and they honored our reservation so we were seated right away. Four stars just because there were a few drink mixups and one person in our party had to wait a bit to receive her breakfast. The owner/manager came by our table several times to make sure we were having a wonderful time so the atmosphere was very welcoming. Would definitely return!

QsID-Tuig_4_H7vn0fpG9A.text: Hash Kitchen was a delight from the moment we arrived, through the meal. The decor is not like a typical breakfast place. Very up scale but comfortable. Bonnie greeted us & seated us. She could not have been more friendly and upbeat. Jen (or Jenna?), our server, was attentive and efficient. Their menu has much to choose from. From pancakes to eggs Benedict to frittatas, but with a flare that isn't too "out there". We will be back and are looking forward to their new location in North  Scottsdale.

PLOFi54uh4YTnXq2_ond-w.text: Don't walk, run! This place rocks.  I don't write many reviews but the professionally trained staff attentive service fabulous food world-class bloody Mary bar separates this from all the other breakfast joints in Scottsdale.  The greeter, bar staff and personable, attentive waiter were all excellent.

Aob6gG_VluZ_7n-W57O-lQ.text: First time going here today. Waited for almost 40 minutes for our order...our ticket got lost in the kitchen but they weren't even busy. The lady gave us some donuts on them while we still waited...finally the food comes out & I'm eating my pancakes when I realize there is a long black hair mixed into the pancakes DISGUSTING!!! Never going back.

otGkqmX3zEw1aPryGyIf7w.text: Just had an amazing breakfast. Everything on the menu looks so good--- it's hard to choose. We sat at the bar and the waitress put in a soccer game we wanted to watch. Food was amazing and service very pro and friendly.  The only criticism I have is the water tasted bad... apparently from the tap & unfiltered.  :(

P2b83z1rNuQ0Lfadv8VfEQ.text: Love Hash Kitchen! Bonnie makes you feel warm and welcomed! You have to wait for a table on the weekends but it's worth it.

s9kgg58hs2uUODpyiNd2ug.text: This is my second time to the Hash Kitchen with my fiancee Kimberly, and we cannot rave anymore about this place than we already do. The staff is always on top of their game especially the owner/manager Linda, one of most friendliest persons I've met in any eating establishment ever. But besides the amazing service is the incredible food. We have ordered several things of the menu over our two visits and have always left full and satisfied with our choices. This restaurant is certainly becoming one of our favorites for brunch! Check it out ASAP!

JT5c7_bJGHOkGdvO2ZWDkA.text: Adriaan at the Bloody Mary bar made my experience at the Hash kitchen out of this world.  His hospitality was out of this world. He truly understands what it takes to create an amazing experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Custom from the Bloody Mary bar!

bqdn_klna2F6RmaTJCVDtA.text: Best Bloody Mary Bar in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area!!! Drinks, food, and staff are fantastic! The DJ on Saturdays and Sunday's plays a great variety as well. Ask for Chris, he's awesome!

ym6W5JcOqgi6wds0FZS4sQ.text: What a great time we had! Angelica and Alisa were super warm and helpful! We can't wait to come back!!!

BQfLwN1OW8aKqRzJbySUqA.text: The good reviews of Hash Kitchen are driven mostly by its trendy concept and presentation.  The food is actually pretty bad.  To give an example, their corned beef hash was made of cubes of brisket.  You can't cut adequately cooked corned beef into perfect cubes because the meat will be too soft.  The only reason they can do this is because the brisket was under cooked leaving the connective tissue in the meat intact and the corned beef still rubbery.  If they didn't know how to prepare it properly, they were better off just using the stuff that comes in a can.

JOFOLdGzrsKSAtt62_N_Tg.text: Decided to check this place out while on a Business Trip in Scottsdale. Based on the reviews we gave it a shot. Well worth it with Great Service and Food. Tried the Corned Beef Hash and it was one of the Best I've had. French Press Coffee was a Nice Touch also... Would recommend to everyone in the Scottsdale Area.

_S0S1bqVF2BhWIXTrDOD0A.text: Second time here was a cluster. The front staff was very unorganized and unprofessional. I was told our wait would be 15 minutes. They proceeded to seat people that arrived after we did. We waited 25 minutes I finally asked the hostess and I was told the owners Doctor got precedence over us. That is the last time I attempt to eat here.

gEBlDKHDP06LJb2PDLc3qA.text: Wanted to try something new in Scottsdale. A beacon of light guided me to Hash Kitchen. I was tempted to try everything on the menu but my stomach said go with the Breakfast Lasagna and I was not disappointed. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. 5/7 would recommend to anyone.

KRvyEs5IAbcSQZ5ScJg5yA.text: This spot takes the cake! The cocktails were on point, meals were above and beyond, and service was stellar. Prices were reasonable as well! Great place to get a little tipsy on a Saturday morning... or Tuesday.

JfyY7rcxPBqcAwSkiamr0Q.text: Our go to brunch spot! The bloody mary bar and mimosa flight is obviously what brings us in and the food is really good as well. Get the bruschetta. You will not regret it!

dK38NyX6uRjZVDwMNBjNLA.text: My friend and I drove all the way from the far East Valley to check out this little gem for their Wednesday special (half off Bloody Marys) and we truly enjoyed our meal! We were greeted right away and treated to a cozy table where we marveled at the menu options. We were pleased to hear that another location was opening soon in Chandler. Our server Natalie was quick and efficient and made sure we had what we needed. My friend thought her biscuits and gravy was divine, but the sausage was a bit spicy and intimidating so she asked to "trade up" for some more of that delicious gravy. Natalie made sure to bring a generous helping of gravy right away and we were truly happy! My smoked salmon benedict and side of potatoes were really good too! Only gave four stars because I would have liked to hear more about the advertised "Arizona's Largest Bloody Mary bar" & when I ordered, and I wasn't given the top shelf option either. Overall the experience was pleasant and we will definitely be trying the Chandler location as soon as it opens.

AcTqNA5bFOfeAAq4PmMm7w.text: Absolutely horrific. I have never experienced worse food or a worse meal. When we arrived we were told 10 minute wait for table. We sat at bar, wanted a drink while waiting. Waited 22 minutes for our drink order to be taken. 1 bartender was working two bars and outdoor tables. Got drinks about 10 minutes later. Still no table. Decided to order food at bar. Picture attached of the most horrific pastrami sandwich ever. Fatty un edible bacon they said was pastrami covered In about a 2 inch layer of Mayo. Nothing at all as they have advertised on Instagram (top pic) Bread was a half frozen Texas toast. $59 for two bloody Marys and the worst meal and service ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

owKNMH8Lo0wK34CAPMMS_g.text: Ambiance and Service is 5 Star. The food was just okay. I ordered their Lump Crab Meat Sweet Potato Hash, the crab meat was good however, the sweet potato hash should have some crispness to it. Their Bloody Mary Bar looked amazing. I wanted freshly squeezed OJ and was disappointed that they don't offer fresh OJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cMJuJmyctcAwH7R-qvYgUw.text: Great brunch place. Its definitely busy. The dj was awesome! I will definitely be coming back!!

oFnqss2-Q9b9bNdSCWzWJA.text: Such a great breakfast with a great vibe. Briana was such a doll and really helped make our decisions when we didn't know. She was so real and fun. Great service and food!

wDSGlmxoBpeVm5I-PtOBXg.text: Amazing spot for breakfast and drinks! We ordered the "Cereal Flight" and "Mimosa Flight" drink flights....absolutely a must. Our server Lona was amazing as well! We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tfdn0S9NXHR8gJCVKuRM4w.text: This place is great, amazing drinks and even more amazing service from Mona! My favorite place for some mimosas with the girls. They have the absolute best Bloody Mary bar I have seen to date. Huge portions on the good as well.

fK0R_Oui6aPmsA-_JDXhdw.text: I had been wanting to try hash kitchen for quite some time now after having read all of the fantastic yelp reviews. Today I finally got my chance, and I was not disappointed. Absolutely everything was fantastic. The drinks, the food, the DJ, the hostess, the server... you name it, hash kitchen outdid themselves and I am so full I can hardly move. But I can't wait to have my leftovers!!  This place was packed even at 11 on a Sunday and I had to wait about a half an hour to be seated in the restaurant at a regular table. There was no lack of entertainment or drinks while I waited though. there isn't a huge waiting area and probably not the best place for kids, IMHO, although there was one party that had 2 children there but left shortly after we were seated around 11:30. No other children were there that I saw that day.  Since it was both my friend and I's first time there, we asked our server about a few items on the menu. He recommended some great choices and was careful to tell us which items were overly large.  He also told us that we could order half-orders of both the pancakes and the French toast, which we both did. Even the half-orders of these were huge. We both ordered Mimosa flights and I ordered one of the signature cereal drinks as well. The Bloody Mary bar looked amazing too, but just wasn't in the mood for it that day. Drink service was a tiny bit slow, it took awhile to receive our first round of mimosas, and one of the Mimosa's was Kiwi instead of Strawberry like it said on the board, but the kiwi was fantastic! Worth every bit of the wait. Alex, our server, was super fun and spot-on with his recommendations.  The breakfast lasagna; out of this world. Never had anything like it and can't wait to have it the next time I go.  I wish they did a sampler flight of the breakfast cereal drinks (hint, hint!!) because the Fruity Pebbles was amaze-balls. But would love still to try the other two (I think Cocoa Puffs and Cinnamon Toast Crunch). Next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Benedict French fries!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fruity Pebbles!! (Adult Beverage)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash

jAs-L-7cmcUe_yJx8zBR8Q.text: The vibe here is HILARIOUS!!!!!  Loud DJ music during breakfast?  I guess people don't enjoy their friends anymore and don't care to have conversations with one another.  The Host was a stuck up brat.  Their attitude is very much "we don't have to be nice,  we are busy and don't need your business."  Eventually,  you will regret that snotty @ss attitude.   We were going to stay and requested to sit outside because weather was nice and we wanted to be able to HEAR each other because we LIKE each other and enjoy chit chatting without losing our voices.  I get the loud music during happy hour on a Friday night but this just made the restaurant look like it was trying too hard to be something cutting edge.  LAME. Anywho, we left before getting seated.  The patio looked crazy jammed with no breathing room.  We went to SOL Mexican Cocina for their brunch and it was amazing!!!!

G0hJRjFM3bZQY0AsGrg1BA.text: amazing.   the Maggiore group (also the creators of Sicilian Butcher/Baker) does a wonderful job of creating delicious and beautiful food.  this place is always lively and full of fun. some people have their fun at the custom drink station. others enjoy at their table where stacks of creative waffles indulge any customer.  exceptional service and mouth watering food makes Hash the best brunch in town!

4X9mTNfsqT9IGKc7ZpS5rw.text: I'm a big hash fan. I found the ambience and staff was nice.  The food is could feed a family of five, but not a lot of flavor.

KqNFL-Aqlh3ueBi-lFIrHw.text: Reasons why The Hash Kitchen is better than yo momma's kitchen...  1. The service is amazing. Food was fast and fresh and we were checked on often. I dig that   2. I've been here on multiple occasions -- in fact it's where I take all my friends/family that visit from out of town to -- the food has yet to disappoint. They even change the menu up seasonally to give us other yummy options.  3. The Bloody Mary bar is too legit to quit. One time (picture not included) I had the yummiest hush puppies ever!!   Overall great food - great service!!! You can't go wrong here!!!  ((Adrian one of the managers that stopped by to check on us hooked us up with the Cannoli Donuts for dessert (pictured) 3 words....BOMB-DOT-COM ))

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli Donuts... all made from scratch. #bomb.com
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemon &amp; Ricotta Pancakes  Herb Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict Breakfast Sandwich w/ FRIES

5HD-IX9ifEDXTdZHboxFHQ.text: Great place food and service was excellent and Bonnie is the bomb I will defiantly be back #Hashhashbaby#

_Z_k6TOCgMWRVNGuua2sBw.text: We came in on a Thursday around noon...which I'm sure was a great decision because no wait!! Bloody Mary bar...mimosa flight...and good food..can't ask for anything more! We got a veggie and Mexican scramble, strawberry banana French toast, and biscuits and gravy. We loved it all and would recommend to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry and Banana French toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican scramble

XH4M2wp0KYuJG-fKorcgXQ.text: Absolutely in LOVE with the Bloody Mary Bar. Honestly, I could make a meal out of this drink. I loved the infused vodka and the level of their spicy Bloody Mary mix. It was on point. And trust me, i know bloody Mary's. Years of experience speaking here...  Their Bloody Mary bar has such variety and the items were absolutely stop notch. I loved the bacon, The beef jerky, the oyster on the half shell... I can go on and on. I assume their sister restaurant is next door, Hoggs and Hopps. Cuz the smoked meats and the bacon were absolutely delicious.   They had a DJ during brunch on Sunday, who wrapped up around 1pm.  We got the nutella donuts, I got the herb chicken hash and hubs got the pulled pork waffles. I am sad to say, while good, the meals itself was not very flavorful.   The service was great except out waitress seemed to forget a lot of our requests and was a bit lack luster. But she was very sweet.  Next time I will just have two bloody Mary's and be a very happy bruncher :) I highly recommend you try this!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t remember which burger. The hangover burger maybe?
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb chicken hash skillet

5oKbQ-GW3vpXBs0MQj5SXg.text: Pros: The ATMOSPHERE (nuff said)-there is a live DJ who is so good of you like top 40, hip hop, and pop. It's always crowded but that's what makes it live . Unique flavor options to there food I had Oreo pancakes like what?! Amazing(it's a lot of food) They have turkey bacon and sausage options and many options for veggies.  I loved you can split a full order for most pancakes into a half also. Drink while you wait!  Cons: the wait is loooooong I'm talking a hour long or more. Not a lot of space to sit while waiting  Scottsdale is Scottsdale so a lot of ppl were complaining about it being like a club but why come ? It's Sunday and we're brunchin! :)  Otherwise I'll be back with a group I loved it !

1hs2d8RPWfKqZYrF1oPulA.text: The family and I had breakfast here for Father's Day and the place was very busy but they did a great job keeping the wait nice and short! The food was amazing! Highly recommend the cereal cocktails! Sweet and unique! We were lucky to have Patrick as our server! He was very accommodating and has an excellent memory! Wonderful way to celebrate my father on his special day!

uF0ewu-H0N1aIGbx7ez39g.text: My friend and I decided to come here based on Yelp and Google reviews and we weren't disappointed. There were a lot of people waiting outside (we came around 10:20am on a Sunday) yet our wait was about 30 minutes for an inside table. They had someone blasting music yet it wasn't loud to where you couldn't have a conversation with the people at your table. There was a mix of age groups there as well as families with kids. Our waiter was amazing and incredibly friendly. I ordered the $16 mimosa flight where they choose the flavors to bring you. That day it was passion fruit, raspberry, cherry and mango. I let the waiter know I was allergic to mango and he kindly swapped it out for an orange mimosa. I ordered the Fruity Pebble pancakes and 2 pancakes were more than enough for me (full stack is 4). My friend got a huevo ranchero hash and it was pretty big. He said he enjoyed it yet wouldn't order it again because he wants to try one of the burritos. They have a Bloody Mary bar where people were coming and going to make their drinks and add things like bacon to it. I checked in on Yelp and received a discount. I'd definitely go to this place again when I come back to Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flights for about $16. They choose the 4 flavors for you. The flavors I have there are Passion fruit, raspberry, cherry and orange.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fruity Pebble pancakes. 1/2 stack (full stack is 4) which was really filling. Comes with creme en glacé which tasted amazing.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute little coffee mugs on the table :)

itXn6PRVbSJKeTnWmdyFNg.text: We were so impressed with both the service and food!! We were sat quickly and our server was so friendly! Our party of 6, including 3 children, all enjoyed everything we ordered!! We can't wait to come back!!

juYDFaC8pFUhickorzWYCA.text: Amazing food and friendly people. If I lived here, I would be here every weekend. Try the bacon. It's thick cut and smoky delicious. The carnitas hash is incredible with chunks of meat, perfectly cooked eggs, and crispy onions. You might need a nap after.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing carnitas hash for breakfast. Oh, Hash Kitchen, why are you not in Southern California?!? I would see you every weekend!

BNVOoQ4E3ZdLcxMyIGJ1jg.text: Before I begin this review I want to say I have no connection with Hash Kitchen other than being a perennially satisfied customer. Once again we had a first rate experience at Hash Kitchen.  We usually go during the week, but we broke our rule and tried on a Saturday morning.  The restaurant was very busy, but we were once again greeted by the incomparable Bonnie who took time to greet us as she always does even though the dining areas inside and out were jammed with happy diners.  We noticed that everyone was greeted and welcomed with warmth and friendliness.  Our server, Gino, was very friendly and cooperative-even making a change in my order to satisfy my craving. The menu has some new items, in particular the Benedict Fries.  They are fabulous.  New to me were the delicious meatballs and fried ravioli offered at the Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar.  They take your custom drink to the next level. We also want to recognize the lovely Tiana who has served us on a number of occasions and is always attentive and competent. Looking forward to bringing out of town guests to experience a fun and delicious Scottsdale dining experience unlike any other at Hash Kitchen.

jnhK-T_DQbSYIYO2QqhUPA.text: Great food. Great experience. Bonnie was the best. You don't see service like that in restaurants anymore.

hWlDGBUFk5A4l6wLQ9GrSQ.text: Food was fantastic. Lump crab hash was worth it! So were the Oreo cookie pancakes. Build Your Own Boiody bar is awesome. Our server, Chris, made the experience perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump Crab and Sweet Potato hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oreo cookie pancakes

UIiSqV3BokvbML65cgr7Hg.text: Absolutely love Hash Kitchen, right down the street from my house so we're here often. The staff is ALWAYS amazing! Bonnie is such a great host and is always great to have a conversation with :) order the lump crab eggs Benedict!!

Amd6vpc8nQf9TvmediEDSQ.text: Two words Bloody Mary!  I felt the that the Bloody Mary bar was amazing for 10-12 dollars it was a awesome experience. Everything else was pretty average. My meal was just ok, overall I found the food lacked overall flavor, and the fried chicken eggs Benedict had super dry biscuits and the fried leeks on top were over kill. Nothing a little water couldn't fix. Next time I am in Scottsdale would love to stop by for a bloody, but would probably skip breakfast. Enjoyed the overall atmosphere mainly since I was on the far side of the restaurant away from the DJ's loud speaker. Service was good.

6Q8oXgdnU--TI5MPinpeIQ.text: ordered the chicken and waffle, belgian style of course. waiter recommended that we go with a couple of bottles of champagne instead of the mimosa flights offered on the menu - offers you the opportunity to mix 'em as strong as you like . maple syrup mixed with tabasco and butter; can't be beat.

tK8WiBfEbV41jdGPHFihSQ.text: Always a great time here. Awesome environment with DJ'd music, DIY blood Marys, great mimosas, and awesome food. Bonnie is a great host and keeps the energy going throughout the day. It's become a Saturday tradition for us to have breakfast here. Food recommendations: breakfast lasagna, carnitas hash, French toast, and any of the pancakes. Prices are a bit high, but you're paying  for the ambiance as much as the food. Enjoy!

7lhAyKPwKF3_ctjQLDYQ1A.text: Love this place!! No matter what you get it's good. This is definitely one of my go to breakfast spots. My favorite is the cannoli pancakes it's a must try!

vwd5wfZ8uugmMltD2Kh8fA.text: Wife and I came here for Brunch had Smores pancakes and Carnitas hash both were solid about 4-4.5 stars but the service put this place over the top both our waiter and hostess were great. Usually I only care about service if it's extremely good or extremely bad each of which happens only about 5% of the time lucky for us this service was in the good 5%. We will be back here again.

VFF_AM7rHsaBMeIZjY1LsA.text: This is the best hangout spot! I came in during my lunch break with a couple of coworkers. The best part, aside from our awesome server Lona, was the Bloody Mary bar!! I'll be back again soon

ToxI3X8x2jhIh2AJx7sp0w.text: This is a big Hi to Bonnie, who brings a lot of class to the Hash Kitchen. If you are there on Sunday when the DJ is there, she sing along to "Respect". Bonnie adds a lot of ambiance to the place and you will agree after you meet her.

RlIVajwrzh29_DvOYYjPDA.text: Although I'm not much of a brunch person, this was the only restaurant open at lunch time on Christmas Day last year. The carrot cake pancakes and the lemon ricotta pancakes were sensational and huge! Highly recommended. I wish I liked Bloody Mary's. They have a fantastic selection of choose-your-own add-ins. Even bacon!

GWyihyqm9OnWxadCbqX2Tg.text: My visit to Scottsdale began with breakfast and a bloody (not the bloody bar) at Hash Kitchen. I was impressed with my meal, the lump crab benny! I was able to choose where I wanted to sit, the bartender took care of me. She was very sweet and patient with me. I took a little longer than usual to choose my meal, its hard to choose! It was slow when I got in there by 10am, cool by me. Not only was the food and beverage great, the music was on point! Very important in my opinion!

jNmmAIcCqCNLtRH02zjZkQ.text: The food is delicious and the service and hospitality are top notch. Will definitely return when we come back to Scottsdale!

On9dzF6we5gQ7xD__E1BEg.text: Delicious food and drinks! They have a DJ there for weekend brunch-so fun! Our waitress Katie was great. Will definitely go back

aP4BSiQn1EK7yWdhVDa1SA.text: Atrocious!  We called over the phone to see how long the wait was and if we could put our names down. They said of course and that we would be next for a table when we got there. Upon arriving the manager met with us and told us, ' we dont do a wait list over the phone but we made a special case for you but dont do it again.' Saying it very loudly so everyone else waiting would hear. It was so rude and uncomfortable! Why didnt he just tell us that on the phone when we first called that it was first come first serve? We would have waited. Upon sitting down the entire meal took 2 hours!!! It took forever to get our food and only half of it came. The food was so-so and over expensive mimosas. The water smells like fish..... go ahead smell the water before you sip. You'll understand what I mean. Absolutely disgusting place, I have no idea why it has such high reviews.

edE92DWowM8LPVIrPT486w.text: Really great place with a creative breakfast menu. Excellent service as well. We went mid-morning (~10:30am) on a Wednesday. Not too busy and very nice ambiance. We brought our 9 month old son and were greeted with smiles!! Excellent food, lots of choices and not your everyday fare-but plenty of "normal breakfast" fare for the less adventurous as well.  I can't wait to go back to try more!!!

_uvBv1oGWU1grYlnB5h7zw.text: had a wonderful Sunday brunch here! the Bloody Mary bar rivals all Bloody Mary bars. So many delicious items to choose from. The mimosa flight was outstanding! I had the lemon ricotta pancakes which were the perfect combo of sweet and light. My husband had the carnitas hash and he said it was one of the best breakfasts he's had. At the end our server brought out a cannoli doughnut on the house that was amazing! Will definitely be back!

5YJ8fABpaCLfZevYv4wH7g.text: Hahahahahaha.  Is excess one of the seven deadly sins?  Gluttony is? Well, I'm not gluttonous, but we did go all out at Hash.  We arrived early, which was a smart move, because the literal party had not yet started.  We were sat at a booth near the Bloody Mary Bar and immediately received a waiter.  He couldn't have been nicer, and provided to go coffee after asking if he could.  We also noticed the actual bar on the other side of the restaurant, with a DJ playing music.  When you reach a certain age, you have to party on Sunday morning, and I am at that age.  I mentioned the Bloody Mary Bar.  If you stumbled on one of the various print and internet publications claiming Hash to have among the best bloodys in town you need to know that is 100% True.  The $12 Bar is a step up from the basic $9 bloody into a world of limitless access.  Celery, carrots, pickles, cheese, slim Jim's, bacon, meatballs, pickled everything, olives of all variety all at your disposal. Load these snacks on top of the infused vodka bloody for a top notch drink.  While that may be a meal in itself, we also ate.  And there was much rejoicing.  My wife had the fried chicken Benedict which was a whole fried breast of chicken and 2 muffins.  I think she liked it, but adored the Bloody Mary.  I went with the s'mores French toast and I was served 2 pieces of bread that made up a half loaf.  Best breakfast I've had in a long time.  No complaints, except for the expanding stomach.  You can't go wrong here.  Just come early.

ZrIl9qhHV8Y6bUg9_-4v1A.text: Hash Kitchen is one of many good breakfast/brunch restaurants around Scottsdale. I'd certainly eat here again; however, I can't say that this is my favorite.  Pros: Food -- got the carnitas hash, would recommend Drinks -- huge Bloody Mary bar, various mimosas Service -- no complaints Atmosphere -- pleasant Park -- sufficient   Cons: Value -- fruit platter was $10 for a few pieces of fruit Wait -- expect a fair wait if you go on a weekend  Overall, I'd say that hash kitchen is pretty good and definitely worth a visit. Just not 5 stars good in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash

xu8Axgv8SgYw6d7HrJlJ2Q.text: The setup of the place is really modern and definitely an Instagram-worthy picturesque set up. I was initially really excited to try this place as I come from Texas and we don't have a place like this there. I ordered the Herb Fried Chicken and Waffles with Hash potatoes and they are definitely not what I expected. The potatoes were extremely bland and very unappetizing, and I didn't eat very many because of that. The chicken for the chicken and waffles were really bland as well and overall, unappetizing. I am one to eat all of my food but I couldn't eat all of it because I just didn't enjoy it. The 3 stars come from the waitstaff and the overall set-up of the restaurant , but I definitely will not come back if I come visit Arizona again

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores Pancakes
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VgvU6QdUd-Ird9ehWFDXdA.text: This restaurant has a DJ on site. Although the restaurant was quite loud they had good music playing. We arrived on 4th of July and was seated right away. My friend ordered the corned beef poutine and I had the fried chicken hash. The servers were attentive and courteous. They were also quick and attentive. The food was not as great. My fried chicken was hard, cold and quite frankly tasted old. It was a fried chicken strip on top of the hash. The hash was fried potatoes on the bottom and lacked flavor and seasonings. The poached egg was the favorite part of the dish. My friends poutine looked delicious and he enjoyed his meal. I don't know if I'd come back again I mean who messes up fried chicken? My meal was dry, lacked flavor and was meh.

hexTgX1IQMn1MJzJ6omNsQ.text: I frequent Hash Kitchen due to the proximity to my home. The customer service is always top notch. So far everything I have tried has been delicious. Must try the mimosa flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash and Carne Asada Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight

UDqvS1ohm-Rb5VvxlYjegQ.text: Asha was our waitress. She was very knowledgeable about the menu. Last time my fiance and I were here I didn't care to much about what I ordered so they comped off my order and asked if I wanted something else. This time our food taste amazing and the environment is awesome. Highly recommend this place and our waitress ASHA. #gogettourworth

9pvTzztPq1qvV7ifBlyOWg.text: Do yourself a favor and try Hash Kitchen if you love brunch and a good time. There is going to be a long wait on weekends and they don't take reservations but seating at the bar is first come first serve if you have a small party.   Mimosas come by the flight and they are known to have the biggest Bloody Mary bar.   This is the first place I have ever seen a bacon board as an appetizer and it was amazing!   When I have gone here on the weekends there is usually a DJ and I've seen 2-3 bachelorette parties... great food and great vibes!

bNdkysrkAQMnoWJtgETaSg.text: Came here on a Saturday with a couple of girlfriends for brunch.  LOCATION- its in a big strip plaza where Sprouts is located. There is a lot of parking spaces so no need to worry!  SERVICE-the hostess was super friendly and our server was amazing! I forgot to get her name but I wish I knew! She was very attentive!  CARNITA HASH- it was delicious! It had a lot of flavor! They forgot to put avocados in mine so I informed them and they fixed it right away! The pulled pork was tender and the potatoes went well with the pulled pork. The biscuit that came on the side was bomb. It had sugar on the surface of the biscuit which made it sweet and savory. It wasnt too heavy which I thought was awesome.  This place had a DJ on weekends and the DJ that was there was pretty damn awesome! Its definitely a young crowd so if you dont like loud music, then this place isnt for you. I would definitely be back when Im in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. CARNITA HASH W/ BISCUIT

W3O4QFlOjmAomNcuKwIbCA.text: If you are craving breakfast food and do not visit this place, you are a #bum! #HASH# Kitchen is absolutely the best breakfast joint west of the Mississippi.  It has a lot to offer. The Bloody Mary bar is phenomenal and the Mimosa flight will leave you craving for more. Whether you're looking for a meal that's sweet or savory,  #hash has you covered. Some of my favorites are the avocado toast, cannoli pancakes and banana split brioche.  If you are brave enough,  get the adult Capri Sun #drinkresponsibly. The manager Gino understands the True meaning of customer service.  We were welcomed by the owner and Gino. They made us feel welcomed. Lastly, our waitress Asha was absolutely fantastic.  Attentive, helpful and accommodating.  She had the best personality and provided top notch customer service.  Thank you for making my breakfast experience great! See you soon.

VS8e8DLvIzYTPzgg7sby5Q.text: I've been a fan of other Hash Kitchen's for a while, but had a terrible experience at this one recently.  We went on a Sunday and waited 90 minutes for a table. Now, we expected it (and got some drinks to tide us over, so that wasn't awful, but I expected so much more once we got sat.  Our server, while nice, seemed to consistently forget that she had our table. Took about 10 minutes for her initial visit and kept forgetting to bring things we asked for. Our food took forever to come out and was not all correct. Lastly, there was apparently an issue with the computer system at the bar, which causes them to go into full lock down mode for some reason..as though they couldn't figure out an analog way to keep track of orders. So, not only did we not ever get our drinks, but our server had completely forgotten that we even ordered any!  I truly hope this was a fluke and that they just had a bad day and were seating more people than they could handle, but it definitely left a bad taste in my mouth for this location and makes me not want to come back.

K3fLqOJ4kl0Gbu6pURkpJg.text: This place is the bomb-shiz-nizzle-snap-diggity. No but seriously, if you are reading this you should already be getting into you car. Here is a list of 5 tips:   1. No reservstions. Dont be a premadona, you will wait 30 minutes for a table. Use it as your oppurtunity to start with the mimosa flight for your wait.   2. If you come after 10 am on sat and sund the DJ spins fire .. like old school hip hop Onyx Slam, TLC Waterfalls, En Vogue Free Your Mind fire. If this is your chosen adventure add 15 min to your wait time (see 1 above).    3. Christina corn cakes benedict: a sweet and hearty mixture of love wrapped in a corn husk.   3. The pimp goblet mimosa....so how else would you refer to AN ENTIRE bottle of champagne, fresh squeezed OJ, 2 huge neon straws, a pin wheel, garnished with chili dusted cotton candy?   4. If you like benedicts.....aside from the Christina corn cakes, the Pretzel Benedict is like Thanksgiving at the movie theater assuming you love crunchy onion strings on your green bean casserole and a soft pretzel with cheese at the movie theater.    5. The serial shooter flight, for the stoner in you that has graduated to becoming an alcoholic.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Man buns, mimosas and a legit bloody mary bar. I am home.

ef9qvP3ED70pSpKzGAEiJg.text: Had been wanting to try this place for the longest while!  hubz and I considered it "divine intervention" when there was a Sprout's in the same strip mall.  We were headed to a different one. I had the Veggie frittata w/ goat cheese.  Yum!  And so much that I shared some with my husband and have enough left for my breakfast tomorrow. Hubby went for the traditional corned beef hash and said it was great-he finished the proteins (corned beef and two eggs) and took his potatoes home for breakfast as well. Our waitress was fun, knowledgeable and helpful. Loved the coffee cups!  Perfect size for this coffee fanatic!

YRHznz5VWpY1PIL_heudAQ.text: Such a shame this place use to be great but my family and I literally just had the worst breakfast experience of our lives, and we've eaten at Denny's people!   We started with the bruschetta board which was fine. Then husband preceded to order the avocado toast and I ordered the breakfast burrito. The food came out quickly, much more quickly than I expected, and we quickly figured out why. The bacon on my husband's avocado toast was completely uncooked, it was white! None of the fat had been rendered down. We asked our server to take it back, and the manager came out and had the audacity to ask us if we wanted the bacon WELL DONE. No madame we would like the bacon cooked!  I then had two bites of my breakfast burrito but it also had raw bacon in it so I let it go.   A second manager came out to see us and I feel bad as he seemed genuinely unhappy with the way things were going, but at that point our breakfast was a lost cause.  We asked for our check. We hoped they would at least not charge us for the avocado toast which thankfully they did not BUT after all that they then charged us $37 dollars for the terrible experience! We weren't the only one with problems either, the table next to us waited 15 minutes for someone to come see them. It was a disaster! Shame, we won't be going back.

QHOi5se90P-XzwE0n0Cv3g.text: My friend and I tried out Hash Kitchen last Sunday for brunch. I have nothing to say but ... ummm YES YES! Yes to the food. Yes to the servers. And yes to the atmosphere. We had a blast. They had a DJ and an unbelievable Bloody Mary bar. If you go, make sure to go see Charlie at the BM bar. He is hilarious and helpful. He makes the BM an experience for sure.   Also, the food- so delicious and unique. You can't go wrong. Portion sizes are large enough to share too.   I will definitely be going back.

2yAjmdUjHZZoxmi4cMvBdQ.text: I was very excited to try this place. After reading all the reviews I don't think there was a bad choice to make with what we ordered. We started with the build your own bloody mary bar and the mimosa flight. Both were absolutely tasty! The mimosa flight flavors are pre-selected but in the bloody mary you can get as crazy as you want. There are over 40 toppings and its all self-serve. We went on a weekday but we were told on the weekend the toppings include meatballs and sliders! We also ordered the breakfast starter"bruschetta" which has 3 different toppings but by far the best one was the marscapone and strawberries.we also ordered the fried chicken hash and the carnitas hash. Both were unbelievably good and you get a huge amount of food, easily enough for 2 people for one hash! Definitely will be back the next time we are in Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drink flights
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drink menu

nBTs5XQ2-FyFi2rejA0f9Q.text: In Arizona with friends. This is the first food place that we stopped at in AZ. The atmosphere was really friendly from the time we walked through the door to the end of the meal. LONA was our waitress and she was amazing. The French toast and bacon tasted amazing. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Applewood bacon and classic french toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oeKnZ_eDx63kQamc1OGTJA.text: Saw the pictures of the food and HAD to come check this place out! It's pretty good size restaurant and came for breakfast. Wasn't too busy, was seated right away. I tried the banana split brioche and not only was it huge, it was delicious! Had berries on top with whipped cream, and the second layer had bananas and Carmel sauce. Didn't get to finish it all but wow it was better than expected! May just have to come back to his place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2K4CPugAG7bkkMNUegusqg.text: The service was great! In all, we ordered biscuits- more like scone(sweeter than savory); the New York hash - ok; berry pancakes- ok; kids chicken strips- tasty; kids waffle- best thing at the table   The atmosphere was club-like and loud, but definitely made for a unique experience. Noticed some folks making what appeared to their own concoctions of Bloody Mary's with meatballs and other, full meal-like, options. If you have a couple of hours to kill I would recommend this place for the experience alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kids chicken strips
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. What&#39;s left of the biscuits (tasted more like a scone than what I expected for a biscuit)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New York hash

EETvN8aaym7uCjylM8SdDw.text: AMAZING!!!! The vibe was everything the decor, ambience, drink and our lovely waiter Jessica were top notch. Will Def be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IFTH_K7NFB6_NSbJCTUMtA.text: I took a friend from out of town here to impress her with Scottsdale's cool brunch places & we were NOT disappointed! Portions were crazy big and the service was great! The avocado toast is a MUST TRY, it is not your regular "toast". While the items were a tiny bit pricey; the Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar was just too fantastically delicious to think of taking away a star! 5 Stars! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0N7X-tZjpcox8h9hdZv_DA.text: Omg! Seriously shocked this place has so many good reviews. The food sucked! I ordered Huevos Rancheros, and a half order of the coconut French toast, and my husband ordered a veggie scramble. Basically, what we got was a plate full of potatoes. My huevos rancheros had a bunch of thick, nasty tasting red sauce, smothered all over it, that stained around my whole mouth with every bite I took. It was really bad, and I wish I would've sent it back! The French toast wasn't very good either. The two stars are for our server, he was very nice, and on top of things. The owner of this place needs to try what we ordered today, guaranteed they wouldn't even be able to finish eating it.  Wasted $$ coming here. Denny's would have been better, for real!

dRuzuRrQDowIRZ2A1WVKlA.text: Great food but so freaking loud with the DJ blasting phat beats it's impossible to talk. Would probably come back but maybe request outside or bring some earplugs.

wrrGVQOuNiQaffaNHfbe6Q.text: Going on a Sunday morning we expected to wait. 90 minutes. No biggie for a party of 6.   Waiting awhile into our quote time we finally get buzzed that our table is ready. We go and check in and get walked to our table to find it was only set for 3, when there was 6 of us.   We get walked back to the host stand and they tell us we would have to wait another 45 minutes for a table. After they made the mistake. The young hosts barely muffled out an apology. They should have honored their mistake after notifying the wrong people and put us to the next available table. But nope. Totally felt unwelcoming so we left and took our business elsewhere.

DDh1JxoFD2ZNUamH376Wig.text: I think this is my new favorite brunch places to go to now! The energy of the restaurant brings people in, such as their DJ, this older lady, which I'm assuming was the manager- dancing by the door (totally cute!), and service was great! I ordered their coconut toast (recommended by the waiter) but it was okay, I'm just picky when it comes to coconut. I'm not a big fan of coconut flakes sprinkled on my toast. Their mimosa flight was unique. I would definitely recommend this place to locals around the valley for breakfast and brunch

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peach mimosa!!!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coconut French toast

vJFsG6po48TX22GSbYeW1A.text: Food was very good but came in about an hour and a half near close and only one server was around seating and serving. She was awesome although it made service slower than it should be :/ I felt bad for how much running around she had to do. I wish I could have experienced the regular service they give when they open.

BAAWc-36Q4Dxt0K5C45g5g.text: We were greeted right away and had an awesome server! (Very cute blonde with a braid) She recommended we get the Cristina's Tamale Cake and the Carnitas Hash, both which were absolutely delicious.  On top of that, they have the best Bloody Mary Bar I've seen in a long while with fun flavored vodkas and a variety of pickled veggies! What a wonderful brunch spot, I can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Mhnr5OB-0I5LUCnGv3xpJA.text: Awful! Every single time I've come to this place they get the order wrong..always a bad experience and I live a few blocks away. What a shame. Food is over priced too.

gUB4jZLBmjE4czAaid6tJA.text: I love their Bloody Mary bar. I put bacon, celery, egg on top with Tito's the main alcohol. So good! Egg Benedict with blackened shrimp was so amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ark3AEazoySpTsRYgGTVoA.text: Decided to stop by on a Saturday Morning for Brunch, Definitely recommend you get there early because it gets packed. DJ was playing some good music but wasnt overpowering the Food and the Bloody Mary Bar. I had the Sicilian Sausage Hash and Classic French Toast. I totally over estimated my appetite . The portion sizes were huge but tasted oh so Good. Would highly recommend you try it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic French Toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sicilian Sausage Hash

neShnfv6LhMHJDyfQ_farw.text: First of all... the make your own Bloody Mary bar was insanely awesome! On Sunday's they have a DJ playing good loud music . Ordered the best Monte Cristo sandwich! Very nice place ! The manager or owner was there making sure everyone was enjoying themselves and making sure everything was running smoothly. Great staff. Amazing fun place. The best brunch in Scottsdale!! You have to try !

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3ZzDGnDhohkSu6WQqrw0sA.text: So dropped by because I had heard the hype. They weren't wrong , it was a weekday but service matched food in perfection and Mimosa's for all the flavors are well thought out and flavor balanced. Did I mention there was some kind of electrical issue with my visit? No because it was seamlessly handled and beyond delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Weekday bar visit, stop judging, chicken hash with the most addictive substance on earth those little maple covered bits

uIz5guhCo5W6uOf30Dxing.text: Expensive, noisy, way too big portions. Really not my scene.  The restaurant is nice, service was excellent but it really wasn't my type of place.  I had the Avocado Toast and for me there was way too much bread and not enough avocado, some weird jam it was too much going on in the dish. Maybe I just like simpler fare.

IE1yepCc7v6K9TrWw8AqrQ.text: The food was delicious but on the pricy side; and it took a long time to come out. I am sure that is because this place was packed! There wasn't an open seat to be found. There was a large Bloody Mary bar that had a ridiculous selection of items to pop in it, so if bloody are your thing, you may really enjoy it. Unfortunately for me the DJ was waaay too much; too loud; too in the middle of everything.  Go check it out once but it won't be a regular spot for me.

dtk0-MHAWyTmlK0aA_bPcQ.text: We took our close family friends here based on the great reviews. All I can say is that I am SO impressed. We started with the bloody bar, after we got the BEST server, Selena! All of her "bomb" recommendations were to die for. We tried one of each. We'll definitely be back and we'll always ask for Selena!

81vB_JO4vvG87N8OAvEBPA.text: Service and vibe were excellent. Food was not exceptional or even close. It's hard to make a bad breakfast, but somehow they managed. The potatoes had no flavor and the fried chicken hash was dry and the poached egg was over cooked. Would not return.

rcaRpdhy3BAZwXjKxsm9TA.text: Start with a build your own Bloody Mary bar then go straight to business with a great breakfast situation! Everything is big and outstanding!   Definitely will be back again and again!

56FQp9J74umWtizRFtgi4w.text: Best brunch to date in Scottsdale. Good drinks but not the place to go if your looking for unlimited drinks. We just wanted one and we're so happy with our meal. Great drinks, great food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast brushett
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. MAke your own bloody bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash

yDRwP4WUMgQ_DJQPDGbiBw.text: I really wanted to like this place, but it is more style than substance. My wife and I were visiting Scottsdale from the cold Chicago for a little weekend fun & sun. We decided to leave the hotel for breakfast at around 9:30am. We checked in and were given a pager, which went off in about 20 minutes (not bad for weekend breakfast spots).  The positives: great location, hip vibe with a DJ, Bloody Mary bar with dozens of fixings, great coffee, cool decor and a really nice bar area with flat panels. Negatives: mediocre service, average food and very high prices. We shared a bacon sampler (undercooked bacon dripping with grease). My wife had a dry and flavorless frittata, while I had the Chilaquiles (I've had better both in the US & Mexico). The coffee and Bloody Mary were delicious.  I recommend this place for the drinks and fun atmosphere. For breakfast, you can do better elsewhere in Scottsdale.

kyu1k0hlil6cz3EPHmQ1Eg.text: Brought my boyfriend here for his birthday because he loves chicken and waffles. He is not one to be overly excited about food, but he absolutely loved the chicken and waffles! I could smell the flavor that came along with it and It smelled very tasty.  I ordered the lemon and ricotta pancakes because I love absolutely lemon. The pancakes came out and they were huge and there were four on the plate ! It came with butter, syrup and mascarpone on the side. The pancakes were absolutely delicious . It was everything I expected of the pancakes to be . I don't like overly sweet things so thEse pancakes were perfect . I highly recommend them .   Alec greeted us at the door and we asked for a table outside and he made sure he found a spot on the patio even though it  was pretty full on the patios. Alec was very attentive and had a great attitude! Come in and ask for Alec !   We did not take advantage of the Bloody Mary bar but it definitely looks like a great bar if you are looking for a boozy brunch ! There are fantastic summer specials going on right now for mimosas and bloody Mary's !

096-8HrQJDhjKXs1Ad5UHQ.text: This is always our "go to" breakfast spot.  ALWAYS great food - great service.  Very busy for a Wednesday A.M.

NT5npwH3bpLYqvOsnLZZVw.text: Came here for a bachelorette party brunch and we all thoroughly enjoyed our time. The mimosa flights were a fun and unique drink to get our day started! The food was all phenomenal. If you ask they will give you half portions of some entrees as well which helped us to try more food. Would absolutely come here when in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LGv-BqLSEgGsKRAJ5WgrSQ.text: I went here for the first time last Sunday for brunch! The wait was a little long at 45 minutes, but I think that's pretty standard for a weekend brunch spot in North Scottsdale. They have a pretty big Bloody Mary bar that you can take advantage of while you wait.  The best part about this place is the $6 mimosas! They have several flavors to choose from. I got the blueberry first, and then the black cherry. Both were awesome! My food was also delicious! I got the prosciutto eggs Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was amazing and the ciabatta bread tasted fresh.  Overall I had a great experience and would go back! Just be prepared to wait awhile if you go on the weekend :)

BQBuqZnrTRULHVwxwGXmLg.text: I had never heard of Hash Kitchen but was looking for a place to meet my parent for brunch near their hotel and Yelp helped me stumble upon Hash. The search feature indicated they offered a dog friendly patio, I called to confirm and they did. They mentioned they do not take reservations for under 10 people but the space is good sized and they have three different patios as well. We were seated immediately and greeted by a friendly waitress. She was able to offer some suggestions on our orders and we decided to go with the Carnitas hash (one of the best sellers according to her), the berry waffle, and the chicken and waffle. My husband enjoyed his carnitas, I tried the meat and it was delicious. He mentioned that there were a lot of different flavors that were used in the dish, which almost made it indistinguishable. He mentioned that a hot sauce or more salsa could have enhanced the dish. My mom devoured her berry waffle and highly recommended them. My dad and I both enjoyed the chicken and waffles, you get a little surprise of bacon in the dish. There were a lot of shoe string style onion rings, which were good but perhaps could be fewer. The chicken was white meat, had a good glaze on it and the waffle was delicious. The average meal is around $14 but the portions were pretty decent. If you are looking for something more upscale for brunch, I would recommend Hash Kitchen for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Berry waffle
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles

C7K2tFSThATIFmrq9APpew.text: What a place! The bloodys were ahhmazing.  I've never seen a bloody bar like this place (and we've done bloody bars before!).  The bottomless memosas were great too!  That said - the food was great but lacking in distinction and mostly under-delivered on the menu descriptions.  Don't get me wrong though - the food was really good hence still four stars.  We all agreed these folks delivered an excellent experience.  Some of what we ordered - smoked salmon Benedict, fried chicken Benedict, donut appetizer, cereal Popsicles (for our kiddo - loved em), steak and eggs, and a few other entrees among six of us...

We also ordered a side of scrambled eggs and bacon and they were both very good!! The bacon was the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and crispy. Very delicious!! We would definitely come back here again!! Danielle was our waitress and she was so helpful! She gave us some good ideas on what to order

6PUsPmCEZTsVUmdIoX-T7Q.text: Such a fun place! It's hopping with the live DJ playing fun songs from now and then. The brunch bruschetta... Nom! If you're a bloody Mary fan; they have an entire bar dedicated with a bartender to assist ya. Fun times and good food but be prepared for a wait.

O2fC99YiLTJfA7_l5wQOOw.text: Discovered hash kitchen a few months ago and now we make it a regular visit when we come to town! Their corn beef hash is delicious, but their brunch bruschetta is our favorite! They have a Bloody Mary bar that's build your own but we usually get the regular order. Everything we have tried from the pancakes to all the hash combos have been amazing! The food never disappoints. Weekends are slammed, come early!

vdJTyVDlHfI0fGOsviaw3Q.text: Ok so there is a bloody mary bar and then there is the hash kitchen bar... Who needs breakfast when you can build a colossal bloody mary chalked full of delicious bloody mary bites!  I kid you not, they have over 40 options for you to build a bloody mary, that's 40225345056 different combinations possible, based on Vodka preferences, bloody mary mixes, toppings!   They have a super diverse menu that there is something for everyone, I love the corned beef hash, and the lump crab and sweet potato hash... I recommend staying away from the Herb Fried chicken, it sounds good in concept, execution hasn't been stellar the couple times I have ordered it.. The breading just isn't crispy.   Word to the wise, they do have a have a DJ on the weekends that can get kind of well LOUD! Def worth a visit!

x_Umt7bLKmn3VIm8AAfQOQ.text: Way overrated food reviews. It's all about the Bloody Mary bar. Dry ass pancakes - crazy photogenic though for all you foodie thots out there.

8HQYL5VX603pM0svArfuYw.text: I town for a graduation. Great service; great food. Thank you Gino for recommendation.

eHl7HdrwPQD8eVXJqr8FFQ.text: I had the best brunch at Hash Kitchen last weekend.  The BYOBM bar is the best of any I've been to; the mimosa flights were delicious, food was good...and the service (we had Alec) was INCREDIBLE!!  Highly recommend, worth every second of the wait :)

Yhe cereal flight and raspberry mimosa are to die for, and I havent seen a better looking Bloody Mary bar. It had over 40 different things. It's beautiful. 2 huge thumbs up.

ra6sePEWowtUfVbns7uFfg.text: I love this place! They always seat you quickly, the Bloody Mary bar is amazing and so are the prices! The service is great! Lona was so sweet and took great care of us!

DL7bd3xblM5kqyETWW-BKQ.text: In town for my best friends birthday and stopped here for brunch. Can we say DELICIOUS?! I ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes, applewood smoked bacon and a side of scrambled eggs. The pancakes weren't too sweet especially for being so early in the day and the bacon was REAL Bacon thickness. But the best part has to be the Flight Mimosas - 4 flavored mimosas to get the party started! Our server was very nice and for a group of 11 we got our food pretty quickly. Will definitely be back if we come back to the city.

ETZRKYvGPwjlhfll-F3aUQ.text: Cool place with nice employees.   Visited Hash for the first time on Mother's Day (of all days). It was BUSY, which I suppose was a good sign. Busy is not my choice, but despite, it was an organized chaos. Customers and employees seemed happy and patient.   We started with the build-your-own bloody mary bar.  It was entertaining to say the least.   The food was good. I ordered a mexican scrambler. The French toast (ordered by one of the other people that I was with) little looked amazing.  Honestly, I'd have to revisit and try some other things on the menu before I decide to put this place on my "go to" list of favorite places...or not.   Overall, good food, very lively atmosphere and clean environment. It was the highlight of my visit.

QVnmjSaaUhxQJicUi1xdYg.text: Awesome hip breakfast joint! Took my grandma and mom here over the weekend when all our other options were packed, and we were all super happy to discover this place! The coolest part is the huge build your own Bloody Mary bar. I do not like bloody Marys, but I thought the variety of things they had to add to it was so neat. It was pretty busy on a Saturday morning, but the three of us were seated pretty quickly. The menu has quite a few options, and luckily for me some great vegetarian stuff! I got a build your own scramble, you get to pick three things (cheeses, meats, veggies). I ordered my scramble with broccolini, spinach, and avocado. My mom also got a build your own scramble, and my grandma went all out and got the cannoli pancakes. We were oogling at other peoples dishes as they were being brought out. Everything looked amazing! Especially those donut things, making a return visit for that. My scramble was delicious, I loved it. The fresh biscuit it came with was good too, and I'm usually not a huge fan of biscuits. The hash potatoes were yummy but I prefer mine a tad more crispy. I don't like cannolis so I did not like my grandmas pancakes, but she loved them! My mom liked her scramble too, although the artichokes turned her scramble brown which worried us at first sight haha. Service was good too! We were all pleased.

4vZaycvgwq0sYuBN6o-x-A.text: Excellent breakfast or brunch place with a nice patio (with misters) plenty of parking and good service. Highly recommend their Benedict selections! Also have cappuccinos & lattes.Best feature is their Bloody Mary "Make it yourself" station. Must check this place out

tXFF06-OXZlrEGpgaY5_qQ.text: NOT worth the wait!  Was very excited to bring friends of mine that just moved to Scottsdale & arriving at 11:15a they said about a 40 min wait...over an hour later they said maybe 15 min so we lucked out & got seats at the bar. Fast-forward 30 min later (once seated at the bar) & ordered, I then get my 'ticket' to go & get in line at the BYO Bloody Mary bar. Trying to be nice but also expressing my frustration, the Bloody Mary Maven proceeded to have serious attitude with me! So literally in the subsequent 15 min it took me to get my Bloody Mary (45 min total at this point) I get back to my bar seat to find my breakfast has gotten cold. I asked that they send it back, take it off the tab, which they did & were super nice about, but really...why would we ever come back here??? If you know you're that busy on the weekend for Brunch, wouldn't you at least hire more staff &/or at least try to serve the people sitting right in front of you at the bar? Disappointed, Hash, severely disappointed.

wnqA2LdMKvCX54GoDK6x5A.text: Love this place!  Great food and warm environment.  Although we didn't sample the Bloody Mary bar, it looked amazing!  We ordered cannoli pancakes, large fruit sampler, and two hashes.  So much food!  When we go back we will split the hash.  Solid place for breakfast!

We would have loved to had the food and given them our $500 bill but we will take our money elsewhere.

foFgLR5D7UwQXWLCRx8Jcg.text: Absolutely love this place! I've been twice with different friends and the food is always really good. I've had the Bloody Mary, berry mimosa, fried chicken hash and the carne asada hash.  I'd recommend them all! Next time I go I'm planning on trying the lump crab and sweet potato hash. The place is pretty unique and has a great vibe.   The only issue I've ever had is being seated. The first time it was an hour wait but for 20 minutes+ the table next to us was open and it seemed like no one else was waiting. The manager ended up seating us there and profusely apologized that we hadn't been sat sooner. He even gave us a drink on the house for the wait which was pretty nice since we had said anything. All in all still a great place and worth your time and money. You'll enjoy it!

b1BRFejHdKQdM6_SMQDW7A.text: This place was amazing! Our neighbors invited us to bike over on a Saturday morning because we'd heard about the Bloody Mary Bar... Clearly we had not heard ALL about the bloody Mary bar... This place kills it... we have a choice of celery salt to rim the glass but we also had bacon salt and then the buffet included, no kidding, 62 condiments to add AND at the end you could have a plate full of toasted ravioli and/or meatballs to go with that... All for $12... You read that right $12!!  And, if you're lucky enough to have Natalie as your server, you'll be treated like total royalty!!  Loved, loved, loved it!!!

1YUXTaobT4uOvZjIR-JbFw.text: Food was DELISH! We ordered the Chocolate Nutella donuts before our meal came. I ordered the pulled pork beni - it was fantastic. They didn't use your usual english muffin, they use their own biscuit and was made perfect. Ambiance was nice. Good place to enjoy breakfast / brunch.

n1XBUJYCmjWRodUvCTKqlg.text: SO YUM! We had their breakfast burrito and Mexicana scramble - so delicious! Also, the service was a delight, especially Bonnie who was a joy to chitchat with.   I'll definitely be coming back here :).

a2JbwFvKD4uu5axL77ROfw.text: Fantastic service! Alec was helpful & informative. Brunch was delicious. Bloody Mary bar beyond expectations! Winner winner!!!

fdmYxOibS4iJVn6iHvz46Q.text: Best brunch spot in Scottsdale. Awesome drinks, trendy ambiance and delicious food. Make sure you stop by whenever you are in town. You won't regret it! Will be back for sure!

dkLwP60DqIYr7wncPcCmqw.text: We had some friends in town for the College Football Championship and needed a good Sunday brunch spot.  Being new to the area, we turned to Yelp.  First place I looked at was THK.  Great reviews, 4.5 stars and the food looked great, so we checked it out.  They do not take reservations, but we got there around 1 PM and we only had a 20 minute wait...and that was because we needed a table for 5.    The wait was not a big deal because everyone got the BYOBM bar.  My goodness, you could just have that for the meal and with all of the toppings available, you could get full off of that.  No hassle trying to close a tab quick, they just add it to your table bill.    The food was outstanding, just check out my pics...yum yum.  The regular coffee was very good and for the price, I am not even sure I would ever get the French press for $6.50.    The restaurant has a trendy LA feel to it.  They even had a DJ playing music (he quit playing music at 1).  The staff was super friendly and welcoming.    The only reason for the loss of a star...the waitress.  She was not horrible by any means, and was at least pleasant, but she forgot several drinks, never refilled my coffee, was scarce, and took a long time to bring anything to us or check on us.  I think half the reason I was still in a great mood is because everything else was so good.  I would recommend for a great Sat/Sun brunch experience.

7XOWBWsKCv566qMyvhG2lQ.text: DON'T GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GAIN 100lbs IN ONE SITTING. There is nothing healthy about this place. If you just worked out I DO NOT recommend going to breakfast here because nothing is clean. There is only one omelet that can be healthy but everything comes with a biscuit and hash browns so good luck with the discipline. Additionally the service sucks. Our waitress was incredibly rude. I ordered a green tea and it was clean when brewed and I could tell it was sweetened. On top of that our food came out wrong. I'll never go back. It's a cute atmosphere tho, but the food and staff isn't for me.

Love to dance, no matter what time it is! This restaurant is an awesome adventure! Cheers
