Yclx5DAe35j6lbJNRhkoCg.text: This place is amazing!  Coming from someone who has never posted a review!  The hostess dances in the aisles! Patrick, our waiter was awesome!  The food is spectacular.  The DJ and Music is off the hook!

0NrQk5uA0UpeMzhPzJAZUw.text: Great meal! Alec made our experience though as they have a full menu. Delicious food and drinks. Amazing Bloody Mary bar.  Thanks Alec for making our time!

gjau2RzhwNnHzruMdQdcew.text: We are visiting from California and wanted a delicious brunch on a Friday that is dog friendly. The yelp reviews did not disappoint! We arrived at the Hash Kitchen and were welcomed by very nice staff. Our server was Lorna, she was amazing! Had great menu suggestions and tip and was super attentive! We really enjoyed her genuine friendly nature and over all attitude! We will definitely be back!

NziJrqGa2sSAnAHtI9oTCg.text: Came here for the hype, heard a lot of great things about this place. Food was delicious, mimosas were fantastic  and the service Sarah have given us was outstanding. Definitely coming back!

bqfD8eiwDBnSTqbTkczlGQ.text: Loved having Lona as our server! She was so full of contagious energy and honest feedback on the menu. The mimosa flights were an experience I'd want to do again. For sure would come again!

sz8gEfv8Ob-oCztRfFitrQ.text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant for breakfast in the entire Valley. During a recent visit, we started with the mimosa flight and brunch bruschetta - both amazing and truly unique. The egg entrees were incredible and perfectly prepared. The vibe here is energized and really fun. Although it's usually crowded, service was outstanding, waits for a table and for our food were minimal on a prime time Saturday morning and the servers were friendly, helpful, patient and efficient. Management has it figured out here! I can't wait for my next breakfast at Hash Kitchen.

uhkjTUTUXw8lMEuGUoTEyA.text: Definitely the best place to brunch in the Phoenix area! The whole experience was a blast and their mimosas/Bloody Mary bar are exceptional!! Highly recommend. Our server, Jessica was by far the greatest and made our morning so fun! She was speedy, friendly, and a joy to have serve us!

4dZ5gyRVCZWUnHa1zY3DFA.text: My favorite breakfast menu in town by far. We tend to avoid the weekends, as it's so busy.  Portions are huge!   Love the French Press coffee table side.

jZQ2Ps8rKLSh8anToJwUbg.text: Wow Wow and WOW. We just found Hash Kitchen the last time we were in Scottsdale- and got there early on a Sunday morning. We were able to sit outside which was nice, and our server was super chill as well. I had the juevos racheros hash and my hubby had the corned beef hash. Both were amazing! Be prepared to roll out of there because the portions are huge. The biscuit that comes with is fresh daily - and SO GOOD.

eGPD-cq06jSIiE_FfU_e2g.text: Excellent place for breakfast.  We went last week fairly early around 8 am.  The morning was nice and we decided to sit outside since inside it was like a fridge, super cold.  They have a couple of areas outside with a few tables.  The patios seem to be dog friendly, so we might come back with our neighbors dog when we are dog sitting.  I had the Cristina's tamale cakes, it had a corn tamale base and pulled pork with 2 perfectly poached eggs.  My husband had the Mexican Scrambler.  Service was prompt and efficient.  Can't wait to go back and try french toast or the waffles.  I came back the following week and had the lemon ricotta pancakes, they were delicious but incredibly large portion.  Comes with cream cheese frosting, butter and maple reduction sides. Could barely eat half of the three pancakes portion.  I also had the mimosa flight, so awesome. Joe had the carnitas hash, super yummy.  I guess this is our new favorite breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito, husband asked for carnitas instead of bacon
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I had to get the Tamale cakes again!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava mimosa! Who knew!

9_ZZWLxerkY31fcQXEP1AQ.text: Well  where do I begin** the wait time was almost two hours  the place is definitely under staffed  we didn't receive the complimentary breads un til after our meals which no one could eat so  we were all too full   Dirty classes   Food was good   A million food choices Good music

iFPPdctohaQuewKM03HLQQ.text: I brought my friend from Pennsylvania here for the first time. I was in love from the second we walked in. The music was so fun and modern. The atmosphere was amazing. We ordered the cereal shooters, the 25 oz mimosa, and the mimosa flight. They were all so cute just from the look and the taste was phenomenal. Our server, Kaity, was great! It was a slow morning but she was so spunky and fun and was very attentive. This will definitely be my new go to brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-TpqNZuiAvLTRT3Wm-uvoQ.text: Found this on a whim. Which was conveniently located near our hotel we are staying at. This place has an excellent menu and I ended up going with Natalie's (our server) recommendation for the carnitas hash. This dish was a gem! Excellent and highly recommend. Natalie is very helpful and friendly. Recommend this place for anyone visiting Scottsdale.

fkMOuYQXyPv_SGQd5LoyEA.text: Too expensive, small menu, all items are too sweet, coffee isn't that good even at 8:30 in the morning.

H1nK5NPwE8WGAwMq9EEYhw.text: Great mimosas flight! The blueberry caught heart  Definitely a go to for casual conversation with a long time friend and Lona and her assistant were awesome:).

3rGzc80LMaXh-G-eRHBROw.text: Very good food, the ambience is fantastic, good music and yes the service is prompt and caring

BMd9AHvaASQKVxmVoHOuzQ.text: Hash Kitchen is an awesome place to go for breakfast. The service is great, the food is really good, and the portion size is generous. I plan on eating here again.

DTW1yq8fan8k9xDF265ufw.text: Came here for a brunch bday party!!!  They accommodated our party of 15.  Love the service and attention we got from the staff.  Never had to ask for a refill.  Since a few of us were early, the special menu caught my eye....Bacon donuts???  Say it isn't so!  I had to order it.  It is freshly made, a little chewy/soft (but I like), and very f*cking awesome.  OUCH I need to work out an extra day to burn this off!!!  And of course, got the herb chicken and waffles since I blew the diet plan anyways.  The waffles was good, but I did not taste the vanilla.  The chicken was ok, I did not taste enough flavors.  It was covered by the fried onions on top.    Overall, it was a great time, great service, and good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WcCnX7zoaEKorpMlFhtCPw.text: Great brunch spot! Love the hashes and good environment for kids. Highly recommend and good service.

7I0c1tkKhL8U8tcf2xjl_Q.text: Wanted to try a new place for breakfast and found this place on Yelp. We didn't have reservations and arrived at 1:00pm on a Sunday. We were seated in less than 15 mins. Our waiter was very friendly and the atmosphere was nice and fun. They have a DJ keeping it lively and fun. In the middle they have a Bloody Mary bar, will have to try it next time. You build your own with whatever you wanna put in it!  Some people had meatballs sticking out of their drinks!  I had the lump crab eggs Benedict and it was delicious. I didn't realize it comes on a biscuit do next time I'll order it with an English muffin. The biscuit was good but crumbled and difficult to eat with the eggs. The cannoli donuts were delicious and vanilla latte was good as well. They have a woman by the name of Bonnie, customer relations. She approached us to ensure everything was ok and that we didn't need anything. Very nice   We will definitely be back to try more items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7QXSrk_ofNB4DT2KkvIeBg.text: We've been coming to Hash for the past few weekends and it has been fantastic every time! There is usually a small wait but it goes by fairly quickly and is never a problem. We've had a few items so far but my favorite is the Carnitas Hash and bruschetta board. The Bloody Mary bar is also awesome! We usually have Max as a server and he recognizes us each week. This weekend we had Brianna and she was excellent. They have a dog friendly patio and I can't wait to bring my dog once the weather cools down. :)

1gz8y_j1PpcFutc9GlhHPA.text: Overall a good experience. When you walk in the decor is the perfect balance of subtle yet eye catching decor (such as the disco ball by the entrance). They have a very large assortment of Bloody Mary options (BYO) type setup; I didn't get to experience it but will do so soon! The corned beef hash was great and very well seasoned and perfectly hot. Our server was very attentive and had a great sense of humor which made the experience all the more enjoyable. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 was the Benedict, while it was good; it had 2 big issues. I was missing a yolk (I somehow only got one yolk instead of the normal 2) and the biscuits they were served on were very different. One biscuit was unusually crunchy and the other was so soggy it was literally stuck to the plate. I will still come back again but I might stay away from the Benedict as I was disappointed by the lack of quality control on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Benedict

y0GaVZ2XMnnLmAMUCoqEpA.text: So so good! The food is always amazing and the service has been great, too! We've gone to two locations and both are great. The Bloody Mary bar is worth the visit alone.

vKGyP0_LevJ1ed2WtjNWnw.text: Currently my favorite breakfast place. Such a fun place to be and i can't stay away from the mimosa flight. Jamie was an amazing server- we'll be back and definitely ask for her again.    Update: Still the most fun breakfast place to go- have been going constantly for over a year now. Came back on my bday for brunch with the girls and was super disappointed in the changed recipe of the cereal cocktails. They don't taste anything like "cereal milk" anymore and they are unbearably thick. Really hoping the recipe will be changed back to how it used to be.

vMmxqIJi1wWJVOSsr5KXzg.text: 10/10 would recommend. Amazing food, fun drinks and atmosphere. Our waitress Lona was spectacular! Great value for your buck and a unique menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build our own bloody mary and coco cooler!! So delicious and pack a good punch!

rE8yjjBaydp9_H86tsvhHQ.text: Hash Kitchen is a good place to get some brunch/drinks with some of your girlfriends. Their carnitas hash was scrumptious with tons of flavor and a big portion size. Their brunch bruschetta was a yummy appetizer if you're looking for something small and you have a sweet tooth. Their mimosas were good. Hash Kitchen has the largest Bloody Mary bar in Arizona so if you like Bloody Marys then it's the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry mimosa and brunch bruschetta
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash and huevos rancheros hash

gMW0ukxRVBCBFYJBDBcIQQ.text: Best breakfast/brunch in town. The food was amazing and generously portioned. I tried the mimosa flight and they were all delicious. They also have a phenomenal build your own Bloody Mary bar. Our server was Mona and she made the experience complete, can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PEMVga2hIem-koF5eiQmRA.text: Nothing bad to say about this spot. The atmosphere was great - very trendy, good music. The tamale cakes are the best breakfast I've ever had! The mimosas were amazing. All and all - amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight!

yuEhHvlqeav68fvhR6mQmQ.text: I love cooked breakfast so was excited to go for brunch.  Between the really loud DJ, previous night's partiers trying to work off their hangovers, and the so so food I was not impressed.  I will give it another shot because it may have been what I ordered, but only one more shot.  Trendy places are cool if the food lives up to the hype.  I will say the omelette I had was pretty good.  The biscuit with sugar on it...that needs to be improved.  Was extremely dry.

Q42UAFgDtITQ7j1Brk12nQ.text: This place is awesome! The food is great, service is great, portion size is what you could expect or more. Highly recommend and would def come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WRJQzrFBvSJGjaOiappUoQ.text: Yummy! I especially love the breakfast bruschetta with the 3 different ways it comes.  My daughter has the French toast & really liked it.  We went on the weekend & the DJ was a very nice touch !

pc5c7bgfYijghhfwTMRTaA.text: French press, Bloody Mary bar, wonderful mimosas, and amazing food options.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Large portions but great variety.  I'd easily go back here.

KTV_QHZN8snioKpj1ZBrFA.text: Coolest breakfast spot for a morning after date or for a great start to your day with the wife. Best Bloody Mary's and very cool adult coffee drinks. Breakfast came out fast and service for awesome. This place is a definite Must Try!!

M1XM68chG04LuzpX_AFuQw.text: Ok, first I have to say that they should hand out ear plugs the second you walk in the door.  If I wanted to go to a loud concert it would be outdoors and not expect to have a conversation.  YOU SERIOUSLY CAN'T HEAR YOUR FRIEND ACROSS THE TABLE. My friend and I were waiting and all we heard was people screaming to hear each other.  Needless to say, we left and would never go back.

Ll5dFqonbCf-WuY6rYkqRw.text: Came here with my girlfriend on a busy Sunday. Very cool brunch spot with an upbeat vibe. Good music and cool concept with the Bloody Mary bar. The wait time was less than they said it would be. Our waitress was friendly and attentive.   I had the carnitas hash and cannoli cream pancakes. Hash was good but I wish the potatoes were roasted more. Maybe throw the potatoes under a broiler for 5 mins so it caramelizes the edges before adding the carnitas and eggs. The carnitas were tender and flavorful. I liked the corn tortillas on the side to make little tacos. The cannoli cream pancakes were a little dense and the cream was more of a frosting than a traditional cannoli cream but overall it was tasty for what it was.   The highlight of Hash kitchen for me was the experience. Gino came to visit our table and was a very gracious host. He introduced himself, let us know about his other restaurants, and told us to let him know if we needed anything. He made us feel very welcomed! Experience goes a long way and warrants the 5 star rating. The food was good but I will return because of the service and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SSrXTU4w_CbUEPTRyONm_Q.text: Came for breakfast after reading reviews and was not disappointed. After being seated we were greeted by Gino. He was friendly and accommodating. He served my mom coffee right away, which she really enjoyed. We ordered the breakfast sliders and the Cannoli donuts. The sliders were just the right size, and the bagels they were made with were so tender! The donuts were a nice blend of sweetness and creaminess. Gino came back and shared information about other restaurants to try in the area. Nice people, great food, and fun atmosphere.

heHXmLRyaMqe0xQJYXvVvw.text: YES! Finally got to try this place today! Seriously the cutest breakfast spot in AZ. Very trendy. Obsessed with the decor and vibe but the menu is also super unique and delicious. Check out my photo of the Pretzel Benedict. This is going to be our new brunch go-to for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oE1lrMuKvfU6whc6zNDmqA.text: We had the carnitas hash and it was so good. We ordered pico and tortillas to go with it. We also had the mimosa flight which was so good.

duPsYhuNMNHELHIInDQ0Hg.text: 12/10 delicious. Every part of the dining experience was fantastic. The cannoli pancakes were amazing as were the bagel sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JvzkYNY_5ZOmYYDh19NQpw.text: I came here with my amazing girlfriend on a road trip to the land of cacti. We had some time to kill and this time t'was I that was getting hangry. She crunched the numbers and alas found this gem. Let's get one thing straight. 10/10 simply for the fact there is a disco ball upon entrance. DISCO. BALL. Just shining disco funk from wall to wall. Luckily for my spectacular girlfriend, there was no wait when we walked in so she didn't have to put up with my bad attitude for much longer. Coffee and water was what laid the foundation. They give you an entire pot  which was quite convenient.   She searched their delicious menu for about a year before she decided on the chilaquiles, I chose the herb chicken and waffles, and we split a side of hash browns.    At the last second before our excellent server left, I ordered the mimosa fight which was itself--excellent!  As my girlfriend posted this flight to her gram, I ate all the fruit.   She was not happy but, as I was hangry, I did not see the consequences or honestly care about them at the moment.   The food arrived--her chilaquiles were decent (honestly a bit soggy in my opinion) but the herb chicken and waffle was AMAZING!   Literally the fried leeks on top of the chicken and waffles is too good to pass up--I don't know if they have a side dish of that but I would bathe in their fried leeks.   10/10 would definitely repeat if in the area.   Only downsides were the soggy chilaquiles, the not super funky beat pusher dj, and the bride-to-be who per my girlfriend was puking in the bathroom.   Hey, sometimes you gotta let loose--I mean, we all gotta leek every once in a while right?

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight with delicious fruits

4x7O1UgMrrxJv3KMiQ4gFg.text: Had a great experience here for my birthday brunch while visiting family in AZ. Service was friendly and attentive and food was excellent. I brought my 2 kids (5 and 9) and my grandmother- I would describe them all as a little high maintenance in restaurants. Drinks- hot chocolate for the kids, mimosas for the adults (strawberry and pineapple). All yummy and extra points for the server that put the hot chocolates in big coffee cups only filled 1/2 way to avoid spills. My 5 yo still managed to break a mimosa glass, however, but the staff took it in stride lol. Drinks were good. Food- kids shared s'mores French toast, side of bacon and side of fruit. The lovely staff split the plates in the kitchen so we didn't have to do it at the table which was super appreciated. The French toast was really decadent. The kids loved it and there was so much left over. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes. OMG they were sooo amazing. I almost never eat sweet breakfasts and I'm so glad I got these. They were huge- easily 3 meals for me. Grandma got oatmeal. Boring. She said it was ok- a little thicker than she prefers but who really goes to a foodie brunch place for oatmeal? She said she's dieting, whatever lol. We all had a great time and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

D6Jh6cp-7dkNJXN5gqgeXw.text: Only giving 4 stars because the wait is awful.   I get it.... you're an awesome business and you're always busy but why not capitalize and make the wait better for everyone.   Bloody Mary bar is a bargain. It RULES. Ravioli, meatballs, hard boiled eggs, pickled EVERYTHING..... you can't go wrong.   Please help those locals who have to wait an hour and a half for breakfast. If you're a snowbird please don't come, I'm still waiting in line.

Yfx4uzEWH7hapH43AkwuJw.text: We love the Hash Kitchen.  Number one brunch spot in North Scottsdale!  Deirdre is amazing; knowledgeable, kind, generous, funny, we look for her each and every time on the weekend.  Mimosa flights, all kinds of French toast, and this new creation called espresso martini.  Literally to die for.  Stop by soon and tell them that Stacie and Paul sent you.  You won't regret it.

KBTLo0WCBroWMLUC5EzSCw.text: Presentation wise the food looked phenomenal, but taste unfortunately not so good. I ordered the huevos rancheros. They serve it with crispy fried onions on top with black beans, and potatoes. I was thankful for the salt at the table to give my food some taste. The server offered some salsa which I said yes to. When she brought it out I was disappointed it was just Cholula hot sauce. Not what I was expecting at all.   The atmosphere was almost like I was at the club vibe. Normally I wouldn't mind, but at 9am on a Sunday morning not really feeling it. We met up with family before they headed home to Wa. and we couldn't even talk without yelling across the table.   The French toast was dry, the pancakes were crumbly and dry. Honestly the best thing I had was the filtered water they served when I first walked in.   First time in I will probably give them another try when the one closer to home in Arcadia opens .

qOKxsFbpfBc-7NlQkLlHvg.text: Freaking awesome place! It's like a breakfast club, especially with the DJ spinning tunes while you sip on a bloody mary and eat spectacular food with a twist.  Awesome staff, super friendly.  For sure try the avocado toast, topped off with pork. It's DELICIOUS!!!! You think you've had avocado toast, nope, not until you try Hash Kitchen's avocado toast!!!  Breakfast burritos are also really solid too.  Great place for people of all ages!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3WIdgV4od4qXazydMhbwLQ.text: This place was absolutely fantastic. We went as a bachelorette party and had a blast making our own Bloody Mary's, trying their unique and fun drinks, and enjoying their delicious entres. Our waitress Lona was EXTREMELY sweet, kind, and helpful. She got us our food and drinks on time, was very accommodating to our wishes and made sure we had a great experience. I would highly recommend this place to a group or even as a date spot. The food staff and drinks were out of this world. If you do check this place out, as for Lona!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own Bloody Mary
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pretzel eggs Benedict

fOblJNguRcRcW75LCOVxFQ.text: Yum! Great atmosphere! Great selection of food! Appetizers are amazing and entrees are perfect to share! Service was outstanding! Would definitely recommend!

XruwtN75vRRPQWDGYxY2XA.text: Loved the place and will definitely be back! To set the stage, we walk in. To the left is a DJ, right in front as this amazing Bloody Mary bar. I'm not Bloody Mary fan but it did tempt me to try one, the set up was legit. We wall to our seats and EVERYONE'S plate looked amazing. By the time we sat down I was confused about my food choice and drink choice. EVERYTHING looked soooo good.  I was with a friend so we decided to share. Thank goodness because it was hard to make a final order. In the end, we went with one of their Hash and their French Toast. We were not disappointed.   The food was instant. I swear we order our food and had it within 5 minutes. I was amazed because the place is pretty busy.   Great food and service so I am definitely a huge fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 25oz Mega Bobs Mimosa
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Split Brioche French Toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash

QF2RaA9riWlrha38kePwjw.text: Lona was AMAZING!!! She made my besties 40th birthday brunch SPECTACULAR!!! Super friendly,  helpful and sweet!!! We had a BLAST .. the food was on point and mimosa flight kept us warm and Fuzzy :)) thank you!

wRVe0zKt50kwcwhWUUE-BQ.text: Stop what you're doing!!!!!!!  Head to Hash Kitchen and get the Christina's Tamale. It may very well be the BEST thing I have ever had for breakfast. No joke!!!!  And if you know me, and my love for French Toast, that is saying a lot!!!  But the hubby ordered their donuts for a breakfast appetizer. Which was really good too. But I couldn't overdo the sweetness.  So... I took the waiter's suggestion and was transported to heaven. It has the savory and the sweet. It was the Perfect amount of food and the flavors were On POINT!!!!!!!!!   For Real!!!  You have to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Christina&#39;s Tamale.  (sorry it&#39;s not a better picture... but I did have a LOT of self control to stop and take a pic... a LOT

RC_xBk78g9f_aj8UQWrfEA.text: I consider Hash Kitchen to be a party brunch. The food is great and I love the music. Also love all the fun cocktails. Be prepared the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast

VCmnnRQc8r-vq5I0bjySQg.text: The food isn't all the great and the music is so loud you can't even think. Super over rated and you need a small loan to pay for the Bloody Mary bar.

5gYBtKI_SlVYVyKz2mOzKA.text: New in town and hungry. Yelp helped me find this place.  Wow, the mexican scramble is fantastic. The restaurant was very busy, luckily it was just me so I found a place at the bar. If I weren't driving I would've sampled a glass or two of their yummy looking cocktails, well, it was also 1p, a little early for a lightweight like me to start drinking. I spent my time eating and watching a video on how to replace an FSU on my bmw.  I was so focused on the video that I forgot to take a pic of my food before I dug in. So, sorry in advance that my plate is not perfect looking. I have to say though, it was perfect tasting! Yum!  Also, servers are super friendly and helpful.  Thanks for giving me a wonderful experience. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mexican scramble with Cholula

i30hJ-Zcm8FmMbo5qYFF0A.text: Went for an early breakfast yesterday to start the weekend. We were greeted warmly by Gino and sat within minutes. The waiter was attentive and we were not made waiting for coffee and water. The food was fantastic (try the Cannoli donuts) and the staff friendly. Rachel and Gino continuously checked all was well without being intrusive. Excellent start of the weekend and we will definitely be back. Kudos to Rachel and Gino to make us feel welcome.

K6UOmvbgaCNpnnUed9IX2w.text: If you are looking for the perfect brunch spot, look no more! Hash kitchen has such a great atmosphere, friendly workers, awesome music, delicious eats, and most of all - a bloody mary bar! Build the craziest biggest bloody mary your heart desires! I have been to Hash the three last past Sundays and have fulfilled my sweet tooth!   The first time I went to Hash I ordered the smores pancakes. They are delicious and the serving portion is huge. A little on the dry side, but nothing a little syrup can fix.   The second time I ordered the banana split brioche french toast and it was the most delicious thing I have ever eaten! My favorite item on the menu. Nice moist toast with warm salted carmel drizzle, carmelized bananas, stawberries, mascarpone in an icecream cone, and nutella. This was heaven! Order this if you have a big sweet tooth like me!  Highly, highly recommend!   This past sunday ordered the cannoli donuts and they are very dry. I thought theyd be nice and moist and melt in your mouth. Disappointed in this item. Basically, it just taste like bread with a tiny bit of mascarpone. I thought these donuts were filled with the mascarpone, but it wasn't just on top. To balance it out I think more mascarpone would do the trick, but I wasnt a fan of them. This however, would not stop me from going back. I'll just stick to the banana split French toast!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smores pancakes
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli donuts. Looks good. Super dry.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own bloody mary at their bloody mary bar!

44B9xjOsn6HNCjGLTq1U7Q.text: Good place if you are going for Bloody Marys and loud music with inhouse DJ. Otherwise go somewhere else. I had the oatmeal and it was lukewarm, must have been standing for a while as it had a film on top. Coffee (latte) was watery and had no flavor. My companion wanted to try the non meat Beyond Burger, looked authentic, had a meat-like taste but dry....bottom line, not a place I will return to.

LtnbD53wqIc_csHfNmxEQA.text: I am in LOVE with Hash Kitchen. So much so, that after enjoying breakfast there Sunday, we skipped the complimentary breakfast at our hotel, and came here again on Monday.  The menu is extensive. I had the hardest time deciding what to get. Every time I thought I knew what I wanted, someone else's order would pass by our table. Everything looked so good.   While their egg dishes are good (I tried one of their hashes,) there pancakes and french toast are phenomenal. Their pancakes are huge and fluffy. Cannoli pancakes come with an adorable little cannoli on top. The cannoli cream in between the pancakes is creamy. It ever so slightly melts into the pancakes. Just enough to sweeten the cakes, but not so much that it gets lost. My absolute favorite was the s'mores french toast. It is dessert posing as breakfast. Super sweet, but in a good way. I did not realize s'mores needed french toast and syrup until I tried these. The slices of bread are thick, and hold up well to the toppings. Thick slices also help dissipate some of the sweetness.   I wish the children's menu was as imaginative as the adult menu is. That being said, the portions of the items on the children's menu are large. Quality is just as good as the adult menu. My daughter ended up ordering the banana split french toast (both days.) She love the ice cream cone on top.    I am in agreement with those who say the DJ is too loud. The volume does make it hard to carry on a conversation.   I guess it is a good thing I live nowhere near Hash Kitchen. I don't know if my waistline or pocket book would survive.

SorYs_fHDNqK-SlCJ4uHQA.text: This place is great for a young adult crowd. I went for brunch with a group of friends and as you walk in there's a DJ spinning! The service was good and we got to sit down right away even though it looked crowded. Their bloody mary bar is unreal. So many yummy toppings including bacon, fried raviolis and slim jims! I got the mexican scramble which was super yummy. My friend got the pretzel which seemed a bit dry.Very fun place to brunch all in all.

3N0cb3rkM5MzllZwEitlFA.text: Usually, I would give this place a 4 or 5 but several things fell short.  FOOD They have a few unique items, such as the build your own bloody mary. I live for novel foodie things like that, but body marys aren't my thing. The flight of mimosas was quite pretty though. Food was decent but I the bitterness I felt from the 2-hour wait made it difficult to appreciate the texture and sweetness of the french toast. It was pricier than Snooze, but I wouldn't say it was better. I saw a couple of items on Yelp that I didn't find on their menu.  SERVICE I was told the wait would be 45 minutes. Which was reasonable, since it was a Saturday at 11 AM. Trying to not badger the host, around 1.5 hours later, my brother followed up to ask about our place in line. After flipping through a few pages, we were told we were "second in line." Having observed literally everyone come after us being seated, and realizing that their alert device was likely manual rather than automated, we were pretty sure that they mistakenly marked us off the list and forgot.   It was about another 25 minutes for our order to be taken and food to be brought out. Something I found strange was that the waitress apologized for the wait of the food preparation after she saw that I had taken photos of and with the food. However, the amount of time it took for the food to be ready was reasonable, but the wait to be called in was not.   I guess what I'm trying to say it that I would have appreciated a real apology and perhaps a small compensation, especially because the extra 1 hour we waited resulted in pushing back errands and having to cancel plans for that afternoon (we were visiting the area).   Overall, our waitress was nice but Snooze would have been a more welcoming and less disappointing choice. I thought it would be nice to try something different, but I think it's safe to say that it was not worth the wait -- 2-hours for an average 10-minute meal. What's the point of chatting when you're starving and can't hear the person next to you anyway.   Also, I recommend an electronic waitlist for customers to view their place in line through Yelp or another platform. It would allow for people to hang out at a nearby store or grab a drink elsewhere rather than have a huge group of people loitering in the parking area and next to people trying to enjoy their meal. I honestly don't know how people would do it in the middle of summer.     ATMOSPHERE  It's definitely the go-to spot for "bride tribes" or bachelorette brunches. I loveee that they allow dogs in the outside seating area. The decoration and cliche phrases on the wall make for a nice background for photos.  As someone in my 20's I thought the live DJ was nice and appreciated the smooth transition between songs. However, I wholeheartedly agree that the music is incredibly loud and that it is not possible to hold a conversation with the person next to you, not the mention, placing an order without repeating yourself. I get putting on a fun and trendy vibe, but the purpose of brunch is usually a catch-up or conversational type of meal, and it's not possible when music is blasting as it would at a night club.  To add on to the rant, the waitress brought back one ketchup instead of two. We weren't sure if they were having people share but I assume she couldn't hear everyone because of the music. I also felt there wasn't sufficient syrup to drown my french toast, and asking for more was an option but I was over it.   PARKING Located at a shopping center, there seemed to be sufficient space. Since they do not have a waitlist via a phone application, the seats outside become filled quickly, so some people will stand in the parking area. Music is super loud, making it difficult for people loitering to notice that someone in their car is trying to back out or pull in.  OVERALL It's a cute place, especially if you want photo ops for a bachelorette party. Water had a strong tap or Arrowhead taste. Brunch food is average, though certain drinks like the bloody mary and flight of mimosas looked fun. They allow dogs in the outdoor seating area. Music is unnecessarily loud. Quality of service is average. Ohh and don't forget to check-in on Yelp for 5% off your order.

Everything tasted Amazing and the presentation of the food was so fun. We didn't have any drinks besides coffee but the Bloody Mary bar looked fabulous and everyone around was enjoying their fun drinks like the Disco Cocktails and Boujee Bags. We highly recommend you try this place!

I truly tried to be objective but the Eggs Benedict with Crab was bland, covering equally bland and dry biscuits. The waffles lean heavily on syrup for flavor.  It's telling when we observed a very nice hostess walking from table to table asking patrons if they needed more syrup and sauces instead of asking how they were enjoying their meals.   Fun for a one time visit but we won't be regulars.

KhS0LyBXZCyU3_GWJzw8SA.text: Don't get me wrong by my 2 star review. The food is good, the DIY Bloody Mary bar is awesome it all comes down to service. I have visited here twice. Once during the hustle of a Saturday morning where it is extremely busy. Our poor waiter must have been extremely stretched because we saw him three times. Once to take our order, second time to deliver our drinks (food was delivered by someone else) and the third time to give us our check (after we had to look for him to pay). There was no check in to say "How does everything taste, do you need anything?" nothing to that matter. The restaurant was full despite the 20 minute wait which is not bad. The table next to us had like 14 people in their party which our waiter was helping with among the other tables around us. So needless to say we didn't get much help in regards of getting a refill and extra condiments. Again, super busy but I totally get it just kind of a let down. Maybe schedule more people/waiters for the weekend which I would think would be obvious. They had a DJ that morning which was really cool to see at a restaurant.  The second time we visited was a Wednesday morning. No DJ during the week. but better service for sure. It wasn't extremely busy but it was busy for a Wednesday morning. We sat down right away there were waiters coming by regularly to fill our water, and our plates were cleared quickly once done. Our waitress was super nice and attentive. The burger and fries were tastey.   Moral of the review: I would visit again but I'll think twice before visiting again on a weekend. I would recommend the same to others who would like attentive service and a quiet atmosphere.

qlLxL52V07H8o8IVCV7z1w.text: I thought this place was horrible. I tried corned beef hash and it was greasy and had too many potatoes and actually made me sick. I believe I got food poisoning from this dish. I will never go back.

We did not try these but as they were brought to other tables we def stared.   It's a good spot for breakfast. And reasonably priced.

This place also features a build your own Bloody Mary bar with the most innovative toppings and flavor infused  vodkas, tequila, and gin!  If you're here in Scottsdale, this is a must go!

OIJrRtQB7yU6sAZiCXWU2g.text: I had the flat iron scramble, and split the berry waffle with my guest. I ordered the steak medium rare, but it came out cooked well done. It still tasted good, but it was not how I ordered. After telling the waiter, the manager came to my table in under a minute. Very impressed by that, and he immediately acknowledged the mess up, and offered to have the meal recooked or something else brought out or a discount. As we had already ordered more food than we could eat I asked for the discount. Instead of a discount though, he comped my entire meal. I was blown away.   Most importantly, the waffle was the best waffle I have ever eaten.

RrrP_zTpx4AS4HsEY_pDig.text: Did breakfast just become a reason the reason for me to pull out my old club hopping clothes?! I think it just might have! Call me a bad Yelper but instead of reading a few reviews for The Hash House I just saw the pictures of the great looking food and decided I needed to try everything asap!! Little did I know I was walking in to The Breakfast CLUB. For real!! The DJ Spinning, the mimosa flights flowing, and that Bloody Marry Bar... dude... that thing is no joke!!   It has been some time since I have gone to breakfast/brunch, so I was a real dumb dumb thinking I was going to take me and my friends out to a nice brunch on a Sunday afternoon with no wait. Who do I think I am!? Thank god for the good tunes the DJ was spinning (Yea that's right, apparently on Sunday's they get real lit with DJ playing all your favorite jams.) The massive Bloody Marry Bar, where I had a bacon infused vodka, with all kinds of goodies, including a giant meatball. Which I have to say was the best dang meatball I have ever had. (I don't have much experience with meatball's so give me a bit of a break.) And of course with the help of some great company the hour flew by pretty fast.   Our table of 6 was sat in the cute dinning area and promptly greeted by our server. We had already had drinks, but we knew we wanted to start off with those Cannoli Donuts. They were snatched up and devoured right away. I got a full order (Protip: you can do 1/2 order of most of their entree's. These are pretty large plates. 1/2 order is like a normal amount of food haha.) or the Carrot Cake Pancakes. I was actually a little disappointed in these. They were delicious but they just did not taste much like a Carrot anything. And I was missing my cream cheese frosting. If it were there, I had no idea. The pancakes were still perfect though. Fluffy, buttery, with the maple reduction, topped with those crispy Sweet Potatoes, it was still a great dish. My husband had the Lump Crab Benedict. I got to try a few bites. Very good, tons of crab, lots of flavor. And I also got a few bites of the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Unlike the Carrot Cake, I was definitely able to get the Lemon flavor of these babies. I washed everything down with a great cup of coffee.   The only problem we had was our bill. We sat about 20-25 minutes at the end of our meal. We had things that we had asked to get boxes for, we had asked for 3 checks and then I think he forgot about us. Really I think he just thought we had already cashed out. It happens. I'm not mad. But it did damper the experience a bit. But besides that we really had a great time and wonderful meals. Next time I'm dusting my club clothes off and going to make a day out of this fun breakfast place. Cant wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carrot Cake Pancakes. Not so carrot tasting but still very yummy.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. But really this was my Appetizer. I was starving. Forgive my 1/2 eaten meatball. This bloody marry bar was the real deal.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli Donuts. We decided it would make a great appetizer. No regrets.

We each ordered different specialty benedicts. Both creative and tasty. The service was attentive and prompt. If you are in mid Scottsdale check them out!

tkkiZ-gp2coOxVwHuTFA9Q.text: Quite loud inside but bar and patio are cool.   The Americana scramble I ordered with Jalapenos was delicious and they added the peppers with no problem.   Looks like the drinks are the special part of this breakfast place....I saw a mamosa flight that looked tasty...

ggFlu8_2ALBhECdTJPczWw.text: Not enough help; they do not serve "good old fashioned corn beef hash" ! You can get it with "swiss cheese"  or with "zucchini"  yuk!

oZBlpd8NMR_QDLatxoXYNQ.text: Here's the thing. I love Hash Kitchen, I've been here multiple times and the food and service has always been great. But today the service was absolutely HORRIBLE. The entire restaurant staff looked like they were running around without their heads attached and we had about 4 servers throughout our breakfast. Mind you, it's a weekday so it wasn't overly busy. The busser working his a** off was more helpful than any server or manager. I don't know that I'll be coming back to this location again. Side note - I'm not old or lame, but the DJ on the weekends is awkward and does not fit with the vibe.

dEb-Y9NMgT7QK1Q2z5kP8Q.text: This is my favorite brunch spot on the weekends! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is fantastic! Nothing beats it!!!

iWh0bILbuatAYQ6WaX5wGg.text: Not a great place for kids. Loud DJ and there was an extremely long wait for food. Waiter didn't even put in my one daughters order which was very frustrating. Definitely an adult place for a lazy weekend morning. Food was average.

qJ3kBmmhf-r69KPfT1D7Vw.text: Second time there,  we had great Bloody Mary's.  Sat at the bar because the wait time for a table was really long.  The sound level is pretty high but that didn't deter us.

AyutYv6PtBc8gFS7VL7guA.text: Great service and the Bloody Mary bar is phenomenal! I also recommend the blueberry mimosa. They encourage alcohol fueled nonsense which is a must for any brunch in my book.

ArtDNl5SJQpAm6l1rIsURA.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Can go straight from gym, alone and always feel welcome at the bar alone or dressed up with friends for a more formal affair. DJ always keeping the place jumping. The Bloody Mary bar is ridiculous...almost a tour attraction on its own lol meatballs, cheese sticks...CRAZY. I'm a fan of the breakfast burrito or the chorizo scramble. Honestly can't go wrong with anything you order.

CGEST4iaJ3n0sxBY-2NRiQ.text: They have fresh jalapenos!!!! Place is lit... Consistently phenomenal food . Love the front desk and wait staff.

zpBw0GCDMFPldKUQZM4nNQ.text: Great place, dog friendly patio, attentive wait staff.  Food here is VERY good! Try the coconut and almond encrusted french toast.

jSlHyJekGhvo66hn84l8HQ.text: This place has always been good. It's a favorite for our out of state family to go here when they are visiting us in Phoenix. The herb chicken hash or chicken and waffles are a must. Bloody Mary bar is also only $5 during the week! Only negative is waiting time on the weekend as this place gets packed early.

hrJ6UpSVlDHOl-qWLImN6w.text: Wow! The service was amazing and the atmosphere was great! We were greeted by an owner (I think) and promptly seated. Our server asked if we'd been in before (we haven't); she pointed out favorites on the menu. I ordered the original Bloody Mary & Nutella Banana French Toast, and my husband ordered the. Mexicana Scrambler. We ordered and our food came out in a nice amount of time. My husband said it was the best breakfast he's ever had. We went to brunch with our 8 mo old daughter, and the staff talked with her too. We enjoyed ourselves. We will try to go back before we leave. (We're currently on vacation from Manhattan, KS).

nWjH3iu2f06-wNWuKEuBbw.text: Adrian at the Bloody Mary bar is awesome!  Great variety of toppings.  Good food.  Great atmosphere.  Recommended!

0wIZVk1Oei3g098nRnwu_w.text: Delicious place for brunch. We went here after hiking camelback and had the lemon ricotta pancakes and the lump crab and sweet potato hash. Both were absolutely delicious! Service was great! Definitely going back!

zDJhv31C3RXdUpvHXvrPxg.text: Tried yesterday, service outstanding, food delicious.  Would love to go on the weekend for a bloody!

T0AbzdiH745QmC5uQ8HOiQ.text: We live around the corner from their FLW and Raintree location. We usually come on weekdays to avoid the crowds and the DJ's haha. Their menu is eclectic but I've never had a dish I didn't enjoy and I've tried something new each time. Went with my girlfriend once and she got the breakfast lasagna which was actually so good! The breakfast bruschetta is my favorite morning appetizer. The carrot cake pancakes are SO good. And the fried chicken and waffles with leeks is outstanding. With some hesitance, I had one of the crab dishes once too which was actually wonderful and I would definitely get again. I almost forgot the most important thing ab this place- the Bloody Mary bar! Too many selections and toppings it's hard to make decisions. Very fun to go in a group for brunch just for the bloody Mary's alone! All in all I hope this place keeps up the good work and we will definitely keep coming back.

ZDAgwWs291dTNlAKNFFNWw.text: The food was just okay, but not worth the price and the service wasn't great either. When we were seated we had to wait almost 10 minutes just to get water. We tried to order the mimosa flight with 4 different flavors, which the menu lists 6 flavors to choose from; however, we were told on the weekends that it's a set choosing of only 3 flavors. The flavors change on the weekends and one of the flavors that was included on this particular Saturday wasn't even listed on the menu. I suppose if you like mimosas and options, go here during the week. We ended up changing the drink order because of the lack of options to the prosecco smash, but didn't get our drink until we were more than half way done with our food. (despite having inquired with the server a couple times) When our food was delivered we were never asked if we needed any condiments, etc. since there weren't any on the table and the food was fairly bland. We tried to track down the server, who was friendly, but nowhere to be found, to ask for hot sauce and some butter for the biscuits. We finally got him after 5 minutes , but then had to wait another 5 just for him to bring the condiments. You're probably wondering why I rated this place a three star after all this, but the people watching and entertainment that happens here is probably the best and helps you to look past the quality of food and service.  If you just want an entertaining breakfast, go here, but if you're looking for really great food and service, I wouldn't recommend it.

rEuNumPgbd_RvHx9sGlWcw.text: First time here & unbelievably great food & service. Waiter even making me a to go box with ice!!!!

FMx7-8kJWFrE87kvp1WZHA.text: My sister and I came here for the first time today, Sunday, and it was fabulous. Fresh squeezed juice rocked and so did the banana brioche french toast. My sister had eggs benedict and she ate them in record time saying it was the best ever. I can't wait to try other items on menu. The restaurant was cozy, comfortable and clean. Gino was our waiter and he was a terrific guy. Nice, fun, smart and a great sense of humor.I love this place.

S1AGz6RJ7GGQRCOY2fS9iA.text: I was so excited to try this place and even more excited that I read they would be open on Christmas Day! The husband and I made the 30 min drive out to the restaurant to find... they're closed! Bummer. Not sure if this was an error on Hash Kitchen's side or the New Times, but it was pretty sad. Anyway, I still wanted to try them out, so a few days later we made the trek out there again. The restaurant still looks like the old Cuttlefish restaurant, including the oyster bar, which is a bit strange. The service was good, but one of the women there, maybe the owner or manager wasn't being terribly nice to her employees within earshot of customers. Anyway, we had coffee, which was good and the waiter kept it full, so we appreciated that. For food, I tried a benedict and the husband had biscuits and gravy. The b&g was bland and nothing special. The benedict had perfectly cooked eggs, but lacked in flavor.... overall we weren't super impressed. Maybe the secret is to order one of their more complicated dishes (something with fried chicken possibly) and that would be good, but generally you also expect a restaurant to have good foundations. I probably wouldn't make the drive out there to return.

qPuJ02sKr8_lRyOT0f_y2g.text: 2nd time here and both visits were amazing! Beautiful Miss Bonnie greeted us at the door with her cheerful personality and made us feel welcomed from the moment we walked in. Food is excellent and service is exceptional. I had the Fried Chicken Benedict, so good with crispy leeks! And the Bloody Bar is definitely the best I've seen, so bountiful! Must try if you haven't.

DtMAw9lR8yLAtg4cUeA4Hg.text: This is our favorite brunch place! They have a DJ, a build-your-own Bloody Mary bar, and tasty creative dishes. I think our favorite aspect about The Hash Kitchen is Bonnie! She's a sweetheart (and a fireball)!!!

y2gFwFeZtlA7qLkZO3iSrw.text: Today we finally made it down to Hash Kitchen to give it a try after recommendations from friends. We were seated promptly even during a busy Arizona Breakfast week. I visited their make your own Bloody Mary bar,which is second to none, and created the most gluttonous Bloody Mary ever. My wife ordered her new go to breakfast dish which she tries every place we go now. Their twist on chicken and waffles is Herb Crusted Chicken and Waffles topped with fried leeks and she was in food heaven. My son's chocolate chip pancakes were a perfect mix of sweet and light with a delicious maple reduction syrup. I had the Ranchero Hash which was perfectly crispy tortilla chips on a bed of black beans, potato hash, and carne asada topped with an on point over easy egg. Our dessert, which we would have never ordered for breakfast, was a sweet and savory house made cannoli donut. The best part of all was when the owner came out and introduced herself and chatted with us for several minutes. We felt extremely well-taken care of and can't wait to go back.

5TVECkB0GRbzj9IfLWtbqQ.text: Bonnie is a dream and the food is outrageously good. Will be coming back every weekend!

XDwqBz8fHgdQJsdhm-bbqg.text: One of the best breakfast/brunch spots around. I love this place the mood is perfect and the food is incredible. You have to try this place you won't be disappointed.

OxNLWw1uGQNNxC9dNhjHAg.text: I went here on my birthday today and the customer service was excellent, the whole staff was attentive and friendly to us.   The menu was  great and the food was good.  Needless to say we were both full and had to be rolled out of there.  Check it out at least once.

z9wYNqP2cqhtM44SixFBHQ.text: Really enjoyed my delicious breakfast here with my son. Great atmosphere and the owner was very friendly. Definitely will return to try some of the other menu items.

QFCs4hmrsCFJo_Ssa5DEHw.text: Made a reservation and still had an hour wait. Ended up leaving because too crowded and music was way too loud. Will not come back.

n7TCBsXIAIa4oCbg76SGSA.text: Don't let the pictures deceive you. This was the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. We came to celebrate a birthday and were told the day before that they didn't accept reservations less than 10 people (we were a party of five). We decided to get there right when they opened so we wouldn't have to wait. The manager asked if we wanted to sit outside and when we asked to have a table inside, he acted like it was a big deal (which makes no sense because it was empty and there were plenty of tables that were clearly not reserved). Apparently they were understaffed by 3 people and their ticket machine was down so our ticket was lost or never got printed, we are still trying to figure that out. It took over an hour to get our food, which came before our appetizer and everything was just awful. The food tasted sour, undercooked, and messy. It was embarrassing. It took over 20 minutes to get condiments and everyone looked so unhappy there. While the server tried her best, and genuinely felt awful about our experience - I am most shocked that the three managers knew what was going on and purposefully avoided our table. 10/10 would not recommend. They also expected us to pay the whole bill when everyone ate less than a forth of our food because it was so awful. We left and went to another restaurant for breakfast. If management continues the way they handled our situation, this place will not be there long. I understand why 3 people didn't show up today if they had to work for those three morons who don't know how to manage a business.

J1Fez67ifuKshxYzi_JRaA.text: Love this place.  The epitome of good food and hospitality.  Thanks to Yelp reviewers for leading us here.  My husband had steel cut oatmeal studded with blueberries, strawberries and almonds.  I ordered a corned beef Benedict. It was delicious.  Then the real fun started with a visit to the Bloody Mary bar.  Whee, so much stuff I couldn't decide.  Loved the pickled pineapple.  Gonna have to figure out how to do that.  They'll even shuck an oyster if you want it.  Don't how busy they are on the weekend.  We went on a Friday morning and we're seated and served right away.  Try it, I think you'll like it.

H5nRYGe9WTfCB4yAKq-IFg.text: Highly recommend this restaurant for brunch!  Outstanding Bloody Mary bar and OMG, the Banana Split French Toast was to die for!  I really like that they offer 1/2 orders of pancakes and French toast!  A 1/2 order was too much for me!  Yummy!

zEVstnMrJmnCaU9MIzqlnA.text: Good fun atmosphere, bloody bar is awesome! Big menu with lots of options, food was ok. It not remarkable, good for a brunch place.

7fKBeMD3Jf3tk2sDfUFtgA.text: Upscale breakfast brunch spot. Nice hotel like atmosphere.  Creative menu executed well in slow weekday morning. Great biscuit and superb coffee. Need to work on potatoes. Need to be hotter, fresh off grill  service by waiter very good but floor management lacking,  l will come back to try the waffle.

tpS8f0N5qEmpv-7YDqStWw.text: I don't get how a restaurant thinks its patrons want to come in at 10 am for breakfast and want to hear music blaring!! Way too loud for breakfast!! Im not going to a club. I walk in and there is a giant speaker pointed right at the tables. Does anyone actually enjoy this? I don't care how great the food is. Bad, obnoxious atmosphere for that time of day at a family establishment.

JwITrcVJod2LOKZe9Q64pg.text: I met a coworker here for lunch last week and opted to enjoy their breakfast menu. The atmosphere is nice, the staff is very welcoming and the food is top notch too.

Bloody Mary was so spicy could not taste anything else. Bottomless mimosas were not coming very fast and were probably 4-5 ozs each. I ordered biscuits and gravy. She ordered a salmon Benedict. -G14qlxiNSZkL9pliFxKJQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere.  Pancakes, French toast and skillets were all large portions and great quality.  Love the Bloody Mary bar.

PmTVUSHiGdz3GFNWVXoejw.text: In town for work and found this place on Yelp, the DIY bloody Mary bar sold me. Sure enough the bloodies were amazing, service was great and the food was GREAT. actually came back the next morning to grab some more of the food before I headed out of town. Great place.

q5p_ospagWq9ECZK2Gy7Mg.text: Service and Food was amazing!  Thank you Bonnie and Lona for making my first experience at Hash Kitchen a memorable one!!!

QDmGnt_rpFWuNG4fUF1PxQ.text: Very good for a weekend brunch! The Bloody Mary was spot on. Will definitely be going back soon!

Cde9Q2aPEfzZhJIMRY5Xkg.text: Great food and must take a stroll through their bloody mary bar!!! - everything imaginable.  Very expensive for a small amount of bloody Mary - that would be our only gripe.  Worth going back.

aSjiW96aVRUXzdDVO8eDBQ.text: Found this place under best brunches in the area and let me tell you this place did not disappoint. The Bloody Mary bar is amazing and the mimosa flights even better! I decided to go with the breakfast lasagna WOW delishh and my husband had the Italian hash which he enjoyed! Service is great as well. All brunch lovers must try this out!

csLlctTPOOehYGhAchiVwg.text: Food was hit and miss. Some of the items we ordered were great and some were just okay. I feel like the hype is mostly about the atmosphere, location, etc. and somehow in most people's minds that makes the food taste better. Portions were smaller than average. Solid restaurant, slow service and slightly above average food.

JW7DWspyqpF_DZwiV6LZzA.text: This place seems overrated. We typically do brunch at places that take reservations so we don't have to wait, but decided to give it a shot since there's so many amazing reviews and the menu looked delicious. We waited 45 minutes - super busy on a Sunday morning - good sign, right? Ordered the breakfast lasagna which is highlighted on the menu as a specialty. When it came out (which took a while, the server even mentioned the food was probably taking a minute because the lasagna needs a while to cook), noodles were still semi hard - not al dente just not cooked - and it was barely even warm. Our server (she was super nice, no complaints there) asked if I wanted to try something else and I ordered the fried chicken salad sandwich. While I waited for my food I my husband and I split was waffle which was good, but his corned beef hash was rough - the potatoes looked like they were microwaved - not a single bit of crispy. Our friend's side potatoes were the same. Pretty disappointing for a place pretty much named after crispy potatoes lol. Everyone I was with had finished their food and I was still waiting for mine. My sandwich came out overloaded with sprouts and lacking mayo or any sort of sauce so it was dry. Also pretty flavorless which was also disappointing since it was fried chicken. My fries, undercooked like everyone else's potatoes. The manager apologized for the wait for my meal replacement and said he was taking care of it - which was nice that it was acknowledged but I had already waited that long I wouldn't have known the difference if they'd just taken the time to make my food properly. I feel like they may have too many items on their menu for their own good - they're too busy. Not sure if we'll try it again mostly because it felt like a waste of time. I did appreciate how the staff handled things but I know they can't necessarily control the quality of the food that comes out.

AxcgzID2Fvxu_02ZOTBxQQ.text: yummy!  the hostess has an amazing spirit.  the good was great!  the mimosa flight was the perfect compliment to the meal.  can't wait to go again!

-gYyDen9_U9_e8g46iLpsA.text: Just off the plane from Georgia and we decided to try this place!! The banana split French toast was amazing!! This is a must stop and eat!! We will be back before our trip is over!!

54BBBhWsnl8RjEZyM5BFyA.text: Most amazing time with my girls! Great Bloody Mary Bar! Great Mimosa Flight! Every dish was perfect! Bonnie was the cherry on top with her dancing and smile! She even ran out of the restaurant to chase me down after I left my hat on the seat! Love her! Omg and the DJ!!!! He played me and my girls some Neyo and we danced our brunch away! Cannot wait to go back!

NcYxlFA9TKXvTKtVGYGQQQ.text: This is my third time here now and I can't get enough. The food, the drinks, the vibe, the weekend djs all 5 star. Best Bloody Mary cure hangover in the gainey ranch side. Definitely one of my favorite breakfast joints by far!

DLauGWmP7BYMAlqm1UC9Jw.text: This is hands down my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot in Scottsdale. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu items. I got the smoked salmon frittata and it was really tasty. They have an amazing Bloody Mary bar that I sadly didn't get to try since it was a work day when I went. Bonnie the manger is very kind and accommodating. Highly recommend!!!

ZIr7xCmDBm9LJozosH2qFA.text: I LOVE HASH KITCHEN! It's my favorite place for breakfast and trust me I take breakfast very seriously. Every time I come here I can't decide between like 7 things. Im currently eating the coconut almond French toast and I think it's safe to say I'm dead because this stuff is heaven. ask for Ryan as your server he has top notch service.  Thank you!! I would really go back just for endless cocktails.  I got the Huevos Rancheros Skillet and dad got Chicken and Waffles and I discovered looking around, you really can't make a bad decision! The bloody Mary bar is extensive and while we didn't indulge the Mimosa flights looked great. I had juevos rancheros "hash" and honestly I couldn't even eat it. It was a salty mess served on soft potato cubes (menu calls them crispy), some red sauce, a crispy tortilla, and some strips of very tough unseasoned beef that was supposed to be carne asada.

zXKIoSZ7D71Y27OAFAT3Ww.text: Lona is THE BEST. Come here and ask for her, she is an actual treat and so easy to carry on conversation, it's like you're talking to your best friend. csNmYGfQB6aWOr-8k0PyOQ.text: One word:  divine.  Truly.  Everything from the Bloody Mary bar, to the many many dishes that aren't diet friendly but sooooooooo good!!

joTFUQyD7DB_UmLgRTw6OQ.text: Breakfast was great & our server, Lona, was awesome. Make sure you try the caramelized brioche.

nRoqYl-e4YadbGk0dTXIRg.text: Can't say enough about this place.  The Bloody Mary bar is spectacular.  And all the food choices are out of this world.  Service is great and the owners actually walk around and talk to you!  Can't wait for the chandler location to open up!

W9_a9qsclyOhkg7WGvp6Rw.text: We came for a team outing... Good time! Mimosas !!!!! Oreo pancakes are so good!  We had such a good time...fyi no free wifi

uB5avzsc2VxE1BuaujTzpQ.text: this restaurant specializes in their unique dishes such as breakfast lasagna or fried chicken eggs Benedict. The food is uniquely delectable. If you're feeling thirsty they have a wonderful selection of mimosas. It has a robust hipster vibe to it with the largest Bloody Mary bar in Phoenix. Wonderful spot if you desire to drink with breakfast and experience a fun environment. Fare warning, the music does tend to be cranked up pretty loud inhibiting ample conversation but the patio is a nice alternative if it's available.

EDMWehSkWD12Ypl83m5qEQ.text: Not good. I was treated like I was annoying the bartender by asking to order, or pay, etc. etc. Items were missing from my order, too.

CExOYsZkce92OLQ6c8VLOQ.text: Food is good and the BYOBM is awesome but they only have meatballs on sat and sun!.... They should definitely have meatballs on holidays too! I highly recommend anybody that is visiting AZ or looking for good brunch to come and check out Hash kitchen! This is definitely worth your time to come and get some amazing food!

SFHg-d8di5oihFXx0AjVfg.text: Definitely a most stop, Best damn biscuits in Scottsdale. Salmon Egg Benedict's was awesome and the service was excellent

HpQfW-97gdOAbzXntpc3OA.text: Adrian and our server Katie are the best!! Love Hash Kitchen, by far my favorite breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HiMJJKYhLV6_t8RmIvagcQ.text: Bye bye Cuttlefish, hello The Hash!  We had a group of 15 for a Sunday birthday brunch. I have called 2 weeks ahead to reserve a table.  They don't normally accept reservations but only for big groups. I arrived early to drop off the cake and was told my reservation wasn't there.  I was a little stunned, but they were really accommodating to fit our party.   I sure missed those motorcycle bike seats at the oyster bar when it was Cuttlefish. They took them out and replaced with a DIY Bloody Mary bar.  At $7, you get to customize however you like it.  I guess the V8 juice wasn't bad either for the non-drinkers.  Who doesn't like Slim Jims? The Slim Jims added the special kick in the drink plus made a great snack while waiting for our entrees.   Herb Chicken and Waffles were popular among our table. I tried something different and went with the Herb Chicken Egg Benedict. My herb chicken was amazingly good. JL had the same chicken but hers wasn't that great. They must have made a different batch. We probably ordered all their herb chickens for that day.  As for the Egg Benedict, nothing too special. The hollandaise sauce might need a little work. It was really bland.    For the coffee fans, must try the French Press. One of the better quality coffee blends a brunch place. It was so rich and smooth. I think I probably drank 1/2 of the pot. So good!    The staff provided exceptional level of service. They kept our water and coffee filled at all times. When it was time for the cake, I believe it was the owner that went around the table and handed us with a new plate. He even brought and lighted the many candles on the cake.    Another scrumptious brunch place big enough space to have a large group. They even have a live DJ by the bar area. I believe it ends at 1PM. I don't know if this location was cursed or what, but hopefully, this place can hold on and stick around a little longer.

3zrvgRQhp5IyT-_XpgHrug.text: Hash Kitchen is a really fun brunch experience.  The bloody mary bar is a fun sight even if you aren't using it, fun to watch people create something super interesting.  They also have mimosa flights which allow you to try some different flavors.  The menu is super unique and offers a wide variety of different options.  I fell in love with the fried chicken eggs benny.  The chicken has a great blend of spices, it's not overpowered by hollandaise, and to top it off - fried leeks, surprisingly delicious.  My only reason for not giving it five stars is that sometimes the service can be hit and miss at the bar and it's a little on the pricey side.  There can definitely be a wait to get in here but it's worth it.

scvuJAtmnWRx-Y653uaGRw.text: Breakfast was delicious and fast. I had the paella hash layered with scrabbled cheesy eggs! Delicious! Portion was huge! Although I didn't have one, the Bloody Mary bar looked amazing! Oh yeah there was a DJ spinning during Sunday Brunch! Roughly 20 minute wait to sit 2. Owner stopped by and chatted. Awesome place!

vtPsPFrOIeb9Rcan6gjn8A.text: So much yes. Amazing staff, best bloody Mary's in town  went on my birthday and would definitely come back !!!

ehRQYLQAb49qBEULYTdVNA.text: Great mimosa flights and the food was amazing! Lona was awesome! Definitely recommend!

ITXx0NslMBh9rOexKNtCUw.text: The food was amazing! The Huevos Ranchero Hash and pancakes were so flavorful! It is my new favorite breakfast place, they have unique awesome food, that sets them apart from the rest! Our server Tyler was so nice and accommodating. Definitely coming back!

H7NqjMO0XuLfutdWEmA84Q.text: Amazing atmosphere and great food. The woman Bonnie was the absolute best. Such an amazing personality and made the place seem inviting. Would definitely go back just for her. As well as our server Alex.

Et5UoKu1M6kr977bwOouVg.text: Great Service, Great Food! Great Mimosas! loved the live DJ. If your looking for Breakfast/Brunch this is the place

TQ4GCMiozIUCmeJdy7MQcw.text: Not my favorite menu in town but definitely a great variety and tons of unique dishes. Fabulous service!  We came here 2 days and had different teams and both were exceptional.  Very cute mugs.  Nice large and clean atmosphere.  They were so nice about letting us stay as long as we wanted talking.  I highly recommend this place.

K9M0ZeKoz7WhWZ-CVYecoA.text: Probably the funnest brunch experience I've had. We went on a Sunday morning around 11 and had about an hour wait. But during that wait you can order drinks at the bar and build your own bloody Mary's ! You just pay for the cup and fill your cup with whatever toppings you want and munch on that while waiting. It makes the wait seem to go by a lot quicker.  Gotta admit, the service is where one star gets knocked off. They are very busy and they seemed a bit understaffed. When we looked inside there were quite a few empty tables so they couldn't turn them around quickly.  But the food and drink were solid. Their hash is the way to go. My group of friends and I ordered 5 different ones. And they were all unique and tasty in their own ways. Also, their mimosas flights are 16 dollars for 4 glasses which I think is a great deal. Would love to come back if I'm in the area again !

prP9gaj6vw8k30P0BPqS9Q.text: we came here for my dads birthday and I love the atmosphere, there is a lady at the front door who had lots of energy dancing around, greeting and welcoming everybody, they had a bloody Mary bar, but I did not go to it. I don't like bloody Marys that much, however, with the way it was set up, I most definitely will be returning to try it

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QH2uJxG36F-VRn8i0WtMDA.text: This was a great choice for Arizona Breakfast Weekend! My brother and I came on a Sunday morning when they opened and basically had the cute place to ourselves. Our waitress Jen was great and attentive as we ordered from their ABW menu. I started with an iced tea (comes in an adorable glass jar with a handle) and we both got their cannoli donut, a sweet start to the day. For my entree, I chose the shrimp "Oscar" hash which has crispy potatoes, roasted prawns, asparagus, and a bernaise sauce. It was a huge dish! Felt like I barely made a dent in it but was happy to take it home for the family to try. It was yummy too. My brother got their banana brioche French toast and the sampling I had from it was really good.  At $15/person, this was a fantastic way to check out a new (to me) restaurant and their selections. I'd like to come back and peruse their entire menu.  Side note: when we were leaving, I really noticed their sign outside the entrance. It does not match the architecture of the building and think it could use an upgrade!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Iced tea and water, cannoli donut, shrimp &#34;Oscar&#34; hash, and banana brioche French toast

J6z8-k0sVQbEhN5RYrpGwA.text: Really fun place to have breakfast/ brunch on the weekend! Big and diverse menu and great music.

IGTXxyQJXf7OEQ7ABi0vdw.text: This is a very unique restaurant. It has a very upbeat vibe and interesting menu.  The service and atmosphere was great as was the food. Loved the music!

yGMjykWkEQsNeWMpBNKyQg.text: Super fun atmosphere, complete with a DIY Bloody Mary bar for $12 and delicious craft mimosas for $6! Charming decor, Hash Swag, and amazingly accommodating service! Food is great and presentation is spot on! Will definitely be back!
