Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7uvDJS8G3K8dQ4tTj4dbHA.text: Great atmosphere and Bloody Mary bar! The food was pretty good- smoked salmon eggs Benedict. The drinks were great! Expect a long wait.

F3mLr9FGL-rUxu_gIkFLDQ.text: 1st timers, busy, loud, fun. Ordered the Bananas Foster French toast and the Carne Asada Hash. Hash was super savory with just the right amount of spice. French toast was ridiculously delicious and sweet. Had a side of biscuits just to try. Glad I did ! Friendly staff. Recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carne Asada hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HHFbLrnTKOrLU3xTQkVsqg.text: Came here from California based on yelp reviews. We were more than pleased. We are here twice cause the menu has so many incredible options. Saturday vibe was amazing!!! Dj playing awesome mixes and the Bloody Mary bar is outstanding!!! I wish we had one of these in the East Bay!!!

EDsq2fupDn3oCUwpT-4OVw.text: Happening brunchy spot with a Bloody Mary self serve counter that is off the hook. DJ on the weekend - can get loud. Food is consistent, comes fast, and very tasty.

KwmX3gPmkylt_-YYLOwMTg.text: First time here. Blown away by service, atmosphere and FOOD!!!   This beats out EGGSPECTATIONS back east in Columbia/Ellicott City, Maryland!!!  We are new to are by about 6 months. I am Director of Slot Operations at Desert Diamond Casino - West Valley and live in the West Valley but will make the drive out here frequently.

0OgZKvnzSUghRVhCxbY3UA.text: Best brunch I've had in AZ. No questions asked.   I probably would have given this place five stars for the Bloody Mary bar alone... it's insane. Meatballs, fried raviolis, slim jims, flavored vodka, bacon, olives, peppers... you name it. It was easily a meal in itself.   If you're not a Bloody Mary person (then what's wrong with you!?) they have a great mimosa selection! We got the flight with original, raspberry, mango and kiwi. If you don't need four full size drinks at 9am go with the mango.   Now that we were good and tipsy we got to eat breakfast. I had the monkey bread which was incredible. But I actually ate more of my friends plate of the breakfast cannelloni. Sounds weird, I know but trust me it was incredible. Ugh, I'm drooling just thinking about it.   Can't wait to go back for round two and try everything else! LOVE this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight

sctKO9CJIq2LYsveVqOXzg.text: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning and had the Hash!  Absolutely fantastic.  So much food and delicious.  Can tell the ingredients are fresh.    The ambiance is black and white hopping!  The place was packed, even the bar.  Patio is puppy friendly but it seems that it would be kind of tight.    Currently favorite breakfast place

0-e9WiUnZh5C4GJnLzgoBw.text: So glad we came here from the East Valley. Worth the drive. The food was amazing and Lona our server was awesome and full of energy. Everyone here are friendly. I ordered  the chicken and waffles. Now I'm a fan of Roscoe's in LA but Hash Kitchen won this round. The chicken was juicy and the waffle was moist. The fried leeks on top added to the flavor I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffle, passion fruit mimosas and almond milk latte.

YsKyKOJidsr64fK_E5S3lA.text: We had been wanting to try this place, all I can say is it was disappointing. First the service was not great, we were a group of 7, and we were sat with only 6 sets of utensils. I was looking forward to enjoying a nice French press with my breakfast, but they were out (ugh!!!) of it so we had to settle for their regular coffee which was okay but then we weren't even given spoons to stir our cream, had to use our butter knives, I hate that! Then, we get our food, nothing special, I tried the tamale cakes Benedict and my husband had the salmon charcuterie board, both were plain, really small portions, and left us wanting something more. The bloody Marys are such a gimmick too, I mean sure, they have an awesome bar of goodies to pack your bloody with, but the actual flavor of the Bloody Mary is not good, so you're paying for the gimmick basically. I tried a mimosa, I seriously think they forgot the champagne!  So overall, super pricey for what you get and so not worth it! I'll stick with Snooze, OHSO, Matt's, Wildflower, and Elly's for brunch!

f_tBSRYatTcTF8ba1JegdQ.text: We loved this place and can't wait for one to open closer. We were sat right away on a Saturday morning, our server was attentive. The menu had tons of options and everything looked so good we couldn't stop staring at what other tables had. They have a Bloody Mary bar that was huge although we got a coffee and iced tea. The avocado toast looked soooo good but just too much (you could for sure share it) so I got the build your own scramble with avocado,  bacon and cheese, it came with a biscuit and also potatoes. The portions are just so large (too large in my opinion as you're eating so much and way too full or you're wasting some of your food). They don't offer half orders on a lot of things so although I wanted to try the avocado toast I could not eat that much food and it doesn't make for good leftovers. My scramble was basic and good, I loved the biscuit option. My boyfriend got the lump crab bene he also enjoyed that it came on a biscuit but he is a bigger fan of crab cakes. It was nice to have but probably wouldn't order again. Also got the half order of French toast that was coconut crusted (we wanted to try pumpkin one but they couldn't do a half order). We were so full but managed to squeeze some bites in. For the two breakfasts, coffee, tea, and one slice of French toast I believe it was $48 before tip. So it's a little pricey, but again large portions and probably normal price point for the area.  1. Large portions, bring a group so you guys can share/try more things. 2. Please offer more plates to have halves as some people cannot eat that much!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Byo scramble and lump crab bene
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coconut French toast

DraCTWeIADwteY3ZfwHjJw.text: Food was fantastic. I got the huevos rancheros hash. The potatoes and flavors were great. Our food came out at a relatively good time. However the 3 stars is really for the bar service. I know that weekends are typically busy, and I don't mind waiting. But the bartenders we obviously annoyed with us trying to order drinks while we waited. I hope my next experience is a lot better. Food is absolutely wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros Hash

cQDLvsmr99ervQaWe8QYvg.text: The staff was very friendly. The table are so close together you can't have a conversation because you have to talk over the next table. Not only that the music was so loud you could not hear either. The food was marginal. We will not be going back. It's a shame as we were excited to try it.

BLx_DBI-Yy4NRH21mvUpBg.text: My friend took me here for my birthday and the good was amazing! So many unique breakfast dishes to choose from. It was very busy but we were never neglected! I want to go back and try everything!! Highly recommended

JYcT_7xuVo7UAN4sa-9jLg.text: Similar experience as Naoi. Was sat by older woman. 10 minutes later no server, no drink order, just some tasty water on the table. We were so excited to try some supposedly organic eats which is hard to find around here..was also excited about a grass fed burger and were already talking about coming back for it. But alas 15 minutes in, as a matter of principle we had to walk out. The hostess and waittress said "have nice day" as if we just enjoyed a meal...all I could say was "wow." I, too dont write many bad reviews. But this was embarrasing. There was two other tables there.  Thanks to the bus boy for the water. Honestly we would have came here often. Below average service can be forgiven, but no service cannot..  Try harder. Please.

rjKhA6kd0EFqnnZqlduphg.text: Gainey Hash Kitchen is a fun environment and great food! Awesome Bloody Mary bar and generous portions!

VZZijO5mmtXFgGYY5mf_fg.text: This looks amazing!!!! I'm excited to finally try them. Stay tuned!!!! I've hear nothing but great things about Hash...especially this location! Great music and environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-4BkS-UTHbwqm_1P7dwK7A.text: Amazing amazing place! The bloody Mary Bar right when you walk in is about as close to heaven as you can get! Adrian hooked up our bloody Mary's and was the nicest guy ever! He made our day. Our server Ryan was brand new, but you couldn't tell at all. He had great suggestions about what to order and everything came out perfectly and quickly. I will definitely be back when I'm in town!

pg-czhwlCJnMz2OhwDi6wg.text: Stopped by here for breakfast!! Such an expansive menu with a variety of everything for everyone...almost all breakfast items imaginable are here!! Got the amazing chicken and waffles which is one of the best we have ever had!! Very tender fried chicken and very good waffle!! The lump crab sweet potato hash was also very good...little different with the sweet potato!! But the lump crab was good and the poached egg was well made!! Yum!!

_x8tsvwwdrEiqb_8YviVrg.text: My wife and I and our best friends came here for breakfast expecting a really good experience and by the end of our meal it wasn't really good, it was better than good, it was FANTASTIC! First of all, Lona, provided us with top level service! She was so happy and helpful and very friendly! They have a great Bloody Mary bar with tons of vegetables & other stuff including flavor fused vodka! Two of us ordered the carnitas hash & eggs and both of them said it was incredible. (See photos) My buddy ordered just hash & eggs and he said it was perfectly cooked and very filling. Finally, I ordered the huevos rancheros hash. The presentation was amazing (again see photos)  I've never had rancheros quite like this. It was stacked 6" high with crispy fries onion rings with an unbelievable green sauce! Fantastic!  The prices were amazing, the service was great, and the consensus of everyone in my group was that we would ALL definitely return!!

R9ifnHpNsP9V00FBPaDWvA.text: We had an amazing time!  Max, our sever, our man, took such good care of our large party, which is very high maintenance!  The food was amazing, live dj, takes music requests and just a fun place!  Highly recommend!!!!

fd8bivA7Bu4rZsv-RQTAHw.text: Fun atmosphere but the only"champagne" offering is the cheapest horrible tasting stuff, and they charge $20 per bottle for a $3 brand if bought in a store. They could easily offer something better and in this area it would sell. Also, the hash browns at the hash kitchen are frozen potatoes that are tasteless. On a positive note the frittatas are good, as well as the lemon ricotta pancakes.  "

cmLF9lAj32vXWkS0vpcvKg.text: My favorite  spot in Scottsdale hands down best breakfast with great atmosphere and service....Katie and Amy made our time warm and happy...

oJJddpSLvbSQy6GBCVRRCA.text: First of all I have to talk about Bonnie the manager. She is the sweetest, happiest, and friendliest lady I have ever met. She is also so stylish! She remembers my family every time we come in and goes out of her way to make sure my kids are happy so we can enjoy our food.   On to the food, I know everyone has different tastes but the hash kitchen has never failed me while eating here. I've loved everything we've gotten on all our visits and it always comes out fast and hot! The staff is great and if you love bloody Mary's and good happy environment then you gotta come here. DIY Bloody Mary bar and a DJ!

b7I_Jn7QXCWBnsJEzvsYcg.text: Amazing food and great service. Be prepared to wait a little while on the weekends but at least you can have a CRAZY amazing bloody from their Bloody Mary bar or anything else you want from the full bar. Try the green chile pork Benedict. OMG!!! Everything here is wonderful including the employees!!!!  Alec was our server and he was great!  Professional but funny and on top of everything!

gsXVTqgJJIamegHNwikgsA.text: Atmosphere is amazing here!! Bloody Mary bar is outstanding.. I've never seen anything like it. Some much to choice from . Food was to die for.... definitely will good again....

haqMsU4MHEv4-s6LM2gk5w.text: They have a wonderful staff, excellent service, and the food was delicious, The snowbirds are making a longer wait, but it's worth it,, The bloody Mary bar is amazing, nice way to start a Sunday

iZDqLjrUot50G8CrH-ltxA.text: Bad news, good news, great news:  Bad - Really long wait that they underestimated when giving us a wait time estimate. (Said it would be an hour, it was about an hour and 20 minutes). Things happen, but there were only two of us.  Good - Food was good. I wasn't that hungry by the time it came because the wait was so long we went to panera next door for a snack. (We were hungry, ok?) Also, I put a meatball in my Bloody Mary, which really filled me up.  Great - Bloody Mary Bar. I literally thought Bloody Mary Bars only existed in my dreams. Then I went up North Scottsdale road and found Hash and my dreams came literally True.   Overall, good experience and good food. Definitely going back when I'm less hungry in order to accommodate the long wait time. Worth it.

oJXWDqZ2tJC_RwXT7favvw.text: For goodness sakes!! My friend has a winter home here in Scottsdale, she highly recommended this place!! We got off the plane from Utah and drive straight here! ( my love for a Bloody Mary was my ambition)  it was by far the edgiest, funnest not to mention yummiest place we've been,  in a while! But hands down the best part was the staff!!!! Bonnie greeted us and had a good talk with us ( she called me beautiful ALOT) throughout our time here Lona was fantastic as our server, she was upbeat and funkay!! The Bloody Mary "barista" lol Alisa,  was so perfect! Off to our resort.  Feelin fine in AZ!!!

ShOfnnzMEK7qDd1d-aaENw.text: Food was great...Kitty was flawless and Bonnie...FANTASTIC!!!! 1st time at the Hash Kitchen, but I'll make sure to come visit every time I'm in Scottsdale/Phoenix...Get the Fried Chicken Salad Sandwich!!!

XjpCfCKlqDH9tCgi5KBzjA.text: Fantastic place! Stopped by for lunch and was very impressed. Great menu with so many things to choose from. I decided to go with the crab roll, smart choice! Beautiful big chunks of crab with a light dressing. Huge order of perfect fries. My only disappointment was that I didn't have room left for anything else!  I will be back.

vzbRPVpqFq9p3T-z98cAYg.text: Where else can you make your OWN Bloody Mary?!  We tried the jalapeno and cilantro vodka and both were great.  Additions included hot peppers, BACON, asparagus, green beans, pickles, Worcestershire sauce and pretty much anything else you could want...even bacon rimming the glasses.  Food-wise, the chicken and waffles were tasty, with bacon inside the waffles and juicy chicken, with the fried leeks adding a nice touch.  Berry stuffed pancakes with mascarpone were delicious as well.  Interior was tastefully decorated and Chris was a great attentive server.  Definitely come here if you're in the area!

FFg0Ava-3yw0XTW39CX53w.text: I am always trying new places to brunch! This is by far my favorite place!! Bonnie always greets you with a huge smile and great conversation! The food is AMAZING!!!! There smoked Salmon Hash and the French Toast is to die for!!! I'm hooked!

pec6aVwThcDwCpJ1unTEEg.text: What a fantastic lunch.  I highly recommend the Salmon BLT.  Wish there was a Hash Kitchen in Sacramento.

jR6N3U84pCsYtJyt_cfqrA.text: Came here for a private party after hours. The staff was friendly and attentive. Food was very good for buffet style. They pour a decent drink as well. I would definitely like to come back and check this place out for breakfast brunch and they're huge bloody mary bar. I know they have a few locations around the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nOUcWjR-JI6wjTHwZ3H6GQ.text: I want to start off my review by saying Hash messed up my order. I know you're thinking but you gave them 5 stars. Yes I did because of their EXCELLENT customer service. The manager fixed my order so quickly and offered to provide me other menu items while I waited.   Now from the beginning. I'm here on business and my husband and I haven't been lucky with the restaurants in Scottsdale. I went to Hash because it was fairly close to my hotel and the food looked delicious. Our wait was between 45min and one hour which I expected because it's Mother's Day.   We were seated an hour later outside and it was great. We started with the mimosa flight and OMG yes, yes, yes they were AWESOME SAUCE!!! I asked the waiter for non pork recommendations and she provided a few. I ordered the chicken and waffles and my husband had the steak and eggs.   Our meals arrived and the presentation was great. I dive right into my food and notice some little pieces of meat in my waffle. I have my husband look and yep it's bacon in the waffle mix! Well I tell the waiter and she had the kitchen prepare another meal. No big deal. Well the replacement arrived with a new waffle but the same chicken. I sent it back again because I can't have the chicken because it was on top of the bacon waffle. By now the manager walked by and obviously could see my disappointment. I explained to him I don't eat pork due to religion and before I could finish he said ma'am you don't have to explain I'm going to remake your entire meal. At first I declined and he said no I'm going to get it right.   This is why I will be visiting Hash again. The way he handled the situation is how a customer wants to be treated. Also, my meal was complimentary. I completely devoured the chicken and waffles. It was really good.   Plus, they passed out chocolate covered strawberries to all the moms. Although I'm not a mom they gave me one and the gentleman stated well you have a mom. This small gesture meant a lot since 5/13/18 was my mother's 2nd year being gone after loosing her battle to cancer. Thank you Hash!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zDXkM6cGJ71vx5MJvVGDyA.text: Pretty mediocre experience even with all of the hype and positive reviews. With a place like hash kitchen we were thinking they'd have pretty outstanding hash browns but was sadly disappointed. Hubby ordered the smoked salmon egg Benedict and I got the bacon and egg burger. The hollandaise on my husbands eggs were terrible and my burger for some odd reason didn't have an egg! We were seated outside on the patio and quite neglected but famished. Already had to flag the waitress down multiple times just for silverware and napkins, by the time she came back I already finished my burger. Could've been worse but we won't be back.

D78Y6mN_7CMfoV6InepYfQ.text: Typically this is a great breakfast spot.  Today the eggs Benedict was way over cooked but tasted okay. The worst part is when I got up to leave I realized my pants where soaking wet.  It had rained last night and apparently they didn't bring in the patio cushions.   I had to spend the rest of my day very uncomfortable.    The waitress could care less.   She is not good at her job.  Maybe it was her first day or she is just not cut out to be in service.    A table inside also complained about her lack of care and checking on them.   I hate to leave bad reviews and usually don't but owners should know what is going on.

C5G17wTEW-u9izASkwuuHg.text: warning: be prepared to wait!! Came on a Sunday around 11:30 and it was PACKED to say the least...good thing I expected nothing less. They had a live DJ which made the place have a "party" atmosphere for sure. The DJ played a mixed of music ranging from pop to hip hop and from hip hop to throwback r&b..my favorite.   Was told the wait was 1hr 45 min, but we happened to find a spot at the bar within 30 minutes. (Thank goodness bc 1hr 45min is WAY TOO LONG to wait regardless of the place. The person I was with insisted we wait it out...)  ANYWAY. I was basic and ordered pancakes so I can't say much about the food haha. They were buttery, extremely fluffy and big. Good pancakes. Didn't see the hype about the food but then again I ordered pancakes LOL. Cool atmosphere. Variety of different attire. Women mainly dressed cute with jeans and heels or something of that nature.   Would def come back, but not at that same time!

JpgL7XyLJceHqc659lbPSQ.text: Probably one of the best places I've ever visited for for brunch. Food was delicious. I would highly the lemon & ricotta pancakes! Bloody Mary bar was incredible! I tried the flavored mimosas and they tasted like they were made with fresh juice. Service was great! Would highly recommend visiting if you are in the area!

TZaZkWE3i2vVfvtl_r9LhQ.text: Very cool ambiance, fresh food and awesome vibe. Brioche french toast was super tasty and the hash was very savoury. I did ask for a side of hollandaise as I found the hash dry without it but that could also have been because we ordered the eggs scrambled and not runny or sunny side up. There was a live dj and the decor was very fresh and modern. We will definitely be back next time we are in Arizona.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hash

8lsIH6zfRFSJmFN_bzC71Q.text: This place is so fun and food is amazing! Gino checked on us and had great conversation. Most fun and delicious place for brunch in Scottsdale!

YBeDTV-NIVAbdZyIE3Gneg.text: A must if you're in the Scottsdale area! The food & drinks were so fun! And our waiter (Post Malone) was awesome - we had a big/crazy group & he handled it all happily! Oh, and they have vegan options! The Beyond burger was delicious, although I do wish it had more on it. I would highly recommend the avocado toast for any non-vegans. We waited almost an hour & a half on Saturday am, but it was worth it! Can't wait to go back!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cereal cocktail flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores French toast

S7RDkTYNdcNNewYalsoMIA.text: Whoa - DJ for brunch. This place is very much a scene so if you're not into that it may not be for you. With that said- the food is very good. The scene reminded me of something that would be very Los Angeles (that could be a pro or con for you).   I had the salmon benedict which was very tasty. I also tried my wife's lemon ricotta pancakes which were also very tasty.   Parking is easy and the servers were friendly. I would go back.

mLlxSs6DKeXXCr0XL6ckXA.text: If you want breakfast or brunch in a nightclub atmosphere this is the place for you. It was loud there was a DJ and a bloody mary bar that was actually very well done. We had the biscuits and gravy which was served with Italian sausage that didn't have much flavor at all. The gravy was not very inspiring either.  We also had the boring Benedict that was served with their hash browns which were actually home fries with a spice in it I think Rosemary that was not to my taste. The hollandaise sauce i am pretty sure was from a can. The server was friendly, the food came up very quickly, the bill was $32 which is about average for a breakfast place of this nature. Probably we won't be back.  but it was obvious very many people thought it was a wonderful place because the line was out the door.

Ioox0oxcGd7b6m-elPwgDw.text: This is probably my favorite brunch place of all time! The mimosa flights, food, and dj oh my. Geno was amazing and was so personable! The service is top notch and they cater to you. The coffee is also the best in town. I could just stay her all day!

0bue88HFCFlJbmdxb9AIvw.text: Had lunch at Hash Kitchen at Gainey Ranch this past Fri, July 5.  Upon entering the restaurant we noticed how loud the music was.  So loud, that I had to shout to the hostess that we were a party of 3.  She asked if we wanted to sit inside....NO WAY....IT WAS SO LOUD THAT YOU COULD NOT HAVE A CONVERSATION.  Others in line for the hostess complained about the loud music as well.  We were seated outside....the DJ  music was still so loud through the outdoor speakers that normal conversation was not possible..  When our lovely waitress Danielle asked us what we wanted to drink, we had to ask her to repeat it.  We asked her if the music could be lowered a bit so that we could hear one another.  She apologized that she could not do anything about it.  We then asked for a manager.  She came to our table right away.  We politely said the music was so loud and asked if she could please lower it .  She said she had no control of it, that this is how the absentee multiple owners want it.  Why do these owners have a manager that is not allowed to deal with issues to try to make their customers happy?  Then what is her purpose?  The manager said she would pass our comments on to the owners.  Moments later, we learned that the couple that was seated at our table prior to our arrival walked out because the music was so loud.  We opted to shout at one another, just as other seated guests had to do.  Two friends ordered from the breakfast menu and loved their food.  I opted for the Toasted Cous Cous and Kale salad with grilled chicken.  When my entree was presented, I noticed that there was no cous cous.  Danielle graciously apologized, and took it back to the kitchen,  I also asked if I could please have some olives.  She returned quickly with my corrected salad, however, the kitchen added the olives from the bar.....they were stuffed with large cloves of raw garlic!!!!  When I cut the sliced chicken breast meat it was rubbery as if it were not cooked through.  I bit into the chicken and the texture was not right.  My friend also tried it, and she split it out.  I did not eat the salad as I was very concerned that it was not safe.    Hopefully management will respond to the comment that was passed on to them.  I understand that this is a concept restaurant, but is the concept supposed to be that the loud music disrupts your dining  experience?

yCOMAe94jbPLkFXVfibawQ.text: Lona provides great service! Food was delicious. Atmosphere was relaxing. Will be back again

MPHu0PVD4XmWGjV8Xvp3WQ.text: Be far one of the best breakfast spots I have been to! My husband got the carnitas hash and I got the fried chicken eggs Benedict. They were both very delicious. We also shared the banana split French toast which was out of this world!!! The regular coffee was delicious as well. And I loved the mimosa flight. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!  Side note- We went on Memorial Day and had a 40 min wait but it was well worth it.

qMOlXhTTr7IqVZ5NmdlyCg.text: This place is so much fun on the weekend! I went with 3 other girlfriends for a brunch and the DJ took us back to college. We loaded up at the bloody Mary bar, split the giant Lights Out Mimosa (it comes with a pinwheel and cotton candy!) and shared the Bacon sampler, gluten free pancakes, and eggs Benedict. Everything was delicious! The bloody mary mason jar was a bit smaller than I expected but still very good and I like how you can choose different flavors of vodka and spice, in addition to all of the other fun ingredients. I would expect a wait after 10am. We arrived at 9:30 on a Sunday and didn't wait more than about 15min. I also recommended to my cousin visiting on a girls trip and her friends had a blast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. There are so many ingredients for your bloody mary!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum! Bloody Mary bar!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon plate

TJAJB8j4gqU7VO8Ddf1Wsw.text: This is our favorite brunch spot! All their food is really good! It gets packed on the weekends after 10am when the DJ gets there!! They  have a Bloody Mary bar & mimosa flights! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-BfeirjAqH8qxtNoAdthgA.text: Delicious food. Was visiting Scottsdale and found this great place for brunch. The avocado toast was HUGE ~ have to definitely share that dish!

J0ac88PUX_9FqUgznSowsw.text: Love the drink options to go with brunch. The carnitas breakfast is amazing! Had the chilaquilas another time and it really fell short of my expectations. Gluten free options is major plus though! Asked for extra avocado and wasn't disappointed!

mMv3lSYS8-vqzisEl7wUFA.text: Hash kitchen will always be one of my favorite places to go. Their hash dishes are always my favorite. I've tried their bloody Mary's and mimosas. I have to say they are great drinks. It just gets really busy on saturdays and sundays so I would advise you to go at 915a-930a for no wait. For holidays I usually like to call ahead and make a reservation. Dino Hinojosa greeted me and thanked me for coming in (after I checked in and got the 5% off). He mentioned that the gainey ranch Hash Kitchen no longer takes reservations. He said it doesn't look inviting to people who are visiting. The food and services are great but the one on Frank Lloyd Wright takes reservations and is bigger. If they allow people to make reservations ahead of time just like all other restaurants, I think I would give this place 5 stars. Dino was helpful and alert! Will be back.

dwA6NTIPtTfY1QYFxg4nwA.text: Had heard about this place from everyone and finally made it there the other day. My only regret is not going sooner. The Breakfast Bruschetta was among the most incredible the most incredible breakfast entrees I've ever had. HUGE props to the chef who created this masterpiece!    Good service, nice ambiance, great looking Bloody Mary Bar I will definitely indulge in next time.  My new 'highly recommended breakfast spot'.

g4TNlYl_NgxM15nBAFpLVg.text: My second time to this location! Can I just say how much I love the hostess. I don't know her name but her alone makes this place vibe very well. This time I had the Huevos Ranheros Hash and it was delish. I do like the pork carnitas more. The. Blueberry mimosa was also refreshing. Love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RNz3Bj6Vb0DSVdIiuhkxjg.text: Yum! This was our first time here & it did not disappoint! I got a make your own scrambled eggs and added zucchini, onion, bacon and cheese. It came with buttermilk biscuit (amazing) and hash brown potatoes. We ate outside on the patio -  it was a perfect breakfast! Fun ambience and great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

sRquiXHVD2CdTHJlNQsfBg.text: I was in Scottsdale this past weekend for a wedding, and on our first morning in town my wife and I decided to try to find a good breakfast spot.  A little searching on Yelp! uncovered The Hash Kitchen, and we are pleased to report that the rave reviews are 100% accurate.  From start to finish the staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating, we were seated immediately on the outdoor patio, all questions were answered in a helpful way, and we never waited more than a few minutes for anything we needed.  Now on to the star of the show - the food.  Wifey absolutely loved her french toast as well as the perfectly crisp side order of bacon she went for.  I was indecisive with a few breakfast offerings, that is until our waitress recommended the huevos rancheros hash - i'm extremely glad that I took her advice.  This was by far one of the best breakfasts I've ever had.  The combination of veggies, perfectly cooked steak, eggs & crispy onions was phenomenal, something I'll often wish I had available back in New York.  Overall this is a do not miss spot in the Scottsdale area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros hash - do not miss this one!

mfr-P8hm1GUmW1yEO-3uYw.text: I was really excited to try Hash Kitchen but my experience and meal did not meet my expectations. The wait was forever long and it seemed like the hostesses did not have a proper way of tracking the reservations - as it looked like they had multiple pieces of paper and they didn't know one paper from the other in terms of order. I had the breakfast sandwich with bacon. It came out cold and was just meh. It was definitely not worth the 1 hour+ wait. If you are looking for a breakfast with that long of a wait I would suggest going somewhere else. Also, seemed like it was more of a drinking spot with the bloody mary bar setup in the center of the restaurant.

89DCwAK8gvQe41B0TxvEtQ.text: Amazing Bloody Mary bar!! Great food!! Enjoyed the atmosphere. Everything on the menu is good have been here twice and never disappointed. Sunday brunch can be hectic so call ahead.

2n3vbCYPyUvDivl-fTnrFw.text: Loved the atmosphere, service and food!  Just a note:  If you're looking for a quiet and low-key place for breakfast or brunch on the weekend, this place is not for you.  If you're looking to get the party RE-STARTED, then YES, this is your place!  I loved the super cute hostesses, the DJ bouncing and spinning and the overall, upbeat vibe of the clientele.  The people who come here know what they're getting themselves into. There's a HUGE DIY Bloody Mary bar with ravioli, cured meats, cheeses and MEATBALLS! Even though the place was packed, the server (Max) still greeted us quickly and made us feel like we were the only people he was taking care of.   We started with the Cannoli donuts, and they were so hot, fresh and delicious, I had a hard time saving one to take home for my kiddo! I had to save a little room for a blueberry mimosa and some herb fried chicken eggs benedict!   My husband had the Carnitas Hash.  FORGET WHAT YOU THINK YOU KNOW ABOUT BREAKFAST IN THE VALLEY.  The Carnitas Hash here is ALL you need...EVER. We will be back again and again.  This is a GREAT place for a birthday party or other group.  I can't wait to have an excuse to bring in a big crew and get the party STARTED!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5gfCEAvbsyI9L2TPpn_bew.text: Best in class for brunch. Mimosa flights are delicious and affordable. Anything on the menu good! Tons of options, light, heavy or hearty. Lona was amazing, provided good service and recommendAtions!

yAkmJKBJoKIrYw-D_SJVGg.text: This place is so adorably cool! What's not to like? First of all, You're greeted like they've known you forever and the atmosphere is relaxing and hip. Dj spinning on Saturday to wake you up and get you groovin' and a superb Bloody Mary bar with all the Fixins' ... But wait! There's more they also serve bottomless mimosas in many different Flavors made with fresh fruits and if you're not in the drinking mood you can order up a carafe of French pressed coffee ( they serve Lavazza )  Linda, the manager, is a doll and is known as " mama Linda " loved meeting her.  I give Hash Kitchen a perfect 5 stars for being the best next day remedy to a night out in DTScottsdale. Sunglasses on!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Leg of Lamb hash for Dad
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flat iron steak and corned beef hash in the background. Mr W loved it!

IyIcMy91oiFtxKIVBMgLzA.text: Fun place, a number of cuts above your other choices of Scottsdale breakfast/brunch places, of which there are many.  Our server was charming.  We sat outside under an awning with misters and were comfortable even in the July morning heat.

a2MVn2I0Udl2ObAoz3i5dQ.text: Had our server Sarah pick breakfast for me and she selected the flat iron steak.   Awesome choice!  Service was off the charts great and food was great.  If you go requests Sarah's section!

kQG4kA1Wn-r1M9QR5IxweA.text: This place was seriously so good!! I can't wait to go back and try everything else in the menu! We had the carnitas had and the banana split French toast they were both delicious.

VtvAxuwSFVrRj8lL0COLkQ.text: If you are going to come here you gotta have lona as your server. I ordered the build your own bloody and she took care of me and helped me build the most delicious Bloody Mary. She was super attentive to us even though she was busy and made our friends birthday special.

JA6bmCdbwqhGLDG5rC9cOA.text: I visited on April 30th, and was really disappointed with our experience this time around. I've been coming here 1-2 times a month, and today was the first time I left feeling underwhelmed.  We were quoted 20-25 minutes for a table.  After 50 minutes I asked if they had lost our table, I was assured that they hadn't and it would be a few more minutes.  I got the feeling that the host was so overwhelmed with the chaos that he couldn't manage the situation.  We were seated after 1 hour and 10 minutes. It was another 15 before our server visited the table. We saw multiple couples who were sat after us have their orders taken, and food delivered before we were able to order.  When we received the food we were both underwhelmed with what we were given.  My side of bacon consisted of two raw pieces and one burned black; my friends scramble was watery and flat.  The bloody mary bar is a nice touch, and the server there always remembers what we order.  She is a rock star, and a benefit to the restaurant. Bonnie is also a wonderful ball of energy!  I'm not sure if something has changed here, or we just caught them on a very bad day but I likely won't be back to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Raw/burned bacon served with my breakfast.

90rupTC8wIIIiMrgzgs5ng.text: Wonderful staff, love the environment and great food. The patio is cute and I love the outdoor bar.  The Bloody Mary bar is amazing. I love the mimosa flight.  The s'mores French toast is insane. Totally shareable.

St5cWkvl4TNdNmpyMOuVUA.text: The Hash Kitchen is one of my new favorite breakfast joints in town!! Tasty food and great service. Briana was our waitress and she was phenomenal. She was super attentive and friendly. We will be back to try the Bloody Mary Bar!!!

K1dQMYNMuBlESYppkLCD7Q.text: This place has the best brunch we've ever had, the menu is full of great choices. We had the Banana Split French Toast and the Pretzel Benedict and both were amazing.   We also tried the Bloody Mary Bar which was great as well and a nice touch for brunch.   Service was good, we have no complaints about this place. We will be back!

HgeP1J5V6gSf5SSEG0KGAg.text: Can't say enough. We love finding unique food when we travel to places, it's part of the fun of traveling, and this was an amazing foodie experience. So much so we couldn't decide what to eat and totally over ordered; pretzel Benedict with bacon. Yes. It exists and it's amazing. Ricotta lemon pancakes. Italian hash and don't forget; grab the cannoli (donut)! So good. Literally didn't have a thing that wasn't excellent. We left so full but wanting to eat more. Also, our server, Lona, was just as much part of the great experience. I asked for Stevia for my coffee and because they don't carry it she brings packets from home, in case anyone asks, to keep her customers happy. That's above/beyond level customer service. The only bad thing I can say is, I wish we lived here as I'd visit every weekend. LOL  This place is a must try. You won't be disappointed. Trust me.

R30tfdD09TsoBLMF0etnjg.text: Boom ! Go! Enjoy. Thank me latter . The rest of this is just filler because yelp wants more than BOOM and quite frankly it doesn't get better than boom

juLsuP_jiZFAcchnxvfMWw.text: Lona did great! The lights out mimosa was fantabulous and is a top drink i recommend for brunch!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This place has the best service and always accomadates well!!!!! Lona did a fabulous job and the lights out mimosa is the best!!!!

suOun4OTQ7iQ6yaW9wboqA.text: Wowwwww. Amazing. Fresh. Great vibe. Exciting quality food. Went with a large group and absolutely loved it.

ZZqfBe-tYYlo-CO_XiGRYw.text: It's getting two stars because the food was good... but the manager and owner can kiss my butt. Wanted them to turn the music down just a little so I could talk with the people in my party, but the manager said "NO, this is the atmosphere the owner wants!" I just wanted it down a little so I didn't have to scream and others around me didn't have to scream. WILL NOT BE BACK and I'll make sure others know how rude they are.

LbF-4UKQdYeHz23YS2mCrQ.text: Well I had took the family here Sunday. I've passed this place many times and I've heard about it. So I wasn't to surprised by how good it was. I had the banana split French toast it was a lot of food but well worth it (i think next time I'll go with the Classic French toast) Wife had the corned beef hash a go to for her in various breakfast stops along our marriage. I'll try and get back here one day soon very happy

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_FeUvk5ujaQ2gQSnpV6Q5Q.text: We visited Hash Kitchen on 10/26/18 at 8777 N. Scottsdale Rd. Great food and service. The restaurant was clean and well maintained. My boyfriend asked servers and hostess why they don't serve real hash browns. The potato that their Chef Joey chooses is a little different style of hash browns. They did taste great and since I am not a big fan didn't eat all of mine. We would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. October &amp; November specials

_0S-S50Nmaq9m1tAz-s0xg.text: Wish they had one of these a bit closer to my home.  We stopped by here on our way to the MIM. The food was great the service was too.

QUz-KS3Tw_GiFCqs-i0jHQ.text: Place is pretty cool brunch spot. They had a DJ playing 90's Jams!!! Briana was the best. She on was on time every time checking on us. Food was good! Got the carnitas hash and the make your own bloody Mary which was an experience.

MDvWZ3D_ZAPDOhEPHjvtsw.text: Fabulous brunch! Toby was awesome, recommended the Avocado Toast Hash Style and it was delish. Boyfriend had the bagel sliders and fries, also fantastic. Dominic, the manager was attentive and friendly. Everything looks amazing, we'll be back to try it all!

1hobbbK2lulW2BzpqnOKfA.text: Gross. Busy - always - which is likely due to their Bloody Mary Bar and not because of their food. We've gone as a family of four twice and had to wait nearly an hour to get seated. The food is never good. But, we and many others enjoy the blood Mary bar.

1EgdNPjwqj3TqzmsAp_cBA.text: The chicken and waffles are amazing! Had to try something different.   Excellent service!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YttraS8-Lk6O-WCtRF95uQ.text: WOW!!!  Most unique breakfast spot I have ever been to!!!  Veggie Frittata and biscuits and sausage gravy were amazing!!!  Bloody Mary bar is never ending, the meat balls were the best I have ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dD7uMryxpwTYnlF8oNnvWw.text: Make sure you come here hungry - or HANGRY!  The food portions here are ginormous!!!!!   Holy breakfast sandwich was as big as my face!  Amazing!!  Super cute place in a strip mall.  And bonus points because the owner apparently drives the Back to the Future Delorean that is parked outside.  I mean, literally, the exact same car!!!!!  Super cool.  In any event, the food here was good.  We also had the monkey bread and I'm not much of a sweet tooth for breakfast but boy that was good stuff.  Someone else got the Chilaquiles.  WOW!    Everything was awesome.  And they offer this nice refreshing fruit infused water outside... free.  So good.  We were tired and on our way to drive back to Los Angeles so we didn't hit up the Bloody Mary Bar but that looked amazing too.  We saw a couple of people getting those next to us and I definitely would recommend that.   It looked so good!

hYNTyIlQiHSSZ6RQlrvmSw.text: This place is soo nice, we ate outside amazing weather our person was Lona, she was soooo amazing made us feel welcomed. I would always come back to this location and wait for her! Thank you Hash Kitchen ! 10 Stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0vrZnjvuuE91pN5ByXRlFw.text: Great food selection! I had the flat iron steak, which was a very hearty meal. They leave a pot of coffee for you at the table, so you never even have to ask. The music is also lively. This is a definite recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flat Iron Steak is a must to start your day.

NOn7VIbWdEGy8yQUJ-G8dA.text: My friend was in town so we decided to catch brunch and this is the place my friends finally decided on. Great decision by them. It's a bit far from where I live but by the quality of the food I will definitely be visiting again. First off the mimosas were amazing. The first one was like $8 or $9 but the four I had after  that were only a penny so it was a really good deal. Now for the food what can I say? It was exquisite. I had egg and shrimp hash with a biscuit. It was all amazing. The biscuit wasn't too dry like at some other places and the shrimp tasted phenomenal. Lastly service was amazing outlet waters were always filled up when they were almost empty and we never waited too long for anything. Great place and will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg and shrimp hash with a biscuit

UiMgwodw4i7fGLmMylAKow.text: Good Bloody Mary Bar. Atmosphere is upbeat & lively. Service was pretty good, food came out "warm" but overall, great place for brunch.

SfMdbzqe-nJy5-jFNC3Xlw.text: This place has a great ambience. They even have a DJ during busy weekend brunch hours. Extra bonus- strong, flavorful coffee! Although we didn't try it, they have an extensive, impressive Bloody Mary bar. Husband tried the house sangria and said it was the perfect blend of sweet and strong.   In terms of food, so many delicious looking options. If you like seafood try their lump crab frittata or lump crab sweet potato hash -- both were excellent. We also split a 1/2 order of apple pie pancakes and they were delicious. A 1/2 order comes with two large pancakes and is plenty, especially if you just want a taste of sweet along with your full savory meal.   If you're looking for a fun brunch environment this is your spot. Do expect a wait during the busy brunch hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet apple pie pancakes. This is a 1/2 order!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious lump crab frittata. Side of potatoes and the homemade biscuit were also great!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummm savory

F_nGjhiE71ZjQSqJAjc_Jg.text: Wow! I'm so glad I made a pit stop here. I am very impressed at everything! Walked in and I was greeted so friendly. Got seated right away and my server Derek is just pure awesome! He explained the entire menu so well that I wanted to eat everything. Although he say their skillets are a must try I decided to get their breakfast sandwich. Sandwich itself is very huge! It can definitely be shared with another person. I really liked the sandwich and Derek was so friendly and nice. I am definitely going to come back! Great job Hash staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich and fries

cJ7joN7HqGgvYX8wqLF2zQ.text: Not my cup of tea.  We went there on a Sunday when it was packed and we were lucky enough to snag a couple of seats at the bar instead of waiting 15 min. for a table.  The DJ was right behind us and the place was NOISY!  Ok, if you're looking for lively, then it might be your cup of tea.  We ordered a bloody mary and the BM bar had tons of options for add-in's but the basic drink was meh.    Service was good and the food was prompt.  It was average fare which probably suits most.  Actually the biscuit with a salty top was maybe my favorite item on the plate.  Certainly large enough portions to fuel most people.  Suffice it to say, as long as you are looking for what they have to offer, you might like it more than me, but I'm off to search for more ambiance, less noise and a little better taste.

YNvRaHZ4Hr5CSVrGzUD3ZQ.text: I come here with my family all the time! Perfect brunch place with endless options- savory or sweet! The decor is beautiful and the servers were fast. I ordered the steak skillet and it was delicious.

NszNkcway3kLrPk6df3d_g.text: Extremely hip an a rare find. House music going during breakfast will definitely wake you up!  Best Bloody Mary bar I've ever been to. Can't wait to go back for my next breakfast.

spnpdbyBK0AFs_9TTla2mQ.text: The food here is served in a skillet and is perfect for a lazy morning. The bloody Mary bar and the music just add to the great atmosphere. Difficult to get a table and very crowded on weekends. Slightly overpriced IMO.

K_wayACwyJsfGmcIQGNnXQ.text: You had me at Mimosa Flights. We LOVE Hash Kitchen. They have an incredible bloody bar, large variety of Mimosa flavors to pick from and a fabulous menu. On weekends a DJ plays music- nice touch! We've been several times now and have not been disappointed. (I love the scramblers & French toast). Bonnie is running a slick & smooth establishment and we will keep returning. She always comes by to check on her clients when they visit. Thank you for the hospitality and fab mimosas!

1BKEaS0qXweKSJj82KCxRA.text: I just found this restaurant and loved it! My friends and I went there yesterday and was impressed with the food variety snd the service. I'll be back for sure!

TMHlEYQviZdrWTu0GKMlgA.text: Alex was our waiter and he was wonderful!!  I highly recommend The Hash Kitchen it has great food and amazing service!!!  Come enjoy the ambiance!!  I will definitely be back!!

RdqhiVCxuV-Ne8OG94fk9A.text: The Bloody Mary bar was AMAZING!  The cilantro lime infused vodka had a nice kick & all the toppings had me going back for seconds.    The french press coffee was also very good.  I had the chicken and waffles, which were delicious & I would love to try them again.    The bartender at the Bloody Mary bar told us they have a DJ on the weekends, which would definitely be worth checking out.   The decor in this restaurant is very boutique.  I loved how nice it was & it really had a different feel than most breakfast spots in Scottsdale.

kRXiYPU8-m2IWMswMH3_jQ.text: We were a party of 35 and I think they handled our big group very well. The food was good, everyone in my group was pleased with the food and service.

oiM4jDFcEVYxRVi7rag7LA.text: Their bloody Mary bar is incredible. Reasonably priced too. They have every brunch dish you can think of. I had the crab Benedict and it was really good. The service was great. I would definitely come back for brunch. They have a large bar and a special for bottomless mimosas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome bloody mary!

-UQL6NyTxnFBQUJ5L0qIfA.text: To start the service was incredible. The staff was friendly, fun, and VERY excited to be working there. The Bloody Mary bar was incredible - something I've never seen before. We got the Mexican scramble, waffle, and chicken and waffles. Everything was very good but the spice on the chicken could be changed up a bit. I'm very excited to come back to this place!!

_uIMLadTaarH0HUBdzG44Q.text: We love this place...great food and an attentive wait staff... especially the hostess Bonnie who always goes out of her way to recognize my mom...thumps up!

Zbk5esaOJ5I8Yjcet4P-Dw.text: The service was incredible and the food was excellent! We arrived on a busy super bowl Sunday morning and enjoyed the pineapple and grapefruit mimosa while waiting.  We were seated way less than the time provided which was awesome! I enjoyed the lump crab and sweet potato hash which was absolutely delicious.  Our server was attentive and very sweet.  The decor and music, amazing! The location was somewhat confusing to find and the receptionist was not very helpful. FYI it's a walking distance from Panera if you can't find it.  Def must go when in Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab and sweet potato hash...yummy!

D01McetQug6c-zkP8UorHw.text: I've been to this place twice and both times it did not disappoint me. The food is amazingly delicious and so are the bloody mary's. Bonnie is a great host, and every employee has a smile on their face. They make us feel welcomed. We were a group of 25 and they accommodated us quite well. Our server was amazing. Would definetly come back and also encourage people to try this spot!!!

QXqk6bimTtuVb8EOrDgtgg.text: I was very underwhelmed by my experience at Hash Kitchen - I had heard a lot of good reviews but not when I was there - - the service was terrible and the food was mediocre - - there are many other good places for breakfast in the Scottsdale area - -

4wR3eTi8Rt1U33-NCWbwjg.text: Our friend decided to have her birthday brunch at Hash Kitchen and honestly, I had some VERY high hopes. All of my coworkers raved about it, friends loved it and needless to say I was excited. Once seated, our waiter came around for drink orders. Me and my friend both got the bloody mary bar (my favorite whenever I brunch). After receiving a ticket to go get our drinks, we then had to wait inline at the bar to receive our vodka and mixer. That wait alone, was 15 minutes. Keep in mind, this is on top of having waited for a table and then the server to return with our tickets. Any other restaurant I have been to returns with the vodka and mix and you are then able to go and garnish as you please... not here. The selection at the bloody mary bar was great except half of the items were already gone. We were there at maybe 11am so it wasn't late in the day at all. The bloody mary itself, was delicious, but our table having to wait on us to order meals didn't make much sense. I ordered the prosciutto eggs benedict - meh. I would never order it again. No flavor and the bread was hard as a rock. No one seemed overly impressed with their food - my husband got a hash skillet (Italian maybe?) and he said it was just OK. For the price, and the wait time, there are plenty of better brunch spots.

uolzVc3g6uMyyhubSxsaWw.text: I went here for breakfast/brunch on a Sunday morning! We didn't have to wait long for a high top table. As we sat down we were greeted promptly. We did the Bloody Mary bar. Where you build your own Bloody Mary. I must say it was AMAZING. There were so many options of things to put in your Bloody Mary. The bartender working that bar was very friendly and helped us out a whole lot. I had the vegetable scrambler which was also cooked perfectly for what your paying the food is really good. Our server Anthony was so sweet and and extremely tentative. He definitely made the experience there even better. We will definitely be visiting this neighborhood spot more often!

pMkiTR0aMj-vwSzg9PMWvQ.text: I previously gave Hash Kitchen 5 stars, couldn't wait to bring my adult children when they visited. I'm hoping I caught them on an off day and all the new restaurants opening are not diminishing the product. My son got a Bloody Mary per my recommendation. He came back with it virtually empty. They  had not refilled it so there was no bacon and many other items. Our meals were served without the biscuits. Our waiter told us they were making fresh ones, they'd be out in 5 minutes. 30 + minutes later we left without having them. The food, previously amazing, was only adequate. I don't want to write this place off so I will be optimistic that this was an aberration.

TXkgZ6EZo9wOooj1BBM8UA.text: This is my all time favorite for Sunday brunch, wait time can sometimes me more then an hour, however they have a Bloody Mary bar that is the bomb... the wait is still crazy great food, amazing service

DLpyhbQUzMHBleGnmQmTow.text: Let me premise this by saying the food was delicious. However the service was not very good for it only being tuesday afternoon, only 6 or so tables with customers and having a few waitresses. I tend to be very patient and understanding of what a waitress goes thru. However, our waitress, Katy, did not even take our order we flagged down another waitress after waiting a good 15 min for her to acknowledge us. I normally would not complain about the amount of times a waitress comes but I sat there and watched her go to her other tables 2-3 times and actually converse with them. Meanwhile she had only come to our table once. I finally got up to get the manager to let him know our table was completely ignored and before I could finish my sentence he turned around walked away from me and got our waitress. She came back to the table with our check and did not ask if we needed anything. My mom had to ask her not to go just yet and if  she could  bring us to go boxes. Although the manager was polite he did not ask what he could do to remedy the situation or what we needed. We visited the other Hash Kitchen and on a busy Sunday morning and we received better service than this location. First time in my life I did not leave a tip. Like I said I have a great deal of patience and understanding for what waitresses do but we were flat out ignored compared to her other tables. That combined with the  rude behavior from the manager, I will not be visiting this location again.

awnFr-h7ub4vhgwkJhNO3g.text: I am very impressed by this brunch spot that is centrally located in Scottsdale (literally). As a North Scottsdale resident and someone who is really familiar with brunch after living in Southern California, it's really refreshing to have The Hash Kitchen nearby with a creative menu including endless delicious options with a social atmosphere. As a twenty something professional, The Hash Kitchen is a great restaurant for business meetings but is also the ideal space to gather with friends for a weekend brunch gathering with the DJ and morning cocktail options.  I highly recommend the Lump Crab and Sweet Potato Hash for a savory dish and the Encrusted Coconut and Almond French Toast for a sweet option. The service is top notch and our server was always on top of our orders and coffee refills/beverages.  If you're a foodie or a brunch enthusiast, this is the place to be!

9KP6E7zYUlgG5XtLjLdrxA.text: This place is a gem! A delicious and unique menu, huge portions, strong coffee & creative cocktails (mimosa flights & Bloody Mary bar ). They even have several gluten free options. At first the dj seemed too loud but after only a few minutes our group began to appreciate the awesome music mix.  Bonnie was great and made sure we were all well taken care of. I will definitely be coming back!

v5CP9YwGEq-Wft5XhCYhsg.text: Diverse menu so there is something for everyone here. The skillet was great and their biscuits are fluffy and delicious. Most impressive Bloody Mary bar in town!

wq_L3Kp8h43e2Q3win0zzQ.text: Didn't even know that Cuttlefish was gone, but being a huge fan of breakfast, I'm glad we happened to notice the signage had changed. Since it's a weekday and they haven't had their grand opening yet, we were among the few patrons this morning, but everything was fantastic! The service was delightful, just the right level of attentive without  being intrusive, and the food... The food was perfect. I had the Nutella and banana French toast, when it came out I thought they had brought me plain French toast, but tucked away between those layers of bread was delicious chocolatey goodness. The hubs had a brisket hash brown skillet, he loved that there was cornbread in the dish as well as on the side. The French press coffee was a nice touch, and another day (read: not a workday) we'll be coming back for mimosas.

f1Z--IlQpf-OdBB-VbV7GA.text: Bonnie Bonnie Bonnie! She was the sweetest little lady. She complimented my friends and I calling us the "beautiful table." We were told it would be a 15-20 minute wait which ended up only being more like 5 minutes sitting outside on the bench. dz8JDP1AgoMTXU2glaPsUw.text: Although I enjoy a good breakfast, our quest to find new brunch spots has gradually subsided in recent years. This is largely due to the fact that my girlfriend and I have already went through grueling trial and error experiments in an attempt to firmly establish a set of reliable favorites. And after all, who wants to spend a late Sunday morning experimenting at unfamiliar breakfast places that risk being colossal failures?  But dammit, I keep insisting: Try new places! Don't be like my parents and keep dining at the same five restaurants in constant rotation over the course of two decades. And for this reason, I decided that it was time that we start searching again.   In many ways, I kind of already knew what to prepare myself for while going into The Hash Kitchen (THK). It's one of those entrepreneur "concept" restaurants - and one that caters more to the current trends of the modern brunch/bar hybrid - complete with the required thumpy music and flowing mimosa flights.   Joking aside, I really didn't expect much. I've been to places like this before and always end up disappointed in comparison to some of our favorite spots in terms of food quality. Boozing before noon doesn't interest me, so my judgment lies strictly on the food taste.  But in all honesty, we ended up both being impressed with the offerings at THK after a couple of visits. Although there are a handful of menu items that are served at most modern breakfast joints, including the mandatory dessert-like French toast variations, there's also many dishes that are quite unique.  I'm a big fan of their Huevos Rancheros Hash, which includes the potatoes themselves, black beans, cotija, a few tortillas, over medium eggs, avocado, carne asada, and red chili sauce. Their Carnitas Hash is also worth mentioning. My girlfriend also experimented with their breakfast lasagna, but insists that their hash plates are the safer choice.  On a side note, we obtained a half-order of coconut and almond encrusted French toast. We both really liked it, although my gut tells me the Nutella and banana variation would have probably won me over completely. Unfortunately, it's off the menu and when I attempted to order it on a return visit, they claim it doesn't exist anymore - despite having all of the ingredients.   Coffee was good (Lavazaa), while OJ was also some of the best you can find.  Service can vary. During our second visit, our food took forever - to the point where I wish the server would have just admitted that they forgot to put the order in. On a positive, they're all very friendly.  The bottom line is, don't go in here expecting to find a traditional breakfast joint. And in some ways, that's a good thing - as I think as long as you approach this place with an open mind, you'll easily find something here that you can appreciate.  Recommended!

IFcove7suda9ryuhJRJKVQ.text: What an amazing breakfast/brunch place!!!  Definitely a must go to for our guests!!!  Not to mention....I'm a "hash" anything freak, so that part is well praised!!!  But on top of that, they have the most incredible DIY Bloody Mary Bar!  Complete with Slim Jim's, bacon, salami, jerky and freshly shucked oysters!!!!  Deliciousness in a glass!  They infuse their own vodkas like:  cilantro lime, cucumber, jalapeno, orange and more!!   Well done....Maggiore family!!!  Another jewel in the valley of the sun!!!   Back with our friends from UK!  Well, sorry Barry, but we will bring you next time for spicy Bloody Mary....  I am remiss if I don't mention my lovely ladies of Hash Kitchen!!!  Bonnie is an amazingly beautiful inside & out greeter and all around "go to gal"!!!  You must visit just to meet Bonnie!  I love her & you will, also!!!
