MdKjlZCMK72l02CH5haVFw.text: Trifecta-  great food, great service, and unique atmosphere...i.e. awesome idea for the build your own bloody mary bar.  Would go back in a heartbeat ...wanted to try so many more items on the menu.

XNJ5IHIg2g7DuWC3EG-eTQ.text: Been to this place quite a few times now. Always hopping. Have figured out we can always count on Bonnie, hostess extraordinaire to treat us right from the moment we walk in. I've sent people to this place and told them to watch for the lady at the front desk. She's eccenteic, energized and abs olutely delightful.

apfRNDjeRBjpK0RnyDT4Iw.text: My husband and I love Hash kitchen for its delicious food for breakfast or lunch, and this year we were pleasantly surprised with a Christmas brunch that topped the day! Starting with lovely choice of mimosas to such festive and  tasty brunch choices ! The lemon ricotta pancakes melted in your mouth, as well as the special holiday French toast and scrambled egg omelet! The servers were so busy and yet so friendly and added to,the lovely ambience! Loved it all!

vzRmZmnpADngbpPkBdnvHg.text: My husband and I came in for brunch on Friday, June 9th. The server near the host counter ignored us even though he made eye contact a couple of times. After waiting and being helped  by Gino we were seated and waited an inordinate amount of time for service. During our wait we watched several other groups of diners experience the same issue. In fact, a family of 4 deserted their table after another group was served before them, even though they had been waiting much longer.  The saving grace of our experience was Gino. He was fantastic, pleasant, and literally ran circles around the other servers on shift. The male Manager seemed oblivious to the lackluster performance of the other servers, particularly a tallish, thin man in early 30s with black hair. There was another female Manager on site that was having to manager the male Manager to stay on top of water refills, etc.  In conclusion, the food was good and the property clean but our focus was unfortunately drawn to the disorganized and lackluster staff - other than Gino. I highly recommend Hash Kitchen ownership take a look at the crew on duty on the morning of Friday, June 9th and get rid of your slacking staff and praise Gino. I would venture to guess that he will burn out sooner rather than later in that environment and he was the best part of the experience!

_pkvVxSLJOSzZN790ylseQ.text: Love this place!!! Definitely check it out. Amazing Bloody Mary Bar. They infuse their own vodkas! Smoked salmon Benedict is incredible and you can make your own scrambled'

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar. All the goodies you could ever want!

ywUI0kSe55O_MR-u6wocfQ.text: Hash Kitchen is a great place for brunch! The bloody Mary bar is amazing, Guava Mimosa is delicious and the Carnitas Hash ...sooo good. Bonne you are adorable!

i_jTTCnHb286h4-v-A5a8Q.text: My friend and I met up here yesterday for a nice long-winded "download" visit over lunch. I arrived about 10 minutes before she did, so I put my name on the Wait List and tucked myself in the corner of the foyer as it was pretty busy.  The DJ was on the bar side and it was L O U D. So loud, it made me wince, to be honest. Because DJ was so loud, the patrons had to talk loudly to hear themselves so it was just sort of stressful. I was adamant about NOT sitting to the right (bar side).  I dunno... I guess this (DJ Pauly-dude spinning vinyl) feels more natural at a restaurant in the bowels of Old Town, not North Scottsdale. Someplace like R&R, or Geisha-A-Go-Go...? You know??  The hostess/other lady (maybe owner?) kept asking me if my party of 2 wld like to sit at the bar (multiple times). I kept repeating to them I didn't want to because it's too loud and I wanted to visit w/my friend. Very annoying.  My friend and I did get seated to the left side of the restaurant and it was much quieter.   Our server (didn't catch name) was great! I ordered one of his recommendations (Pork Carnitas Hash Skillet w/2 corn tortillas) and was glad, as it was pretty tasty. Pork was nicely seasoned and moist! Came in a small cast-iron skillet pan which was a nice touch. Couldn't help but notice a good amount of grease pooled at the bottom of skillet pan that made my throat close, but it was still good.

Zbh3KExXSUd2SYwaVGSr9w.text: When there is a dj, Bloody Mary bar, and fruity pebble popsicles you know it's going to be an amazing brunch! The lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing! I'll be back tomorrow to try more

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Bloody Mary bar ever!!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Greek yogurt fruity pebble popsicle

OU4BmNzUx4vOkQLSrxsPkA.text: Go now!!! Visit Adrian at the Bloody Mary bar. You will not be sorry. This is the most epic Bloody Mary you will ever have! Great food, great service, amazing options!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ks-wd5DBlZprlrKnMOFdFA.text: This is by far my most favorite brunch spot in Scottsdale! Yesterday was my second time dining there and I wasn't disappointed!   After having a booze filled weekend in Old Town celebrating my friends 30th birthday, we decided we wanted to end the weekend with a fun, mimosa filled brunch. As soon as we arrived we were greeted by the amazing hostess Bonnie and she remembered seeing my husband and I at the restaurant a month ago. It was a really nice feeling for her to remember us and we had only been there once before!  Brunch was FANTASTIC. I had the Mexican scramble and a couple of others got the skillets. We definitely didn't need any doggy bags because everyone cleaned their plates :)  My husband enjoyed the delicious bloody mary bar and everyone at our table took full advantage of the bottomless mimosa deal!  To show you how amazing the service is at Hash Kitchen, they kept the restaurant open until almost 4:00 (it closes at 3:00), because our group was celebrating a birthday and we were all having such an amazing time drinking champagne and just enjoying ourselves.   Thank you Hash Kitchen for the amazing food, atmosphere, drinks and service. You will absolutely see my friends and I again very soon. My husband and I are very excited for the North Scottsdale location that is opening soon!

B9Bx8evSi-rL4_v9tcElrQ.text: Open your mouth and let me shove this killer breakfast joint's food in your face! Ya...that good. The date was Mothers day and it was packed! My Wife made reservations well in advance and when we arrived we had to wait. We waited 30+ minutes. Big fucking deal. Put your snappy chat, instagram and twitter down and spend some time....you know, talking and hugging it out with your Family. The Restaurant brought out Mimosa's to the hungry and thirsty. I thought they handled themselves well considering the mob and the special day! All that aside, yelp is not about your rude waitress, the slow cook time. We want to know about the food. Every Chef, cook, hostess and waiter/waitress is bound to have a bad day. Please stop bitching about that stuff. Get down to the food. We had a large group and here is a list of everything I actually tasted.  Lemon Ricotta Pancakes - Awesome. Buttery, Lemony, Crisp and Soft edges with moist middle. Almost my favorite ever. Served with a delicious Lemon ricotta topping.  Canolli Donut - Excellent. I would expect canolli creme to be fantastic coming from a Tomasso.   Carne Asada Hash Skillet - Perfectly marinated flat iron with two perfectly poached eggs. Very flavorful on a bed of hash brown cubes potatoes, they could have been crispier and green chilis.  Oreo Pancakes - Delicious in their own right, did not taste much like an OREO. That being said, they were still cream worthy. ya, know...OREO cream worthy.  Carrot Cake Pancakes - Damn good. Like if Upper crust bakery from the long ago Timothy's decided to make pancakes. The crispy fried carrots on top was spot on, different and texturally tasty.  Lamb Hash - Bomb. Period. If you love lamb don't miss this. Juicy seasoned lamb with poached eggs and browns. Good Shit!!  Smoked salmon Benedict. Really, should I go on. Excellent!!  Lastly.... Fruity Pebble Yogurt Breakfast Popcicles. Holy Shit Fred. What a fun and tasty way to start a breakfast. Not filling and full of flavor. I never thought it would work but those pops blew me away. Like a palleta pop thats creamy, a bit tangy from the yogurt and sweet and crispy. Yah, it's good.  That's it. I did not taste one thing that was meh. All food exceeded my expectations. The owner was out and he was very accomodating considering how busy he was. He was funny, relaxed and a small part of why my Family will be back. Can't wait. Fortunate they are right down the road from my house. My waiter. who my Wife said was a manager...I don't know how...was really good. He actually came back and thanked me for my tip. I think he was stunned, I was hoping that if I made him happy, since he made me and my Family happy, that mood would transcend to other diners waiting in the mad house.   Cheers

iwIPbo0TSaZ2xKeIDFn8lg.text: We love spending a morning with Bonnie and her team at Hash Kitchen! The coffee is strong and perfect. The Bloody Mary bar is awesome! We've tried so many things on the menu, and we've never been disappointed.

97scqFRissWTXS-xfuBKOA.text: Very friendly place that was super clean and well decorated.  They are a lot of things on the menu that we wanted to try.  We were able to sit down, order and eat in a reasonable amount of time on a weekday morning.  Their croque madame was delicious.  The mexicana scrambler was also good.  The portions are very large though!  Would love to try their bloody mary bar on a weekend.

cw54qgI-sziMMv33E5e3gQ.text: Hash house is dope, Bonnie is probably the coolest lady on the east side of Phoenix. LeBraun fans welcome. Service on fleek, food on point, and good vibrations. Stop in and treat yourself.

dwbT2GoiEcmZ6HKiXrMmdA.text: Food was excellent. Service was excellent. We will be back! Portions are large- not a bad thing but good to know. Yum!

SL_QOjzUtp0eovFbPsz9Pw.text: Started with a Bloody Mary.  The most mild Bloody Mary was pretty spicy. My wife had a mimosa and that was pretty good.  My wife had the americano and was very tasty.  I had the breakfast burrito and it was excellent.  The service was a bit slow but not bad enough to not come back

jCqLy7WjVeikJ0_D7MRwjQ.text: This place is a rip off. We weren't greeted at all when we came in. They're hostesses greeted us with cellphones. Nobody even said hello. We sat at the bar where we still didn't even greet us. About 15 minutes and finally someone said something. Nobody smiles in this place. Seemed to be very out of order and chaotic to work here.  Seems like the staff doesn't enjoy they're job either. Definitely don't see myself coming back far better Bloody Mary bars that aren't an entire joke or rip off in Scottsdale. I wasn't going to write a review until when i asked the bartender if she could give us split checks since my meal was more expensive. She basically told us to do the math ourselves until another bartender helped us out. Sorry but When you ring orders in don't you separate seats? Can't believe we spent that amount and still had such awful service. It would have been nice to at least get a smile from someone

dEl-7Zb-rb3PHH0LFBBB4g.text: Had a great breakfast with friends and family from out of town. Aimee was the hostess with the mostess. Great variety and taste.  Moderately priced. Our waitress was great as well.

ru23MGMLkg54b_kcarv1CQ.text: Hubby and I went for the first time on a Sunday.  While it was busy we still got seated rather quickly.  We had the mimosa flights and they were yummy. Guava was my fave!  The service was good but the good was better!  I ordered chicken and waffles and they ate KILLING Lo-Los.  It was delicious .  They had good music, good atmosphere and we will definitely be back!

WD9OjQphwJcuAfYlCgHHKw.text: We love this place! The coffee is Hot and delicious, the service is amazing and beyond! The food is so tasty and timely! Go try this place and you won't be sorry!!!!!

azDWWQEvFEXbNGRvP2_FqQ.text: Food was very yummy! Completely hit the spot! I love egg scrambles, so I  got the Americano. Biscuits have a great consistency! I'm not sure if they always have a dj, but it is very loud in the restaurant with the dj playing the music pretty loud and everyone trying to talk over all the loudness. Definitely recommend, if you don't mind the loudness. There is some seating in the outside patio with misters.

kNAtxQ8kZ9xT0TIclzN3Mw.text: Awesome bloody Mary bar! We were a party of 5 and 3 of us tried the build you own Bloody Mary and definitely enjoyed the experience and our drink. We were not as impressed with the food... all but one of us had the hash and we all felt... meeeh. We will come back for the Bloody Mary.

Al6MiAnj3H3YHoFcgfLSUQ.text: I went to the Hash Kitchen for brunch a couple weekends ago and it was delicious. I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict along with the classic french toast. My boyfriend got the smoked sliced brisket and corn bread hash. My favorite part was definitely the smoked salmon eggs bennie. It was super flavorful and each bite seemed to melt in my mouth. The french toast was alright and I've definitely had better but I guess I shouldn't expect too much since I ordered the plain ones. The hash was pretty good but had a little bit too much corn bread and not enough brisket in our opinion. The service was fast and I would definitely come back to try those chicken and waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked salmon eggs bennie, classic french toast, berry mimosa, and brisket and corn bread hash

fUWgwtgygrcHNSrKkSAUTw.text: This place is amazing! The vibe and staff are incredible!! Food is sooo delicious and Bonnie brings the whole place to life! We just love her! Highly recommend!

kLh-7tyvYzNuxg3eu3WwPQ.text: The reviews are in, the critics have spoken, a 99% on rotten tomatoes and 5 stars on Yelp. The hash kitchen is a breath of fresh deliciousness in Scottsdale's outdated brunch scene. Close your eyes and picture the scene as you walk into and be introduced by the fabulous owner (I don't know her name) but she has pictures with the likes of phelps and Kurt Warner on the wall so yah she's the real deal. The smell of smores and Oreo pancakes intoxicates your nostrils. The friendly patron behind the most complete build your own Bloody Mary bar gives you a wave and a nod as to say "hello old friend glad to see you again." As I'm writing this review Bonnie places her hand upon my shoulder and thanks me for coming.. Bonnie is the owner i now know her name and will be back soon.

hfHlLJ2nIvdAqoi-zHkTZg.text: Definitely my go to spot for Brunch with my girls. The service is top notch and the food is amazing. The high light of it all is their Bloody Mary bar. Thank you Bonnie, Evan, Lona and Alyssa for making me feel welcomed and appreciated. I'll see you next week!

rLDfSmA_KupS2BOLOxs16A.text: Very nice selection. Fresh ingredients. Friendly service. I ordered the paella and was good. Their pancakes are delicious.

ZlPALHisCyGQ8kLB8EADTg.text: This place is incredible!! We are from out of town and decided to check it out! I would highly recommend this place for the vibe, good food, the Bloody Mary bar and the mimosa flight!! This place has it all and the service is excellent!! You also have to meet Bonnie! She makes the experience and is so good to all the customers!! She lights up the room!

_QBGyMYq3nd55X-lvvSyUg.text: I absolutely love this place! I have taken my whole family there twice now and both times have been worth every penny. When we arrived (my girlfriend and our two daughters) we were greeted by Bonnie. She is amazing and we will back to see her and enjoy the French toast again soon!

I had the chicken and waffles that feature bacon in the waffle, eggs, and fried leeks. Awesome.  The hashes and chilaquiles at the table were excellent as well.

z2lU0KKxXcF6vZ-kkzzj5Q.text: After hearing rave reviews about this place, we decided to try it for my 40th birthday brunch with family.  My mom had made a reservation days before we went (they said they don't take them, but they made an exception for her).  When we got there, they had the reservation down for the wrong day.  It was a busy Saturday morning, but they did their best to seat us right away.  We did not realize their was a DJ there on a Saturday morning.  It was VERY loud and we couldn't hear ourselves talk.  It was also very warm and very crowded in the area where we were sitting.    The food was ok.  I didn't love what I ordered, but some of the others that were in our group had some tasty meals.    Definitely not a place to go if you want to have a conversation with others.  Would be better to try it when it's nice out and enjoy their patio area.  Not the best experience for my 40th birthday brunch.

Q99rlBsQF412uo0v59SBEw.text: Pricey but large portions, options for all types of breakfast eaters. The $22 mimosa was enough for two but way too sweet. Didn't finish it. IG worthy presentation though! Love the different mimosas options. Great friendly customer service.  Outdoor(dog friendly) and indoor seating. Amazing Bloody Mary Bar!  Got the avocado toast and the giant brioche was so yummy. Very filling for one person.

9d3h30qKFQjrlWCu7Ly-hw.text: We were staying in Scottsdale and stumbled across this place from other yelp reviews. Our family came here twice (first on Friday and then on Saturday). On Friday the place was less busy and we didn't have to wait. We went out Friday night and being a bit hungover, I was looking for some brunch to cure my headache. When we arrived Saturday we had to wait 10mins which was no big deal. Inside there was a group of college girls enjoying brunch and doing tequila shots - it was quite entertaining. There were multiple birthdays and the ambiance was good. The DJs music was pretty loud and being hungover, it was over stimulating. Had I not been hungover this would have been fine.  Food 5/5 - the menu here is extravagant and it was difficult to choose what to eat (that's why we came back multiple times). Honestly you can go wrong with anything on the menu. If you are up to drink, they have quite the drink selection and custom bloody Mary's and mimosas. I'd definitely be back to do this with a group of friends if I come back.   This place is definitely worth a stop if you are in the area. I'd recommend it to friend and other people visiting for an energetic brunch experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried chicken eggs Benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg white veggie scramble
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken frittata

tJQd0m9JngyTSSG0WVXptg.text: Currently on a mini vacay and decided to try out this place.   Upon arrival it looked very busy and I figured the wait would be long. Sent my gf in to check in and find out the wait time. She was told it was 35-45 minutes, but once she arrived in the car within five minutes our table was ready.   That was a great relief because we were starving!   Our server was prompt and brought us waters out immediately. The menu was thorough and had all the information we needed.   We ordered the chicken and waffles and herb chicken hash. My gf loved the chickens and waffles. She tore it up lol. Said it met her expectations.   As for the hash I got the serving was great. Definitely felt me up. I do wish there was more flavor to the dish. It felt like it was missing some taste to it. I did substitute the poached egg for scrambled. Which probably led to it being dry. It needed some uuoomphh. So I added some syrup and it was good.   Will definitely come back next time we're back in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb chicken hash

Au-YznuubPyCu8pVirFe6Q.text: I've been to all three Hash Kitchen's and been here many of times. Surprised I don't have a review yet. Anyhow, the Scottsdale HK is probably the smallest one. Smaller outdoor seating and a smaller dining area but still very consistent for HK. DJ here is probably the loudest of them all. Just remember that this is just a Scottsdale thing and you just get used to it.   I tried something new on their menu. The Carne Asada Torta. Which was really good. The Carne Asada was thick and to the point little hard to bit it off but had thick piece of tomato and cheese. The sauce is what really makes this sandwich. Has a nice kick and really brings out to taste. Very good. Comes with a small bucket of fries. Fries were very crisp which I like and very good. Overall, a very good meal.   My son and wife got one of their usual. The Carne Asada Hash. Standard good as usual. No complaints here.   The service was very good. Our server greeted us right away and got us our drinks. Refilled both water and coffee. She also kept an eye on us asked how everything was.   So overall very good. Consistent ambience for Hash. Loud DJ and everyone having a good time during their meal. Really good food cause I love their Hash dishes and starting to really like their sandwiches too. Really good service too.   So of course I enjoyed this place. Been here multiple times with consistent food, service, and ambiance. I'll be back. Enjoy we always do.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian Hash

nfbIZKQWcZPwl7DzdQU-DQ.text: Food - 5 Stars Service - 3.5 Stars  Definitely come here for the food - it is worth it! But don't expect to have top-notch service (at least in my experience). I came here on a Monday morning and it was still fairly busy; it seemed like they were understaffed or the service was just a bit slow. So I'm hoping they have a lot more workers on a weekend when it is actually very busy. If you are a bloody mary lover, this is also a spot for you!   I sat at the bar, and the bartender was pretty busy with having to serve the whole bar and some other tables around it seemed, so it took her probably at least 10 minutes to get to me. At least I wasn't in a hurry. I ordered a pineapple mimosa, and the fried chicken benedict.  So. Damn. Good.  This is not a place to come and have a healthy meal, but it is one to come and have a delicious one. The friend chicken benedict was probably the best meal I had during my 3 days in Scottsdale, even though I was in a bit of a food coma afterwards. Luckily my hotel was walking distance so I could walk it off a bit.  Highly recommend here for a great brunch - you have to try it!!

RxWxogApbKWlJ_wfbnRllg.text: I was among the group of women and experienced the rudeness of their manager Geno. On top of his rudeness he went through his business caller ID to call out my friend about her bad review and asked to be taken down. Seriously, inappropriate!! You would think he would try to make it right...but no! All Geno wanted was for my friend to take her negative review taken down! Horrible customer service!

6cy2hi7XAw3bX7RvRizqwg.text: Wow this place was great on a Sunday for brunch.   If your looking for great food with an even better atmosphere you have to go here.   We took a day trip to Phoenix so of course we had to have great food. I found this place online that offered music, food and fun! They didn't disappoint.   We opted to sit at the bar. Great choice. Service was excellent! Every bartender we encounter was GREAT! They recommended yummy options better drinks and served amazing customer service. They laughed talked and danced with us while still keeping the other customers happy!   Food was tasty we each had an idea of what we wanted to eat but wanted to try a sweet dish as well so we shared the Banana split brioche. Yes give me more! My huveous ranchos was perfect. Just enough spice, crunch, savory goodness...   So about this Bloody Mary bar! Man I am a fan and Bloody Mary aren't even my thing. So many options and to me the key to a great BM is the tomato juice. They nailed it. I was even a big fan of the mimosa flight. The pineapple was delish and my fav... orange and pineapple were fresh squeezed and it definitely makes a difference.   If I lived in Phoenix this would be my spot. Keep up the food work.   Oooh and the DJ was great.

Kz21R2LiYguIZjgrS8faPw.text: This was a cool breakfast spot. It was a bit crowded but the food and service was good.

UsmviwlAdTFiR-tXPIx2yQ.text: Had to check out this place since everyone suggested that I should try it. I decided to do brunch on a Saturday (day before Mother's Day) around 11 so as you could imagine the wait was long but reasonable.  When I was seated I noticed that the menu was a revised Mother's Day version which was slightly disappointing  because they didn't have everything that's normally on the regular menu. I wasn't able to order what I wanted so I opted for the chicken and waffle along with mexicana scramble with a side of pancakes and turkey bacon.   The chicken and waffle didn't disappoint as it was flavorful although a little dry, I was satisfied with the dish. The turkey bacon however was undercooked and due to the place being busy I wasn't going to inconvenience the waiter to have it cooked crispier. The mexicana was also flavorful and satisfying but the pancakes were nothing out of the ordinary.   I also ordered the strawberry pina colada with the cotton candy on top and that was the highlight of my brunch! Super cool concept as well as a drink that was strong yet enjoyable! It's deff worth the price!   Overall this place is great just be prepared to wait. I more than likely will be back to try a few other menu items!

All my favorite things in one place...good food, company and banging music!!....like this place is LIT (Awsome)...I am like in love it was packed when we pulled up but I could hear Cardi B blazing from inside and I knew this was it! oU7AoWwKL55CkOqp4wEzBg.text: I had high hopes for Hash Kitchen when I walked in. It certainly has a fun vibe (and was packed for a weekday morning around 9:30/10). However, I soon became less and less happy with our decision to come here for breakfast.   We waited quite awhile for anyone to come fill our water- or even acknowledge us. For me, this is often indicative of future service. In this case, that proved spot on. Our waiter took a while to take our drinks -- and then wouldn't let us do our food order at the same time (we weren't sure when he would be back). I got a hot green tea and my sister a hot coffee. The tea was unbelievably weak. The hot water didn't turn any color at all until I added honey. Turns out, I was pretty much just drinking honey water the whole time (kind of gross).  Our appetizer came out - the biscuit board - in okay time. However, the six biscuits were dense like a rock and about as flavorful as one too.   Our entrees came out shortly thereafter -- I got the carne asade breakfast burrito and my sister got the chicken and waffles. Both pictured below. My sister liked her meal, although I did not. The burrito was HUGE -- way too big for a reasonable meal and I hate wasting food. To top it off, the burrito was entirely tasteless. The avocado added some flavor but not enough to enjoy the burrito. My sister also couldn't finish her chicken and waffles and found it to be way too much.  Overall, this restaurant feels more flash than substance, and I wouldn't waste time or money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carne Asada breakfast burrito

0f2bfMORKYSF1TOkcbd3TQ.text: I've wanted to come here for a long time. The reviews are awesome and it's close to my neighborhood.  When you walk in you're greeted by a large build your own Bloody Mary bar. Really cool if you like bloody Mary's.  They didn't seem too busy in the late morning but after 10 minutes of sitting down people were piling in. Definitely to be expected from a popular high rated place.  The amount of people seemed a lot for the servers because there seemed to be 3 or 4 employees floating around but only 1 taking orders and handling the checks. But the service was good. Our server was helping everyone and did a good job. She even took off the poutine fries because they took way longer to come out than everything else and we ordered it as an appetizer.  Which brings me to the food. I didn't realize they serve the biggest portions in the world!! I'm a guy and I eat a lot of food and I'd be more apt to complain about not leaving someplace full. This might be the only place where I'd say they could tone down the portion sizes a little bit. The food is impressive to look at. It wasn't bad but it wasn't good enough to where I'd want to comeback unless I wanted to see someone struggle to finish a plate of food. The avocado toast is on a very large impressive looking brioche. Super, super thick. Too thick to be honest. I like a quality bread that's got some texture from being toasted. Also that's warm and fresh with a little bit of chewiness to it. But also a bread that is a transportation for the amazing mashed avocado, and other great tasty ingredients. On this avocado toast it was more like a decorative hat because the brioche is a monster. I apologize for not having a pic. I also had the lasagna brunch. It sounded so good and wanted to try it as I've never had it before. It was ok. It lacked flavor in my opinion.  I think if it was my style to drink alcohol during breakfast this place would be really cool. But too much heavy food to enjoy breakfast for me.

tfXPgPvHjwdNjq1GXxx-GA.text: Let me start off by saying the food was great. Giving 2 stars totally based off service. When we arrived it was only a few tables occupied in our section. It took 15 minutes for us to even get our drink orders taken. Then another 10 to receive them. When our company goes out in groups we tip well. We could not justify gratuity based on the service of our server Lona. When we finished our meal we waited 30 minutes and then had to ask another person for our check. Lona's attitude and demeanor was not reflective of this establishments reputation. We will not return or recommend this location.

oYE4_tCgl0q6VkwbY6hJgA.text: We are visiting Scottsdale on vacation and saw the amazing pictures of the Bloody Mary bar, and it did not disappoint! The toppings for the Bloody Mary were endless and you could add as many as you liked! Our food was delicious!  The only reason I am giving this restaurant 4 starts instead of 5 is because there was a leak coming from the bar, I don't know if this was a one time this or happens often. But there was a stream of water across the bar floor. Waiters and customers walked right through it. Kinda gross!

YzSkoNZlpmH0Qqa0KGLRJw.text: The food, drinks, and ambiance are all great. I visited twice this week. I recommend the scrambles and the mimosa flight. Very cool that they have a live DJ and a BYoBM (build your own Bloody Mary) bar.   This would've been an easy 5-star review if when I had gone to purchase two of their mugs, they didn't bring me used ones from a table that had just been bussed. There were greasy finger prints and a chunk of egg on the side of one of the mugs they were trying to bag and give me. So gross! They said they didn't have any new ones in stock.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight Orange - Strawberry- Blueberry- Pineapple

A-UEBnfkW0YuH01mGigxJw.text: I've been here a few times and really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere but today was not a great experience. We had breakfast here around 9am in order to beat the rush, this place really gets busy later in the mornings. We were seated right away which was nice but our server was terrible. She didn't pay any attention to us and we didn't get our order in until 30 mins after sitting down. She brought us coffee 10 minutes after we asked for it and I'm not joking, she filled our cups up enough for about 2-3 sips of coffee! I laughed out loud because I couldn't believe it.   Our food was good and the order was correct so that was good but then it took another 20 mins to get the check and at that point we were just upset with the whole experience.   The food and drinks are good but service was really disappointing today!

VJqCKGY3ToCIfn9sBRzpwQ.text: Love trying new places and this one was on my birthday list to try. Let me tell you music was banging, mimosas were flowing and, the food was on point. Right when you walk in the vibe was epic and the staff was very nice. Everyone got something different to eat and we all were NOT disappointed one bit. Chilaquiles crispy not soggy, Avocado Toast enough for 2, Chicken and Waffles was surprisingly very juicy and, the Scramble was fluffy with well seasoned potatoes.They served our mimosas right away (tad on the warm side) but refreshing. The manager kept checking in on us as well as our server. I even received a birthday donut which was very thoughtful. We most definitely will be back and can't wait for the one to open up at Park West

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight x4 lol

dc50Gf0U_J1CbbD03d3VHQ.text: AMAZING!! quick service on a busy Saturday brunch! DJ was great! Bloody Mary bar was super fun and good with unlimited toppings! (Ravioli, bacon, cheese, olives, meatballs ARE YOI KIDDING ME) so good!!  We ordered the carne asada breakfast burrito! LITERALLY AMAZING LIKE sO GOOd! Next we had the classic French toast on the fluffiest bread. Also so good but I liked the burrito more!  Would 100% recommend. Tip: super fun environment for younger crowds. It is very loud.

ePdWICsnHA319fVW8smn5g.text: Such great food here! And I understand they also own Sicilian Butcher. Both are great places. Delicious food and terrific service. The portions at the Hash Kitchen are over the top, so go when you are starving  Nancy Nurse

2J30rW2fr79eFfZcMQiDNg.text: LOVE, Love, love this place.  Would eat here every day if I could!  Huge portions, excellent flavor and great selection n menu. Best bloody mary bar in the valley! Fun atmosphere.

5Dw8TO0JWoO3ZV2y0O-0uA.text: I've heard so many good things about The Hash Kitchen! After running some errands in the area, we decided to stop in for brunch!  We shared the Huevo Rancheros Hash and Bruch Bruschetta. The Huevo Rancheros Hash was a large portion, that was served on a hot skillet. It was filled with cilantro carne asada meat, two eggs of your choice, I picked poached, fried onions, and a biscuit. Lots of flavors going on it one dish!  The brunch bruschetta came with six pieces. One with chocolate and banana, strawberry and cream, lastly a bacon with some sort of sweet sauce.   The prices were fair. $15 for the hash and $8 for the bruschetta.   Our wait on a Saturday afternoon was about 15 minutes. We sat outside in the nice weather. Oh the weekends they have a Dj and big speakers! So we didn't want to be in the loud restaurant. And there was a huge party of 20 as well.  Our server was attentive and polite, can't miss him! He has a Jersey accent.

-DNtFTYMEXw3jozT5pa_dA.text: Unreal Bloody Mary bar. We have been several time and it's always excellent. We can't wait for the Arcadia location to open. Our kids love it as well

ZgpKy2vrYBn3d_8CzS5Vsw.text: Up Beat Scene With Loud Music and Tons Of People!  Good music is super loud and make this sort of like having lunch in a upbeat club more than a restaurant. It's a cools place and our server was from Rhode Island I believe and he was cool, but swapped with a table of more than 30 which made him never stop running around!  I had the Huevos Rancheros Hash or something close to that name... It was good, nice portion size and good presentation.   I also had the Breakfast Brushetta which is definitely just a snack! Probably not worth the $8 for it since it's pretty small but the presentation is good and would make a good addition to coffee with friends....  I met the general manager who seemed friendly while we were there. I am guessing the older lady with the super fun upbeat personality is the store manger. Everyone was friendly and I can see why this place is buzzing.   We even had carolers singing Holiday Rap Songs to us on the patio which was unexpected but amusing.   All in all, this is. cool spot to hang out and get a bite.

Jb6Cc_21KCqQK-zZqS4vag.text: The food is good and if you order a morning cocktail they will not say something snide to you, like other places.   If you like to dance and clubbing is your thing during breakfast, go here. They pump the jam for some reason, which makes me want to eat in a hurry. Maybe they jam out for that very reason.   I know in my twenties that would have worked out fine for me. However, I have not been to a rave in 20 years. By the looks of it, a lot of the other customers probably don't choose Sasha or Paul Oakenfold  for their favorite either. I'm not sure why establishments have to hammer this crap out assuming everyone likes it.

fo85KQZPYeU2xaa_plwxgQ.text: This place is so bomb and worth all of the hype. Came on a Saturday morning, the wait was quoted 50 mins but we were sat in 30. Mimosa flight was awesome and $16 dollars is a great price for 4. Friend had the biscuits and gravy and I had the breakfast burrito, they were both amazing and the portions were so huge we only finished half. Lennard was our server and he was attentive and super friendly. Been wanting to come here for a few months and it 100% exceeded my expectations & I'll be back soon for sure! Has a great vibe and the dj on Saturday's makes it fun. I'm so happy it lived up to the amazing reputation I hear about it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burrito with side of potatoes

cOjN0aVd_GeFG7nTD6LyZw.text: A great place to start the day! Became even better because boy (whats up with the B's?) were they friendly and courteous!   First time at Hash Kitchen and certain to be a long relationship. First impressions create the tone of image and mood. Miss Aimee our hostess, definitely made a positive one. Miss Aimee greets everyone as "friends" and although it was our genesis( it was Sunday, had to inject somewhere) her warmth was most welcoming.  The restaurant is large providing a bar area ;) and several seating areas including an outside sojourn. The day was pleasant and we elected to sit outdoors.   Our waiter Evan could not have been nicer and patient. Explaining the menu (there's lots to choose from) and making recommendations. We began with a bottle of Chandon bubbly. Excited to try a few different dishes, ordered the Herb Chicken and Waffles, Real Men eat Quiche, and Carnitas Hash. Having no "Real Men" around, I auditioned and got the part after 8 tries. Every Dish was different and worthy of praise; tasting delightfully delicious! Pictures truly tell a story, and I'm hoping to have captured their tasty essence. Please see Pic's.  Combining our experience from beginning to end, makes this a reoccurring must. Plenty of parking without any problem!

HvetHjLtLmSoTtENaG1Ypg.text: This place has really good coffee but the music is a little too loud.Maybe sit outside will be better.  I was there Wednesday around noon, it was the music that was too loud!

9zeaWTF9gp_q8STHDF2Yaw.text: Beware: You will have a long wait for weekend breakfast, we're talking 45-1 hour. And no, they don't take reservations. But is it worth it? 100%!   I've visited this location and the one up north at Frank Lloyd Wright. I definitely prefer this location. I enjoy the upbeat atmosphere and it felt like a big breakfast party. The had a great DJ playing some major throwbacks and it made waiting for a table more enjoyable. They offer a large bar area where you may sit or stand to wait by the DJ booth which is as entertaining as it gets at a breakfast joint. If you prefer a more chilled out environment- maybe try the location up north, they seem less busy; this one is a definite upbeat spot and a great way to start a fun weekend.   Food was fantastic- definitely order the donut appetizer and the bacon board (I attached a photo) soooo good!   Will be back soon(:

wF13WmUISB--ORsdAt02QQ.text: Going up on a Sunday  The atmosphere of this place is like party party party  loud music, dancing granny, and 20-to-30-somethings gettin their breakfast on. The wait was long (45 minutes on Sunday at noon) but the food was worth it. Got the Carnitas Hash with tender juicy carnitas (albeit not crispy), 2 over easy eggs, Chile verde, avocado, and piled high with fried onions - put it all together and you have the perfect bite...that I literally couldn't stop eating even though I was BEYOND full bc it was so  damn  good

t2vA9MQWA-envzKW0jX1LQ.text: This was my first time here-- what a cool place! They have a live DJ, cool atmosphere, great food and our waitress Jessica was bomb! I will definitely be back!

sVZ0R1xajMHLD4ygyKqruQ.text: I love the vibe here! If you and your guest want a peaceful visit...do not go here! I love love the vibe in here! This place is turnt up with an awesome DJ!  We will be coming back for more Mimosas, Bloody Mary Bar & the brioche french toast!

EOSTJssVbAw0SU-TjOpfmQ.text: This was my first stop after landing in Phoenix early in the morning on a Wednesday. I found this place on Yelp and was impressed with the great reviews!   I got here around 11 in the morning and it wasn't too busy at all. I decided to sit at the bar and was greeted by the friendly bartender. I saw the Crab Eggs Benedict on one of the Yelp photos but they no longer had that item on the menu. I chose to go with the Blackened Shrimp Eggs Benedict.   I really don't eat eggs benedict too much but I thought the hollandaise was pretty good! The blackened shrimp was good and the asparagus went well with the dish. The only change I would make would be to ask for the potatoes to be crispy. I don't like soggy potatoes.   The restaurant looks pretty trendy and seems like a good brunch spot. I would definitely come back to try the other dishes.

mTiF1U_cEJCEqwz18Jt7YA.text: I typically don't hand out 5 stars very easily but I've been waiting on this one (forgot to post for some time). First, the overall atmosphere and vibe from the staff here is fantastic, you feel like you've been invited to a Sunday brunch party and everyone is happy to be there. The bloody bar is obviously great and we did partake however these were the real MVPs: 1) the cannoli doughnuts were delicious with just the right amount of buttery sweetness and a flaky crust. 2) The blackened shrimp and grits were definitely one of the best I've had. Meeting Joey was the cherry on top for my Scottsdale visit!

9r-hoYYNEolvZP7wwk8DyA.text: Talk about brunch spots. Hask Kitchen is a place to add to your list.  The ambiance for this place is kind of "vibey"; think bright colors, plastic chairs and loud music. Lets just say it's young, hip and casual, with a side of turnt. The menu is vast & each breakfast selection has its unique twist on presentation & taste.   The wait can be long on weekends. Luckily we had a reservation and got a table right away.Once seated, we were handed menus and the server took our drink order. Our server was on point checking up on our table without interrupting conversations and refilling waters without us having to ask. He was also quite informative to questions and made good recommendations. The food and drinks came out within reasonable time and looked great.  As soon as we began to dig in to our food, we were interrupted by the puking of one of our table neighbors. While I'd like to say this came as a shock, it didn't. While we were hanging out waiting on our food, we noticed the girl who ended up puking was passed out on the table. Both their server and a manager approached the table as this was taking place, and did absolutely nothing about it. Let me preface this by saying she had consumed the 25oz MEGA BOBA MIMOSA and a partial mimosa flight. The manager conversed with the rest of the table, as if this girl was not drunk and passed out, and walked away. Within moments she awoke and proceeded to throw up then stumble to the bathroom. Just like that breakfast was over and we were ready for our checks, which ended up being comped. While this gesture was greatly appreciated, the situation could have been better handled.  Outside of the incident, the service went smoothly and our drinks along with our few bites of food were delightful. My only suggestion in the future would be the restaurant escort people who fall asleep at tables out, to mitigate the potential aftermath!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. #baconboard #oinkoink
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry Mimosa #nom

2YQFfInijZ-Yh3892Z7Zhw.text: AMAZING breakfast place. I already want to come back. First off - the bloody mary bar is so neat! It's not cheap but well worth it. They have so many different options for you to choose from: alcohol, salt, mix, tons of additions. It was so fun to make them! The food was great too! I recommend the French toast, so yummy. They had music playing and the staff was fun and lively. We will be back soon for sure and looking forward to the new location closer to home!

1G-HqDy5ywHFt49GuRISww.text: Best Sunday brunch in Scottsdale. Very hip joint. We love coming here on Sundays because the DJ makes your dining experience a little more memorable. Before you know it you will be rocking to the beats in your seat. The Bloody Mary's are the best in Scottsdale and the waffles are sooooo delish. This place defines the concept "brunch redefined"...as every item on the menu has a "twist" to it and little something extra and special.

5Jv2d8sm0FVl0WCXfUjbyQ.text: My favorite brunch restaurant!  Good vibes, friendly staff, amazing bloody mary bar and the food selection is incredible and it's all great!!!  The only negative is there is always a wait but it's worth it.

XDiNL9ZTfDRHmF3lcur-Bg.text: The food was too die for! Best brunch I've had in my life. I know that sounds aggressive but I'm so serious. The the carnitas hash and the herb fried chicken Benedict were amazing. Also the mimosa flights with the different fruit flavors were superb. 10/10 would recommend our server  Patrick he was a gem.

KDidgpi5IrEdtSX15KJZ6g.text: Patrick is the shit!!! Best server at Hash Kitchen! Everyone should request him! Great service and extremely great hair!

vskey_jFbOFHLoetXJRSgg.text: Amazing brunch and breakfast spot, patrick was a waiter and he kicked ass. He made sure we had a perfect view of the TV and kept the masters on for as long as he could. Really great spot

dFctnW5-M_o7zvgQl-BVkA.text: Great atmosphere  Great service  Excellent food   I highly recommend this as a breakfast destination! In addition to the great service and food Bonnie in guest relations was so friendly and accommodating. I'm coming back to try all the items I enviously saw other tables receiving!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

L8lLwQQZ147Bn6bR-4WtOw.text: Excellent food and presentation.   Wide variety of breakfast and lunch choices. Natural burger was big and delicious. Eggs were perfectly prepared.   Be aware, music loud on weekends and a young crowd.   For me..no problem. Go to the kitchen and get what you want... you won't be disappointed.

5t50lsU0sJHiklUJJvX5aQ.text: In the Gainey Ranch Shops at the previous Cuttlefish location. Good size restaurant and vertical modern building. The old oyster bar from Cuttlefish with the scooter seats are transformed into a Bloody Mary Bar.  Had the Build Your Own Scramble with Chorizo, Italian Sausage and Mushrooms which was excellent. It came with a small container of hash browns and a home made biscuit.  Everything was excellent,  the chorizo was just right not to hot but with enough kick to give it flavor.  The mushrooms were plentiful and the Italian Sausage was very good. The Hash Browns were good and the home made biscuit was fresh and soft.  The disk jockey playing the music was different in a breakfast / lunch place. Was good to liven up the place but at times was difficult to hear the other person talk.  The service  was excellent as our waiter Ryan made sure everything was right and for having a party of 14 he handled every need without an issue.   Was also a nice touch that the owner came by to talk with us.  Will be back to try the lunch menu and especially the burgers that looked very good on the menu

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burger
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burger

fM1TztBcKDdLHTQPDWwZ3w.text: Very popular brunch spot in Scottsdale. Went on a busy Sunday morning there was a large number of people waiting inside as well as outside the restaurant to be seated. But there was lemonade available, drinks, and a cute Bloody Mary station for those waiting. The host advised me it would be a 35 minute wait and we had made the drive to Hash anyways, so I figured we would wait. After only waiting maybe 10 minutes to our surprise our table was ready! We had a very friendly and urgent waitress, I ordered a delicious French Press coffee and tried their cinnamon roll pancakes that were probably the best pancakes I've ever had! Sadly, the only reason keeping this from a 5 star experience was the music. It was way too loud to visit with my company and honestly enjoy a nice brunch. If the music was lowered or we visited when there wasnt a DJ would be 5 stars.

Un8dNH_Pc9HMUeYrdwUN2g.text: Lona, the bartender is the BEST! Always so friendly, helpful and smiley! She rocks the bar and makes everyone feel like home! The mimosas are the BOMB!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosas flight

G4M81Z3of4K24XvpqMNkDg.text: Bloody Mary Bar = A Bloody good time! If you are a fan of Bloody Mary's, you have just arrived in "Bloody Mary Heaven". With 40 different ways to top your drink (not to mention many flavored vodka options) you will be delirious with joy!  At only $10.00 per Bloody Mary (or $7.00 for a Virgin Mary) this is the bargain of the century! I selected homemade cucumber pickles, green beans, olives (too many olive choices to list!) pickled carrots and cucumber flavored vodka.   If you are not a fan of Bloody Mary's, don't despair, the creative menu is a dream for breakfast lovers! I can't rave enough about the fabulous menu. So many unique offerings.   I'm embarrassed to say I ordered a kale salad, (I was trying to be "good") which was a total wasted opportunity to try something indulgently delicious. However, next time I'm definitely getting the coconut french toast and perhaps even the leg of lamb hash! My friend ordered the pork hash and I tasted it and it was delish.   In closing, I have one suggestion: RUN over and treat yourself to a fabulous meal. You won't be sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy Bloody Mary&#39;s

36OiQWW3LENyiqCcQ1ja0A.text: Excellent food, service, atmosphere and Bloody Mary bar. Very busy on Sunday but worth the wait!  DJ and disco ball made for a fantastic experience.

2bMQ48LM6e--AW_Tr746CQ.text: This place was wonderful!  Great atmosphere, great staff and great food.  We enjoyed the service and food. We had the huevos rancheros hash and the mexican omelet. The food was well seasoned, fresh and the presentation was stunning. We also had coffee. It was fresh and strong! And finally we had the mimosa sampler (flight), boy was that good! Overall the experience was great. Next time we will bring our fury friends and sit on patio and we will definitely try the bloody Mary byod station!

mwo1poHIx9ERKDeKuDxIlg.text: Hash breaks the stereotypical breakfast place.  They played good music and it was loud like a nightclub.  The majority of people were drinking - mimosas everywhere and they had a great looking Bloody Mary bar.  One of the hostesses, Bonnie was a hoot and spent most of her time dancing around the tables.  We had the paella hash and flat-iron steak hash.  Both were delicious, generous portions.  I give this place my recommendation and was happy to hear they're opening a 3rd location in Chandler - closer to home.

c2nHKarLqQFDzjTWawzzAA.text: Food was just ok. Service was arrogant and slow.  Eating breakfast in a parking lot patio was not cool.

kMHRFf7JylRUEyA1y23w9g.text: This was our first time trying this restaurant.  After waking up hungry and not wanting to cook, we decided to give Hash Kitchen a try.  When we pulled up, there were quite a few people waiting for a table and it was packed which we thought was a good sign.  We went in to check in and get our name on the waiting list but we noticed there were some seats available at the bar.  Lucky us, we didn't have to wait!  The server at the bar quickly approached us and brought out some water.  The menu was amazing and I ordered the Paella hash and my wife ordered the poached eggs with green Chile pork and sweet corn cakes.  Both dishes were incredible.  The portions were generous and we couldn't finish our plates.  We prefer more food versus less especially when it is absolutely delicious.  If you haven't been here yet, you need to go!  The Bloody Mary bar looked awesome too.  Will be trying that next time too.  Lastly, they had a DJ keeping it lively with good tunes.  Yes, a DJ spinning during breakfast.  The vibe was very cool and alive.  Well done Hash Kitchen!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BpLFijTcU4rP6N1qGwMaHg.text: Went here for brunch and it was AMAZING 10/10. Mimosa flights are a definite recommend. And also for starters you NEED to try their brunch bruschetta. It was a 12/10. Great atmosphere and great service from our server Lona! Loved her. She was super upbeat and beyond friendly. Will be coming here again for sure!

KwgaN_e7VurtAod54Q5jFw.text: If you're looking for a fun time and an A+ meal with amazing service, DO NOT HESITATE TO COME TO HASH KITCHEN. My family and I were in town for the weekend and came here for brunch two days in a row. Our experience could not have been the same without our amazing waiter, Alec. He recommended great options and was so attentive. The wait time can be long but they have a build your own Bloody Mary bar that will help keep you busy! This place is one of its kind and you will not regret it!

THF4k9amVGW2MvFOnAcUsg.text: One of my new favorites for brunch if ... the DJ and Bloody Mary bar... then throw in some great chilaquiles and service and your done.

9kNJU15rhZyE-jXBnWB99g.text: All about the Bloody Mary bar!!!   And on top of that food is out of this world.   Highly recommend for anyone who is looking for a phenomenal breakfast experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TZf3AQtB0K5SJlRgKNWzeQ.text: If you're looking for a premium novelty bordering on gimmicky (read Disneyland/Vegas) Bloody Mary bar you've found it. $10 per cocktail and the DIY bar has everything from marinated mushrooms to BP oysters. The seemingly limitless options feel excessive and unnecessary. Recommendation: Hit the bar to build your own once, Then move on the a classic cocktail.   The food, on the other hand, was delicious. Split a hash and the fried chicken Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The finished product
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody bar at hash kitchen

9ivF5DluWbIj3WmUL_8mWw.text: Staff was extremely nice. Food looked amazing but was nothing to write home about. Got the carnitas hash but it was drenched in salsa so much i couldn't taste anything else. Would recommend going to downtown Scottsdale instead

CnLi3wf0XxOHUtXYd2aMyA.text: Went with my boyfriend on Sunday! First thing to notice was it was extremely busy! But we sat at the bar and still managed to get wonderful service! The food was creative, delicious and quickly brought out to us! They have a good menu with so many different dishes to try! A place I will come again to --- an again, and again!

nuewdrD-eN7SIksi4zM9XA.text: I was in town from Florida for business and had a free Sunday to explore. As a foodie and a brunch fanatic I looked up some nearby places and found Hash Kitchen not only was close but had awesome reviews. So I tried my luck and of course the place was packed, good thing I was traveling solo as there was at least a 35 minute wait for a table and time is precious. I was able to snag a seat at the bar which I find the service at the bar is better and this one sure didn't disappoint. The server/bartender was knowledgeable and on point when it came to my meal and drinks. They also had a DJ which was playing great pop and hip hop hits so the vibe was definitely there. I always do bottomless but since that wasn't an option here I went for the Mimosa Flight. Awesome choice as the juices for the day were Orange, Cherry, Passion Fruit, and Blueberry.. YUM. I also had their Carnitas Hash which was delicious. I am a carnivore so I would've liked more pork in my hash but man the fried onions they topped it was were unforgettable. Needless to say I would definitely come back :)

fm0YQbsXoL8xW876J95iqA.text: Awesome services by Justin.  Really busy location  and Justin came back to check on us constantly.  Great food.

3vLKQb6TFJBSvWJZVYQSvg.text: Love Hash Kitchen! They have THE BEST Bloody Mary Bar!  Lona was amazing! great service! Plus during the summer on weekdays the Bloody Mary Bar is $5 and mimosas are $3! How can you beat that!   This place is definitely my favorite brunch place!  Weekends are pretty crowded, so be prepared to wait! While you wait you can grab a Bloody Mary!

hC_kjsQ2JZ1DGXa9iHCvMg.text: Cool atmosphere, however the food was awful. Server was great and had the bad food taken off the bill. Manager was nice and came by to follow up.

4CiMI03nb-3Sf19_xikuGA.text: 1) The bloody mary bar is awesome. We sat at the regular bar and watched the bartender replenish their in house infused vodkas. A lot of work goes into their bloody marys and it pays off!  2) The food is delicious and portions are just right  3) The service is stellar. We sat at the bar because we didn't feel much like waiting for a table and we had great service (from both bartenders and the managers checking in on everyone)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I believe this was the Mexicana Scrambler, very good!

Kq6lgEaTfhlqC-QmOWgr0A.text: I'm not going to spend much time on this review because the problem was simple - the food was not even average for breakfast fare.  We had a couple of the hashes -- corned beef, and brisket with corn bread.  Both consisted of an inconvenient skillet with simple hash potatoes on the bottom.  This was topped with the meat, followed by our eggs.  There was little flavor in the potatoes (except grease), and our scrambled eggs were very overcooked and dry.  Worst were the meats.  These are not chopped into the hash but rather served on top of the potatoes.  The corned beef had a strange flavor that I find hard to describe.  The brisket was very thickly cut, extremely dry, and virtually tasteless (no smoke flavor at all).  On the good side, the biscuit and jam were good.

K1babjhoqSajpGpwR_5yRw.text: Over easy eggs were medium. Hash dishes were mostly potatoes. Other than Bloody Mary bar, this place misses the boat.

uy2bIZ5wjsfETYa9zhdpMg.text: The absolute best Bloody Mary bar I have ever seen!!! So fun! Great menu options and some seriously fun house cocktails!

VZcvtMLwkIkhNzq1QsfcAw.text: Had the mexicana egg scramble and mango bottomless mimosas ($9!!) food is great and drinks even greater. Shout out to Lona our server!! Great and friendly service provided

RwCaSxZSDd_edyKFMLzv5Q.text: This place is my happy place. Lots of laughter and conversations happening outside of the restaurant. Host was super friendly. Bonnie is so adorable and attentive! I had literally one of everything. I highly recommend this please if you're looking for music, fun, high energy for breakfast and celebrations!

TCQh6bezoYCb4-ZcHBOPYg.text: Fantastic food and service!  Quite possibly the best Bloody Mary bar I have ever seen.  I will be back for sure!

9mPcWURDtbY9lNMiDzNhtQ.text: I love the atmosphere and the music from the dj was great. the make your own bloody mary station was the BEST! the wait was the per usual for a saturday morning, but worth it!

cwWOmJyLym633iI1L5OOZQ.text: Loved this place! I love going for brunches, tried this place for the first time today and I'm happy I did. My friends and I had a fantastic time. Service was good and fast. Menu had decent options to choose from and food was yummy! And yes, Guava mimosa was really awesome!!

GLNOyQrfpfaF3clI9To2Gw.text: I've been here twice and both times the food was FANTASTIC!!! Build Your Own Bloody Mary bar is on point too. Only downside is the service is a little slow at times, but not to the point where it would keep me from coming back.   I've had the salmon benedict, the stuffed french toast, a build your own omelet with crab, and the ranchero hash. Nothing bad to say about any of the dishes. Portions on most things are on the large side, so come hungry or prepared to take leftovers home. Or just roll your stuffed self out of the building.

ZlGfn7pdU0Q9YW_kTdlCEg.text: Bloody Mary Bar!!!!! Fantastic Bloody Mary Bar!!!! And the food isn't bad either!  we love all the choices given at the make your own Bloody Mary bar. The chicken and waffles are our favorite!!!! This is a must do every time we're in town.

N-_qdo-bLBrGFq3ct41y0g.text: We only stop by here if we are really hungry after the gym that's close by. There's usually only a 10-15min wait on a Sat but there's no reason to make it uncomfortable to eat your breakfast. If your table has a white drape over it, it's one of the cheap folding ones that they bought so they can seat more people. The legs of the chair stops you from pushing in your chair and if you're wearing a dress, you'll have to sit with your legs to the side. I couldn't back up my chair either since I was already backed up into the wall. Other people at my table was backed up to the people next to us. Food is good but service (slow) and accommodation really lacks here. Everyone that sits on the outside was getting hit by other customers and workers as they walk by.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is how they will squeeze customers together. Added tables in the walkway.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You&#39;re squeezed in between the wall and table to the point where you can&#39;t even move the chair.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My chair was backed up into the wall and right into the metal folding leg of the table. Couldn&#39;t move the chair in or out.

Nt6ych1A-3hl8vDgQD1IAA.text: Patrick was an awesome and informative waiter . Food was great Bloody Mary bar was fun for our group of girls visiting from out of state . Would definitely recommend and repeat. Loved the free parking and excellent customer service he also didn't mind taking our picture!  . I got bacon vodka and for someone who isn't really a bloody Mary person it was delicious. Liked that guests have a choice of indoor, outdoor and/ or  bar seating . Thanks so much!!! Xo

aHdKPEbcB7Op7cnjRUqp2g.text: My husband and I so enjoy their yummy breakfast and they make outstanding bloody Mary's.  if you go on a Saturday there's a fun energy. Lunch is just as delightful.

ZlWgq54-D6ExqahDzOsDeQ.text: This restaurant has a great atmosphere and an excellent brunch menu. We tried the Lump Crab and Sweet Potato Hash, which was not my favorite but an interesting mix of flavor and definitely worth trying, and the encrusted coconut and almond French toast, which was a must-have for any sweet tooth. Although we didn't try the Bloody Mary bar, it looked impressive. All in all, a solid Scottsdale brunch option.

wJ9EMNsfJg_lYpbqqrhyXA.text: We picked this place based on the reviews and it was certainly a winner!!  The bloody Mary bar is impressive and delicious! Smoked bacon salt rim? Yes! Fresh infused vodkas??  Yes yes!    The carnitas hash was amazing. Perfect home made corn tortillas, fresh zesty sauce and perfectly cooked potatoes.  We also shared the lemon ricotta pancakes.  Sweet lemony flavor with just enough tartness and the ricotta made them fluffy and creamy inside. I can't think of anything they could do better.    The staff was nice, knowledgeable and helpful. A perfect meal!!

-8mKvH5UKasO8LrHJsUKEQ.text: This place is great for breakfast. The food is awesome and the staff is wonderful. Really glad we found this place! Service was quick and prices are what you would expect in Scottsdale, however pretty reasonable. We will definitely be stopping in here again for breakfast

gcmL_TKk_1u87-lZfzngBA.text: Jessi, Bonnie, Linda: You guys are awesome, I enjoyed my brunch moment with my friends from out of town. I will definitely be back. The food was awesome, the mimosas are to die for.  Overall, A+ experience!

D4hxr-qtuHeZrCEsyFzshA.text: Came on a Sunday around 11:30.  Very lively atmosphere with a DJ, which I liked.  Unfortunately the wait was really long (over an hour).   I wouldn't mind it if we could get our name on the list before we left the house, but I called ahead and they don't allow that.  So, we had to stand outside most of that time because there is not room inside or at the bar.  Really cool Bloody Mary bar, if you are into that.   Lots of things you can add like sausage sticks, meatballs, ravioli, eggs, olives, etc.  If you prefer mimosas, they have a mimosa flight.  Good size mimosas (4 of them) for $16.  Not a bad deal since they are $6 each if bought individually.  I ordered the guava, which was very good.  For food, I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were delicious, probably best pancakes I've ever had.  I would probably order those again if I come back (that is if the wait is ever less than hour or they start taking reservations).

__ObIeiuMElMyBFqJrn1TA.text: So, there are a few good and bad things about this place.  Pros:  -Thethe bloody Mary bar is legit. Had lots of toppings.  -The presentation of the food looks really good.  Cons: -The the food taste was, ok at best. We had 8 people, and 1 person said it was great, 1 said it was good, 1 said it was bad, 5 said it was OK. -Wait time longer than normal breakfast places. -Slightly high price for breakfast  We also waited 1 hour 10 minutes when they said it would be 25-30 min wait. This was on Sunday July 31 around 11 ish.  A couple things we ordered weren't as described in the menu, but not a huge deal.   I had the steak eggs Benedict, the steak was good, flavor of the rest was ok, and the eggs were not runny, yolk was hard.   So overall, this place has great potential!!  But for the price and wait and expectation, not there yet. One day when it gets better we'll return.

KFtok07M3TubqGgX6zv4rQ.text: What a fun atmosphere!  Sunday morning breakfast - music going at 10am.   Upbeat and energy...it's clear people working here really like their job.    Bloody Mary Bar - can be intimidating, but absolutely do it!   Anything you can think of for a BM and they walk you through it.    Split the huevos rancheros hash with my girl.  Great dish!  So much food we didn't even finish it!

ylM58T4SlOoMC38r0FOmhg.text: I went to The Hash Kitchen and got the AZ Breakfast Week for $15. I got the Ranchero Hash with a peach mimosa, and a cannoli donut for dessert. I loved the atmosphere! I will for sure come back for brunch. There was even a DJ!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own bloody bar. I got jalepeno vodka. They even had fresh meatballs!

5hY2LKuSuBAAiRbznXulgw.text: The best brunch place I've been to! The menu has a great variety and everything we tried was delicious. Staff is friendly and our waiter was pretty funny. To top it all off, the prices are very reasonable especially for the quality! We will definitely be coming back here whenever we're in Scottsdale.

Yuj75m4Lk_VtmN9lfieusw.text: One of the best all around breakfasts we've ever experienced. From the upmost quality of food to even better service from all the staff.  Hands down the most amazing chicken and waffles in Scottsdale! That is of course followed by the amazing Bloody Mary bar. Would recommend anyone go here that is looking to have a great meal along with amazing service.

tFRZiavJivZ7yXwpfRedDA.text: Everything about this place was amazing! Went on a Saturday morning and there was absolutely no wait! My friend and I both started with mimosas. The majority of it was champagne so no complaints here! I had the herb fried chicken and waffles which was honestly the best chicken and waffles I've had in my life. My friend had the corn beef hash with her eggs scrambled and she loved it! There was also a live dj playing all the jams to get us in the proper brunching mood! Overall great experience and we'll definitely be coming back!

_u5Tu3SXWL3u5dpjCUZJZQ.text: this is my first time here at hash kitchen off scottsdale road & everything about it from the food to the service was exceptional! my friend & i sat at the bar, our bartender Lona was enthusiastic, on top of everything & was extremely personable! John, the manager, came & introduced himself to us, engaged in conversation& made sure our food came out good (of course it did) he was also helping the staff throughout the duration of our meal; running food, bussing tables, etc. Jonny the kitchen manager did an amazing job with our food, too! 10/10! we will be back to see Lona she's here Wednesday-Sunday!

Hk2AvW8i7EbfiaNLUZs7dw.text: This place was delicious! And the service was incredible, everyone was so nice and made us feel welcomed

hpardcY-Snc8TxjK7p0ONw.text: If you're looking for a brunch party atmosphere outside of Old Town, I think The Hash Kitchen is as close as it gets.  There's a Bloody Mary bar and different flavors of Mimosas, plus a DJ that starts playing Saturday and Sundays at 10 AM.  If you're not looking for that kind of atmosphere, I would advise you go to Breakfast before 10 AM on the weekends.    Service is good, and the food is good, too.  My wife got the Vegetable Scramble and wished there were more veggies, and I got the Smoked Sliced Brisket Hash and wished there was more brisket.    Whatever you're looking for, I don't think you'll be disappointed with The Hash Kitchen.  Enjoy!

t1aC-Y1rVBscdPC27UeQzw.text: Came here for my birthday brunch with 7 of my girlfriends. This place came highly recommended for their build your own Bloody Mary bar. The Bloody Mary bar did not disappoint. There was numerous garnishes and you get to choose your type of vodka or even tequila. Our server Patrick was attentive waiter and gave us tips for ordering. The menu was extensive & had a good mix of savory and sweet options. I will definitely be coming  back when in town again.

LFlmK5xoMNRhDtysf6FKwg.text: Had my wife's 40th birthday celebration at the location on Scottsdale Rd. Food and service were both awesome!

1FzFIYWtR-y7cbfpyMZZRQ.text: The staff was super friendly and the food was fantastic. Bonnie was an absolute gem and it was so nice that she complimented my hair (Lol) and my family. The whole place was alive with great music, happy people, and excellent food.

-Fs8Fw4KY87xA8bxkbUc-A.text: We went for a late breakfast on Friday and the service and food were fantastic. Bonnie and Evan were so helpful and the fried chicken Benedict was delicious. A new favorite breakfast place for us.

2kalAxPv5DA2R98bYhNAiA.text: This place is wonderful, the food and ambience was amazing. You must meet Ms. Bonnie, she is a joy to meet and talk to. Definitely worth visiting when in the Scottsdale area.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great food and even better owner. This place is a musts visit.

znGAc8VKNpZbrIMYAk1lww.text: Very busy place on a Sunday morning. The live dj was an interesting twist. The food was great and service was good. Would go back again, especially if it was closer to where I live.

82GNseoehVtwm-ifzypsQA.text: The legendary Bloody Mary is reason enough to go to The Hash Kitchen (THK), but it turns out that they serve up some awesome breakfast dishes too.  They also have a wall of fame with all the athletes and celebrities who ate here as well.  I rarely get Bloody Mary's, so I opted for the THK Bloody Mary instead of building my own.  The drink itself was spicy yet refreshing, and had a smoky flavor from bacon-infused vodka.  I enjoyed all the edible condiments: celery, bacon, pepperoni, pickles, and zucchini.  Perfect appetizers.  The sweet potato hash with lump crab meat came with two soft poached eggs and hollandaise sauce was outstanding.  My wife found it a bit rich but I like pairing egg with real crab meat.   Chicken and Waffles was another excellent dish, especially with fried leeks on top.  Waffles had bacon bits inside.  Chicken was breast only but had crispy breading and soft, juicy interior.  It rivals our previous favorite chicken and waffle at San Francisco's Bluestem Brasserie.  Solid 5 stars.  Hash Kitchen makes breakfast great again.  Perfect meal to fuel up for a day of hiking!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles with Fried Leeks
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet Potato Hash with Lump Crab Meat, Hollandaise Sauce, and Soft-Poached Eggs
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. THK Bloody Mary with bacon-infused vodka and condiments: bacon, pepperoni, olives, zucchini, and celery.

nrkjAZup0rpSd6uqjgedRQ.text: Great place good food and great service lona was a great server and we had a good time

Za92jNcVUEAK3hxzNwdQ0w.text: I decided to head in for brunch with a group of my friends and it was great! The mimosa flight was what intrigued to me to go and we got the orange, guava, mango, and raspberry. The orange and mango were my favorite! There were so good and great to share!   It got even better with the food! I ordered the breakfast sandwich with Texas toast and woah was it packed with flavor!   Tyler was our server and he was awesome! If you're ever looking for a great place to have breakfast and drinks this is your spot!

4yAHTZPmhYRlhZG-Uvh6pw.text: We tried this when it was still pretty new and it was packed! I love how they decorate the place and love the staff who are friendly and fast! The food though is not really that extraordinary to set it  part from other breakfast spots in the area and would not justify the higher price point. But then again, this could be a nice place for that nice start to a special day because the place is nicely decorated and a bit fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V16RT-hp4DAP3hHcnemmyQ.text: 8:31 - arrival. No line. But by the time we left 9:36, it was a maze trying to find the exit. The place is a nice modern twist to the good o' fashion brunch scene. The service was very fast and the menu options were simple. We got the carnitas hash, boring benedict, and classic French toast. The Benedict came with small cubes of potatoes. There's also a bit of cooked onions, tomatoes, and rosemary minced in which adds to a naturally sweet and herbal taste. The Benedict comes in two and is a decent serving. It stays True to its tradition - soft English muffins, Canadian bacon, and delicious poached eggs. There's the perfect amount of hollandaise spread throughout. It's enough to deliver a good Benedict experience. The carnitas hash is a very generous serving size for 1. It came with pulled pork, potatoes, bits of corn, avocados, sour cream, and two eggs. The dish also comes with two tortillas on the side. This was a good meal but for brunch, the carnitas hash was a bit heavy for my preference. The French toast came with powdered sugar, creamy soft butter for spread, and amazing reduced maple syrup. In general, the food wasn't bad and fairly average. The portions were spot on with some potential leftovers for later. For the price - the food experience, flavor, and texture was okay.

nbT_2baQfzC3bGYahCzioQ.text: We decided to try Hash Kitchen based on the reviews and it was close. We arrived at 9am on Saturday and were seated immediately since the place was only half full. The first thing we noticed is the restaurant is extra noisy and very loud. Not even to mention the loud music. The second thing we noticed is once they seat you, they forget about you for at least 10 minutes as you watch at least 10 employees walk around doing everything except service customers. The menu is eclectic with many interesting choices. I believe they have put too much emphasis on trying to have an edgy-cool restaurant/bar and should work on improving the food. We were a party of four, we each had some different, none of it was worth going back for. Especially when my Son ordered one of the Benedict's and there was a  large egg shell in his meal. No clue how one leaves egg shells in poached eggs. Also the poached eggs were cooked solid. This restaurant is more like a bar that serves breakfast. Loud, so-so food and very slow service.

y5myGQNeMe7Kd-CM57rYAw.text: This place is super busy on weekends but there is a good reason why! The food in phenomenal and the staff is so friendly!! Best advice...try the mimosa flight. It will change your life.

nnjL8JSF973XK_NYKIOVww.text: My husband and I visited Hash for breakfast in January. I enjoyed that food, service, and atmosphere. My husband got the avocado toast and it was impressive. He's a meat and potatoes kind of person and he was not disappointed. This was a huge portion loaded with toppings. For breakfast good quality coffee is important to me and at Hash it was spot on. The atmosphere was fun. I was visiting from out of town and now that I'm Back home I find myself wishing I could go to Hash for breakfast.

1ziE5i2n4uVIgG9qxQynUQ.text: Wait time was not bad at 9:00am, food was delicious and service was great!  Management very personable!  Love the Bloody Mary bar, just beware if they offer you the big Bloody Mary, it is $32.00 Pulled me in and I said sure without noticing the price until the check came!  A little pricey for a drink even if it is 32 ounces and you can add all kinds of garnish. Won't do that again!

ZgNkydhoFHh8zq2WmaN-MQ.text: My first time here and definitely will not be my last. It is a little on the expensive side but I think it's worth it. My man and I shared the biscuits and gravy which more than enough for the both of us. He did the Bloody Mary bar and added just about anything and everything he could find lol I did the Mimosa flight, so I got to try the different types of mimosas and I'm honestly not a fan of blueberries but that happened to be my favorite mimosa. We sat at the bar, our bartender/server was very nice and took good care of us. The Manager Damian (I believe that's what his name was) even came up to us to make sure we were doing good, when my Man mentioned it was our first time here he gave him his card and said next time we come in to let him know. Overall, I would recommend this place! Also good DJ!
