H70GQAxpqHYtOvyX8BeRow.text: The hash kitchen is a great place for breakfast, brunch or lunch. It was really busy but the wait wasn't too bad. I loved the music there it's like a morning party!!  Food was amazing really big portion and very special dishes !!!  I tried the french toast which was great! I would like to go back and try one of their hashes though because they looked A+ !!

3XA8cIwKEsCQmFdY--JiTw.text: Brunch is my favorite so I'm willing to wait for a table. Most places are usually very busy in the mornings so it was no surprise that there was a 40 minute wait on a Sunday at The Hash Kitchen. It was almost exactly 40 minutes later that my friend and I got a table. We were seated in a little booth and our server came by to get our order shortly after.  I got a Mango Mimosa & the Herb Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and my friend got the Herb Fried Chicken Hash. They were essentially the same dish put together in a different way, but the flavors were absolutely on point! I really enjoyed how crispy the fried chicken was and how well it went with the fried leeks and hollandaise sauce. The surprise was the maple reduction which enhanced/complimented all the other flavors really well!  I would definitely suggest going early or being prepared to wait for a table. If you have to wait, the good news is that they have a pretty impressive looking build your own Bloody Mary bar as well as a few different mimosa flavors to pick from ... more than I have seen at other restaurants. The food though, in my opinion, is definite worth the wait!

JmpXvUISWUlI8QYfa1UjeA.text: Love Hash Kitchen! The best lemon ricotta pancakes in town. BloodyMary bar is awesome. Good food, wide menu, and clean restaurant.

15Y6y-Mq66saw_tmE8_gsQ.text: The food was amazing and the server Colton was helpful and really on the ball, music right on tempo and not to loud and this was the second time here and actually get to eat here and the service was nice and really good vibe.

Ax71q4frbzqriaQnDpK6yQ.text: I stand corrected! Last weekend, I go the veggie scramble and swapped the eggs for hash. It was delicious. The potatoes and the variety of vegetables mixes perfectly together. I can't wait to get this again. Hash Kitchen is a fun and lively spot to catch up with friends and grab a yummy bite. :)

pUXilaNfXXps1EmT8IUpNg.text: A snapshot of a summer Sunday at Hash Kitchen: Bloody Mary's and mimosas EVERYWHERE, a REAL LIVE DJ bumpin' Despacito, and herds of well-tanned suburban families waiting for their chance to be called for a table...  Hash Kitchen was confusing, yet wonderful. It's clear that this place has the brunch game down PAT.  (+) REASONABLY-PRICED, AESTHETICALLY-PLEASING DRINKS At $16, the Mimosa Flight is pretty freaking worth it considering you get 4 full-sized mimosas to try. My friends were fans of the grapefruit mimosa!  (++) THE CARNITAS HASH HUUUUGE TASTY portion that I could not manage to finish despite my greatest efforts! The way the hash mixed with the carnitas and sweet corn, topped with an egg and some avocado....SO. UNREAL. I would come back for this dish alone.   Why not 5 stars? I wasn't crazy about the Lump Crab & Sweet Potato Hash - the portion was smaller than the other hashes and not NEARLY as flavorful as the Carnitas. The service was very attentive, but a bit slow. The time from arriving to actually paying the bill for my group of 6 girls was about 2.5-3 hours....so don't come on a time crunch!  Overall, I would TOTALLY come back, I could seriously eat that Carnitas Hash everyday!!

qYcLKMqZosCCSjhfnONo6Q.text: Our group of 10 was looking forward to  brunch at Hash Kitchen after it had been recommended by friends. We were in Scottsdale celebrating and had flown in from all over the country and wanted to catch up over brunch.   When we arrived for our 10:30 reservation, the hostess told us rudely and flippantly that there was no reservation. After much back and forth, they continued to say the mistake was on my end. I had been planning this trip for weeks and since brunch was going to be a big event during the weekend, I am absolutely certain that I had made a reservation for 10 at that location.   The staff was extremely rude, unhelpful and dismissive. They did absolutely nothing to try to remedy the situation- they didn't even offer to put our name on the wait list. The reservation "system" was a paper list and since I had called weeks in advance, it must have been an error on their end. Our group ended up stranded in a strip mall with no where to take our large party for a fun meal together.  Update: The owner did reach out to try to determine what went wrong and make the situation better. Unfortunately, there isn't much to be done after the fact but the follow up is much appreciated!

RymTB0Y95wGGnYCBkkiWmQ.text: I love this place!!! Ordered food to pick up for a week straight! Wasn't disappointed once!

wc7aWJX-NGugpl3sbmeIdQ.text: Usually I'm impatient and leave restaurants if they have a long wait, however I knew I wanted to stay here when I saw that Bloody Mary bar! The owner, Bonnie, and my mom hit it off when we walked in the door and she was so friendly. We went on a Sunday afternoon, there was a DJ and groups of people that were boozin. Our server was awesome and recommended to try Cristina's tamale cakes. It was one of the best meals I've had and my mom had the chicken & waffles. I love how fun the environment is and how tasty the food was :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cristina&#39;s tamale cakes (10/10)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cristina&#39;s tamale cakes (10/10)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My mom said this is the best chicken &amp; waffles she has had

Jl9VZGiRgDjQyuFphA3N3Q.text: Just love this place!! Always great service with a smile and perfect service.  Food is yummy and the music is great on a Sunday !! I highly recommend!! I've been there over 5 tiimes and each time has been great!!

aFRHYZ1A7FHytYaZpSn5Zw.text: Hash Kitchen was great! Brunch was so much fun with the live DJ. I even was lucky enough to get to dance with the owner! Loved the Bloody Mary bar, such a fun experience and the drink was amazing.   My main critique would be the food. Several dishes I asked for were unable to be served due to lack of ingredients / inventory. Kind of a bummer. And the good I did get to eat was average.   Overall great experience.

Q00_jirYWq787cufz00Khw.text: Just visiting Scottsdale for the weekend and had the best brunch food at Hash Kitchen. Lona was an amazing server who made the experience that much sweeter!

KeY1sAQ5Zb62DquE5D9U2A.text: I believe in giving second chances especially if the other party makes every effort to win you back as a customer. In this case, Hash Kitchen made every effort to make me a fan and they succeeded.   I was invited back by the owner and I brought along my hubby and in laws. I ordered the cannoli donuts and lump crab hash. Hubby ordered the huevos ranchero hash. My mother in law took advantage of the build your own Bloody Mary and she loved it!! Father in law ordered the American scrambler. The result? We chowed down and enjoyed every bite! The in laws were raving about the taste of the food and the concept. It was by far a different experience than my first.   At the end of our meal, the owner gave us complimentary cannoli donuts even though I already ordered some. It didn't matter because my family slurped it up like it was soup. The only negative thing I can say is that when we placed our order, it took awhile to get our food (20+ minutes), but after we were done eating - my mother in law said, "the food was worth the wait!"   They all give Hash Kitchen five stars and so I will too!

c8EoUsiqPUenlXnkaSGmSg.text: According to them their ratings on their door this is Phoenix finest and this is one of the top restaurants for breakfast. I ordered the eggs Benedict they had no substitution for their potatoes which have bell peppers in it and I'm highly allergic to bell pepper. The alternative was a biscuit a cup of fruit or toast. As the pictures are shown this is what I received and paid $16 for. This place was extremely loud looks like their main thing is there bloody Mary bar if that's what you're into looks like a pretty good place. The staff was friendly and was embarrassed of what they serve me for the value which is absolutely not the staffs fault, staff did a good job. But if this is the finest we have in the area for breakfast Arizona's in trouble.

JFR1PPGeNhypCVPAnh08VA.text: First time to Hash Kitchen and it did not go well... the waiter spilled my mimosa right onto my iPhone and then told me "at least it's water proof" he didn't do anything to help clean up and we were left with the wet napkins and garnish sitting on the table. After a while I went and asked if we could get someone to come take away the soaked napkins the manager came to remove them. She said she would give me her card in case anything went wrong with my phone but then never reappeared. All in all poor customer service, they didn't even comp the spilt drink or properly apologised. I guess they aren't worried about customer service at all...

Bam142jaGMycAHm8TqgBAA.text: Frittatas are good but eggs and bacon was child sized portion. Was hungry afterwards and I am a petite woman so not sure if this was just a one off but left hungry... ugh.

siFYWwj_zn5pWzwS9B31YQ.text: The Bloody Mary Bar here is so awesome! Soooooo many options. The staff is pretty good about keeping it stocked up too. They have a live DJ every Sunday morning, it's the best place to start off a perfect Sunday Funday.

Tm9JrmBIN5A-cFNvTSpcmQ.text: If you are looking for your standard, American breakfast, go somewhere else.  If you're looking to run it off the rails and have something totally different, this is the place!  Food was great with very healthy portions.  The only downside was the annoying music, geared more for a college-aged crowd, than the mixed bag that was there on this day.  We would definitely come back -with ear buds if the same music selection was cued up!

lp5zszG49hfKyRJDR1kR1A.text: The owner is amazing! So full of life and just pure fun. The food was excellent and full of flavor. We were happy to find huge portions of delicious food that we could share. We planned on going to Snooze but it was packed so we found this on Yelp and decided to give it a try and we most certainly were not disappointed.

ZqFnkKhP6XGkKULoCwD13g.text: We went yesterday (Sunday). I could hear music from the parking lot. We were sat immediately. The music was a little loud. I just pointed to my coffee cup to our waitress. I heard the next table over comment about the music. He said he loved the food there but had never heard the music that loud. Ok, so the music was loud. We were visiting from the east coast and i had never seen a bloody mary bar. I did not have one but it looked fresh and awesome. The food came out quick and was deelishious. I would go back again. Maybe on a weekday

rNSxNjoZAAyoJm77Qsmzww.text: The food was excellent. Bloody Mary bar was unbelievable. My only problem was they had a DJ and it was too loud so if you're with friends it was hard to have a conversation. It was noisy enough without the DJ. The service was very good. Our waiter was very attentive.

YeSU8jEjADhKoEszOPvg1Q.text: I ordered a hash and wanted it exactly as the menu says, which means poached eggs, yet the waitress decided that over medium is popular and I'd probably like that better. I didn't, it was dry and not what I expected. She said sorry, I guess I should have checked, took a very long time to bring our check so I thought maybe she was adjusting it. Nope, just being inconsiderate once again. We won't be back.

ORjyd_Fi-JgMbcSOWAZHow.text: Excellent Brunch! Ambiance, service and food all wonderful.....the Bloody Mary Bar is one of a kind and worth the trek by itself....!

2H0_kTgzfpIE6DGCY3g17w.text: I loved the hyped up environment. The Bloody Mary bar looked tasty until I got it I am pretty sure it was the flavor I choose because everyone else was enjoying there's. We were super excited to try out their unique menu and ordered two plates each. However, once we got the actual plates the food was not too flavorful and pretty bland. So disappointed because the place is fun to be around. Maybe we were there in a bad timing, because all of the reviews say otherwise.

zQDTZZJJDu2RXDd3i8k7Yw.text: We are still at our table and I couldn't wait to post this review. This is such a great place from the food to the atmosphere. Our waiter, jesus, was helpful with recommendations and attentive even though the restaurant was super busy. The general manager, Linda, was very warm and professional. We enjoyed our quick conversation and really felt she cared about our experience.  We never felt rushed and nobody seemed to mind that we split our breakfast entree.....which brings me to the food. Oh my gosh, the coconut almond French toast was amazing!!!  Everything around us looked delicious too and I can't wait to come back to try the bloody Mary bar!!! Wow!

-mYmRVKgICUeEZKvlF8Jfw.text: Today I had the Nutella and banana french toast. ...awesome. Great flavor! My wife had the crab benny again, it  is soooo friggin good! No pics today, we attacked our food so fast! Lol.  I keep forgetting to mention, the kids meals are really big and tasty and only five bucks! Choc chip pancakes, scrambled eggs, grill cheese panini, fresh homemade chicken tenders, etc.. The kids love the food and we love the fact that the kids meals are thoughtfully prepared. Most place don't take the time or effort to make good kid's meals!  See my original review below!

NPzufCoeCpFDK5dUHYM2Uw.text: Our favorite meal of the trip! Our server, Dani, was awesome!! And the Bloody Mary bar is one of a kind

4mYgRhzyiYJ4WOqE8A5XxQ.text: We've been here twice when down in Scottsdale visiting family, and, I have to say, it's the closest I've found to a proper Wisco Bloody Mary in AZ. The MYO Bloody Mary bar isn't cheap at $11, but you can choose from about six house-infused vodkas, and three mixes, and then there's a garnish bar of literally 30 items from olives and limes, to cactus and pickled eggs, to bacon and smoked cheese. The only thing missing is the de rigueur beer chaser, which our server was surprised to hear is a thing in WI.  Oh, and the food menu is great, too. Overwhelming, with too many good choices, but that's an okay problem to have. Service has always been attentive, genuine and friendly. Don't go on a Sunday if you don't have the patience to wait for quite a while. Weekdays are much quieter. Great spot, though. We'll be back!

2Oe-JA4BOqE9wuGMcaKdDA.text: First time to come here.  Our server Amie was excellent in helping us making our selections.  Loved the Bloody Mary bar and the Mimosa Flights.  Food was excellent as well as the service.  We will be back!

Pl8sZl1uoHVYum7_rjZiaA.text: My first time at this location for Father's Day Brunch and the setting is very open and comfortable.  The staff is both attentive and personable.  Superior service consciousness and clearly efficient.  The Hash Kitchen dishes are creative, filling and delicious.  The Bloody Mary bar is off the chain as well as the their offering of fruity mimosas.  Clearly, a satisfying experience for me and my son.  Kudos...

IIRVcHTc0rQzfaN3SfyXIA.text: Love this place!!! Evan took great care of us and gave us some excellent recommendations! Food was delicious!

PCtQkSp3HXx6q8Y2OS7OcQ.text: My husband and I came here based on the other reviews and it did not disappoint! The bloody mary bar was excellent and the food was terrific. Our server, Lona, was also great. Extremely friendly and helpful.

5Nm_uh5LVlOkPXv14jCKhQ.text: Delicious every time! The chicken and leek hash bowl is sinfully sublime! Sunday morning brunch vibes are best in Scottsdale.

gy11jl3kSe_dHwL22KHu4Q.text: 3 words...BLOODY MARY BAR! That's really all you need to know! This is by far the best Bloody Mary bar (and Bloody Mary) you'll ever see or have. I could easily stop here but I'd totally be remiss if I didn't at least mention the amazing food and super friendly owner and staff. So if you arrive and it's packed, don't worry, the Bloody Mary bar will hold you over. Besides, it's worth the wait!

r1TPxw70jeGV8f6xLKM-1g.text: I've never been to such an innovative restaurant! Everything on the menu sounded delicious. I opted for the s'mores french toast and it was to die for. Ask for Lona, she made the experience that much more perfect!

Qd2lTRLT9hluAh41AmnflA.text: When I first got there it looked like any other place but then when you walk in and you see some older lady shaking her money maker well!!??  The Dj was great,I had the breakfast lasagna and it was terrific and thr bloody Mary bar was very good! Would definitely go there again!

-1jTXzARgpbYlXsq-kMemg.text: I love the environment and food at this place. Has a full build your own Bloody Mary bar with awesome options. This place is a breakfast must, but we ordered from the lunch menu as well and their salads are amazing. Bonnie came to our table and was so sweet and welcoming, making sure we had what we needed. I am very happy that I chose this restaurant (after multiple recommendations from friends) during my trip in Arizona!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loving my flight of mimosas! My favorite was Guava but all were amazing ! Great presentation and well worth it!

62BN1ITVGu1MhMgetLyfug.text: It's Adrian!!!!!  Not Andre. Adrian makes the best Bloodys and is a fabulous bartender!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best ever Bloody Mary bar! Go see Bonnie, the best hostess eva, Adrian for an amazing Bloody, and Chef Daniel for awesome food!

DbbOeF0-ZDroXlQM4Xi5zQ.text: I ate with my family this afternoon and it was wonderful! Everyone was super friendly and the food was delicious!! Reasonable wait time for as busy as it is on a weekend. Can't wait to go back and try more pancakes!

v5gc7StagokP3AwMuSAG6g.text: I'd go between a 4-5... Making it a 4.5!  The Bloody Mary bar is amazing and is a must do if you like Bloody Mary's. You can top it with all sorts of goodies and they have their own infused vodkas to give your drink that extra kick! Jalapeno lime was my choice and it was amazing and spicy.   Once you're done there, enjoy them while you get your food. The chicken and waffles are delicious. The waffle is perfect. Crispy and fluffy and flavorful. Be aware that they are topped with a lot of fried leeks (which I loved) but my BF could've gone with a little less. Which is totally ok cause then I got to eat what he didn't want. I ended up adding the leeks to my Mexican scramble because my scramble was just alright. Just imagine eggs with a mix of whatever you decided to order. I felt like it needed a little something more but next time, I'd do the crab scramble or the benedicts instead. The potatoes have great flavor and I'm torn between the flavor and then not being traditional fried breakfast potatoes. The biscuit was good but almost needed some extra butter or something. Not as moist and flaky as that perfect biscuit.   Overall, we loved it there and would definitely go back. We plan to go back in March during spring training!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Digging into the Mexican scramble. Ok.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $10 Bloody Mary concoction. Yum!

VqAGs8ghYmNl5Xwa7FhvqQ.text: What an amazing breakfast!  The service level was 5 Star and it was New Year's Eve!!!  Thank you Amy!

NcJv9w3gjdhAP7Z9SwtUzA.text: Excellent! Somehow I didn't expect them to have the full Bloody Mary bar open on a weekday but I was pleasantly surprised! I chose the jalapeno vodka and bacon salt rimmed glass which won me over even before I added on a plethora of goodies. I also ordered the lamb hash, great quality and quantity of lamb! My guest ordered the guava mimosa said it was amazing as well! I will be back again!!!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb hash

5v-6IRCDbMqDdiqKVc6NlQ.text: I sooo wanted to love this place as I dropped by a couple of times previous to my first visit and the wait was too long for me. The staff was fine and the atmosphere was nice but my experience was just average. The food was beige. The Bloody Mary bar was a bit over the top but fun all the same. I wish the food had a bit more freshness and flavor. I might try again someday.

5OiGAf4vFrwgtjXBZrppXw.text: You must try the Hash Kitchen...This is the best breakfast place in town!  I've gone back three weekends in a row. Normally, I stick with the same menu item when I find a good thing, but I have tried something different every time. There is something here for everyone, from healthy to decadent. Try the Salmon Benedict, one of the Hash Skillets or the Waffles! You really can't go wrong, everything I've tried is amazing and they have the best biscuits I've ever had! They even have French Press coffee. I can't wait to try their lunch. I saw a Chinese chicken salad go by that looked to die for. The Hash Kitchen does not disappoint and the staff and service was second to none! Exceptional all around!

3tWyA7kaKKELRoL8uz0RLQ.text: I so wanted to like this place because it's close to my house but I unfortunately don't think I will be back. Maybe the big draw of this place is the bloody mary bar, but I went for the food and was pretty disappointed. I woke up craving a biscuit, punched biscuit into Yelp and thought I would try something new and check out this place. I ordered the eggs benedict which consists of a biscuit, hollandaise, ham, and poached eggs of course. It comes with a side of hash. The hollandaise was good and the egg was cooked perfectly, unfortunately, that was not enough to earn a good review. The hash had no crisp or crunch, it was all soft potatoes, and it came with bell peppers, which is not indicated on the menu anywhere. I have a bell pepper allergy, so automatically, I could not eat more than a few bites of my hash. I'm not going to dock points for that, because to be fair, I could have asked. However, I don't really know anywhere else where bell pepper is a standard hash ingredient. If you call yourself "The Hash Kitchen", you should have an out of this world hash with texture and bold flavor. Then, the biscuit was sweet and dense. I had been expecting something fluffy and savory, but it was really more like a scone which was kind of strange with all of the lovely savory flavors of the benedict. To be honest, I felt like McDonald's does a better biscuit, and that's a little sad. The service was excellent and the location was adorable, but I can't justify spending the money on really sub-par food. I shouldn't be left wishing I had gone to a fast food joint instead. It's a new place, so hopefully some changes will be made. I think they could really benefit from changing their flavor profiles up a bit, many of the menu items were basically the same thing with just one small difference. Also on Saturday and Sunday they have a DJ starting at 10 AM. Maybe they didn't realize they were in a residential area, not the Old Town bar scene?  I think the restaurant just missed the mark all around, which is too bad, that complex would really benefit from a delicious breakfast spot.

5BiSjEEO0_P66rPj2GKWcw.text: the food is good and the various egg alternatives make this place a great choice for breakfast.

p5MoQ6aSLTnGLrabfGQnXQ.text: Very friendly and great staff. One of the best Bloody Mary bar's I've seen and very good breakfast. Would definitely recommend it to anyone

DIQFR1aL9YJ99HfbsXiP2A.text: Great service. Very warm in the restaurant. The only complaint I have is that the 'warm biscuit' that they serve with the meal was cold and rock hard. I had to ask for some jam to put on it and no butter was offered. Other than that, the food was excellent and came out hot. The Italian coffee is wonderful. Looked over the Bloody Mary bar and WOW, certain family members and friends are going to love it!

jImN535jRPqd2AXAdejIKw.text: Outstanding service, make your own bloody mary bar is way cool, large food portions, neat breakfast experience.

6KWq_42JzAVE8hU_2k6vDQ.text: In town for vacation.  Good French Press Coffee, nice scrambler, ok hash browns.

2oax-UArb2s9erZyq-wz6A.text: Good breakfast, had the fried chicken & waffles

p7OK8oLEE91pbkA5Yi4wKw.text: Wow!  We were treated so rudely by the hostess that we will never return. It was a Sunday and 2 hostesses were working.  It was the woman with the gray hair and black and white striped top.  We came in and were not greeted nicely, but told that there was a wait unless we wanted to sit at the bar.  We were happy to wait, standing patiently and quietly, looking over the menu.  After about 15 minutes the hostess approached us and said it would be another 15 minutes at least, and was not very nice about it.  There was a table set and unoccupied since we arrived, and several others waiting to be bussed.  There are lots of places to eat in Scottsdale, and if the first person you encounter in the restaurant acts like she doesn't care if you eat there or not, my feet (and recommendations to others) will patronize other establishments.

zdGMvRHKh1wb14KQfnHuVA.text: An absolute must! I am a big breakfast fan. Definitely a threat to all breakfast restaurants in Scottsdale. Lemon ricotta pancakes hit it right on the mark. Hot with a wonderful light and citrus flavor. I love Butterfields (biggest reason is the speed of the food) but they matched it here but with more of an upscale flair. Leo (my server) was great. You're missing out if you don't try this place. Prices are more than reasonable.

bvaoXgP5P2Z15N56g56SOw.text: Now this is an excellent breakfast. Great selection of delicious breakfast items. Very good service. Beautiful Bloody Mary bar.  A little pricey but what do you expect in Scottsdale. Highly recommended. Will be back on my next trip to Scottsdale.

B_nrERIkcC7hBsm_iph5LQ.text: Very disappointing!  We needed to ask for coffee refills, oatmeal served without milk, hash was subpar.  Server acted as though he wanted to be somewhere else.  Never again.  We also felt the same after one try of the fish restaurant they had before.

CsyIzy3KuJvEzOmWDxjLoA.text: Love this place! Bloody Mary bar is fantastic and my favorite. So many great items on the menu, I wanted to eat everything .

nwNBqNi3JgYF9YSmthXuug.text: What a great place.  We had a group of 20 and they served us without a hitch.  On top of that, the food and most importantly the Bloody Mary bar are to die for.  My wife and I had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and the Smoked Brisket and Corn Bread Hash.  They were both excellent.  The only thing that might be questioned were the fresh made cake donuts which were good but a little gooey.  They were good for me but some folks might not like them.  Other than that, everything else was great.  Keep up the great work.

k6-qyG5eecIHqpoCRdgejA.text: Awesome food , great service , I will come back most definitely . Try the breakfast burger , was to die for .

RoAaxqIJ3xgO-ryvyat7fA.text: Great service awsome food. The atmosphere was very warm and welcoming.  The Bloody Mary bar was unbelievable kudos to the staff and our waiter it was an unbelievable experience we had a group of 20 for are annual retreat and they went over and beyond to make us comfortable very accommodating for are party. Thank you for such a great experience.

uF5BghZcu7nxpTOxzl6mGQ.text: I was really wanting this place to be fantastic...but it wasn't. To start, we had to wait at least 30 minutes to be seated because they don't usually have seating for 6 people. Apparently they only cater to parties of 4 or less. Once seated it took another ten minutes for a waitress to come over and take drink orders. Then another 15 minutes to come over for our breakfast order. Then at least another 35 minutes to get our food. The restaurant was only 1/2 full. Once our food arrived, water glasses were not regularly filled, no one asked if we wanted another overpriced mimosa, or a coffee refill. After asking what happened to our food, a manager buzzed by asking if everything was okay, but not in a way that seemed to indicate he actually cared what our answer might be. The food was okay. Highlights were the chicken and waffle, and the yogurt parfait. The almond and coconut covered Frenzy ch toast was tasty but came with some nasty bananas. The Belgian waffles were pretuty heavy. The corn beef hash was not worth going back for. The sides of hash browns not that thrilling, either. So, they did a nice job renovating the place but it will not be there that long with such uneven service and fairly mediocre food. The Bloody Mary bar looked pretty great, but I don't think a restaraunt can really depend on that to keep the customers coming back.

s30RvH9XfiaHOXg1xu5xfw.text: Very clean organized place, the food was so good we ordered so much and everything was great. The cannoli pancakes, frittata, hashes looked amazing and tasted the same!!!!!! The server Jesus was so nice and helpful would come back again!!! Also recommend the vegetarian scrambler

WMfNnuuuRtMuyUEhqlGRXQ.text: With such great reviews, I was excited to try this place but left utterly dissatisfied.   We were seated on what seemed to be a slow day and had to wait a few minutes before we were even attended to with just water. When asked if we wanted something else to drink we said fresh squeezed orange juice, which they happened to be out of. Unsure of when the server would get back to our table and to avoid waiting any longer, we decided to order right then. We ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and the Huevos Rancheros THK Hash.   The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes came out smelling of lemon and sweetness. With that scent wafting towards our noses, we got really excited to eat. However, while it smelt so good the lemon flavour seemed more for show than for taste, as it was nonexistent whilst eating the pancakes. I love a good ricotta hotcake and this just tasted like a regular, below average pancake lacking serious flavour and very inconsistent - the first pancake was overcooked and dried whereas the second was chewy. Also, the maple syrup was not warmed it had been cooked because when you pulled it up it formed fine toffee strings, like spiderwebs which indicates it had been cooked.   The Huevos Rancheros THK Hash had the ever so slightest kick on some, not every, bite and was lacking in True Mexican flavour. The black beans seemed to be dried out and tasted of cardboard and there was an overabundance of red sauce poured over the meal.   Based on my experience, I would be reluctant to recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Overcooked, not warmed maple syrup. These strings trailed everywhere our forks went.

cE4eYVSBRO0zVpNFyliB7w.text: The customer service and friendly staff make this place great, and the food makes this place spectacular!!! Bonnie greeted my family and I as if we were at her home, exceptional service!! The buttermilk pancakes were so delicious I can't wait to try the lemon ricotta pancakes! I will definitely be back!

x08FxE2_OYw5KcdTHGsCSg.text: Food is delicious, service is incredible.  Tony knows what he is talking about and did a stellar job!  Second time in, and we will be back.  Don't skip out on the bloody mary!

vFDgVqse1WMKOw_e2pEyNw.text: I rarely write reviews of businesses - especially negative ones but today my husband and I had one of the most horrific experiences we have ever had and I am compelled to share this with anyone (especially the owner if he bothers to read reviews about his business or cares how his customers are treated!) who is considering dining at the Hash Kitchen.  I feel so strongly about the rude, embarrassing treatment we received from the General manager Linda and the owner, that I will be re-sharing this post on every social media outlet that I can to warn people about this restaurant!!!  In fact, this is probably the worst review of any restaurant I have EVER written!  I am 62 years old and my husband is 66.  We both travel extensively for business and in over 30 years of eating in hundreds of restaurants around the country, have NEVER been treated so rudely!  Please note this was not our first visit to this restaurant.  In fact, we live just a few blocks away and strongly believe in supporting our local businesses including this one!.  We are always very polite customers and typically grossly over tip and are not considered cheap or rude people.  This was probably our 15th visit to this restaurant and we have also referred other people to it!  The owner of the Hash Kitchen originally had another concept in this space named Cuttle Fish.  For reasons unknown, the Cuttle Fish concept never seemed to take hold and after a brief shutdown, re-opened as the Hash Kitchen.  They share the same kitchen with a little restaurant space owned by the same person, which was a hamburger restaurant and also has been re-opened as the Hogs & Hops BBQ.  So, here's how the story goes:  It is Sunday at 1:00.  The Hash Kitchen is busy but not on a wait list.  My husband and I decide to sit at the bar as we have often done.  We are given waters right away by the girl behind the bar (who we were later told is the bar back and her only job is to wash glasses) then we wait for 10 minutes before we finally get one of the bartenders to come over and take our drink order.  Ok, so this place has never been known for 5 star service but both bartenders have waited on us in the past and are are very polite and sweet girls.  When they bring us our drinks, we order our food.  Sounds ok so far right?  20 minutes later my waffle and bacon and my husbands scrambled eggs and sausage finally show up - again pretty slow - but we're not complaining!  Now this is where it gets interesting.  The young couple sitting next to us had ordered a side of pancakes but the food runner brought out a huge stack (full order) The couple said they didn't order a full stack and perhaps it was someone else's order.  The food runner says to them "so , you don't want them?" And they politely respond that they only wanted a side order.  The bartender comes back a few minutes later with the same stack of pancakes and apologizes for the confusion and tells them they will only be charged for a side order.    Now this is where the fun starts:  The couple strikes up a conversation with us - telling us that they live just a few blocks away and have been to the Hash Kitchen once before but the last time they were there, the service was extremely slow.  They said it didn't bother them because they knew it would probably be that way again but that the food was good so there they were.  My husband and I agreed with their statement and said that the servers probably should be better trained and that seemed to be a fundamental problem with most of the Restaurants that have been in that location  Linda, the GM came up behind me and asked if everything was ok.  I told her everything was fine and that's when she started harassing me saying "Then why was I talking so negatively about their restaurant and the owner?  And to stop talking  about them to their customers!"  I said I hadn't said anything about the owner other than he was the son of Thomaso and had owned other restaurants.   I told her my only complaint was the slow service but that our bartender had been very nice to us once we had her attention.  She called me a liar and said the staff heard me bad mouthing the restaurant and the owner and I was ruining the "Morale" of her people!!   Then she started in on my husband with her hands on the back of his chair, leaning over his shoulder.  He told her to please take a step back and take her hands off his chair.  Her response was 'It's not your chair.  It's our chair and we are going to tell you to leave"!!! So we finished our meal, paid our bill and started to leave but as we were walking out the door, the owner who had been waiting for us, accosted us as we were leaving, accusing us of "Talking smack" about him, trash talking, and screamed at us all the way to our car!  My advice to anyone reading this is DON"T GO THERE!!!  You can get a much better breakfast / brunch at the Twisted grove, the Vig, Butters or the Village Tavern where you will be treated with respect!

kzCiULVCd5fDEBxtlzrGJA.text: The owner, Bonnie, is fantastic!! She came up to our table and personally asked how our meal was and small talked with us! The bloody Mary's were FANTASTIC and the hash was phenomenal! My husband and I are from AL and the atmosphere felt just like home!

Granted I am a New Yorker with obnoxiously high standards, but having lived in Phoenix for the last 2 years I have had to adapt and evolve to the disgustingly poor expectation and execution of service in restaurants and bars in Phoenix.  However The Hash blows away the competition, hands down superb service!!!! 5 Stars!!!!

Boring Beni- Amazing Chicken & Waffle - Amazing  Chicken Beni- Amazing  Salmon Beni - Awesome but would probably do the Chicken Beni versus Salmon   Can't wait to go back!

_bW_NwQC6ph6Y6GP_iukpQ.text: Service was great! Lots of interesting dishes on the menu. Hard to choose. The hashes all looked good but lots of good. Had a Benedict with tamale cakes. Different flavor and good. And the biscuit that came with it was very good!

DDkAmf1r3pQLhoMxR17Rzw.text: This just became my favorite brunch place in Scottsdale! My kids and I met up with my wife during her staycation at this swanky, hip and trendy brunch place on a Sunday morning. When you first walk in, you were instantly treated to get the best bloody Mary bar in all of Arizona and a DJ spinning music to liven up in your experience. Bonnie not only greets you at the front, but makes you feel like one of the family. She is awesome, so friendly, and checks on you to make sure your meal experience is top notch. I had the herb chicken hash, my wife had the herb chicken and waffles, and the kids had a "healthy" stack of buttermilk pancakes to get through. The food was delicious, the portion sizes were well above average and the customer service was extremely good considering a busy Sunday morning. But best of all was the bloody Mary bar!!! Pretty much anything you could desire to be added to a bloody Mary including their own bacon infused vodka and bacon salt on the rim! What?!?! We just loved the atmosphere and will definitely be back again! The only thing keeping from giving 5 stars, just to be fair, was that some of our food came out cold. Probably due to how busy it was, but still. Friendly staff, great music and an excellent food make a great combination. And Bonnie dancing with my 1-yr old daughter to cap off the meal was priceless! See you guys next time.

iYykSxS4cn4l1h0qK4dO_Q.text: this is the cutest breakfast bar i've been to! the mimosa flights are amazing and they have the most extravagant bloody mary bar! our server Lona is phenomenal! most awesome server ever! definitely coming back again soon.

gTCzXVNC1e1IBH0ICpKrPA.text: Great breakfast with young adults, do in place and music loud but made for fun atmosphere. Large portions

UhoQ_UqoAyZ7Uynjdmc74Q.text: Delicious food! We got the corned beef hash skillet and it was amazing! The mimosas and bloody bar are awesome!

Dg8GxPIwVwxLnj2FgMFmcA.text: We went to Hash Kitchen for my Bachelorette brunch and everyone was so awesome. Our server was Lona and she got our orders and drinks in! We loved the food and the vibe here!

57B3SAOuDZc4X_0a_1xHvw.text: Bonnie, the host was a sweetie. So friendly and helpful. Sadly, We sat outside and felt forgotten. Our waitress barley came around and when we she did we could barely get a word in- she was in and out. We had to order our meal at the bar while we were getting our amazing Bloody Marys at the Bloody Mary bar.   The Bloody Mary bar is fun and filled with lots of fun snacks you can load your drink with. It's a must.   We are the salmon frittata- it was amazing. So tasty and enough for 2 people to share.   We had an amazing experience, but our waitress was MIA for most of the time. I wound have given it 5 stars otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EOf0Yirwe9PTT4QG_Dgsqw.text: Hash kitchen is great, especially the Bloody Mary bar. Lots of choices. Now the bad part, if you go Sunday morning your going to be waiting 1.5 to 2 hours for a seat, or at least 3 Bloody Marys.   The food i thought was good. Lots of choices and some interesting things I haven't seen elsewhere. Like lots of flavors of hash.    So if you have 4 hours to spare on a Sunday morning, or 3 hours on any other day, I'd recommend it for something a bit different.

hic7Dd7otx4FWbUoLLhfKQ.text: Outstanding breakfast with friendly and attentive service. We ate here twice while in town on vacation and will recommend to our friends. The Carnitas Hash and Fried Chicken Benediction were both excellent

yhZIJG2aUyRkAtTpL2eGkw.text: Pretty darn good. Food was above average and service was friendly. I'm very picky about my breakfast but this was pretty good but not excellent. The lady in the front Calls everyone "young lady" or "young man" so that was a little uncomfortable, but whatever she's old so I'm not holding it against anyone. Definitely worth a visit if you love trying new breakfast places. :)

H7sidF37PBFXDPmV72G0Ig.text: Absolutely love this place!!! The food is great, the drinks are amazing and Bonnie who was either the owner or hostess (either one she is great at her job) and Tyler the waiter made my visit worth while! I will definitely be going back until I try everything on the menu because it all sounded so good. I got the carnitas hash which was cooked to perfection!!!!

3WyndEQfdDtocbQ3nFDy9g.text: What's not to love about a place that is open from 7am-3pm! They know how to do brunch!  They have a GREAT bloody mary bar...it even had meatballs on it!  The house bacon infused vodka is a must try...and the mimosas are fantastic.  I always get the berry one.  And they don't have a ton of juice, which is how I like them.   The food - we haven't had a bad dish here...and have been multiple times.  The Americano is my go-to for breakfast, but the lunch menu is also good.  My wife had the burger and would order it again.  Portions are substantial.    Outside the the great food and drinks - the people is what makes Hash Kitchen.  Bonnie is always there to greet you with a smile - her spunky personality is certainly contagious and a staple for the place. We have never had poor service...everyone is pleasant, efficient, and always smiling. When we have company in town - this is ALWAYS on our list for brunch.  It will not disappoint!

G89PvgKh-kNTiRLg6CPWHw.text: This place is out of this world! We were looking for a good bloody mary bar on a Monday and this is THE place! The service was exceptional from the minute we walked in the door...from the hostess, to the bartender C.J., who walked us through the menu and the bloody mary bar, to the manager Linda, who took the time to make sure everything was excellent! We will definitely be back and tell our friends about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pYughYPfxqTqRXrkWmp6Hg.text: Breakfast or Brunch, whatever time you decide to give this delightful place a try, you won't be disappointed.  I was sad not to be able to take advantage of the Bloody Mary bar, but having over indulged in alcohol the night before, I just didn't feel like I could do the experience justice.  I did order the chicken fried chicken Benedict with the hollandaise on the side. I later requested a side of the sausage gravy instead and that felt and tasted a little more like my southern roots.  Very large portions and very good.  Come hungry!   The staff were all friendly and the owner a True entertainer and ultimate hostess!!

sycbZBLV6xuKhJFh7sKcHw.text: This place was awesome... food and service!! The portions are great for the price. Really cute decor inside and out. Everyone who was working was very nice and helpful we were checked on a lot. We went on a Monday around noon. I can see how this place would be crazy on the weekend but great durning the week not packed but at least 10 other tables. Didn't have to wait long for anything. The pretty blonde hostess in the black and white dress was super sweet( I didn't get her name).Colton our server was helpful with what he liked cause everything sounded so good it was hard to pick(not a bad problem to have).Can't wait to come back and try the Bloody Mary bar. Big plus they have a dog friendly patio... (my dogs are to crazy and way to big to bring but little or just one dog might be okay not a huge space). Five stars after I try the drinks maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Skillet: Carnitas Hash!!! With corn tortillas Closest plate: fried chicken Benedict with crispy leeks on fresh biscuits.

Am4E3MBcQyOKx1iPPRaMOw.text: Love this place! They are friendly, on top of it and we always have a great time doing brunch here. Make sure to try their Bloody Mary bar! Delish!

3b47jFq4HkitAQoDhrvgzQ.text: Such an exciting environment with expressive, genuine staff. The hash skillets were top-notch and the Bloody Mary bar was exceptional. We also had the mimosa flight which was delicious. I definitely would recommend calling ahead (if available) on the weekends!

cz49kKGmbrds7Qevsnxynw.text: We have visited the Hash Kitchen twice with good friends.  The hostess remembered us from previous times and greeted us with a big smile. The food is amazing.  Our friends are  die~hard lump crab with sweet potatoes fans, which they state" is out of this world"  but we like to change it up a bit - I've had the caprese benedict (loved this great flavor) and have also tried the lump crab benedict.  Both were great - large servings.  My husband has had the frittatas and the skillet, his preferance was the skillet, he felt tht frittata was not as flavorable.    Service has always been great - nice comfortable surroundings - we'll be coming here again.

LVpmp1d2OyIqSKVkaY6Uog.text: Great service! Didn't realize my entree came with meat. Completely my fault, but the waiter brought me a new one out within minutes. We came on a bachelorette party and they were very accommodating to 15 of us needing separate checks and even brought everyone a free round of shots!

HlqfSUCodgdVrD7K6Ruj9g.text: Hash Kitchen is the place to be if you're looking for a brunch to impress! Just the food alone is good enough to secure a solid spot in my heart, not to mention the adorable decor/ambiance, fabulous service, fun drinks, and OF COURSE that Bloody Mary bar. How can you fit so many good things into one place?? Mimosa flights with fun seasonal fruits... check. Creative and delicious cocktails... check (at a brunch place! Yes!). Meatballs and ravioli and pickled eggs and whatever else my heart desires on a fully customized Bloody Mary made fresh for me... check. The menu has something for everyone, whether you're looking to carb up with a decadent French toast creation or go easy with a veggie frittata. Love! Servers are always happy to answer questions or explain the processes without being too pushy or too distant. Wait times can get nutty on the weekends but what else could you expect from a place this rad?

IXy7LcKJSmTwT5XiMnUlPQ.text: I had the Crab Eggs Benedict and it was good but not fantastic. I saw the reviews and was looking to be wowed but wasn't. My dish did not look like the others on yelp. The crab meat seemed less than other in yelp and it did not have the garnish. The biscuit was good and the service was OK. Overall good but not great. It might have been an off day for them.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great Blood Mary Bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zbA8CxhcwnqyyqEeumK_Mw.text: Bloody. Mary. Bar.  Not just some crap fixings and garbage vodka.  Titos. House made infused vodkas.  Bacon.  Bacon salt. Pickled everything...  And the food is freaking awesome.    This place is a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody. Mary. Bar.

qwHfdIC_JyLP2VideoE8ew.text: I'm tempted to give this place 4 stars but the food is so good I can't do it.  Reason for 4 stars would be hit or miss service.  The reason is they pack so many into the place that food delivery timing and tables per server are inconsistent.  Place can get SO noisy also, not the place for a quiet, relaxing breakfast - try Breakfast Joint if that's what you want.  But you will NOT leave hungry.  Take an Uber cuz they have lots of liquor!

68uIwlbtJlQQRmhXglcbQQ.text: This place is awesome! Bloody Mary bar is incredible, with so many options and two hot appetizers included. Definitely will be back!

i4Umt3G3iPKcNFNSKXOk4w.text: Super hip place for breakfast. Food was delicious and our server was wonderful. Our kiddo had pancakes... they were huge! We had a great meal here and recommend it for sure!

0NaXfgBZUJNh8Sq2TjANkg.text: Fantastic brunch. Consistently high quality. Hostess Bonnie is welcoming and warm...and entertaining - she loves to dance. Norman & Andrea

dnidQt6VM6HeuFLWPVfK6w.text: So... I fell in love with the bloody Mary bar last time I was here so couldn't WAIT to come back...Came in and was seated immediately...however...I've been sitting ungreeted and unacknowledged ever since..Sat for a good 20 minutes before going up to the bloody Mary bar and buying one directly from the bartender Lisa (SHE is amazing and friendly - offered to find out who my server was. I declined, never dreaming I would get ignored for another half hour lol)...with my seat and purse in view the whole time WAITING TO WAVE at a server...that never showed...Now...I'm back  in my seat  (literally yelping as i wait)and have been for a good 20 minutes working through my bloody Mary and fixins....STILL no server or order taken...Others around me have come in and gotten food...I'm disappointed....they're not even as busy as last time (earlier in the morning then)...but regardless no-one has even ASKED if my order has been taken :(...Once I'm done with this Delicious drink (bacon vodka yum) I've paid for, guess I'll go find a place to actually EAT ...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

swWeQRuZ9TsrYR_v4Joi2Q.text: This is a pretty incredible place.  Chef Joey and company have another hit on their hands.  I cannot wait for the Chandler/Gilbert location to open.  A fun innovative menu with fresh quality ingredients.  What more do you need to know?

6LLOGWfYLnezhH4zUVdO1Q.text: We went to HK this am for breakfast, myself, my husband, my best friend and our puppy! Service was second to none, Lona was very attentive, funny and professional! She had a great knowledge of the menu.  Food was amazing! Bloody Mary bar was great and added a little extra fun.  HK is a must if your in Scottsdale, we will be back!

LqNMhC65c-tgDCjI7cv6Xw.text: Cute place with a party vibe. It was my 21st birthday and they didn't do anything special, which I was kinda bummed about. Food was decent. Great ideas, but quality could've followed through better. Ex: pancakes were dry. Service was OK, friendly. Won't be my go-to breakfast place, but fun for a special occasion.

HZdWjxI97rnORu4gLQkaoA.text: Ordered the Cubano and paired it with "notorious sauce" from the burger offerings. I'm not sure what's in that sauce, but it certainly is good on that sandwich and fries. The service was just fine with nothing out of the ordinary encountered. Next time in Scottsdale, I'd like to come try their French toast choices. They looked quite good.

7xE1ONQm0a6wy1r0XKIj-w.text: Great spot, best bloody Mary bar around. Large portions enough to share so try pancakes and French toast lol. Busy place so expect a wait for sure on the weekends.

4Gh_wxjfhoI6WpbF7GqMBg.text: Came here for my 21st birthday breakfast and had the most incredible time! Drinks were great. Atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. I was able to try the French Toast, Chicken and Waffles, and a Ranchero Hash. I personally thought all of it was delicious and I loved every minute of it! Thank you for a great start to my 21st Celebration!

hzY6WEAJAVsFCR9c_S7hHg.text: I'm still not ready to embrace the DJ at Sunday brunch phase... so there's that. The frittata was just a very, very sad circle shaped omelette with no flavor.  The good stuff was our server was awesome, coffee was tasty and always full.  Decor was unique and the best part was the Bloody Mary bar.  Overall, I probably wouldn't be back unless it was for a super sweet breakfast and drinks- all my friends raved about their French toast etc dishes.

nAAaS-sV6bqgAtiaCI0CNw.text: Food was good,  but the entire meal took a horrible turn about half way through when the manager turned the music up so loud you couldn't have a conversation without almost yelling. Asked to have it turned down, was told 'the is nothing we can do'. Won't be back

BlqrzxUIW2uG1LmslZ6qwQ.text: So. I'd like to give 0 star. This place is hopping! And the menu looks good. By after a "30 min" wait turned into an hour. And our name mysteriously disappearing from the wait list or our pager being paged but not working (which is it) and the manager attempting to fix the situation I'm not sure I care to eat here. The food will need to be better than orgasmic to make up for the idiots running the wait list.  So the manager got us a table and then paged us that it was ready!  Really!???!!?  After just telling me the pager must be broken?  And I was 5 feet outside the front door. You should have walked outside and gotten us.  So we were seated and given a complimentary bruschetta for the wait fiasco. But no plates to eat from. Seriously. Are these people actually in the restaurant biz? Max out waiter was good. But I puke disappear for long periods. Drinks took an exceptionally long time to arrive. And my extra spicy Bloody Mary was not spicy at all. Food came out super fast... and....  well. Had to be sent back. Came out a second time missing key ingredients, but I had given up by then.  Frankly the food was tasteless. I've had a better tasting has from IHOP.  In addition to the shit show that is this "restaurant" the DJ was so loud it was annoying.

JiOho_EUzVR500Ki_n8GmQ.text: We were told the wait was 30 minutes  We specifically asked for a large table and not to be put at a table for 4 with a chair added on.... After almost an hour they tried to seat 5 adults in a booth next to the very busy hostess stand with a chair in the walkway- None of us thought the manager was very nice.  Needless to say we left and won't be going back.  Those friends that we have talked to since- won't be going either.

eN3QfzC47wrFz0nb0m-FzA.text: One of my favorite waitstaff members, Deidra, left Breakfast Club and started working here.  I had the Carnitas Hash.  It was fantastic.  As always Deidra had me laughing.  Good place and great food!

EEQc0kvxgsoDBv7wZsihOg.text: Hash Kitchen provides an awesome atmosphere for Brunch! The DJ was great and the drinks were even better! I suggest trying the Mimosa flight (pineapple was my favorite). As for food, their creative dishes were fantastic. However, the breakfast classics fell a little short for me. I love eggs and my veggie omelet was very bland. The Chicken and Waffles was magnificent though! The crispy onion strings on top of the waffle were amazing! I'll take a bowl of just those. The hash brown side was also yummy! It's the perfect salty side to soak up all their great cocktails!

f-8gGVo0kfonweO1PWM4NA.text: Food was really good. The hash is a must have. Mimosas were fresh and delicious. Lona was a rockstar waitress

WfH4dXKKi7f6o2bjM2Vklg.text: Outstanding customer service. Made us feel so welcome as soon as we stepped in the door. I came here with my grandmothers and Mother for Mother's Day. By the end of our meal my grandmother ended up dancing on the dance floor. There's a warm atmosphere. I had the lamb hash. The banana coconut french toast was amazing and I normally don't even like coconut. Very fluffy and hot. The lamb hash was tender and hot. I didn't get Any cheese or dairy on my hash but I will say the lamb and potatoes could use more seasoning but it was a pretty healthy option . My sister has the chicken and waffles she said they were the best she ever had. I would def come here again it's a fun place to hang out . The mimosa bar was pretty neat and the DJ made the vibe positive and fun. If you haven't been I would suggest making a pit stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tropical green tea

WXqeZn4tSsWIj3M8wcBc3w.text: While in Scottsdale with my boyfriend we wanted a very nice brunch spot before our couples massage. I found this little gem on yelp and did not regret it one bit. The service reminds me of gals from the south - very friendly and actually look happy to be there regardless if they are or not. I went with the smores French toast and it was seriously heaven! Like if I died and went to heaven I would imagine this was at the breakfast buffet (because heaven rewards you with breakfast buffets and in heaven you don't gain weight). We also got a side of fruit and it came out on a platter and displayed nicely, very impressed. My man got the eggs Benedict and he of course gobbled it all up. Definitely swing by if you can, no regrats  (spelling intentially wrong)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smores French toast

SGe0MTcjEhpgvlJTpPotmg.text: Great food,atmosphere, and service! Derek was awesome. When you go, make sure you have a Bloody Mary.  They are pretty good. I went with the mild but I should have gotten the spicy!  I enjoyed my corned beef hash was great and I can wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Very good!

v38poc9m1S83V6wLjcHd2w.text: My absolute favorite place for breakfast/brunch. Food is fresh and imaginative. Bloody Mary bar and Mimosa flights are wonderful. The menu changes often, so be sure to check in often. The coffee is out of this world  Update: Father's Day and another wonderful brunch. Thank you Patrick with the engaging smile!

h733V-GjDeSEc9_9G4SeQw.text: Love the Bloody Mary Bar.  Looking forward to our next annual dining experience.  This time with Melissa.

UEzcjjuEoj67k_VxIHRxbA.text: My first time in arizona and I decided to check this place out. I found it at yelp one of the top breakfast joints in Scottsdale. The main thing that caught my eye was their bloody Mary bar. So I knew I had to go for sure. we got there around 9 AM on Friday morning and it was already very crowded but we did not have to wait the service was great the food was delicious. I had the chorizo scrambler it was very good my boyfriend had the Carnitas hash he loved it. And finally the bloody Mary!! you go to the bar they make your drink then you add all the toppings you want in it. I put celery, carrots, olives, bacon. Yes bacon! And a hard-boiled egg sounds weird but it was so good I definitely recommend this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The chorizo scrambler!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Above is the bloody Mary bar with all the fixings and below are the two bloody Mary&#39;s me and my boyfriend had

OO3NOtGU9wcMFrOEA1LMaA.text: I love this place. Being from Europe I am unaccustomed to all the skillets etc and they are an absolute treat. My favourite is the pork. Being from the UK I am familiar with bloody Mary's and this bar is phenomenal. It's a first class act. The lady in charge recognised me from previous visits and made me feel like a regular. Good service good food. Well worth the lines and wait on occasions. Came back in today and our waitress Katie was an absolute gem. She made the perfect Bloody Mary and was so accommodating towards my parents and their wishes! I had the pork Hash again and it's my favourite pork dish worldwide. So glad they keep the standard again and again.

qAX-QPsvJGS0tgrW1sJVbQ.text: Where do I begin.... this place is amazing. I had a party of 22 which is hard to accommodate, and they went above and beyond to make sure it was the closest location to our hotel as well as fitting us in last minute. Drinks are amazing, Bloody Mary bar is awesome, mimosa flights are a must. We went to the 8777 location and if you do the same, you must request LONA! Best service and recommendations I have had in Scottsdale, hands down! Check this place out.

BZZbfYs9tizni2LHbXFQLA.text: We ordered brunch to go here. The line was long so it had to be good and it was! They had a bloody Mary bar and great amenities for those that were waiting. The atmosphere was a little too much for us. There was a DJ inside and the music was just too loud for us. The food was very good and iconic to a southwest brunch.

G1c-VNS9eWxWdyrlqEhasA.text: Best experience for Sunday Brunch! Bonnie is awesome! The food is amazing the jumbo shirmp and sweet potatoes and veggie scramble. Make sure you try the flight of mimosas and the bloody mary bar. Nice vibe and music. Such and great menu and so much more I plan to try. Bonnie I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K2hBLM2-s8wTXdUH5xxhIA.text: Four of us tried it while in town. Coffee was great, bloody mary bar is incredible. We had the traditional waffle, cornbeef eggs benedict, bananas foster french toast, and avacado bread pulled pork sandwich. This is one of those places where nothing was bad.

gX2dIzD3MYr7RnXxSX8LAA.text: This has been a new found favorite for brunch . As you enter the vibe is always fun, upbeat and uber hip .., there is a DJ spinning , a mind blowing Bloody Mary bar and the decor is very cool. This was my third time to the establishment as , I wanted to get a wider selection before,  I reviewed. I have had the bagel board ( so tasty , bagels toasted just enough, lox fresh and not too fishy & also had my favorite accoutrements; red onions & capers ) I've also had the banana brulee's French toast ( very sweet , but loved the banana flavor and challa bread ) Last time I was at Hash I had SBLT ( salmon , bacon , lettuce & tomatoe sandwich which , I will say was completely out of this world) this is another amazing spot to bring friends from out of town to blow them away. The Bloody Mary Bar is so decked out , nothing left to the imagination ... But, come hungry the portions here are gargantuan!

VJaqUcaPwVbSPLkQDvdH0A.text: Great food and drinks. It's being kind to call the service subpar. We saw our server three times throughout the meal. We had to go ask another server for condiments. We received no water refills. And the runner who brought out the food walked our dishes to every table around us - we were two people, the other tables had three or more people - passing us twice before she acknowledged our hand waves and calls that it was our food. I am only giving 3 stars because the GM was nice enough to take an item off our check and apologize for how we were treated.

uPC3xK7asWIBLkY0VDkGIQ.text: I'm so happy I found this place! If you can't decide on a mimosa flavor, that's ok, just get the mimosa flight! I ordered their avocado toast and it was AMAZING! Thanks Lona for taking such good care of my friends and I. We'll be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

529uRWrtwEwd6unbcI2eXw.text: Jessica is awesome, and oh ya, the food was great!  Came across this place on a whim, we must return!

fy76pHUYjnzuiM3RiwSxnw.text: Must have The Cannoli Pancakes!!! Oh my gosh they are amazing. Everything I had here was great, higher prices but it's also an experience. FYI if you go on a weekend it resembles Vegas. DJ, people dressed up like they partied all night. It can get a little loud. I've heard it's great on week days if that isn't your thing.

9a5fZKFp-D4CfIgftDxXlA.text: My favorite place ever!!!! Get the burrito! YUMMY Hash Hash baby is right! Service is so amazing! BEST Service ever! nicest staff ever! Wow! WOW!

n51eMhhfaqRY_IT38v-lfQ.text: Wonderful food! Unique! Great place to enjoy a great breakfast with a very cool Bloody Mary bar. I'll be back!

37EngFS_SFA7VBmH-rr2AQ.text: Love this place! The wait can be a bit extreme... but the food (and drinks) is great! The portions are really big, so keep that in mind when ordering.

yExkfuxyw4qS4Hi4eDCFQw.text: Awesome atmosphere, great service, and fantastic brunch! Kiwi mimosas?! Do yourself and order this.. unless of course you're going to build yourself the greatest Bloody Mary from the bar!

KaHhDgJNoZeekIVByRteHA.text: Been here twice already and it has yet to disappoint. Server (wish I could remember his name) was wonderful in recommending the Carnitas Hash to my 15yo son who usually gets Oreo/cookie whatever at breakfast restaurants. Son's was delicious- we both enjoyed it and took it home to enjoy again. I got the Smoked Salmon Frittata - good but not as delicious as son's hash skillet!  We got here early on a Sunday and was seated right away. Place was buzzing when we left.  I will be back (when I'm not dd) to try the Bloody Mary's. The bar has so many offerings, can make a meal out of that!  Definitely not usual breakfast place - I highly recommend!

duGzGblWCSGHHtqcshYXAA.text: This place does not need my review, just look at the line wrapping around the building in weekends.   GREAT food, normal Scottsdale prices, a gimicky bloody mary bar that 30 somethings find amusing....   Lots of wealthy sports stars at the bar, lots of all kind of wealthy people at the bar.....  and then me of course...  Food is great, management keeps a tight reign on servers..  Dog friendly patio... what is to not like????  5 stars all the way.

9zRG3qow8TfsgPm_u69JLg.text: We were fortunate to stay next door recommended at our hotel.  Great find!  Everything fresh and delicious, great presentation! KT is the very cute and knowledgeable server that helped ensured our experience was enjoyable.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pastry board...  WOW!
