L0D_a67af65Mfd16vvbP3g.text: Second time in Scottsdale and my best friend and I were deciding on where to eat brunch at, found this on yelp and glad we ate here! I'm a big eggs Benedict fan and I tried their herb chicken eggs Benedict. I have to say it was pretty good! I loved the caramelized leeks! Really made the fried chicken so good! My best friend ordered the chilaquiles and we loved it! The environment was so fun, with a DJ who played really good music!

wa4oQ7FdfuOLspkamqd17A.text: The Bloody Mary bar is a cool reason to visit. The carne hash was INCREDIBLE! I got hash Benedict and it was just ok.

FMjiZaSJClycbkrIIBmfig.text: This place has a maze in food, very good service. The place actually had a DJ live playing music and it was a very modern new school vibe that I was really into. Me and the guests I had along with me you had a great time the food was prepared very delicious Lee and the prices at this place are very good as well. I look forward to coming back next time for a great meal and entertainment

kEmctAvix_N_HetHuYUIRA.text: The service was really good but the food was mediocre at best. Nothing super about this place

FsmNlfWErPUGC7-XR6884A.text: I have eaten here plenty of time.  Food is OK. It's second tier amongst the local breakfast options. It's well behind OBH and Butterfield's but it is a half step up above IHOP, although my kids still prefer IHOP  A pet peeve with Hash Kitchen is that they cannot judge a wait, or, if you call in, they flat out lie. Last time I went in, I called and asked the wait. They said no wait for a party of 4. I arrived 10 minutes later, there was a 35 min wait :(  That is irritating, especially for bleh food

Ie-SQvleZ5gd1qcxBC6zVg.text: Came on a Monday morning during a spring training vacation. The coffee was weak and the carnitas hash flavorless. The crab eggs benedict was very poor, too. Not recommended.

1P3vM5faU5OP23BtnWcEKQ.text: One word: Bonnie. She is a ball of everything good in the world. We need more people like her in the world! I won't explain anymore because you'll have to come in and experience Hash yourself and understand why. I'm here on a Saturday morning, DJ playing rocking music. Bonnie dancing, girls dancing.. well maybe just me and my best friend. Bloody Mary bar. Pancakes are great, I want to come back and try everything else. Come to Hash kitchen! It's bomb.com

cHRYuCChz6t_qex5VqSDpQ.text: Service is poor. Food is average. Breakfast potatoes undercooked. Scrambled eggs rubbery. Trying to get attention from the server is a joke. 2nd and last time here. I thought the first must have been an oddity but this place really isn't good.

W0Qvl0At8gzzQvwe8vi7Ag.text: Great brunch & lunch place! Been here 4 times now, and will be back soon.  Gino does a great job on service....

nL-0hg1nDHgIpb4Pfzk8-A.text: Definitely had mimosa and Bloody Mary envy during our short time here, but we opted out of the alcoholic beverages since we were going to have a long day that would surely involve more drinking later on. We ordered a couple hashes that were nicely portioned and well-balanced in both textures and flavors. Service was great too. Would come back again!

7bQiob-dHORtwrOg8FtEEg.text: I got one of the better huevos rancheros skillets I've ever had here.  The red chili was awesome and the plate didn't become an unappetizing pile of mush thanks to a crispy tortilla in the middle and the fried onions on top.  The meat that was supposed to be carne asada though left very much to be desired.  It looked and unfortunately tasted kind of like the steak they use at taco bell but sliced thinner..   My friend got the biscuits and gravy which was not very interesting.  You get like 3 lump biscuits in a pool of gravy.  Honestly, I've had better at a hospital cafeteria.  The service was pretty good.  Everyone was nice and asked how everything was.  It started getting old towards the end of the meal, maybe add in a few other lines they can say or just skip the question every other time...?  They were pretty good about refilling water and coffee, etc though so can't complain too much.   The bloody mary bar looked awesome!  We're definitely going to have to go back  one day to try lunch and the bloody mary bar.

EQTGzsNSf4TiAKMz7Y3Fqg.text: First time here for Breakfast.  Food was spot on. Service was great with server Rachel.  Restaurant is clean and inviting.  We will definitely return.

3PvyKyZwhdcj6oa8wz55IA.text: The place was kind of hard to find but when I did, I walked into a gorgeous place. The dining area was very welcoming, the place was nicely decorated and the hostess was such a sweet lady. Loved her purple shoes!   My girl friend and I waited not to long for water and drinks. The Bloody Mary is a must have. Next time I'm going to be brave and attempt making a creation of my own. Amazingly they had a Bloody Mary bar aside from the full bar in the other room!   I ordered the Huevos Rancheros Hash and the red haired young gal took our order. I forgot her name. We had to 32min, yes we timed it before she took our order, the placed was not busy. We use an app that times out service and based on the wait it determines our tip! She did not score high at all :( It looked so yummy but on the first bite the meat in it was cold and had a weird taste then the sauce itself was so bland. I never send food back but this was not worth trying to swallow :( I was so sad as I LOVE Huevos Rancheros. The server did noticed and kindly suggested the pancakes so I ordered the carrot cake. Now that dish was pure heaven!!!!   Would I go back? Yes. I would try s different HASH but if that fails, I will just stick to the sweets and bloody Mary's!  I gave 4stars due to the servers acknowledgement and bringing me something yummy instead, the sweet lady up front and the kick ass blood's. Oh yeah and I have her more tip then the app suggested for her recommendation of the yummy carrot cakes.The good out weighed the bad... Please HASH KITCHEN, retrain servers on timing. Timing is of essence. Thank you ;)

S8B7lYKp3rh-4VLetCE8VQ.text: Just moved into the neighborhood, and this was our first time here.  All of the employees are great, and he hostess in particular is super sweet!  The ambiance is very welcoming, and they have a really fun Bloody Mary bar to tempt you, just inside the front door.  My Preggo wife couldn't decide between entrees on the super creative breakfast menu here, so we went for 3 choices, the Lump Crab Sweet Potato Hash, the Huevos Rancheros Hash and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes... My pregnant wife's dream come True!  And all 3 were Excellent.  We'll be back, and can't wait to try one of the 20 or so other tempting items here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump Crab Sweet Potato Hash, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and Huevos Rancheros Hash, Yum!!!

8Ikksg26yNmm83lTTJnjew.text: So this is our second time to Hash Kitchen Scottsdale.....the first time was amazing so we decided to come back again to celebrate another birthday.  This time although Evan our waiter was amazing the experience was not quite the same.  Our glass's smelled like either wet dog or fish and when brought to management attention we did not get the response we expected.  We did end up with not being charge for some of our meal but the manager never came back and addressed the issue.   I will say we will try a Hash kitchen but I'm not certain we'll return to this one.

AraJk7_EclSIKrB8fuOCig.text: Great service. Fun personalities behind the bar. Good coffee. Chicken and waffles were good. Bloody Mary bar is super fun. We will be back.

28HyBYRoEP5QS_grjLfmKQ.text: Brought my family to brunch today n I should have went with my gut and went to El Chorro. We called at 1130 and were told the wait was about 35 minutes so we drove 40 minutes there. We were given a pager and told it was 30 minutes. The odd thing was we kept seeing people come in after us and get seated. My annoyance started.  After we were seated it took a good 8 minutes to be acknowledged by a server. The food was mediocre, the service was off n then she over charged us and I had to correct her. Please keep your money or spend it elsewhere. The only lure here is the blood Mary bar.

M_YwMur9VpTvoOkTTi8Nug.text: Fantastic Brunch joint. Amy at the front is the sweetest! Food is fantastic, our server CJ is always a homie and hooks it up fat. Highly recommend this place to any fellow Munchers!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Munchers

fvUqSyJqUsQ_sLjuWpyGAg.text: Love ... Great place for Sat/Sun brunch, when you don't want to go 'too hard' when 'Brunching'... Great Bloody Mary bar, delish Mimosa Flights and a DJ- but it doesn't feel super aggressive or loud- i.e. you can still take your parents here or even bring kids and it isn't awkward... Amazing food and service- I love the Salmon Benedict ... If you are with a big group grab the mini donuts for the table as an fun app-(I don't even like donuts and loved them)

UG2zdx_K2HBfMfoeq3Pwyg.text: The food here is amazing. We got the herb fired chicken and carnitas hash and both were delicious. Our server Patrick was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely come back for more.

3fE8RXS7p9OMP_u9_CMFTw.text: I ordered the chicken Thai salad. You get a bunch of cabbage with maybe 3 oz of grilled chicken breast for $16. Go ahead and pass on this one

fNhfeuowsl-c7HYCWkrnKQ.text: My fiance and I come here all the time just for Bonnie. She makes Hash Kitchen what it is. It wouldn't be the same without her.

UYEdfOBnvrblgmpZdxnyig.text: Chicken and waffles are great, real maple syrup.  A side of gravy for the chicken eould be nice. Pass on the corned beef hash, too many green peppers,  corned beef tasted like from a can mixed with the potatoes. Biscuits were good.

xv2nizPvLIaeoWTa-IEcZA.text: Let's be honest, i think this is my FIRST one star review ever. I have always looked at the 1 stars at a restaurant with great reviews and now I've learned my lesson. Every review matters.  My husband and I came on Valentine's Day and were pretty excited based on the pics and fellow Yelp reviews...we will not be back.   The wait was expected 30-40 minutes in our opinion was actually really really good considering the day and the area.   We were seated at the bar as the hostess asked if it was ok, which we were fine with, give a table to a family or someone under 21. No biggie.  My husband opted for the 'build your own' Bloody Mary bar and i opted for the house/bartender makes it for me Bloody Mary, it would have to be just as good if not better than his, right? WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Ok so the hubs makes his own drink and I literally wait 20 minutes for mine. Not kidding. Then finally when she brings me my drink she then takes our order....which doesn't come out for nearly 45 minutes. No apologies, no eye contact, no how's your drink, you haven't touched but I see you sipping off of your man's.  Ok so what was wrong with it? You know when the mix isn't stirred/shaken and the good stuff is all at the bottom? Yeah, I didn't get the good stuff or the garnishes.   Kudos to the blond bartender working the other side of the bar who checked on her waiting patrons and offered to comp a drink if they would like another while they waited. I wish you were our waitress because service is half of a review.   Our food was mediocre. I had the chicken and waffles which had absolutely no flavor...the hubs had the Boring Bennie and the biscuit instead of the English muffin was actually genius.  All in all the wait For food and poor service is what this review comes down too.   **DO NOT SIT AT THE BAR**

cVGhm6dNMFGwD8A5_6unjw.text: Table of 9 at 10:30a, three of three egg dishes over cooked to overhard (ordered overeasy). Corned beef hash uneatable, lukewarm, potatoes mushy, low flavor, greasy. Long wait to get food, must have been in window too long. One of two waffles over cooked and burnt tasting. Below average service. Rough showing

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corned Beef Hash lack luster experience. A lot of good reviews prior, not our breakfast.

iL6elvnkIve8jxi6e79TXg.text: Not one item the four of us ordered was tasty. Gross sauces, not cooked correctly and the bloody marys that were touted as the main attraction tasted like tin.We finished nothing for $135

JeqLqj78lqRNRW89RJdfRw.text: Love hash kitchen! Everything here is so cute. I love the big disco mimosa with the cotton candy. Lona is a great server and very attentive! I totally recommend this place!!!!

Yon_1stfhDCNmV-9z28quQ.text: Hash kitchen has the BEST menu. Everything is so different and exciting! Getting the mimosa flight is a must. Make sure you ask for Lona!!!

iawRtsZBl8xMIbT0frAFLQ.text: Amazing food, atmosphere, and service. Highly recommended. We'll definitely be back next time we're in the area. Lona was awesome!

C7baJ9t3Z9s7aj9SKGo2kg.text: Love. Love. Love. Everyone was so friendly. The food was so so good. Will definitely be back again. A great place for a day date with your favorite person.

aSImmfG_CvCHP2Isa6qzJw.text: This place has amazing food, atmosphere, and the Sunday Bloody Mary bar is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar on Sunday&#39;s at hash is the best!!!

4_7-VDQxE-fF7MAiPoEmAg.text: One word.... Bonnie! She is just a sparkle of sunshine when you enter this place!! She made us feel welcomed and we laughed until our cheeks hurt with all of her great stories! Thank you for the wonderful experience you give when we come to Hash for brunch!!

L4SxMp_1KTQR_v8jrFmRug.text: Went here for the first time with some girlfriends.  So fun!  Great atmosphere & yummy food!!

oxamLkef89oGE--TKuDWMQ.text: This restaurant was a huge disappointment. We arrived on a Monday morning at 11:30 and were told it would be a half hour wait despite the fact that there were numerous empty tables and not many people ahead of us. We opted to sit at the bar since we were a little pressed for time. The bartender was visibly frazzled and said they were very short staffed. I was brought watery iced tea with no straw and no sweetener and the bartender disappeared. We finally ordered and had a long wait for food which didn't look anything like the yelp pictures and was not even warm. We were told sorry for the wait but the frittata takes a long time which would explain why it was burnt and my hollandaise was dried up. Definitely an off day for this establishment!

ULCJBupgXlswwmDuudQ1Ww.text: Went for Saturday brunch, and was stoked the second I walked in: live DJ, hip decor, friendly staff, and a massive DIY bloody mary bar.   Then I saw the menu... and my mind was blown. A huge selection of classic breakfast favorites with innovative flavor twists and creative combinations.   My group ordered and before we knew it our table was covered in deliciously beautiful works of culinary creations.  Heaven.  Then we started eating... and it was good... don't get me wrong, but the ambiance and the flare set the bar so high that when I realized the flavors were lacking... I nearly cried.   That's the only issue... the flavors lack. Not bad. But just weak.  The Chicken and Waffles: covered in fried leeks and came with a "bacon waffle"... sounds awesome right? Looks awesome too. But two bites in we had to order more maple syrup to coax a little life out of it.  (Also the chicken itself was pitiful in size, but looking at other reviews it looks like we just had an off batch)  The Berries Pancakes, "stuffed with local fresh berries", was a regular stack of pancakes... with a spoonful of berries on top, and maybe 2 blue berries in each cake.  The Lump Crab and Sweet Potato Hash: which we were told by the waiter was one of the most popular items, was a basic hash, topped with a few peices of crab meat and two perfectly (I'll give them that) poached eggs, with a depressingly weak drizzle of aioli... good, but nothing to write home about.  The Scrambles: as good as most, the unique combo of ingredients failed to create a unique experience though. Also... the bowl of non-crispy potatoes served with them? Maybe it's the new style... but I personally would vote for a few more notches of crispy.  Anyway... i try hard to rate places on what they are, and not my own experience. For this place, I feel like they are trying to be a hip and modern eatery that pushes the boundaries of breakfast dogmas with unique flavors and creativity... that is what I experiecned, saw, and felt... but not at all what I tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6-jtm1Hj40-gWq9PubRhPg.text: They have excellent food! Mimosa flights are great. It is a great cute place for brunch or a quick lunch during the week.

5wOhjY5UBFDcfixo2WH4ug.text: Excited to try for first time, heard good things Pulled up, tons of people in the parking lot drinking bloody mary's Asked how long for 4, response 45-55 minutes. As I was handed my buzzer by the nice older gentleman taking the names, a rude older woman ordered me to not put the buzzer in my pocket. I said, I've got at least an hour to wait why does it matter. Forget this place. Not worth wasting your time. First impressions are everything, they should get rid of the old lady.

kE6M6oL6tt_CGABgeJ9EcQ.text: sooo sooo good! got the carnitas hash it was sooo good!!  our waitress Briana was awesome!!

wBbADJWiKmAwU11sW4NjMA.text: Briana was awesome!!!! Breakfast was so good, the tamale was the best! Outside was hot, but the food is so worth it!

Ax8CAb6nBWIy8T-rBmOBSw.text: The Bloody Mary bar alone makes this a must-stop brunch. However, the chilaquiles were phenomenal as were the cinnamon roll pancakes! You can't go wrong on this menu.

LESAF6zc05w3EoU4eaqHeg.text: Super cool breakfast hang spot. I went there with a party of 7 and they were more then accommodating. It took us maybe 20 minutes to get a table which is above average for places this popular. The service was good and the food was good as well. We tried many different things and the fries appetizer with egg on top was great. There is a semi typical Scottsdale crowd here so if that's not your thing maybe this isn't the spot for you. The portions are large and pretty much everyone at our table took food home with them. I had the corned beef hash plate and it was very good. Everything was clean and the Bloody Mary bar was insanely cool. I would recommend hash kitchen to my friends and will be back once again when I'm in the area. They did good with this place.

vx6Q74_nx6vTzoVwHjA_DQ.text: This place was so delicious. Omg will be coming back. I got the lump crab Benedict and it was so gooooddd!!! The berry waffle was crispy and just the way I like it. The only reason for not the full 5 stars was that the breakfast lasagna came out cold. But over all great service and delicious food recommend getting the flight mimosa.

OXxG-IpIRhiu7lfHBuFXFg.text: The atmosphere here is amazing, the DJ adds a little club atmosphere while the food and decor add a essence of elegance. The customer service was so fast and friendly.  The food is impeccable. The presentation is astounding and the favors are devine. I will return to have breakfast here and recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to eat.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carrot cake pancakes

Hj15vZJv-R_YH0YmCKWN1g.text: One word: Epic. A Brunch/Breakfast place that makes me get out of bed. Energy, ambiance, Bloody Mary bar, mimosa flight and menu selections are several reasons to visit. Come early or later, or else you are waiting a good amount of time. Can't wait for them to come to Arcadia. Big shout out to Alisa, the fabulous Bloody Mary bartender.

Lorna is the mixmaster behind the bar, Evan always takes care of us Alyssa runs the BEST bloody bar and then Bonnie is always the best Hostess

l7gw6INTLFoNsQ3BdRtO2g.text: Really nice setup, heard its pretty crazy for brunch on the weekends but their food is just not that good and it's expensive. Service was good but the food wasn't.

1CNLB4fhpfIA-FDGhRKnlQ.text: Having fun with Lolo and enjoying delicious food!  Thanks so much for the great service!

yZ0t7_drsimZN5gVVNA0zA.text: Amazing brunch place with a great atmosphere with amazing options of mimosas! Natalie was our server and she was great!

wHo00_cFpVKnKgn0CXS7vw.text: Yummy.  That sums it up! Everything is fresh, tasty,  and real.    The frittatas are awesome.   I had the veggie one.  My wife had the shrimp salad.   Awesome.  Classic French toast... anything but run on the mill.  It is huge! My daughter had the quinoa burger, very good. And I stole some fries!  Amaxing.  But don't forget to get a bloody mary from the bar.   Omg! Toppings  galore! We had a table of 12 and Patrick could not have been more attentive, fun and professional.   This is a great place! Can wet get one in Florida please!

iicahbYyUWKMyXsRbk49SA.text: What's the saying under promise and over deliver. They missed that at Hash Kitchen. They over price their food and drinks and serious under deliver. My hubby and I have tried several times to give it a shot and every time we eat there we walkout wondering how we spent that much money and are so disappointed. We have tried the one on FLW and the one on Scottsdale same disappointment. The staff and food are pretty, unfortunately the service is slow and the food is bland.

u0TuvFr0GEaX67XbQrFWnw.text: Fun brunch place with the girls! The food was good but the experience was better. They even had a live DJ. Don't forget that Bloody Mary bar!

FgldH8ESMtrgDTxu0kemmg.text: This place is AMAZING! Mimosas, food, build your own bloody bar. Definitely worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet potato hash. AMAZING!!!

vntcoSxPparGatM1y7Ueqw.text: Great service even during a busy Sunday brunch time. The drinks were amazing- definitely a fan of the breakfast cocktails and the chicken and waffles were a staple done right.   The chicken was perfectly seasoned and not the cheap tenders some places out on waffles. The Benedict was well done too, and the Bloody Mary bar looks like something we need to try next time. The options are great and this might be the best breakfast spot in Scottsdale

JjL2zakJ0isC0lOggq7oCg.text: Love love love this place. Super accommodating to a large group at the last minute. The food is amazing and the service is extremely friendly and quick!  Definitely recommend to anyone in the Scottsdale area!

uS_DT66thCU6TZnoXdMIEA.text: Came here for the first time, was with a party of 9, so was worried we would be waiting for awhile. Host told us 40 minutes, we waited about 20. Well worth any wait, the food was amazing and definitely worth the price of the food! Highly recommend. I will definitely be returning.

S-nb6FJGuybA6KkeQyeh1Q.text: My favorite bruschetta! Totally worth the drive until they open one in downtown Gilbert!

zTiQ4wr5edfmPGLeNwdoVA.text: I went to The Hash Kitchen a few weeks ago and will be returning! The restaurant is very cute; open, bright and airy.. The service was friendly and fast. I tried the crab benedict, it was okay, but I thought the combination of flavors and texture didn't work for me. My friends got the chicken and waffles and the fried chicken benedict, both were really yummy!!! We also tried the cannoli donuts, those were freaking awesome! I would love to go back and try more of their food!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. crab benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. cannoli donuts

eDR0E6k8OGf5cMioPHhwSg.text: Yeah. I was so excited to try this place. I love hash.. And didn't even realize the amazing pancake options. We were greeted by friendly staff and were welcomed in the entrance with a very impressive bloody mary bar... Too bad I don't like bloody marys. Oh well. Seated. Ordered. Both of us tried hashes. I was torn between pancakes and hash, but I felt I should go with the restaurants name sake should be the item to try first. It only makes sense... But oh those pancakes... Ugh. And then it was down hill. The restaurant was pretty quiet so it wasn't like our server was overwhelmed. Literally watched the employee gossip unfold as I stared at my empty coffee cup. I dramatically drained my last tiny drop to kinda say hey.... This is a breakfast place and coffee should be free flowing.... But no. The coffee was on lock down. Hmm. Not happy. This girl wants hot coffee and without getting plenty of refill options the points drop. Then food comes out. It looks good, sounds fancy for hash, and looks like plenty to eat. Oh wait.. The biscuits that come with the meal are still cooking. Oh OK. Sounds good. Doesn't matter anyway.. I have no coffee. So it takes half a meal to get hot sauce. The biscuits were forgotten and the moment she remembered she had just picked up the coffee pot and I thought my dreams were coming True... Then she put it down to go get biscuits. Basically my hash was lacking the flavors the menu described. I finally was able to get more coffee at the last bite of my meal. I didn't eat meat if my potatoes because they were bland. And the biscuits... No butter. No jelly or jam. They had a sweet light coating on them... But it wasn't enough to make me want to eat the. I was pretty disappointed. However I will probably go back one more time to try for better service and the pancakes... Because they do sound good. Hopefully round two will have some kinks worked out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast!!!  Hungry anyone?

d9iU6sZfftHlQVj9CObD2Q.text: My life is changed. This is the best breakfast joint I've ever been to. And I really like breakfast.  Update: came here again. Still the best. Lona is my girl. Bloody Mary's here are amazing!!!

EQX-3fz57IPnYgPy2H5JIg.text: Farm house hash is awesome been there many times with the exception of one dish for me everything was really good. Service is good again couple of piss haps but overall Really, Really Good!

6gEUtgzHC2c1rsK6winGWw.text: Really creative menu. They offer healthy options as well as fantastic hash bowls for those looking for morning after night out food. Love the delicious Bloody Mary bar and custom Mimosa flights! Delicious! Can't wait to go back!

aRZPypfWBehiIUKZsd_AZA.text: Great place to eat! Awesome food and a lively atmosphere. The breakfast menu has lots of good suggestions to try. It is an open restaurant and it reminds me of LA.

ZBK9mcpUMvF55RICebbU1A.text: This breakfast place has good food and we would go there again.. the bigger thing to understand is this is not a good place if you want to eat with friends and chat, or have a nice meal with your spouse..The live music or DJ is so loud you get a headache eating.. if they seat you outside there is no space between you and the people waiting for eat..   The bigger thing is once you finish the make an overt effort to get you to leave.. very embarrassing for the employees and the manager who show up at your tase trying to take even more stuff off to get you to leave.  With practices like that they will not be in business Long.

SmXxsdEaOCLDmObwZIAAwA.text: Oh my goodness, this was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. It was tough to make a decision (bacon board?? Lemon marscaone pancakes?) But finally I chose the Pretzel Benedict. A huge pretzel with eggs, bacon, and beer cheese sauce y'all. It was as glorious as I imagined it would be. And from what I saw on the other tables (the pancake stacks are  HUGE), nobody leaves here unsatisfied.

RR09xAs2K3hHK8nD18EQog.text: Great reviews but this place was underwhelming. The presentation and service were great. The food was just average.

K15szcEys2vTTL9AQdexXw.text: Long wait but worth it ! The Bloody Mary bar is the best in Phoenix ....and they have a full bar . This place gets packed on weekends because it's perfect for groups. We went for a birthday celebration and everyone loved it. I had the boring Benedict which was great, though I regretted that because everything else looked bomb. This place is the spot for weekend brunch in Gainey.

w_MkuBTeXxZ-g9Si1_Kyeg.text: YESSS! Delicious chicken and waffles! I came here with a friend but we had to split the entree because we were so full from the Bloody Mary bar (the jalapeno poppers are bomb at the bar are bomb). Overall, this place has delicious food. I'd definitely come back to try other brunch items on the menu. The biggest downside to this place is probably the noise. This place was popppin with a DJ and very loud people. This wouldn't normally bother me but I could hardly hear my friend sitting across em so if they toned down the music just a bit, it'd probably help. The service is a bit slow but expected because this place is so popular. The servers were also really friendly so we didn't mind the slow service as much. Also, we were told the wait time would be 2 hours by but it was only 20 min so that was awesome! Other than that, the overall environment/look of this place is pretty awesome.

Uz8p8Z6aY9K4BDLZNqnx2w.text: Awesome corn cakes, fun Sunday morning DJ with the obligatory disco ball, amazing Bloody Mary bar. Our server, Jessica was THE BEST!!! A perfect place to meet up with friends for brunch.

zCmn54K9HNMKu86Z3Q8DBA.text: Waited an hour to get seated after being quoted 30 min. Then waiter took 20 minutes to come to table. Service was very poor. Normally receive great service but not today. Very sad.

gfIJH8NSiKmuiaGBE_1i3g.text: They have a a DJ! Best brunch spot in Scottsdale, will be coming back to try the mimosa flight . Jessica our server was great and attentive!

Yh93D4H6Ict-Z_10BYVFRw.text: OMG STOP! I wanted everything on the menu. I had an egg white scramble and coconut encrusted French toast - amazing! My only gripe was the music! Way too loud. I couldn't even talk to the person across from me. If it was a little lower I would have definitely enjoyed it. Overall atmosphere is fun! Will definitely go back to try everything else on the menu!!!

et5kQPb8zpdECE4NrrYolw.text: This place is all about aesthetic, not so much the flavor quality of food. Drinks are great. Very fun for drinks and conversation.

IgVDMt6Q7yjDW2ah3_Hqjw.text: Delicious food and a fun atmosphere. Came here for a Bach brunch and was extremely pleased with everything. Rachel the hostess was super nice and gave great recommendations. Matthew our server was also super nice and both took photos for us. Worth the wait!

gZcnUxYydXR3mU54Q9WqTg.text: We went to brunch this am and there was a DJ playing music so incredibly loud that we couldn't hear each other talk. That being said when the waiter did finally come to greet us at the table he put in the wrong latte (didn't hear me right I guess) and the lady that brought the drinks was guessing what kind of latte it was and got kinda snarky when I told her what it was supposed to be , as she eye rolled and said she would make another.  I didn't appreciate that at all..  The food was decent and all lot of it.  The waiter was not engaging but was nice however we had to ask for more water hot sauce etc.

G_RKDchsZhe3fZoqpxxyFg.text: Came here on a girls trip and had the time of our lives! Great Bloody Mary bar and food! We will be back!

x1O4PGntLZbscXNN3ni9jw.text: Too loud. The food is mediocre at best. Miserable dining experience..... it's 10am on a Sunday and loud as a club! I used to love this place. Used to give you a complimentary biscuit with meal and had Lavazza coffee. Not anymore!  DJ used to start at 11am, now it's fist pumping time at 9/10am. Get ready to scream, Vegas club style while eating your Sunday bfast.

TlJy5TWLkD7vcvUx1mIQuA.text: Always a cool and funky place to be! A very creative and interesting menu always catches my eye. The Cereal shooters are awesome and so are there pancakes! The only catch is that I find this place changed their menu quite often, so it might be hard to catch a regular crowd that way... but still a great place for brunching it!

ajRMULZdvI72A36jjV9N2g.text: We r a family of 5 came here for brunch in a Saturday they had a DJ going and a blood Mary bar. I got a Bloody Mary for a whopping $15. The food was ok nothing great. I ordered the chilaquiles and they forgot to put the fine Mexican cheese called Cojita on top and I didn't eat it. I tasted all he kids plates and pancakes and thought it was ok nothing that great and honestly pretty forgettable. Even the coffee tasted strong and bitter. Food took forever and service was lousy barely checked on us. I was gonna ask for the cojita cheese myself to put on my chilaquiles but no one bothered to check on us or ask if we needed anything. They removed it from our bill and the bitter coffee too and our bill came to $70 for 5 people. Music was a bit loud felt like a nightclub scene. It's great for a young college, single crowd not so much families with kids.

_t0iEB3IfzpwFBsCN-OCdQ.text: Update for another 5 stars! Stopped in for another fabulous breakfast! Just want to give a shout out to Lona for the fabulous service! Always a pleasure to sit at the bar with Lona! Best bartender in town!   We went for breakfast this weekend and this place is fabulous! I had the Mexicana Scrambler and it was fabulous!  My husband ordered eggs over easy style and he said they came out perfect!  I love love the Bloody Mary bar and the DJ!  This is a great place for breakfast/brunch!  Great place to ride your bike to breakfast.  Another fabulous weekend at the Hash to celebrate my Birthday! Evan took care of our table while Lona was behind the bar mixing up our fabulous odrinks! As always Bonnie is the best hostess! 5 stars for all of the staff at the Hash! Y'all all rock

2KeF_F_Emjq_atUNPBlDUw.text: Thank you Lona for making my birthday special! The food was great, we will be back to visit you Lona

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thank you Lona for helping make this birthday a great one!

YBXmEOwDAgu86a27dKI0CA.text: Absolutely incredible breakfast!! Not sure where to begin...the service was outstanding and the menu was packed with creative and classic breakfast items. Their cocktails were even more impressive as they had an impressive offering of various mimosas and their Bloody Mary bar was gigantic! The passion fruit mimosa was by far my favorite although the grapefruit was a close second. There was a great bacon app that we started with and had a bunch of thick pieces of bacon seasoned a few different ways. I ordered the money cristo sandwich and it was by far one of the tastiest things I've ever had! The park ales were huge as well. Another one of us ordered those and they filled up the plate with a stack of 4 pancakes! The atmosphere was awesome and put off a great vibe. I've heard there is also a DJ over the weekend so we'll just have to keep coming back to take in the full experience. Hopefully they open up many more!

mV6U1K_VJHxGIhyC_iBmRg.text: Honestly, if you have been to one breakfast place, you have been to them all. Pancakes, eggs, same old, same old. BUT Hash Kitchen is delicious. Everything we order is out of this world. They always have a unique twist on a classic which makes it fun.  The music can be a bit loud for us, especially at 9 am on a Sunday morning, but it does add to the fun atmosphere.  I highly highly recommend this place for breakfast!!

tAVT4S0Bohqt1T_8JM729g.text: To be honest, as soon as I entered the restaurant, I smiled! At first, I was looking at the food at other people's tables and I died. Literally, it gave me chills to try out the food! I only ordered 2 dishes, one for dessert and one for brunch... they were so good. However, I really want them to work on their plating! It is TOO BIG. I know it's an American breakfast cuisine but it's too much, adjusting to the right portion would do the trick!

eSYiM8HoF1AeTpKPcdm1-g.text: We were in town for the weekend for a Bucs game and decided to give this place a try before the game. The restaurant itself was packed when we got there around 1030am on a Sunday. We were told that it'd be about a 25-30 minute wait but they actually got us in within 15 minutes. The place was packed, lots of people and the DJ was loud but in a fun way. We ordered the Paella Hash and the Breakfast Cannelloni. Both had good flavor but i'd probably pass on the paella hash. Although tasty, it wasn't what we were expecting. The Breakfast Cannelloni was superb though. Good place to try, I'd probably be back again once I try other brunch spots.

Zpb_FqUJBiBstZRaT7BVsA.text: This restaurant not only has amazing food & Lattes but also one great owner/management (Mrs. Bonnie).. She's one phenomenal & sassy lady who knows how to mingle with her customers and make them feel welcomed!! I'll definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6S0DKOjtFtMCh8gUc38O3w.text: What a cool brunch spot! I did not partake in the Bloody Mary bar but it looked amazing. Some of the add ins my friend got were fried ravioli, bacon, hard boiled egg, celery, and slim jims.  I ordered the Monte Cristo and it was delicious! Perfect sweet and savory dish.  And Bonnie, their guest relations manager, is the bomb!! She runs around dancing and getting everyone in the mood for a good day of brunching. Definitely will be back!

jQKVtVbc6zvVKITxvNJjtg.text: The service itself was good and the build your own bloody mary was delicious! I ordered the salmon eggs benedict and it was weirdly sweet.... And not in a good way.  I felt disgusted eating the dish. I believe it was the biscuit served with it. The biscuit tasted more like a pastry. My boyfriend ordered the hash huevos rancheros. The dish was bland in flavor and the biscuit was once again weirdly sweet. We also ordered french toast to share and that was good, once again really sweet but we ordered a sweet french toast so we got what we ordered. Would we come back to this place, no. The savory dishes are not savory and are lacking flavor. They are also weirdly sweet.

gGsRfbgxheipCMPHWI9RnA.text: After waiting 30-45 minutes to be seated, the wait for drinks was even longer. We ordered the mimosa flights which seemed to take forever and then were told they were out glasses because another party of 10 had taken them (huh?) It was only 3 to our party. When our drinks finally arrived, the guy told us "sorry you guys don't get them on a board, we're out". The food was mediocre to say the least. I will not be returning to this place. Very disappointed.

qJhFIpSF1sdWochz6T9yDQ.text: Tried this restaurant out on a whim today. Amazing Bloody Mary bar (if you're into that), great mimosas, generous portions, great service, and reasonable prices. We will definitely be coming back to the Hash Kitchen next time we're in Scottsdale.

1El-Olmgay42LeDpEv3X9g.text: Delicious and good portions. I enjoyed the coffee a lot too!  Service was good, however think a little more attention to the floor could be improved, cue in to the amount of food and when you bring the bill if you are going to wait late to give it. I would rather have the bill sit there from the early part then to need to leave and can't because the attention isn't cued in that I am sitting not eating and want to go, waving down isn't something I feel proper to do, but did both times I came to dine in.

WiGFf7HFk8Fibplv4luObw.text: If your coming to drink & party it up, this spot is for you. If your looking for good food and service, this probably isn't your spot. Neither of us are drinkers, so we can't say anything about the alcohol, although that seams to be their only focus, cuz the food defiantly wasn't. My husband wanted a simple "pancake meal" eggs, a couple pancakes, & some bacon; the most basic breakfast item in the country right?? Well not here! If you want that, it's all ale carte....adding up to over 20$ for a couple cakes, eggs & bacon. They don't have that basic meal. He got the French toast, dry & uncooked on the inside with hard as heck butter to go along (one of my biggest peeves, how are u suppose to spread that stuff?? I got a skillet with straight MUSH sweet potatoes & carnitas was just meh....if your coming to booze it up & party this is your spot. If your looking for good food, take a PASS

8TmTOReIBNl2nzHcyGoD9g.text: Love this place, the best food, the best bloody Mary bar, and the staff is so nice:)  Anytime I get together with friends we always go here..

Yo719h_5f8MnbEo7zTAsvw.text: Awesome customer service!!! My family and I truly enjoyed our food and experience!!  They even had gluten free and vegan options! Two thumbs UP!!

-VAwH83rviIgu9_el-oKSQ.text: Best Bloody Mary bar and incredible food. This is my favorite brunch place in Scottsdale. The Bloody Mary in itself could be a whole meal and is a great deal for the amount of toppings you can get on your drink

vqKYs1muyPGXORjdRTRYAg.text: Very creative menu but not impressed with the quality of the eggs or hash browns. The burger was excellent and I drooled over the French toast passing by.

LP-kQo3qZ_2nITg540P4jA.text: We went here yesterday for the first time and we will definitely be going back. The ambience is light and fun, the menu is huge and everything looks so good it was difficult to decide. They have a huge Bloody Mary bar if that's your thing. I ordered a mimosa and it was delicious. The wait staff was great and for a Saturday morning, the wait was only about 10 minutes. Definitely adding this to my rotation of regular brunch places.

C0_-fMLrfhlU6H5qrVbbPA.text: This place was amazing. I had the French Toast, my wife had the Scramblers, and my daughter had the kids Eggs and Bacon.  It was easily the best Breakfast that we had while in Scottsdale, it was very nice and the staff was great, especially Bonnie. From what you hear there is a good chance of meeting celebrity sports figures here on a regular occasion.  I would recommend this to anyone who ask.

Z9LWvbEY-KI5mzbBDuHakw.text: I read about them in Phoenix magazine. I was looking forward to see their gluten free menu. The waitress said we don't have any gluten free menus, they "were never printed." Since it's called HASH kitchen, I figured I'd try one of their hash skillets. It comes in an individual cast iron skillet with potatoes on the bottom and an egg on top. It started out very good, however all the potatoes that were touching the cast iron tasted just like hot fish! Yuck! I suspect they use the same skillet for something with fish or crab in it. That strong fishy flavor ruined the dish. They should reserve skillets just for those orders. The cannoli donuts also were friend in oil not reserved for a sweet donut. You could taste savory flavored foods that were fried in the same oil on the outside of the donuts. Tasted like fried onions. My coffee cup had old lipstick from other patrons on the outside. I really wanted this place to be good. The photos of their food look so enticing! Too bad. I hope they change some cooking procedures in the future because it could be good.

gZ-yUkhUJ-kcbHwR_rD2zA.text: First time at The Hash Kitchen.  We love trying different breakfast places on the weekends but they are limited on who allows dogs.  My wife had been searching and found this place and she knows I love my hash.  We took our dog to the dog park on Sunday morning at Chaparral Park and then went over to the Hash Kitchen at Gainey Ranch.  We arrived around 9am with a few people waiting and requested a table on the patio.  Our wait was very short and we were seated.  Our waiter was out quick to greet us with water and to find out what other beverages we wanted.  I guess they are popular for a Bloody Mary Bar but we aren't drinkers so we went with a very bold house coffee. When he returned with our coffee he answered questions that we had regarding the various items on the menu placed our order.    A wonderful lady by the name of Bonnie stopped by our table to see how we were doing and to check if we needed any thing.  After Bonnie realized it was our first time here she shared some of the other wonderful items that are favorites of the regulars.  She sent out a complimentary order of biscuits and jam which was wonderful with our coffee while we waited for our food.  I ordered the Leg of Lamb Hash and my wife had the Carnitas Hash.  Wow!  So much flavor in both dishes and plenty of food for us to share with each other.  My Leg of Lamb was so tender and rich over the potatoes and was topped with 2 poached eggs & fried leeks.  The Carnitas was mild in spice but full of flavor which is totally fine with wifey.  Shes not a fan of spicy hot and was hesitant at first to get this but our waiter explained that the Green Chili Sauce Crema was tomatillos based and just a small amount of chili's is added.  We really enjoyed both and decided we will be making plenty of future visits here to try many of the other options on the menu.  Bonnie stopped by again to see how everything was and I have to say that all of the staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Only one complaint; talk to Waste Management company to schedule a different time of the week to empty the dumpsters.  A distraction from what was a wonderful morning on the patio enjoying a great meal - see you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Leg of Lamb Hash

td-Ag-ZrMolKKTvlStlK1w.text: Went here for brunch on a Sunday. Service was soooooo very slow. I saw other people eat and leave before we even got our food.  They have a build your own Bloody Mary bar which is cool but the line was super long. They did offer tons of stuff to add to your drink. Our food was average at best. I heard the biscuits were delicious, mine was hard and lacked flavor.

vh9qqoisQ-LDI5f4xSW64g.text: This place is amazing!!! We had the best server and the manager also took such great care of us, we were calling her "Mama Linda" by the end of our meal. Both our server and Mama Linda suggested the lemon ricotta pancakes and I haven't been able to stop thinking about them since we had them. My mouth is literally watering right now and I've told everyone how amazing these pancakes are!!! They have the best Bloody Mary bar I've ever seen, cheese sticks, pickled everything, and house made tomato juice. Besides the magical pancakes, we had the fried chicken Benedict, YES. The combination of the hollandaise sauce and maple syrup reduction was outstanding. Btw, we also had the cannoli donuts. #bestbreakfastEVER

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The BEST pancakes EVER - lemon ricotta goodness. I miss them...
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Benedict, DIY Bloody Mary, cannoli donut, carnitas hash, side biscuits and gravy (homemade sausage), and French press.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli donuts - the perfect combination of a donut and a cannoli. Paired perfect with my French press.

Iw-GjGmVHh45h56dnZypkw.text: Came on a Saturday about noon for a late brunch. DJ was playing music and the place was hoppin . The food and drinks were very good. We shared the breakfast cereal cocktail flight, and I also had a White Russian. My wife and I shared the veggie frittata and some pancakes. Perfect balance of sweet and savory. Staff was super friendly. The bartender thought she made my drink too strong and came over to offer to remake it. Our waiter was great and made sure the water and coffee was fresh. Great brunch environment and I'd highly recommend.

jwEz3QzY8-kOzUablZhaVg.text: The ambiance and decor was beautiful. When you walk in, you're greeted with this gorgeous fully stocked Bloody Mary bar with pickled everything. We had a group of 4 and came in around 2pm for Sunday brunch - luckily there was no wait for an outdoor table. We ordered the mimosa flight, which I strongly recommend; it came with 4 generous portions of pineapple, blueberry, strawberry and orange mimosas.   We ordered the lemon ricotta pancake as a starter which was light, not too sweet and delicious! We also ordered the hash huevos rancheros with the huevos on the side and without the meat. Also ordered the impossible burger with a side of fries. The presentation for both were promising! However, the hash huevos rancheros tasted bland and was overpowered by the number of potatoes in the meal. Really wish they had added a more flavorful sauce/salsa/guacamole to make this more tasteful  especially considering that hash is their main product.   The impossible burger, on the other hand, was delicious! Overall, I enjoyed the mimosa bar and the lemon ricotta pancakes but was not thrilled by the hash.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Impossible burger
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros without huevos

Yq6437ZYrLAWroFvBw4plA.text: Tasty breakfast fare at Hash Kitchen.  In town for a few days, and up very early on East coast time, stopped in at Hash Kitchen. There were only a few tables taken, and we were promptly seated outside.  This location is free-standing in outdoor mall. Outside seating is along the side and the back of the building, so you can sit in full sun or in the shade.  Our server, Matthew, did great work. He explained the menu, food delivered as ordered and kept our coffee and iced tea full, plus offered a couple of iced teas to go. Thank you!  Seems like if you go to Hash Kitchen, you have to try.... The hash!  Mine was served in a cast iron skillet atop home fries and topped with a pair of sunny-side up eggs. The hash was good, if unimaginative - diner style with diced corned beef and potatoes, seared to a crisp crust on the griddle.  Eggs perfect with plenty of yolk for dipping. Home fries were crispy, but needed some peppers, onions and spices to pump them up.  This was good, but for $14 at a place called Hash Kitchen I was expecting something  more creative.   The chicken tinga was excellent.  A fluffy moist fritatta is covered with shredded chicken simmered in tomatoes, chipotle chilis in adobo, and sliced onions.  This was garnished with a big slice of avocado, cotija cheese, sour cream and cilantro.  With a dash of Tabasco, this is a mouthwatering combination.  Food here is good. The tab was $40 with coffee so too expensive for everyday breakfast.  Other things to try on the menu.... I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken tinga
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_i9liVdHUWMxqeVHB_PqmQ.text: The doughnuts were bomb, but unfortunately I wasn't impressed with everything else.. Portions are massive, so if you like to stuff yourself with food it mat be the place for you. Besides the fantastic doughnuts I have ordered salmon eggs benedict but they tasted weird.. instead of a traditional English muffin they were served on a very hard sweet kinda scone.. I could not eat that.. our server was kind enough to take it back.. we also ordered the mimosas.. tasting ok but the fruits they were decorated with have seen some better days.. the strawberry looked dehydrated.. and none of it was fresh  Place was packed and I think i have seen only one server.. it was a mission impossible to provide a decent service.. even though our waitress was very sweet and nice we waited for our food almost an hour..  in overall it wasn't a bad experience but I don't think I will be going back anytime soon

3IXp_9amyPgofcUsl7BiPA.text: We finally tried this place!! The biscuits were amazing!! I don't know what they put in them, but they were the bomb!!   I tried the Mimosa flight and impressed the blueberries actually bobbed!  The orange and pineapple were fair and the strawberry was tasty.   Hubby loved his biscuits and gravy and I enjoyed the fried chicken Benedict.  They infuse all of their vodka which is the bomb. Hubby was not a fan of the bacon infused and didn't love the Bloody Mary, but the original hit the spot.   Will try the other locations and give the Bloody Mary bar a shot next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight

iYxuhhs76UxSmRDFiUs7pg.text: I finally made it in to Hash Kitchen and it was just how I had dreamt it would be! We came early on a Sunday morning (at 8 AM) and it was the perfect time because it wasn't too packed yet! It was pretty full though, so I would suggest coming earlier than later. I assume they get a pretty crazy wait as the morning goes on.  Of course, we had to partake in their famous Bloody Mary bar. You go up to the special bar, pick a vodka (I got jalapeno), pick a salt rim, pick a mix type, and then fill 'er on up with all the goods! They have LOADS of pickled veggies (my mouth is watering just typing this), cheeses, meats, peppers, you name it - they've got it. It was SO yummy! If you're a Bloody Mary fanatic like me, this will literally make all of your dreams come True.  For my entree, I got their pretzel benedict which was lathered in beer cheese hollandaise. Um, WHAT?! So. Dang. Good. Yeah, it was probably my week's worth of calories but oh so worth it!  This is such a fun spot to come with a group or if you're REAL hungry for a hearty breakfast. Our server was also quick and super friendly. The food came out fast and hot! I can't wait to come back again and am super excited for their Arcadia location to open.

Lj1Nh8jMYHL8S7FjI_ahtw.text: We drove up to Hash for brunch for my sister's 21st Bday. The layout inside is bright and open which we enjoyed; the bar was beautiful and the table settings gave it a subtle elegant feel. We got a flight of mimosas - lime, strawberry, kiwi, and orange. I loved the strawberry and enjoyed the other three as well. I believe the juice used in each was fresh which was a nice touch. To eat I got the hash with tons of crispy friend onions over chicken breast. The chicken and onions were tasty! There was quite a bit of oil though, but it wasn't to heavy. It is definitely enough food for two meals which I liked. My sister got the frittata with Italian sausage and found it bland. For the price I think I'd consider other places for brunch but I enjoyed my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. crispy fried onions hash

RtZ2Lz3kuX-T19_-NnpQ4g.text: Hash Kitchen is now one of my favorite brunch places! The variety of drinks from mimosa flights to adult Capri suns to mini disco balls to cereal shots certainly keeps things entertaining. All the drinks were pretty reasonably priced as well.  As for the food, I think the portions were spectacular. I got a hash brown stack eggs Benedict and was very satisfied by the amount of potatoes I ate in the span of two hours. You'll definitely have enough to take home for leftovers as well. All in all, 9/10! The only complaint was the misters weren't quite facing the right direction and as a result, sitting outside in the Arizona summer was a bit painful.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cereal shots!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight

DFwwf2fr-kXO1FqQ-SS_QQ.text: Hash, Hash baby....... Alright stop, and listen.    Hip, modern trendy eatery with a live DJ captures the young and want to be seen peeps, a trendy hot spot for sure.   The service is attentive & accommodating, love the ambiance and layout of restaurant. They are making all the right moves with marketing and creativity from food presentation that are IG worthy.   Our food was good but not over the top, the Cannoli pancakes are a great creative twist but failed with the syrup that should of complimented these pancakes.... a little dry if you didn't have tons of syrup.  The corn beef hash skillet didn't have enough corn beef and what I can't stand Sysco bagged potatoes, that gets me sad. I don't like eateries that don't utilize fresh cut potatoes, let me tell you "it's disturbing"  My herb chicken Benedict was the noteworthy part of the morning.   All in all "Hey Mister D.J. Put a record on, I want to dance with my baby"  "music makes the people come together"

jPhrwFctn03zRVimmlWOew.text: They really do have the best bloody mary bar.. omg.  I tried to come here once before and it was a 45 minute wait, so I left. I came back today and it was only a 25 minute wait. Pro tip: You can start your bloody Mary and make it at the bar while you wait for your table to be prepared. By the time I was done making my Bloody Mary today, my table was ready!  The Bloody Marys were wonderful. My friend also ordered some cereal milk shooters, which were good as well. The food was as good as you expect for a good brunch place. I ordered a hash, which was good.. and a lot of food, so I have some to bring home.   One note: it does get a little loud there because there is a DJ during brunch time.   I am excited that they opening another outpost in Arcadia in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros hash.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody marys... yes!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cereal shooter flight.

MBmJXEZ2hXGapozMVhhm9g.text: Such a good brunch spot. The bloody Mary bar is comparable to my home state of Wisconsin and if you're looking for a good one, look no further!! The cannoli pancakes are one of my favorites!!

1K87f7CWXbp6AKslMStaKw.text: Finally checked out Hash Kitchen and it didn't disappoint! They have a very diverse breakfast menu and plenty of boozy drink creations if that's your thing. I especially love their selection of sweet breakfast items (pancakes, french toast, etc.). Everything sounded so good, it was hard to pick. I went with the banana split brioche french toast. It was awesome! Just the presentation alone was to die for. It had an upside-down ice cream cone on top which was filled with vanilla cream. Sooo good! The french toast was thick cut and buttery. I also had a mimosa flight, which was really good. I need to go back again so I can get the cereal shooter flight and the cannoli donuts! Their build-your-own bloody mary bar looked impressive....it's just too bad that bloody marys aren't my thing.

Yd_wqWl1DAXKmIEZiIhRTw.text: Used to go there quite a bit but the food and service have definitely slipped. So many better dining options...

CmXcXt1U2xQiMN-H9PdnRg.text: A group of 8 came for a late brunch on Saturday. Although they said they dont' take reservations they kindly accomodated us when I called ahead for our large group. This was a great place for brunch, especially with their 40 topping Bloody Mary bar! I'm not personally a huge fan of a Bloody Mary but I couldn't resist! You can personalize your drink down from the flavored vodka to all the toppings you can carry! Tip: there are meatballs and fried ravioli at the end of the topping bar that's included in your Bloody Mary bar too!  The portions for the food are large and I must say I was especially amazed by my giant avocado toast that I couldn't finish!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PrmnRSLrG020NDrUcz4mCw.text: Now I completely get why Hash Kitchen has over 2k 4.5 star reviews! It's rare that you find a brunch spot that has a quality food, hip and trendy flares and impeccable customer service.  The Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar was of course a huge influence in my choice to visit Hash Kitchen. It was even better than I imagined. Hash kitchen infuses their own vodka with flavors and you get to choose what flavor you would like along with the rim flavor and level of spiciness (mild, Med, hot). The menu is a mix of creative apps and entrees. I had trouble deciding what to order so I turned to Yelp reviews. I landed on the Cannoli Donuts and Cristina's Tamale Cakes. Since I don't eat red meat the server suggested replacing the pork with avocado. It was absolutely delicious! I would definitely order that dish again.  The table next to mine ordered the breakfast shooters. They looked like so much fun and were very decorative. If I get the chance to go back I will order them! Caution: If you are looking for a laid-back quiet family breakfast, Hash Kitchen is not for you. They play hip club like music at a higher level and encourage a young fun crowd. The cost for my entire meal plus the Build Your Own Bloody Mary it was only 40 bucks, extremely affordable!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Receipt
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Several patio areas with misters

MIhsN-YE_evlZOQRegzljw.text: Omg!! Amazing..  Bloody Mary bar was so much fun..they have every additional topping you could imagine. They pour the alcohol and mix you add the rest and make your own creations. We order the poutine corned beef hash and split because we planned on a "dessert" French toast.  Service was awesome. Danielle was our server she was very accommodating and we did not feel rushed at all. The bartender from the Bloody Mary bar stopped by and asked us how we liked our drink. She was also great , Dee. Very friendly very clean. Just ordered our dessert holy Toledo.. so so good. I'll be back. The only thing I wish is we had one in R.I..

-rdT2agDLmytlLPOheBzlw.text: We finally tried this place! We had heard great things about the food and  atmosphere, it did not disappoint.  Food: individuals at our table had corn beef hash, Mexican scramble and fried chicken; each was outstanding.  Drink: Two of us got the Bloody Mary bar(everything from vegetables, pickles, olives, meats and Slim Jim's) and a flight of mimosas. Desert: we had the flight of cereal shots which included Fruity Pebbles, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, Captain Crunch and Coco Puffs, fun idea and taste outstanding, great end to our breakfast brunch.  Service: excellent our server was attentive, fun and informative. All in all it was an awesome experience, we will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cereal Shots Flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosas Flight

Ak5fuAOv2okK8A6y6cGo_A.text: Woah! This place is so unique and fun! We came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch and it was packed! There's a DJ and it's super loud and fun. There was about a 30 minute wait but we walked up to the bar and ordered bloody Mary's. They have tons of Bloody Mary options (Classic $10, Bloody Mary bar where you choose your toppings $13, and various flavored ones that come in a bag and are named after blood types). They also have flavored mimosas and a mimosa flight that seemed really popular. They have tons of food options (mainly brunch but also lunch options). We ordered the avocado toast and it was HUGE. It looks like it's made for a giant. It was covered in delicious braised pork and bacon jam with a green chili hollandaise on the side-highly recommend! The portions are definitely big enough to split and the bloody Mary's are practically a meal in itself. Our server, Matthew, was great! We probably won't come here regularly because it's loud and the meals and drinks are heavy but we'll definitely bring friends and family here, especially when visiting from out of town! I highly recommend you check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. B- Bloody Mary in a bag- jalapeño vodka w/ tomatillo bloody mix (spicy and delicious- not your typical Bloody Mary)
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Original bloody Mary&#39;s (yum!)

opdsdCUEYzPVAwJKJwmi6A.text: A couple of weekends ago we finally tried The Hash Kitchen . I had had this place on my bookmarks for awhile as I love the owners/ management who also happen to operate The Sicilian Butcher , ( a favorite!, in PV); Tomaso's, ( another favorite ) and Tomaso's When In Rome. I'm posting because some of it we loved .. and some of it .. we didn't. You should be the judge! Maybe we are just old!  The vibe was a bit like a day club.. BUT.. with breakfast !  As there was a DJ booth and a bar in the center; complete with spinning silver disco balls .. IT.WAS.LOUD. It made us wonder what age group The Hash Kitchen is attempting to lure in. My husband and I don't consider ourselves completely 'old' .. But GOOD grief ! I want to eat brunch with maybe less EDM at the loudest volume you could find on a weekend morning. You almost had to shout the order to the waitress. We didn't find it busy on this particular weekend day.. and that in itself, was odd for this area. We were served water with lemon right away; a mimosa ; and coffees..  the waitress was attentive UP until we ordered the food. Our starter , a Salmon Charcuterie Board , ( really good , btw !) and main , ( Huevos Rancheros Skillet , which was tasteless) , came out together. We wanted the charcuterie board as a starter ... as it's called? Again, having found the Huevos Rancheros Skillet , ( we shared this ), tasteless and it had these awful crispy , greasy fried onions on top; the poached eggs we ordered over easy to top the skillet  , were done, NOT over easy. We were brain storming to pep' up the taste and could not get our waitress back to our table for anything. It's a little bit of a pet peeve when food is delivered by a runner and the waitress doesn't come back in a few moments to check to see if it's actually to your satisfaction. Well.. this was the case , and they were not busy and seemingly had all these waiters hovering around. We asked for sour cream and salsa , when she finally came back .. probably 15 minutes later. Then another 8-10 minutes later she came back to tell us she had NO actual salsa but came with a bottle of Cholula sauce and no sour cream either. The waitress said they had 'crema' and we said that would work... BUT, again, she didn't return with the crema. We asked for the bill.. and when she asked if all was okay.. well , I said .. no. But, in the fashion of some millennials .. she didn't seem to care. She said with a half smile , 'Oh.' Hands us the bill and we left , unimpressed. . Our waters had gone dry. My mimosa was great ... but also .. now empty.. with no care or concern from the waitress. So unlike the other restaurants in this group that owns The Hash Kitchen .. this left anything but a great taste in our mouths. Return factor? meh. Too loud on the music  ; Too few on the care decibels.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blueberry Mimosa -$6

x6jNhHfff3txcaDS7u-1oA.text: Caveat: I'm Celiac and need food that's truly gluten-free without cross contamination. If you're in that position this place was more like a 3 as you can mostly only have the scrambles and frittatas. The kitchen/manager were a little uncomfortable when they found out I was Celiac. Otherwise most of the food looks amazing and probably is around 4.5 stars.  We came here for brunch and got the bacon board. That was very good but without actual gluten-free bread to put it on was just a lot of bacon. My wife loved it with the mini bagels they brought out.  My wife also got a Bloody Mary which looked amazing.  I ordered the Sicilian Frittata & my wife ordered Mexicana Scramble. I really enjoyed the frittata and my wife said the scramble was like most everywheelse, solid, not bad. I would mainly be cautious with their gluten-free designations if you're allergy or intolerance is sensitive as most share a fryer or are cross-contaminated in some way. They did the frittata in a clean pan which was very nice!  We will definitely come back with friends!

xkbCwoZkbxmjeEKoxl0A9A.text: Chicken and Waffles were great! Also had mamas cold brew w/ Whiskey.  Overall a great dining experience with the family.  We sat outside on the patio which was very nice as well.  I will definitely be returning to this place for brunch next time I'm in Scottsdale!

80bi38_oH9yicWtzETJeoA.text: Obsessed with the Benny's and the bloody mary bar! The lady at the front is always so welcoming and sweet (i wish i could remember her name) She always remembers me and my pup ! She even brings her her own bowl and water glass :)

tIdLir1m2IMfsWzps3Gbtw.text: Marcus was the best server! He was very accommodating, great suggestions, and made sure that we had a good time. Phenomenal food too!

otBdo2Oq0L0Tnc50vrcApQ.text: Amy and Jenn were fantastic. Mimosa flight on point! Had the Thai chicken salad, deliciousness! Trust me I'm a fatso!

pFRYZqlK0mSA3vTWzWtW8w.text: An all around fantastic establishment, from the Bloody Mary bar, to Bonnie (who was the best), to the food. 5 stars!

JPhO1Rlx4WiJLl2plVKGvQ.text: This review is a little late, but we really liked our experience at Hash Kitchen. We were visiting from Lubbock, Texas and were meeting up with old college friends. We looked at online reviews and stumbled upon Hash Kitchen. We are pretty picky about our food units and restaurants and wanted something unique, good vibe and great service. HK certainly lived up to that. We sat outside side and the service was great. They were serving their Holiday menu and it was great. You definitely need to try the Cannoli donut. We shared it with our entire table! I had French toast with caramelized bananas. We didn't visit the Bloody Mary bar, but it looked amazing. We opted for mimosas instead. The music wasn't loud and allowed us to enjoy our conversation. The shopping center was also very nice; clean and modern. If I lived in Scottsdale, I'd eat breakfast here all the time. We will definitely be back the next time we are in the Valley of the Sun.

o-rO8HNIeVO_zRSdtS-IcA.text: This is a great place to go for breakfast / brunch where the menu is just different enough from the typical breakfast restaurants, but there is still something for all tastes.  There's usually a wait on a weekend morning but the service is efficient and the food is terrific.  We went to celebrate a birthday and Bonnie ensured we were happy with our meal and service.  She and our server arranged for a nice dessert for the birthday celebration.   If you like Bloody Mary's this is the place to build your own and add almost anything to it, from ravioli's to bacon!

ZLRysOC9XX_7UBrujP4EUQ.text: Amy is amazingggg best breakfast EVER!!! Amy and Katie were very warm and happy and welcoming best customer service

YZgGLnC84Pav7WO91eS4VQ.text: Quality food but you can usually can expect slower service from this place and thats what turns me off from coming here on the regular for breakfast. They do have a lot of perks like their build your own bloody mary bar (not a fan but still attractive feature). Their mimosa float is bomb but it will probably take awhile to get to your table. The owners are kind, attentive, and seem to really care about the business which is nice to see.

tmFI9soi7XzPcZJLumaQag.text: Very good food and excellent customer service. The prices are a bit steep for breakfast food.

A5aG8cLLhpC8El_Fakgtfg.text: Wait too long.  Bloody Mary bar kept you busy.    Asked for bacon free meal, brought it out with bacon.  Asked to remake, only took the bacon off the bread and reserved.  Disregard for religious beliefs....unacceptable.

fkFBq8XCUyWdrdKPBbEE4Q.text: This place was phenomenal! Went for brunch and the food, drinks, and service were fantastic. The dishes were all incredibly unique and happily tailored to our individual likings. The waiter even helped make suggestions I would've never thought to make, like grilled chicken with Caprese Eggs Benedict. The Bloody Mary bar was absolutely fantastic and also unique--I only wish I were in town long enough to go on a Saturday; it sounds like a real treat. Our waiter, above all, was excellent and I'd love to go back.

xNSs_OciKt7w7KsT_kBQrA.text: Love this place!! The mimosa flight is one of my favorite and Bonnie is the absolute sweetest! Service is great, food is delicious, and it's an awesome atmosphere! Will definitely be back!

ro2cBkZBA9ZL4_WPz1BM7w.text: This place is so great! Beautiful food and drinks. Win win location, atmosphere and service! Thank you Bonnie-guest relations manager, for the amazing experience at your restaurant!

RcB61W5GnjLe-TaoaUvLLg.text: Awesome food, excellent service. Had the chicken and waffles add two over easy eggs. Cousin had the breakfast burrito. Both delicious!!! Great place for breakfast. Glad I live in LA or I'd be here every morning.

mO8di0-ZHydGQa6YSgmnUQ.text: Such a cool place! A huge group of girls I workout with at Jabz Boxing went there for a Sunday brunch. The Bloody Mary bar and mimosa flights were so delicious. A very cool concept. Definitely a place that I'll take all of my out-of-town visitors when the come to see me!

vczuO9zEICyhVSGoD98Hjw.text: This place is not a 5 star! It's a 10 star! The ambiance is amazing! The bloody marry bar....only a genius can come up with that idea! The food was delicious. Smoked brisket and eggs....amazing! The fried chicken with hash browns breakfast...even better! I am so glad we tried this place out! Can't wait  to come back!

sL91a7VSNCyk5t-3bkMaZA.text: Visited on march 21st and what an experience! I had the smoked salmon hash and it was incredible. Bonnie, who is part of the family of owners, was a sweetheart and Ohio born and bred just like me! Great experience, good service and super customer relations. Can't wait to return here!

I will go there again and recommend this place to people also

kglClvwVVg6ykH0f9yhWwg.text: Coffee was good, cornbeef scramble was good, scramble woth cornbread was a tad bit dry but still nothing to really complain about. We sat outside which was pleasant with the crisp breeze.

DZBkSItzudo1cd1v2-s4aw.text: Can't say I'm a fan of avocados. However I thoroughly enjoyed the avocado toast. The staff was friendly as well.  I generally like a place if they don't screw it up.  So the bar is high lol.  The food I had impressed me.  So there you go I even wrote a review

KJNxbno_B16BmxKj6au42w.text: This place had a bit of an odd vibe for a Sunday late morning brunch.  Music was a bit too loud, people were dressed up like they were going clubbing afterwards, and the food was just OK for breakfast fare.  I came here for food, not to go dancing...

IAp5y8pZfLMEm7nkmk37Mw.text: Jessica (Princess) is an absolute delight.  This is by far the best way to start your day.  Great food, great atmosphere, great staff.  The world would be a better place if there was a Hash Kitchen in every corner.  This restaurant is a must if you are in the area.

Wj_SutYY87IDKRK3Vrfjag.text: Good food, different atmosphere, on a Sunday they had a live DJ.  Very large portion size, seemed like they were famous for mimosas and Bloody Mary's.  Might be hard to get a table quickly on a weekend.  Younger generation crowed.  Hash seems to come from Hashtag.

vA7US3aWg_TdOyp2h6C3Dg.text: Love love love this place !!! Came in with some girlfriends on Sunday for brunch & not only was the food AMAZING, so was the service!! Our waitress was super friendly & attentive. & then halfway through the brunch, the manager stopped at our table & asked how everything was & made sure we were good. It was so genuine ! I noticed she was touching base with other tables as well. & i think that's so important & shows that the manager cares ! I've been to plenty of restaurants where you never see a manager & its nice to see one that's involved! It's also such a cute place & great environment for a brunch spot ! My friends & i can't wait to come back for our next Sunday funday !!

FJhfAgcQ1zkGKp5twF4eNw.text: Dominic was amazing and super personable at the door. The Bloody Mary bar is hands down best one in Arizona...being from WI where we master the Bloody Mary that is saying a lot. The food is fabulous as well...come with an appetite. And I love the vibe...can't beat the owner dancing around the place.

A3rOklavPGCrqgrAvMc3pg.text: Fun atmosphere, unique drinks and good food! The wait is unbelievable, but the people watching and Bloody Marys make it enjoyable.  #housewivesscottsdale

CgN8M_2bH6PR3Owu-T5shQ.text: So I absolutely love Scottsdale. The weather is great, the bugs are few and the food has proven to be impressive.  The first place we went to for a breakfast during our trip here was Hash Kitchen and the reviews seemed cool so we decided to check it out.  Menu was great, food was fantastic (that monkey bread is to die for) and the whole experience made such an impression on my wife and I we decided to stop here one more time during our 5 night trip.  Definitely a staple when we come back.

Ge_259j0JLrZwh0xn7kGeg.text: post-flight brunch on a wednesday morning with my brother. thought that maybe this place would be like hash house, but it wasnt. thats okay though. i ordered the almond-coconut crusted french toast with an original bloody mary and my brother ordered the chicken fried "steak" with waffle. loved the brioche that they used for the french toast and the toppings weren't too sweet and the bloody mary was pretty standard. my brother enjoyed his meal, however, i noticed the steak/waffle ratio was off (too much waffle, not big enough steak). our visit overall was good. would come back if ever in the area.

FLFFrxn2mpMj3_-R5SF_qQ.text: Not good food, but seems to be packed often.  I just don't understand that.  Our first experience here was so bad that I sent my meal back and got a second breakfast which was not much better.  I vowed never to go back, but my wife has been with her friends who think it is great on 3 more occasions, and each time she has come home saying it was a terrible breakfast.  So I cannot understand the attraction to this place.  If you want a great breakfast, and we've been to them all, try the Breakfast Joynt or Cafe Paris both in Scottsdale. The Breakfast Joynt has the best bacon, eggs benedict, and swedish pancakes in town. Cafe Paris, near Costco, has the most incredible French crepes I have ever had!!

s80tIlnz5UG2ElI_6xmKiw.text: This is possibly one of the most creative breakfast options that I've ever seen. There is something here for everyone. My friend and I were in town visiting and eager to get off of our resort for a good meal (preferably with a good mimosa on the side).   We arrived and immediately were greeted by super friendly staff. The restaurant has lots of space including indoor and outdoor seating options.   We opted to order the order the mimosa flight. So awesome! And such a great deal if you are a fan of mimosas. Just perfect and the presentation makes it even better. The hash options seem endless. I ordered the Mexicana scrambler and was impressed from the beginning until the end.   When I next return to Scottsdale, I just may go straight from the airport.

The mimosa flight is a great deal

FhY_X19z_unZS6ZsJ1etSA.text: We gave Hash Kitchen a second try today.   Happy to say that the experience was great.  The Beyond burger was amazing.   Will definitely go back.

-KfCOYLY9KapSvoDUpL0cw.text: Food was really good. Service awesome!! Bloody Mary bar was fun. Try this place out. Visiting from Seattle and Cali.

I loved how the the booster seat came with a new slip cover so that my child doesn't get other kids germs. I've never had a restaurant provide that before.   Now the food: it was absolutely amazing. The food is very inventive and with the best flavor!   When I'm back in Arizona, I'll be sure to make a stop here!
