bY13HIKSlAvMH6_w_j-fTg.text: We think corned beef hash is the perfect breakfast. These guys do it right with plenty of cb, silky potatoes, and chunky onions and peppers. My wife's veggie breakfast was also superior. Bonnie was the perfect host and the table service was good. Wonderful selections on the menu, a Bloody Mary station, and French drip coffee. Thanks for the tip Yelp. It's a keeper

upZ4ReLSmCdWSjHszlhf0w.text: Great brunch place in Scottsdale!! Bonnie, guest relations, was warm and inviting. The mimosa flights were very good and reasonably priced. Lots of variety of different foods. Their hash are great!! Although I don't drink Bloody Mary's, their bar is huge. I'd definitely add this to my list of brunch places!

Uq8qugTCMM8p9T04XoCuIA.text: Absolutely love this place. I live close by to the Gainey location and have taken so many people here when I want to show them a good atmosphere for brunch! The food is amazing, you'll have a very hard time deciding what you want because it all looks so good! And the Bloody Mary bar is to DIE for. It is a one time purchase so load up and let them teach you how to get the most out of it by using your celery stalk for a pin board for the rest of your food on toothpicks! Trust me, best $11 you'll ever spend (and I usually hate bloody Mary's). As a Scottsdale food snob, I've been waiting 23 years for a place like this to come to town and I can't wait to go back.

xboY_8kRoWCg5jUjrc7uAA.text: What a pleasant surprise.  Great food great service.  Bright and clean.  The hash is amazing and super pancakes

rLdg7iTTzIcFv1MMhTUJlA.text: Fabulous place. Amazing wait staff. Excellent food!! Bottomless mimosas are the main draw for me but the rest is the icing on the cake.  Ask for Jen to be your server. She met all our needs and we were a little needy..

wOx1Plu27h8G8IiPjYnM3Q.text: One of the best spots in Arizona!! The chicken and waffles are REALLY REALLY good. Far better than Lo Lo's ( I'm from California so I'm educated in good food). Bottomless mimosas on Saturday! Why the f not. The hostess...the elderly supermodel who greets you is THE BEST !!! I would come back just to hang with her!! The waiters/waitresses are awesome, nice and they are always in good spirits.   I always come on the weekend. There is a Dj here who definitely makes the atmosphere worth while!!   Go. Bring your friend, gf/bf, dog, frenemy and whoever else!

2EqS4i2xP2CAlWOIiAuJRw.text: We live in San Diego and go out to eat 5 days/week. Our daughter is a physician in Phx so we all came out here to visit her and she insisted we come here for brunch. Top notch food, amazing service and personable staff! We ordered French toast, Americano scramble, corn beef hash, fried chicken hash, cocoa puff drinks and other delish drinks. Bonnie's effervescent personality is such a great entertainment, as she is so sweet and bubbly. She is human champagne!! Katie behind the bar was a doll and so helpful and Chad was a pleasure to speak with about our experience there. Will most definitely be back!

v9hcsM9gDAz6ETYE7mUMKw.text: Had the caprese Benedict and it was DELICIOUS. Pesto goodness. Our server Jen was attentive and really sweet. She made our breakfast the best breakfast we've had in a long long time - she asked if I wanted a coffee refill 4 times during our meal, which, for someone who drinks coffee like water, was stellar. Definitely will be back here - next on my list is the Nutella and banana French toast...

y_brx_eqK_i_iryUnY8JyA.text: Amazing Bloody Mary bar.  Tasty menu.  All the Scottsdale "beautiful people" you can stomach. And an hour and a half wait.

ItUQKSGWK8hKyNsdOWeZjA.text: Best brunch spot in Scottsdale! Plus now they're opening a north Scottsdale and Arcadia location!!

_ecVDvGav62PoALR97uOBg.text: What a fantastic place! Great food, wonderful atmosphere and fantastic service. I believe going out to eat should be an experience and this place is just that. Evan was our server and was outstanding and Bonnie was so much fun. Will definitely return soon.

g2AuNQpb_8GiBNsARTK2dg.text: What a great place, amazing staff, amazing food, cool environment. Dj plays music while you eat. Great bloody Mary bar.

ICPxLk0gprT-eJLXCPs5yw.text: I have found my new favorite place in Scottsdale for breakfast!!! What sets this place apart is the energy and the food quality relative to other joints in town. When I die, I would like to be buried in the hash browns here. Go here and be happy-- I am considering going back for lunch. Lol

0Rp3p-NH4cSPohmPFxj8jA.text: Just had a delicious breakfast at The Hash Kitchen.  Food was yummy and definitely going back to try the Bloody Mary bar - looked fabulous. Our waitress Rachel was awesome - made it an all around great experience for us.

B6NrTmO35nhUD_aYc0yHDA.text: This is probably the best breakfast I've ever had! The staff is all incredibly nice and the service is amazing. Order the Carnitas Hash (OMG!!!)

EoCp2sy-ryN5-WHHBNOluQ.text: All I know is that the feisty , adorable older woman whom I believe is one of the owners and a fabulous hostess is just AWESOME! I would come back just to hang out with her if for no other reason. Their bloody Mary bar is out of this world and the best $10 I have ever spent. I mean it is a meal in itself, and the fact that they let you go back to top off your toppings is awesome. If you like spicy, definitely get the jalapeno infused vodka with the hot sauce. OMG delicious! My actual meal was not all the great to me. I ordered the lump crab and sweet potato hash and unfortunately it had no flavor. The hash could definitely been cooked a little longer because parts of the sweet potato chunks were still raw. The lump meat was bland and the portion was ok for the $14 I spent on the meal. I just wish it had more flavor. The biscuit however was pretty tasty. Not sure why my meal was so lackluster, but because of the the service, the company I was with, the bloody Mary bar, and that fabulous hostess will definitely earn a repeat trip.

6fXvyg1wDRH5HJRgctMrxA.text: Exceptional food and service!  Gino was great with suggestions as to what to do do in PHX since we're newbies.  DJ for the breakfast crowd -nice touch!  We'll be back!

IfEYUfm6AbA7qbyq1Ayedw.text: My wife and I came here for the first time about 2 weeks ago. It is a beautiful place. Very Scottsdale. The food was just ok. We had the the hash, eggs bennie, biscuits and gravy and bacon. The bacon was amazing! The brisket hash was good, not great (needed seasoning badly), my wife said the eggs bennie was not that good. She said the hollandaise sauce lacked flavor and seasoning and was quite bland. I would say that this is an issue other yelpers have noticed but it doesn't seem that the chef is reading these reviews. I did speak with the server about the issue directly so hopefully it will finally get address. This place could be amazing, but right now they are just 3/5. Service was 5/5. We had no wait and the place was essentially empty on a wed. morning.

8bMkYbrpNxSD1UXyF8actQ.text: Absolutely LOVE this place!  The food is just freakin' fantastic and the atmosphere is fun!  The portion sizes are very generous, fresh and unique.  This is definitely worth a visit and/or drive from anywhere in the valley.

Bt711coO6SsurZem2sje8Q.text: This was pretty amazing all in all. Great customer service and the food was delish! I ordered the mimosa flight which was on point and my favorite has to be the kiwis. The waiter I had was Alec and he was honest and very attentive. I chose the Carnitas hash which he advise was a good choice and it definitely was. The portions were perfect for two people or atleast some leftovers. The verde sauce was a bit limey but I actually enjoyed it. Also the cutest person there has to be the manager or hostess who is a firecracker haha. Great atmosphere, very clean and great setup.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash! Bomb

MpdURVbiJMZK7MUWIGLOGw.text: On mondays they have 9$ plus one cent per extra mimosas! Definitely get the cinnamon roll pancakes and a strawberry mimosa!

X8UZAtahU3gJ3dqpVfNoUQ.text: Visiting my daughter from Chicago her and her boyfriend took me here. The bloody mary's were outstanding and the Italian hash was very good.I will come back to this place every time a visit my daughter.

kkgPkeXUtmkhC4IWHwxWZw.text: Every bite was excellent The French toast was wonderful The carnitas , chicken and waffles, caprese Benedict, the scrambler , breakfast Popsicles, cannoli donuts wow

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary w cucumber, pickles, celery, bacon, lime, jalapeño juice, salami made extra spicy   WOW!

FAPDg2O_JTl6OLuIJHCfFw.text: Very satisfied with Hash Kitchen. We are coming from out of town and stumbled upon this gem, amazing environment, great service, and delicious food. I highly recommend getting a bloody Mary, delicious tomato base and all kinds of add-ons that are super yummy. In the words of my brother Nathan, "The Bloody Mary bar saved my life." He was recovering from a night of wildness... Also, our server Derek is amazing and has a gift for hospitality! Thank you for the great service!!!

iij9vfeTY6fYSeMuM6ZlNw.text: In the area for family vacation. We ordered the bruschetta brunch, corned beef hash, and the tamale Benedict. Wow. All were all just fantastic. I also tried the Bloody Mary bar. It was unique and well worth it. I'm bring 10 people in this week for brunch. Must go if you're close.

NBDoV5S0tuMAUW9WRtuxpg.text: Best Bloody Mary bar and kudos to Derek, our server for A+ service! Carnitas hash is a must.

xRzdnmmpZ_lBzGu7Jy0OEw.text: Wow, wanted to go here for several months. Suggest to get there by 9am on Sunday to avoid crowds. Bloody Mary bar is one of the best. The food portion are large, go on empty stomach and be prepared to take home leftovers. Service is excellent. Owners have great reputation in the valley and this adds to their quality restaurants.

_fP82-2L4dVQE5WVl01otg.text: On a birthday vacation with my boyfriend and we did a quick google search for the best brunch spots in Scottsdale... We found Hash! Our expectations were high and Hash still surpassed anything we had anticipated! From the Bloody Mary bar to the home style food! Bonnie treated us like family! She even added a photo of Cyle to her athlete screen as you walk in the restaurant! She's SO cute! We're totally in love with the place and definitely will make a point of returning to eat during spring training next year!

2KcOmgKpzRfkEys4fbntvA.text: Came on a Sunday and it was very crowded. The service was okay, we asked for a table for 5 people but they had thought we had said 3. Regardless they fixed the mistake shortly after ! The Bloody Mary bar was excellent. Food was good with lots of variety on the menu.

3Bi0b745GqcPubdSzJetkA.text: The food, drinks, and service is amazing! Lona is super fun and energetic and always the best recommendations. The cereal shooters and lights out are definitely things to try!

ny3csIqMcFWN0jIvzoEY9g.text: Amazing! The energy is always on point here. Very pleasant staff. Bonnie really made us feel special. Phenomenal Bloody Mary bar with excellent vodka choices (cilantro lime and cucumber especially) They have a bomb vegan option too!   *Vegan*  Huevos rancheros:  No egg No cheese No carne  No crispy onions Add extra avocado  Tortilla instead of biscuit

HaE8xmWFIE_XXbTr69xfIw.text: What an experience! From our attentive server Alec, to the amazing food! I will certainly be back every time I am in town!!! This is a restaurant that should never be passed up. As a graduate from the local culinary institute I appreciate the entire package of this breakfast extravaganza!

_LD09TS4sMHfnqZfeUjiZg.text: If we were getting picky, I'd probably assign 3.5 stars to this place. The pro's, the food was delicious, great presentation, awesome bloody Mary bar open all week, great selection of coffees and other drinks. The con was the service. Everyone was very nice and kind. However, the staff was either over attentive, or extremely under attentive. We waited about 10+ minutes to place our drink order after sitting down, we then waited a long time for our drinks, then the food came and almost every staff member came to our table asking how the food was (4 different people). Then we had no service for 20 mins when we needed refills on our drinks. The servers need some lessons on how to monitor a tables needs. They clearly didn't know when was a good or bad time to check in. For the prices and atmosphere of this place, the service needs to step it up.

7mmh5NeCbTwVQ-w1vbNBAw.text: Love love love. This is a must visit when we are in town. Their Bloody Mary bar is like no other. Their food is tasty and we love the DJ

ymUzfsXFSvDsQVCzsEROUw.text: Great spot! Service & food were great ...ordered the lump crab,  hash & 2 eggs. Server was friendly. Nice location, clean place. I will return.

Xj2ciTnLnPYr5vmp2dN6iA.text: This place is a hip and fun atmosphere. The staff is helpful and on top of things.   We had a group of 10 and they easily accommodated large and small parties.   The deejay playing great music made you wake up.   There was a large assortment of menu items that I didn't know where to begin. We started with the little doughnuts. We ordered both the Canolli and the Nutella.  You don't need to try both. The Nutella is all you need to try.   For breakfast I tried the waffle with fried chix and thought it was just ok. My husband had the lump crab cake Benedict and enjoyed it. Overall, our table enjoyed their meal and was stuffed.   A Yay for you to come and experience this fun place!

5TC13Djv4CTBCPVzr_4ocA.text: I have been here multiple times, and everything I have tried here is amazing. They have so many great things to pick from. Some of my favorite things right now have to be the lemon ricotta pancakes and the chicken and waffles. Every time I am there I have to get there French Press Coffee it is some of the best coffee around. They also have a massive Bloody Mary bar that has everything thing you could think of along with tasty Mimosa flights. The decor and atmosphere is very lively and modern. Also staff seems to be very friendly as well they are always willing to help answer any questions.

XWHVwoSizETFef034LrxGg.text: Food and service were great. We had breakfast and i thought everything tasted very good.

B3PI3-BbIcXyLbBQKcJ4NA.text: Lana was a great server ! The whole place feels like you're at a club for breakfast. Highly recommend the mimosas. The food was also really good priced and very good. Other than the server other staff was friendly to make sure we got what we needed.

Qg21cJOYi4Mmw3Tn_Ady9Q.text: Went here again on Sunday for brunch. Was not disappointed. The reason I originally gave it 4/5 stars was because the music was a little clubby and loud for my taste. However, this time they were jammin' the reggae and it was not nearly as loud. Well done!

0e1k4pcpnugPKjbsBL68OQ.text: the best new place in Scottsdale for breakfast and lunch. Food is very highly crafted, with first rate ingredients. The service is super friendly. We loved Chris, our waiter. He made spot on suggestions and gave us exceptional service. It is nice to see a private chef owned restaurant in this part of town . Hope they open for dinners soon too. loved the hostess. she made us very comfortable, even though we were coming from hiking, and had on work out clothes. eggs benedict with crab and lemon pancakes were both excellent.  chicken and waffles--perfect ! All the hash items were really well done too. great bloody Mary too !  2 visits in 2 weeks.

026AKRajFl6XN1YZiufOLA.text: Chris was our server & awesome guy! And even better food.  Very swanky place with amazing customer service!!!

HVqFYQBSY9P4y3KKh5tILA.text: Just finished breakfast at the Hash Kitchen and the whole family is raving about it. Our waiter, Chris, was fantastic and the food was absolutely delicious! The lump crab and sweet potato hash is one of the best things I've ever tried for breakfast,  but honestly everything we tried was great. The DJ (weekend mornings) was great too!

LH2weFesul0tllvdl6Lflw.text: This was a great choice for our Sunday brunch! They have a HUGE make your own Bloody Mary bar, full size bar, and a dj on Saturdays and Sunday's. I ended up getting one of the scramblers and it was pretty good but I really enjoyed their home made biscuits and home made jelly. Our waitress  Dominique was awesome, very sweet and quick. We will definitely be back.

MQKFv9zg1eaS4DWOSFqQEQ.text: I haven't felt the need to review a restaurant until now. This place is amazing! If the food wasn't enough, the people were amazing. Chris and Bonnie were so fun! The atmosphere was amazing and the service impeccable, I only wish it was closer. We can't wait to come back with our whole family!

JAp3uO4PI6z6utempZdXcQ.text: Came in for brunch on a Saturday morning. My parents were in town visiting and we had been wanting to try this place so decided to check it out. The hostess quoted me a 30 minute wait for our party of 5 and we got seated in 5 minutes. The bloody mary bar was amazing of course, but the real credit goes to our server Christopher. It was refreshing to have great service for a change! The food was good, not the best thing we've ever eaten, but I'd probably come back and give it another shot.

zhC3BNRJjxeBdKRziYjTaw.text: I am giving this place a 4 because we loved the food and the staff was friendly. That said the wait was a bit much. We have a toddler who we take with us every weekend to brunch and this place so far takes the cake on a wait so it's a good thing she's a trooper. It was also a bit loud. I personally love live music so I wasn't a fan of the dj. It's a bit of a brunch after a night out place which is great if you dont have kids. Hoping the new location by our house is a bit more family friendly cause we do love the food and people. I was a big fan of their biscuits. This place does have good things going on but try to get there before the late brunch crowd.

SwyAZ0XL3PpMqyLyK9KlXw.text: I had the crab egg benedict that came with seasoned potatoes.  The crab was real, not imitation (big thumbs up), and it was served over biscuits, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce.  I had a few hard shell pieces that made its way into the crab meat, but it wasn't a big deal.  I wasn't a big fan of their hollandaise sauce so I'm glad I had it on the sauce.  Overall, it was good but I found the biscuit to be quite heavy for the pairing.  The poached eggs however were great.  Their breakfast menu is very extensive (I had a hard time deciding between sweet or savory!) and portions are generous.  Their decor is very nice (open, clean, modern) and staff are upbeat and friendly.  The owner comes around and chats with the patrons which I always welcome because it adds a personable touch.  This place seems to be a local favorite.  I hope to get another chance to go again and try their other items.

8ykJNVL4Qa15X92Zqg-IgQ.text: Service was great the minute I walked in the door. The host was such a sweet and funny woman. I got the mushroom and spinach scramble which I would give it 4/5 only because I thought it was too much spinach! Our waitress was nice and service was great. They really take care of you. This was my first time going and I will definitely come back, as well as, recommend this restaurant to my friends.

-QmiCPJqn4WEIMJDKK3x2g.text: Great atmosphere, interesting Bloody Mary bar, very charming service. The dishes that we tried were lacking in flavor and the fruit board smothered with a sticky sweet sugar drizzle of some kind.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing. Servings are HUGE - enough to split three ways.

jdwOr4OV2cHQqVFVkCSgNQ.text: We are always looking for a good breakfast spot and are sick of the chain restaurants.  We stopped by The Hash Kitchen today and were rewarded with an outstanding breakfast.  Our waiter, Leo, was an excellent server.  Very attentive and knowledgable, but without being smothering.  I ordered a Frittata which was delicious!  The homemade biscuits are to do die for!!  My husband ordered the Corned Beef Hash and loved it.  The French press coffee was wonderful and a nice touch to the meal!!  My only recommendation would be to change the music.  I didn't care for the techno beat music.  Overall an excellent experience!!  We can't wait to go back.

Cw9ZxR-df6AVLGM0XQMDbQ.text: The Hash Kitchen provides a delicious yet engaging culinary experience. The Bloody Mary bar is unlike anything I have ever seen before where you can choose from over 40 different toppings and custom create the cocktail yourself. I would also highly recommend the Red Velvet pancakes, a breakfast treat that is not overly sweet and well worth the calories. The Owners, Joey and Cristina are all about customer service and making sure everything exceeds expectations.

f4-4nnOIM3CrIvm9G8N69Q.text: I highly recommend the lump crab bennie's! They are perfect!  The corn beef hash was also delicious!

4hieJyKgjvvdBLK91P2m1A.text: Great new breakfast place. The food was excellent. Service in spite  of being full and busy was fast. Linda the manager is hands on and checked on us to make sure we were taken care of. Ambience is perfect.

B_Ls6hnjnaKncWD0euxQag.text: The food was on point and the service was stellar. Rachel made recommendations, kept our drinks full and took care of absolutely everything! All around great experience, we will be back.

s3OtDL8uhKc2pm68m4YEnA.text: With a Bloody Mary bar worthy of a Best of New Times award, The Hash Kitchen is the brunch spot you need to hit up.  The lump crab sweet potato hash is the perfect balance of sweet and savory, and the staff is phenomenal.  Chris was the most charismatic delightful server we have ever had!!

o4lzxI8oXtrHt-xlCOGbdA.text: My husband and I chose this place for brunch while on vacation based on the great reviews...but it was very disappointing. The service was terrible - we sat at the bar but the bartenders were more concerned about doing dishes than helping customers. The food also took a long time to arrive once ordered. For a place called hash kitchen, the hash was underwhelming - it was dry and lacked flavor. Worst of all - I ordered a virgin Bloody Mary (since I'm pregnant) and received a normal one. This is a place you can skip!

IyZHxrETbTy0ZfSkaQCnfg.text: The bloody mary bar is incredible and the carnitas skillet is absolutely to die for! I work across the street and it takes every ounce of strength in me not to order breakfast from here every morning! That being said... I can't wait to try the doughnuts!

qAuiyDqffoIUJlS_72VJVA.text: This place is very nice on the inside and the atmosphere is very inviting and enjoyable.  The staff for the most part is pretty friendly.  I went with a friend of mine to try something new for breakfast. From the beginning it went downhill.  My friends French press coffee was very good and I had a large orange juice that was okay.  I had a build your own scrabbler and my friend had a chicken enchilada type dish.  Both of us barely ate any of the food because it was bland and had ingredients that did not mesh well together at all.  The waiter took back our plates and didn't even ask us if anything was wrong even though most of the food was left on the plate.  The portion sizes for most of their dishes is small.  And finally we got the check and were shocked,  it was $40 for the two of us.  They charged $5.25 for a large orange juice that was barely 8oz and my scrambler was $12 for hardly any food.  If you are looking to make your own mimosa this is the place for you,  if you are looking for good breakfast this is not the place for you.

226Agt6yqT_pO0HGUEJT-w.text: When I saw the Hash Kitchen on the Arizona Breakfast Weekend list, I decided it was time to finally make my first visit.  The Hash Kitchen is co-owned by chef Joey Maggiore and his wife Cristina Maggiore of Maggiore Culinary Concepts (who also own Tomaso's Italian Restaurant and Tommy V's Osteria Pizzeria). They seek to "reimagine breakfast classics with creative remixes". This location is located in the beautiful Gainey Ranch area. The atmosphere was very inviting right when we first walked in as several people welcomed us before we were sat (we didn't wait long either). Their popular build-your-own Bloody Mary bar (claimed to be Arizona's largest) with their many garnishes and bacon-infused vodka is the first thing you see as you walk in. The bacon on a stick was calling to me as I passed by it. To start off, each of us in our party ordered a specialty coffee drink. The breakfast week menu consisted of an entree, a classic mimosa and a cannoli donut. The donut was a nice little treat to pair with my coffee and comes fried to order. I ordered the Carnitas Hash - a cast-iron skillet filled with potatoes, roasted corn, tender pork carnitas, avocados, two eggs and a heap of crispy onions (and a couple of corn tortillas). It had a nice hint of spiciness and was just as good as it sounds. The portion sizes here are pretty generous and I had plenty to take home to eat later. Overall this was a pleasant experience and I hope next time to partake in the Bloody Mary Bar. I'm excited to check out their Chandler area location (down the street from me) when it opens.

The wife had the avocado toast and Wow!!. amazing presentation and the taste was good as well. I f you want  a little fun in your morning and a full belly don't hesitate to visit. The staff are very attentive and look like they are having a good time doing their job as well.

h7Hu9gp7SQcWIUdNqzaRvQ.text: Mimosa flight and get a Hash breakfast. Heuvos Rancheros all the way! Great food. Clean restaurant. Great service

Be professional and don't lose sight of my needs.   This place is solid in both these areas. Definitely off the beat and path but good find if you are in the area.

gXUvcnYSTnvoHPwAezgQOg.text: Derek was our server at the Hash Kitchen on Scottsdale and we had a really great experience! it is worth the long wait, and there are shops and things nearby you can walk around while you're waiting. Derek was really on top of our service and the food was amazing!!! Don't skip the Bloody Mary bar. The coconut almond crusted French toast and carnitas hash were amazing.

I believe it's a good price for what you get. Sunday's have a DJ and the vibe is upbeat and exciting.service and food were really good.

-cc4ymXaLoT86HbUG2LVYg.text: Best bloody I've ever had made by Adrian!!! Cilantro lime vodka made in house  Our waiter Cj was awesome!! Definitely coming back here again!

9selSZYvDEk_UFqji-H7Jw.text: Patrick was amazing! Food was great. Definitely get the Hash Monkey Bread for a starter. We loved the Bloody Mary bar!!

pQZCPVuOrtZDn7ESPYdVEw.text: Just had a great time at the hash kitchen. I was part if a group of 20, and they did a great job keeping up with the requests.  You can even find some low carb options if you are so inclined.

BBcm3hSyxRKdOZta6IeAsA.text: We have left this restaurant twice now without eating. The 1st time was on a weekend. We waited forever and they either gave us a broken buzzer or skipped our turn even though we were waiting right by the front door. When we said something they sat us at the worst table right at the entrance then never came back to take our drink order. The 2nd time was this past Monday, the restaurant was completely unoccupied except for one older couple. We asked to turn the music down and they refused. It was still 7am and the absolute lack of customers made the empty room even louder with the echoing of the blaring music. You're not that cool! Turn the music up when people actually show up or something so it isn't amplified in your empty cave of a restaurant. There are way too many places to get a wonderful breakfast around Scottsdale/Phoenix/Tempe to have to settle for poor service. It's sad to see when a business starts thinking that it's so great that it stops caring about everyone. Next!

csEs61W26fyw-5EiCz9mLg.text: First time here and loved it!  Great staff - had our waiter joking around with us as he was very attentive to our needs.  Various other staff (owners?) checking in on us and making sure everything was great.  Loved it!  Outdoor seating with water misters = a good time.

MErExcIwWi76Kjdak4B7Rw.text: I came in yesterday for lunch after the Jewish New Year services. Very cute and trendy place. We had a party of 6 and sat down in the corner. We were all starving so we were looking to order asap. But for some reason, we sat for 15 min w out anyone coming over or even pouring us water. So that was a little disappointment especially since the restaurant was not packed at all. Eventually our server came over and we started ordering. I got the Bloody Mary since you can make your own n my other two friends raved about this new brunch spot so I was very looking forward to it! I love the Bloody Mary bar! You can add so many different things!! I added beef jerked, jalepenos, jalepeno olives, pickes, salami, celery u name it!! My friend and I both ordered the huevos ranchero hash while my husband ordered the corned beef hash. And my girlfriend and her kids ordered the flat iron steak hash and the Oreo pancakes. Oh and I got a side of bacon! I enjoyed my huevos ranchero hash but I was expecting my hash potatoes to be more like hash browns, thinly chopped and crispy. But they were more like bite size potato pieces and they weren't that crispy. I took a bite of everyone elses' dishes and they were all very good. Next time for me, I don't think I would order the hash dish again. Too many potatoes for my taste. But overall everything was good. And I finished it off a strawberry mimosa!! Yum!!

Ym3nGSMDL4ACZpifR-_usQ.text: Absolutely delicious, great atmosphere and food. Had no trouble with my reservation and the staff was very efficient, food was absolutely delicious. The french toast was very filling! ILL BE BACK !!

k3hiOOSCx6Y7-4eM90rV3w.text: Everything was fantastic about this place! Bottomless mimosas, build your own Bloody Mary bar, the coconut French toast was amazing. Service was soo friendly and a great atmosphere! Definitely will be going back! The staff is great! Bonnie is such a ray of sunshine! Thanks for a great breakfast!

vKcH0b1kbfkQO_X5oZiWkA.text: It's about time to leave a review! Every time we have been here, it's been a fantastic experience. Sarah was our server today and she was great! Food came out super fast and as a girl who has spent a lot of time in the south, the biscuits are some of the best I've had in Arizona! The GM, John, came by to say Hello and was very kind. Excited to hear about all of the expansion plans of this fantastic restaurant!

8RXD8GrqUjMK2v_O6MsfOg.text: Great breakfast!  Very crowded and very loud though.  The mimosa flight was fun!

gIihecaJYGyOrEOwPfFHGQ.text: Visited the Hash Kitchen twice on our trip to Scottsdale. On both visits we received service that went above and beyond, and that's not even getting into how good the food was!! Wow. Biggest portions and quite possibly the best breakfast I've ever had, and I'm a huge fan of breakfast so that's saying a lot.   Pic is of the Huevos Rancheros Hash. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WtlJj8XdB9NzbXZWdAscXA.text: Great place for drinks, good laughs, ohh and the breakfast is outstanding! Won't be disappointed, but maybe a bit chubby when you leave (:

1KpXkdrer3J2DwpT_HhyiQ.text: Don't get the Huevos Ranchero skillet. It's mostly potato and crispy onion....fillers. The beef is SO chewy and dry you can't chew it. The other toppings are nowhere to be found. The eggs are tiny and were gone in a couple bites.  Maybe the other food was better, just don't get the skillet!   The server didn't even ask how I liked my food. I really hated it. He didn't even ask when I ordered a second entree....but he did try to rush us out while we were still eating lol. No I don't need a box if I'm still using the fork to put food in my mouth.   On the upside though - the place is really cute. The bloody mary bar looks super cool and has a ton of topping, but the toppings all taste like perfume. Only the celery and olives were good lol The mimosas are super cute and worth it. The cereal shooters looked delicious. Basically, go to drink or order basic food like waffles or pancakes.

ZrkSGLUBY9T3D9hclugp4Q.text: If you need a fun place to brunch please go to this restaurant! Now the wait was a little long but to be expected on a Saturday afternoon. They do have a very big Bloody Mary bar to help pass the time. I came with a large group and my favorite part was the live DJ (and dancing with the staff) they have until 2:00pm and how quick and nice our server was. I don't remember her name but she had a short hairstyle and is from Michigan!   I got the mimosa flight (which two of the four weren't that good) and the steak burrito! The steak burrito was HUGE I only ate half of it and it was soooo good! Next time, I probably would skip the flip and just order a single strawberry mimosa as that was my favorite one!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak burrito
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight

gl3V97jv8GomwGOyu5snzg.text: Absolutely love this place, Their food and atmosphere is EVERYTHING! I have been here 4 times, and had to wait 3/4 times, but trust me, it is 100% worth it. Their vibe is so fun and cute, and the food is to die for. I have ordered something different every time and have been more than satisfied! Today my mom and I shared the bagel breakfast sandwich sliders, and the Smores french toast. Amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Y1vsDK_o_b_bsq7lJ_HPZw.text: Not sure that the 2-1/2 hour wait was worth it. I mean, for the amount of people descending on this place on a Sunday morning@11am in the middle of a hot and humid July day, you would think the food would be outstanding. Their menu, while pretty big, is basically all the same. Potatoes with eggs, potatoes with beef, potatoes with veggies...and it wasn't all that delish, but not horrible either. I'm just saying, it's not worth the wait.  The restaurant is trendy, I guess...lots of pretty people and very loud music with a live DJ. As loud as it was, there were people there from age 2 to 90.   So, the main reason we went, was the you guessed it,  Bloody Mary bar! So disappointing! First off, the Bloody Mary just didn't taste right. It had a strange grainy consistency. The bar was a great idea, but the food and veggies were hard to get on the sticks. The tongs were too small and flimsy to grab things like the olives and pickles.  It Just made for a  big old "bloody" mess. If the food and veggies had been tastier and fresher, maybe it would have been a better experience.  Service, music and vibe were really great. So were the prices, but the food and Bloody Mary's didn't excite me. Off to find another place for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Make your own Bloody Mary Bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flat iron hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos ranchero hash

1Jdrv_O-hLXkkkX7JdUvUw.text: Jessica was such an awesome waitress! She was so warm and welcoming - she talked me into the corned beef hash and it didn't disappoint! Will definitely be coming back!

ZgtTjGEBQ7m8Z3apNlxGlg.text: I absolutely loved this place. The mimosa flight is to die for and our sever LONA was fantastic!! Requested her for sure if you venture out.

Ha_iz5juRAVnaH1FsDET6g.text: So much fun at Hash Kitchen! Delicious EVERYTHING but especially #lona BEST! BLOOD Mary bar on point! Mimosas flights WHAT! SO SO GOOD! COME HERE!

nECJ32XIYwkJNxRiafjgFg.text: I had the berry waffle and my husband had the veggie scramble. Both were good and the restaurant was super cute inside. I would go back if I were in town. I do wish they offered a chai latte but other than that, everything was good.

_UJ5Ebc-wiuRwMcBZStcpg.text: The portion size are huge. This is definitely a great brunch spot. It is extremely loud inside more club sceneish so if you want a relaxing atmosphere op to sit outside. Everything on the menu looked and sounded good would definitely be back to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

OZAUv3OU8xdA_yk48ClaMg.text: Hostess 5 stars. Waitress 5 stars.  Had the corn beef hash and asked for eggs over easy and they came out well done. Too late to send them back as my wife's meal came out and didn't want to make her wait. Just removed them from the plate. Otherwise would have been 5 stars.

ljfrsGg_LFsrhXuIv6aMCQ.text: Awesome new place.  Nice change from the normal food scene in Scottsdale.   Owners, managers and bartenders were all awesome.  Will 100% be back

QX1xz6SDajdn1HykahaXrw.text: Starting off my friend's 21st off right! If you're a Bloody Mary lover you absolutely need to come here for brunch! We had the salmon Benedict, salmon board, and built our bloodys. Awesome food, great service from Lona! Thanks for making Such a great experience for us, ask for Lona if she's there to get awesome service!

7hAW1n8MIHJLwSRUzMM5GQ.text: Our first trip to Hash Kitchen was AMAZING! Our server Lona was even more amazing. Great food, great atmosphere, great staff! Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hash Kitchen

9tybRHg-tZcQjSvuFytwkQ.text: Such a great place. Food was awesome. Really cool vibe. Great brunch place. My only two frustrations.  1. There is a DJ, at least on Saturdays. And the music is LOUD. If you are inside it is very hard to hear the person next to you. But I think it adds to the vibe. So I get it. Just something to consider.  2. When we arrived they said it would be a 40 min wait. So we stood outside (next to the door). After about 35 mins and seeing people who came after us get seated, I decided to ask where we were in line. The girl said, "we buzzed you a few times". I said that's weird buzzer didn't go off. She rolled her eyes and had it go off. Of course it worked. Another girl next to her said don't go far this time. They did seat us pretty quickly after it. BUT I did t appreciate the eye rolls or the attitude. Also... pretty sure it happen to at least two other groups while we were waiting...

WKnAfi9qZ5Q1ypb-XiUXsg.text: Certainly glad I stopped by. We started off with the Bloody Mary bar. Options for salt rim included bacon so of course we went with that along bacon infused vodka. The website indicated bacon as a main ingredient topper but it was not an option when we got there, however, upon request it was available...had we not asked one would've never known.   For breakfast we had the carnitas which is apparently the top favorite of restaurnnteers and the corned beef hash. The flavor was spot on but we were left feeling...where's the beef! We dug into the excessive amount of potatoes only to find more potatoes, the amount of meat with each dish missed the mark.   I'll be back only after I check out other Bloody Mary bars in Scottsdale, may not be for a while but I'll be back. The vibe was positive and the DJ was spinning some great mixes. Be warned...wait time can be up to 45 minutes and for good reason!

z2uEwQKH75-ePsbPxDiK2g.text: The moment you go in the restaurant it's a party! The Bloody Mary bad is so much fun.  You can add toppings to your drink, which then feels like a meal. My brunch club crew had the best time here!

IAzpNiWCFCZfND-WJlhNJw.text: Too loud, not able to carry on a conversation with the people at my own table ( I LOVE loud music-not while I am eating). Poor service. Food was not good. Have not been back since our original visit.

touviql17DriDAhM6RAeyQ.text: Had the best time at Hash with a group of friends! The environment was awesome with a DJ and people having a great time. What really made the experience fantastic was having Jessica as our waitress! She was so much fun we were constantly laughing with her! Definitely ask for her section for a guaranteed fun time!

aDO6qXRZL4zt6FOf7RenCA.text: Wonderful place !!!!! Super good food and friendly people  was my first time in Scottsdale and I couldn't ask for a better place to stop by :)

n9PjwGOSL_BTtK6bxSy18w.text: The place freakin' rocks - quite literally, on the weekends!  There's good reason it's an hour wait to get in.  But it's worth the wait.  The over the top bloody mary bar, the flights of mimosas or cereal shot flights are outstanding.  The food was great also, with one caveat.  I ordered a pancake on the side -and it came out raw (full of batter) in the middle still.  The waitress apologized and brought a new one, but not much else was said about it.  That said, the second pancake was great and light and fluffy as they should be.   I would have rated 5 stars, but knocked one off for the undercooked pancake (c'mon now, it's a pancake it's not rocket science to tell when it's done).  Still, it was a great place and I enjoyed myself enough that I'll definitely be back.  I'll just make sure to double check everything has been fully cooked. :)

z-uG1Z76xHtiKej5ng-V2Q.text: This place is by far one of the best brunch places I have been to world wide!!! SERVICE was extraordinary from the time I walked in the door ..Gino greeted me with a smile a personable demenor....The concept of a bloody mary bar is so innovative...I'm so happy I choose to come here ..so I got a strawberry pineapple mimosa , salmon Benedict and a virgin bloody Mary..The food was cooked to perfection, the right amount of seasoning, and proportion size..danielle was my waitress and she was amazing....this made a fun outing..I would definitely come here for a date or a or party...the decor is nice and inviting...There is alot tables....the price is decent and the menu is oddly weird and yet delicious..  I cant wait to return...

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My version of the bloody mary with all the fixings
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cool decor
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Memosa

Sb0gKfPEalmfCC0j04ZHnQ.text: I love the location as well as the overall atmosphere. They have a decent sized outdoor patio that is dog friendly -- also a bonus. The staff was attentive and pleasant. The food however left much to be desired. Their crispy potatoes were the highlight, fresh and flavorful. I also purchased the lump crab Benedict along with biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were very dry and old tasting and the lump crab Benedict/biscuits were not even fully covered with sauce.   My advice to the chefs: don't be so conservative with the sauce on the egg benedict. At the very least assure the biscuits are covered with sauce.   I would have given 4 stars as the location, atmosphere, staff and crispy potatoes were all very good, however, when the aforementioned meal cost $25 plus tip I would have been more satisfied going to a handful of other breakfast establishments.  Update:  My wife and I came back after the encouragement of the owner, Joey. The food was over-the-top good and fresh. The portions were bountiful and as previously mentioned, the atmosphere, staff and location are hard to beat. 5 stars! We look forward to coming back again in the future!

r91oExCM82IXEBA3zb8FMg.text: Our server Lona was incredible! Not only was she fast with great service but she was funny and sweet.   We went in for a birthday and she brought out a birthday dessert without me having to say anything.   Talk about service with a smile, she was overjoyed the moment that she saw us sit down & attended to us right away!  Would give 10 stars but 5 is the max, so 5 out of 5 stars is it! Will definitely be back soon just for LONA!

Dn-apZGp5ScSTozqhufgIA.text: Danielle at the Bar has excellent customer service.  Visited with us and gave us advice on the Sandwhiches since it was our first time eating lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nix the onion in the crane asada sandwich.

XWraotqteNojD3tpc9ROVA.text: I think that the place is really a five-star if you are more of their target audience. I felt a bit out of their age range - we came for brunch with a baby and wanted to have a conversation, but the DJ was blasting music way too loud inside. So we had to sit on the patio (thanks for misters, made experience tolerable), but still the tables were too close together and hard to be comfortable with a stroller. So the ambience of the place was hard to embrace, hut if I were a college student, I would be thrilled!   Now, the drinks... we went for Bloody Mary bar with all 45 toppings - that's an experience, who cares about the Mary when you get to put an egg and a meatball on top?  This is the experience to come back for!!! also ordered mimosas, but those were underwhelming - barely bubbly and flavor just wants there.   Food is good, but not excellent that I would want to be back to have it. Salmon bennies were good, but the poached egg was a bit over cooked for my taste, but the biscuit and hollandaise we're great. Everyone else was happy with their build your own scramble, salmon frittata and some another frittata with chicken.   Overall - I'll be back only to share the Bloody Mary bar with some guests visiting Phoenix, otherwise some other brunch place

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli donut
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon eggs Benedict

fwrLp6a4UDVWUH1Wxa0IsA.text: Service was superb and the staffs were really polite!!! This isn't my first time here and despite the price, I and friends keep coming back for more. Well recommended their Banana Split Brioche French Toast.

I56cjP5bvUyZatq6tGnIWw.text: We came to celebrate Father's Day with our 14 month old daughter. We've eaten at both this Hash Kitchen and the one off of Frank Lloyd Wright, and both are just okay. When it comes down to it, the service is just so slow.  I ordered a blueberry mimosa and the chicken chilaquiles, he had a Bloody Mary from the bar, and the pretzel egg benedict. We loved our food - everything came out great! And our server was nice but we just felt forgotten. It took 20 minutes to get my mimosa after ordering it. It took 10 minutes for service to come to the table, and the food took a little while longer than normal to come out.  Also, the music was so loud it was hard to hear or hold a conversation across the table.  We keep coming back for the food, but the service hasn't changed!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pretzel egg benedict with beer cheese hollandaise sauce and bacon
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken chilaquiles, crema on the side

tTw2BKNA7lVMvm86YxYeNA.text: Delicious food and a very upbeat atmosphere. It's very hard to find an upbeat brunch spot in Scottsdale. Coming from Chicago, I say they need more. With that being said, we were happy to find Hash Kitchen. The reviews were good and I saw they had a mimosa flight .   Even though it was crowded, we were promptly seated. This place is lively. A DJ, TVs playing, lots of people both inside and outside, people making the craftiest Bloody Mary's at the huge Bloody Mary bar. I mean, they were putting everything from celery to mini cheeseburgers to ravioli on their Bloody Marys.   I ordered the huevos rancheros. They were delicious. The tortilla chips were fresh. The chicken was well seasoned. My friend got a cheeseburger and the other 2 in our party split the hash and a fruit board. They give you A LOT of fruit. They did not lie when they said board. The fruit was good too. Nice and sweet. Everyone liked their food. They messed up my friend's cheeseburger sour had to be remade. Outside of that, the food was good all around.   Their portions are HUGE. We looked at the tables around us and the French toast were like half a loaf of bread. Lbvs. It looked delicious though.   I love their coffee mugs and I wanted to buy one but they were sold out. So I asked my waitress if they ship them...they don't . I love a nice big coffee mug and theirs was a cute matte black. I'm determined to get one of them now. Lol.   The only downside to Hash Kitchen was the loud music. Don't get me wrong, I loved the DJ. She was playing some good music. However, it was sooooo loud that you couldn't hold a conversation. I could barely talk to the person next to me and I didn't bother to talk to the person across the table. We had a hard time speaking to our waitress too.   If you want a fun brunch with some good food, go to Hash Kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute decor

7VX-yAwHtph7euk9VNzS7Q.text: Definitely the best brunch spot to visit! The DIY Bloody Mary bar is amazing! And the Mimosa Flights.... . The food, live DJ, & atmosphere is the best!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Split Brioche

CC-rFrBghJdtgTv-GAaKuw.text: I reviewed Hash Kitchen 3 years ago, and decided to do another review/update. This is definitely the breakfast place you should go to when you have family/friends in town. It has a definite wow factor to it. The only reason I am taking it down to four stars is because living in the area for a while I prefer going to more standard traditional breakfast places. Hash has a really funny twist to its menu which helps the wow factor. I really prefer just a good old standard eggs bacon and pancakes from a place like butters. I frequent hash kitchen primarily when we have people in town so they can see the bloody Mary bar, have a mimosa flight, DJ playing on weekends, etc... I ordered the carnitas this time. The flavors were tasty, but it needed another egg in it. Kids ordered s'mores pancakes. They look pretty decadent, and of course the kids liked them.

CbkQf_GWjFunJYGwQEnZgA.text: The food was great and portions were huge! Service was a little slow when we asked for extra honey and coffee. It's a huge restaurant and the blood mary bar was fun - there were lots of toppings, great for Instagram photos! The whole restaurant was really IG-worthy actually.   My favorite dish was probably the Mexican-style omelette and the fried chicken hash. I had a few bites of the lemon ricotta pancakes and that was tasty too, but it's a huge portion so it felt very heavy. Come hungry!  Parking was great and it wasn't too busy when we got there around 9am on a Sunday morning.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vF9AnKaA5ARVwRb6nZ4JQw.text: This place came highly rated as a 'can't miss' brunch stop on a weekend trip to Scottsdale. Our flight landed at 8am Saturday morning and this was our first stop. We made it to the restaurant at around 9am and only had to wait ~15 minutes to get a table for 3. For how packed it was, we were shocked by how quickly we were able to get seated, AND how fast we were served our food... It was almost unsettling how quickly our food came.   Overwhelmed by all of the options, we opted out of the build your own Bloody Mary bar, and just ordered basic B.M's and an order of the cereal shooters to share. I still can't decide if I loved them or hated them... but am so glad I got them - I'd highly recommend. We thought the Cinnamon Toast Crunch flavor was a bust, but all decided we could've had 5 more (each) of the Captain Crunch flavor... but likely would've walked away with a stomach ache and been destined for an awful sugary hangover in a few hours.   The food was good but not spectacular. Our biggest complaint was that it was TOO much food. I ordered a breakfast burrito that was the size of my arm. By the time I was finished eating, I wasn't even able to make a dent. No one at our table came close to finishing our plates. Staying in a hotel with no fridge, it felt like a total waste.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cereal Shooters

dWCub31QPMz0SVevhjpu4Q.text: This morning my family decided to stop in for Brunch before we head to the airport to fly home to Texas. I ordered a blueberry mimosa and chicken tinga frittata, my little one ordered the s'mores pancakes and my oldest the chicken and waffles. The frittata wasn't traditional in presentation but the chicken tinga on top was flavorful. The hash browns were lacking seasoning. My daughter didn't enjoy the chicken and waffles. The chicken was lacking seasoning and flavor. She said the waffle was just ok. This restaurant has a cute setup and decor but left a few things to be desired. If I'm back in the area I may give them a redemption try.

O7RRDpSi2BfE8HbepZlbJA.text: Great place for breakfast! Our group of 4 started out with the Craft Bacon Board. Thick cut bacon-different flavors to try-brown sugar, jalapeno, and peppered bacon. The board came with bacon jam, charred Brie cheese and toasted mini bagels. Great way to start! I ordered the Thick Cut Bacon Scrambler-eggs, bacon, onions, potatoes and Swiss cheese. It was really good!  Our waiter was very attentive, always filling our coffee and water.  My husband had something with chorizo, I tasted the chorizo and it was very good.  Oh upon Yelp Check In we got a coupon for 5% off the whole bill, that was a nice little perk!  We would come back, everything was tasty and it was a fun experience.

w6YyMWWT7M-RJa92AZ6a_A.text: We found this restaurant on yelp and it was a good choice! There is outdoor seating and indoor seating. The restaurant is huge and has lots of parking. We were told it would be 25 minutes for a table because it was really packed but it was only about 10-15 minutes.   The hostess was very friendly and recommended the banana split French toast. Great choice! It was an awesome! It had chocolate, blueberries, strawberries, bananas and mascarpone in a cone. I didn't evened need to use the syrup.   Our waitress Lona was awesome!!  She had a very outgoing personality and engaged in conversations with us and was a great server. Sit in her section!! I will be back if I'm in the area!!

t3Run0LJZ0k9vOg0oXJuzg.text: Brunch is done right here. Have your conversations while your waiting outside for a table bc once you get in you'll be too busy dancing in your seat! We went in on a Saturday and the DJ was spinning all the right beats!   Hash was the perfect way to introduce Phoenix to my friends from Texas. They loved the atmosphere, food and drinks.   I had a mimosa flight and avocado toast. My friend had the pretzel Benedict. We shared and I def liked the pretzel better.   Super trendy spot. No reservations accepted but we saw a bachelorette party and baby shower happening. So maybe reservations for special occasions? Either way we were told our wait was about an hour and were called in within 20mins. Maybe we got lucky!   Super pleased and would def recommend to my peeps!

xtIpQa8QP4BWYIiMx3nA8g.text: Love love love this place! Get ppl environment and amazing dishes! I also go to brunch with the girls here!

W-fjJBkDIvlfH99qr7IIog.text: Great food, lively music, amazing one of a kind drinks. Couldn't have asked for a better breakfast. Prices are a little more than average but for the portions it's worth it. I love the build your own Bloody Mary bar and the mimosa flight is great for sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar

3EppK6XSiMeFrVNRWYSFzA.text: We came here for my bachelorette party and absolutely loved the experience! Dominic is one of the best restaurant managers I've ever met. He was amazing and attentive to our large group and made sure that we were well taken care of the whole time. The highlight is definitely the Bloody Mary bar. I have never seen something like that before. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in town!

o7AgdP17CKvWCbksialUKw.text: This place is fabulous! The service is great. Everyone is so friendly. Live music sets a chill atmosphere. The food is delicious. The bloody Mary bar is a great touch. Love,love, love.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frittata was divine! Delicious salmon blends well with capers and dill sauce.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Chicken and Waffles I have ever had!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bloody Mary bar rocks!

VU-10ETKYcbNnsYOt-IzNA.text: Great place great food. The manager and owner were very accommodating trying to find us a table outside this past Sunday when they were very busy. The pancakes and eggs benedict were great along with fresh squeezed orange juice!!!! Wish we had one in Ohio!!!!!

qrEUNDh0HiJZ5rww4xMgyg.text: This was our first visit, upon arrival we were greeted by Amy who was very welcoming. We were seated at a table and waited quite a while for a server. After a bit the manager, Evo showed up and pretty much made for a horrible visit. Due to a special diet, we specifically ordered our meals with NO potatoes and asked if we could have fruit instead. The only fruit he offered was melon, of which we couldn't have. Moments later we saw several bowls of berries going by. We had to wait and wait just to get coffee, we finally asked another server for some. Aprielle then became our server - I believe she was also doing double duty as bartender to the Bloody Mary bar, yet still managed to take care of us. She was very pleasant and tried to fix what Evo messed up. When our food arrived it came with the potatoes that we were very clear about not wanting on our plates. I flagged down Evo and told him and also asked about all of the berries we saw going by, he told us that those were for children only! WHAT? Are you kidding me? Later we asked Aprielle about this, she said no and offered to bring us some. We declined as we were finished eating and a bit upset about the lack of knowledge and customer service provided by the manager. We may not return, especially if we see Evo on duty.

QjGvtAED6cdlMc3u5wgfhA.text: Turn your head the other way if you want a relaxing and quiet Saturday brunch. If you feel like extending your Friday night girls/boys night out, then this is your place. We immediately got a table soon as we walked-in. The vibe was so alive. If you just got out of bed, walking-in to the restaurant would definitely wake you up to the tenth level. They have a DJ on a Saturday brunch. An actual club DJ!!! (I started to look for the dance floor when I walked-in). The service was really nice. My glass of water was always full. Food was served fast and hot. Our server also gave good recommendations (a sign that he knows the menu). The restaurant was also very clean. Tables were set and cleaned as soon as the customer leaves the table. The dishes that we had were just OK. I did not get a chance to try their famous Bloody Mary bar (which looked awesome by the way). I'm not a Bloody Mary fan but I guess it's something I'll consider trying the next time. Back to what we had, the food that we ordered had good points and some room for improvement. I had the Breakfast Lasagna and my wife ordered the Herb Fried Chicken and Waffles. The Herb Fried chicken was a little dry for my taste. A little over-cooked but had some good flavors. The herb wasn't very prominent but you know it's there. The waffles were nice. Soft and tasty on the inside and a bit crunchy on the outside. I would have wanted a little more bacon mixed in to the waffle but it wasn't a deal breaker. I still enjoyed it and the fried leeks on top complimented the dish very well. The breakfast lasagna was a bit of a let down for me. Maybe I would have loved it if it had a little more sausage and a little less potato. The potato and the lasagna pasta just had very little texture and flavor differences that it tasted very one dimensional. The bacon was crunchy but the dish needed more protein. The egg that was placed on top of the dish helped add flavor. The creaminess of the yolk gave some good points but I couldn't get past the potatoes. There was just too much. To be fair, the breakfast lasagna is new to their menu. That's what the server told us. Hopefully, improvements are on its way. A great place with an OK food selection. I would definitely come back. Maybe I'll try the Bloody Mary bar the next time. Maybe I'll order one of the popular options. Maybe they deserve a 5, but for now just a 3.5 (4 at the most). Visit my other review at themealexperience.blogsp...
