The wait can get quite long on the weekends but it's so worth it. I 100% recommend trying to build your own Bloody Mary bar and load yourself up with slim Jim's and bacon! Yum yum!

7-aJaJ_jm_KUBHT2FvdDUg.text: So good! The food and the service! Mallory was so great to us and the managers Dominic and Keri are the sweetest and so accommodating! We will def be back and highly recommend the mimosa flights and avocado toast!

6rdVRqPMgeL0PSZA54Ly3g.text: Great food. Quick service. Mimosas were awesome. Dominic the manager checked on us a few times and Mallory was great.

wi5S7aJ-CGMetNcitsOJJQ.text: Awesome birthday experience. I'm picky, but the food was great. The manager, Dominic, did a great job making sure everything was perfect. We had great service, the wait wasn't too long, and the food came out promptly and was delicious.

FTxMCl1gp-k_rL51MAYJHg.text: Had such a wonderful Sunday morning breakfast here! Our service was great and our food was amazing. We were able to bring our dog and sit on the patio (doggy water was given without even asking!) Dominic was so warm and inviting. Will definitely be stopping by again!

dmy7varqH0Uh9cmgdvOlRQ.text: Brought my folks here for Saturday brunch. As soon as we walked in and my Dad heard the thumping music and saw the DJ booth, he started making a beeline to the exit. Enter the amazing bloody mary buffet extrvaganza to the rescue! My Dad was perfectly happy to wait a half hour to be seated once he had a mug full of vodka'y happiness in front of him. Once we sat down, the servers were super quick and attentive. Everything we ordered was amazing! My rarely impressed parents said they couldn't wait to come back

pX3aV2UDrCOs9dKFsGHbHg.text: Great unique menu items.  Potatoes for a place called "hash" we're at best average.  Live DJ was a fun add.

jodaaNXBRKDSgpHtQmfh1Q.text: Very trendy, fun vibe. My girlfriends and I came for brunch on a Saturday. We walked in, and it was pretty packed, but we were seated promptly. There were a ton of dressed up young girls and a few families. Small bar area, with TVs. Awesome Bloody Mary bar! Even though i don't drink bloody Mary's, i was impressed by the extensive selection of accompaniments. I ordered the corned beef hash. I've had much better. The corned beef looked like it was dumped out from a can. I had to pour hot sauce on top to give it some flavor. My friends had the chillaquilas and Mexicana scramble. They enjoyed their meals. Coffee was good, they have almond and soy milk as creamer alternatives. Mimosa flights available too.

y_97Gr26w-CkpWM6M937hA.text: I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant and the staff! 13 of us came for a bachelorette brunch and were impressed by not only the food and drinks but also the staff! Our waiter was quick, attentive, funny and a pleasure to be around.  Blood marys were amazing, mimosa flights were a huge hit and everyone was raving about the food all weekend.   I cannot wait to go back!

wOkEvcFQGsfjX7hrjbsnbw.text: This was one of the best breakfast meals I have ever had.  Mimosa flight, bacon board, avocado toast.  Oh do not be fooled by the generic title "avocado toast".  This thing was a beast, a beauty, a bready masterpiece.      Lovely service, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon board= bacon, bacon jam, charred brie, bread

ek-5SxkXhVwVYe1QUaWOgw.text: Wow this place is awesome! We love checking out new brunch/breakfast spots and were beyond impressed with Hash Kitchen!  Interior/decor: Super cute and trendy vibes! You can tell they put thought and care into decorating this place, love the cute chairs and wall paintings!  BYOM - Build Your Own Mary Bar was the best I've ever seen!! A huge variety of pickled items (eggs, zucchini, carrots, green beans, cauliflower, different kinds of olives), multiple vodkas to choose from (including cilantro Lime & bacon infused!), also they had meatballs and fried raviolis available as garnishes since it was the weekend!   Food - Amazing! So hard to choose what have, but we decided on the Coconut & Almond Encrusted French Toast and the Carnitas Hash. Both were awesome with huge portions!  Service - this was the icing on the cake. I've never been more well taken care of at a restaurant! Multiple individuals came to check on us, including who I assume to be the owner.   All in all, amazing spot and wish they had one in Southern California!!

4knhXjmCsjz8LjdV9i0fAA.text: The food was great, the mimosas and Bloody Mary Bar was the best and the DJ and dance with the owner was awesome.

B8zXBSUZKuKOGN0Cb5FGOA.text: Good food and okay service. Bloody Mary's are good but very expensive for how small the glass is.

Xf5SZabHI0Gtviakr47Mxw.text: Delish food and great music !! I love the atmosphere and not to forget that AMAZING Bloody Mary bar

9zAFiEgaS8IQwnqS2QC5HA.text: Great Blood Mary Bar!  They have a DJ on the weekend, its a fun place with decent food.

YEvw7uYYJCOJvp64g-jwQA.text: First time... amazing food, amazing service and a great menu of brunch cocktails!! When the manager comes around to greet and ensure satisfaction you know you found a gem!! I will be back.

Ddv3LtFW2AyxSFSoK1xSPg.text: Food: 7 / 10 Service: 5 / 10  The place was nice, the seating was nice, even the presentation of our dishes was nice. Prices were definitely on the more expensive side for a breakfast joint. Our server wasn't the most attentive, I had to wait for water twice. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros Hash, flavor was there. Mmm - but so was a huge piece of fat. Bleh. The biscuits were super good and they have a stellar Bloody Mary Bar.  All in all, whatever. I came, I saw, I ate. But next time I'll go to U.S. Egg

7PHO7nBpcIx4sGOM5jKZvA.text: We had an incredible time.  The atmosphere is terrific and the food was everything one could expect.  Had the opportunity to meet the owners who made every effort to make sure our time there was as enjoyable as possible.  Our waitress could not have been nicer.  I will definitely go back and highly recommend it to anyone looking for an exciting new dining experience.  Bob from Wisconsin

YhPK_mxZy_BgLbp2DgUGXQ.text: Oh my gosh amazing food. Lemon ricotta pancakes! Amazing atmosphere, made breakfast cool! A DJ and an awesome Bloody Mary bar. What an experience, don't miss this opportunity.

4d_fETuDedADQnHKbFWI8w.text: Lolo was a wonderful server! Fast service, amazing food and the big mimosa was a lot of fun. Highly recommend!

N0CpYxOAHmZWutJP6fBcuQ.text: Get your Hash on!  Love this brunch place.  One of my favorite breakfast places in Scottsdale.  They have a huge Bloody Mary Bar and they have a DJ on the weekends.  The energy of this place is amazing...  The food was also top notch.  I recommend the S'mores French Toast which is graham cracker brioche / nutella / charred marshmallow fluff.  This was a massive dish.  You get the crunch of the cracker with the char of the marshmallow fluff with the nutella taste on the back end.  Super rich super awesome!  The next thing you must get since the place is called Hash Kitchen you have to get the Herb Fried Chicken which is potato hash / poached eggs / fried leeks / warm maple reduction.  The fried Chicken had a nice crisp crunch and a juicy white meat center, then you get the taste of the egg yolk, and then you get the sweet of the warm maple syrup.  Boom Sweet and Salty in one dish!  The only knock would be the service was ok.  The waiter did not come around enough to fill up our cups and check in on us for what we needed.  Overall, if you are about to go out to a pool party or go party at some happy hour later go to Hash Kitchen to get you amped up!    BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb Fried Chicken - potato hash / poached eggs / fried leeks / warm maple reduction
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores French Toast - graham cracker brioche / nutella / charred marshmallow fluff

She was friendly fast and super great with our kids. Wish we leave closer, definitely will be back before our trip is over.

D-avop_-ZIhXmnCOgZkkHg.text: So good! To start, the Bloody Mary bar was amazing and a meal in itself. My daughter loves the banana split waffles. The biscuits were delicious and great service! Will definitely be back soon!

XggD7aNol195wj4NqxynFQ.text: Excellent breakfast with amazing service! Brioche is the only bread to use for French toast! Loved it all.

Kd7WdtCYezlwEfEg-91a3A.text: Kaity was amazing - we have been coming here for over a year at least every few weeks because the Bloody Mary bar.  This time to avoid the wait (it's worth it) we sat at the bar and had one of the many amazing flights...Kaity was our bartender and turned this place from an occasional place to our go to.  Scottsdale has a lot of places with great food, but our experience with her now upped this from great food with great staff..   expect our business often!

-_SZCulEg-Y8Mhs8AB0vfA.text: Awesome Bloody Mary bar! And get the bacon board starter and lemon ricotta pancakes - AMAZING!

7may6ui8_EmWSA2LPrEhwg.text: Recently, my father and I were looking for a different place to eat brunch on a Saturday morning.  While we expect there to be a long wait for a good brunch on Sundays, it was a surprise to us to find a 45 minute or so wait on a Saturday.  While this was certainly longer than we would have wanted, the Hash Kitchen staff made sure we were comfortable with small cups of juice and tastes of one of several DELICIOUS starters.  I tried a piece of brunch bruschetta with fig jam, warm brie, and thick bacon.  I so look forward to actually ordering this in the future.    Both my father and I felt like a Scrambler, where we both ordered Thick Cut Bacon Scramblers (potatoes, onion, swiss cheese) served with hash potatoes and a warm buttermilk biscuit (or toast).  Clearly, I am my father's son!  The food was tasty and well worth the wait though the service itself could have been better.  Our server was helpful though she clearly had too many tables to watch over.    Hash Kitchen has some great specials from weekday $3 craft mimosas, weekday $5 bloody mary bar, and Kids Eat Free Mom Mondays.  Also, if you check in on Yelp, you get 5% off your bill even on the weekend!  While I would prefer not to wait so long for a table, I definitely have every intention to have brunch at the Hash Kitchen in the future.

Xu8iXCLfrYgToOSUqHdvpw.text: The cornbread & carne asada hash was totally amazing! We also had the mimosa flight which was delicious. If you aren't into pickled stuff I wouldn't recommend the Bloody Mary bar otherwise go for it. If you are used to Midwest Bloodies that come with a "meal" these aren't it. Still good though. The place is like a club with a DJ spinning music inside which can be kind of loud. We chose to sit outside. The food was so good I would still go back!

zqamz1hna5pUgywVpGnaiA.text: Vaguely hipster-ish and very proud of themselves and their menu. Food was pretty good if not a bit over the top. They had a DJ playing music at 10:00am on Saturday and it was ridiculously loud. Made it difficult to have table conversation.

h0rY2cO7aRMYQoKymFx77w.text: Stopped here for a late brunch after a recommendation from a friend, and it did not disappoint. I did not see it on the menu but our wonderful waitress informed us that we could do a bottomless mimosa bar for $9 and 1 penny each mimosa after. We tried mango, grapefruit, strawberry, kiwi, orange, and black cherry were all delicious.  We started brunch with the hash monkey and my boyfriend informed me it was the best he had ever had. For our main courses we had the carnitas hash and chicken tienga frittata. The food was SO SO GOOD! The portions came out and they were so big and we said no way are we eating all this and of course we did.  The ambience was nice and quiet at about 1:00 pm when we arrived. Overall we loved it! I'd come back again and again! Wish I lived closer!

iu0VhI-0YXBbiHzEqrRMFw.text: We frequent Hash for brunch often. The food, music and service has never disappointed. Today we witnessed people from all age groups dancing in their seats. It's just FUN. We've sat at the bar for a quick breakfast, hosted our daughter's birthday brunch and everything in between. We've never had a bad experience.    Hash has a 'gem' and her name is Bonnie. I don't know what Bonnie's official title is but she is someone to look forward seeing each weekend. Her personality is contagious and so are her dance moves. She goes above and beyond ensuring her guests are taken care of and enjoying themselves.  Bonnie makes our visits extra special.   Why go somewhere else when you can go to Hash and have an experience!! Thanks Hash for your venue, food and staff! Especially Bonnie!

PgUOabmjdRgwdNcfcxKJKQ.text: This place has the perfect brunch atmosphere! The outdoor patio is perfect even on a hot day with the mist. Great food - taste, portion, price and presentation, drinks- creative and tasty and music- a live DJ. The concept is unique. I wish they were in Houston, TX

s18ceraYdMuhudXjDZ9hTA.text: The breakfast menu is exceptional.  Grand opening weekend offered complimentary Berry infused mimosa.  Got the lump crab bennie and was very impressed.  Egg was cooked to prefection, biscuit was light and fluffy with an ample amount of crab.  the side if potatoe was just okay.  Tried the bloody mary bar.... with endless possibilities.  Um ya yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wow!  Amazing lump crab bennie over a beautiful fluffy biscuit.

XKKZq0KUTl3dFauFJTUXpg.text: -My mimosa was well made. -I had the Salmon Hash. It had a substantial portion of salmon but needed a few more capers, in my opinion. -My fiance enjoyed one of the specials: Sweet corn waffle with shredded pork, which was awesome and plentiful. -Our server, Christopher, went the extra mile to actually make honey butter for my biscuit! -Pleasant, relaxing atmosphere.

X7iJmkQtz0X12BWfIiY1VA.text: The owners are the same owners as Tomaso's (Family owned Italian restaurant in the Valley for 37 years).  We had Crab Benedict and Crab Sweet Potato Hash ($15). Both were wonderful!  Saw lots of creative dishes---skillets, belgian waffle piled high-- come out of the kitchen. I would definitely go there again to try the French Press Coffee ($6.50) and the build your own Bloody Mary Bar ($10) !

kNB1TI6SDr0yk2-6yk4eNQ.text: I really want this place to be great. My third time here and orders were not delivered accurately all three visits . Waiters seem overworked but definitely trying hard to keep up with an unreasonable number of tables to cover. Wait for food was too long every visit.   The food is fine, but the atmosphere is confusing and awkward. Management has fixes to make fast or this place will fail

UWjCu8SKgdM6Z_DNgcT2JA.text: This place is an awesome find.  The Bloody Mary bar with add ins like different types of olives, oysters, celery,meat sticks, banana peppers,pearl onions, bacon and extra items.   They have mimosa flights. The French toast melts in your mouth.  If you can visit her it is worth the wait !!! There is a wait of 30-45 mins to get in.

VkF4hfjvsoNzih0oviSiwQ.text: Oh my god! I am floored by this establishment.  It is bright and airy with Windows surrounding the building. The energy is incredibly upbeat and exciting. We were greeted by the owner, Bonnie and she is the most darling woman. She brought in a DJ and has been dancing around the restaurant, she is extremely personable and you can tell her passion for good food, friendly staff and excellent service is What makes this place thrive. Aside from the wonderful entertainment and the energetic atmosphere, the food is incredible. Unique and packed with flavor you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. The coffee is hot and fresh, the Mimosa flight is unique and the bloody Mary bar is the stuff dreams are made of.

PGChbwE_w8zNHnc96eVoXw.text: Absolutely delicious but don't go on a Sunday it's so packed. The good part is they give you free mimosas when you're waiting online. Great bloody Mary bar and wonderful food. They even have a DJ which is pretty awesome.

NBjNM6bP5RSIa9ODEqdX6g.text: The Mimosa Flight was amazing, and the Herb Fried Chicken was amazing as well. My friend had the Breakfast Lasagna and it was a game changer. It was my first time going there.  The staff was friendly and speedy. Definitely have to try the Blood Mary Bar next time.

V0ojTi5oWxrNmIbUIRwDPg.text: I visited Hash Kitchen a couple months ago and our service was excellent, and the food was awesome as well. I liked it so much I told a group of my friends that we should go again. We went for Sunday brunch, and things seemed a little crazy and unorganized in there. We were underquoted for our wait time and ended up waiting 30 minutes longer than we were told. Our server was never present, we were given food without silverware, and then I had to physically get up to grab a manager to get silverware, syrup, water, and coffee refills. I am a server so I get it when you're busy, but our server never came back to quality check our food, and we felt as if we were a burden to be asking for anything. The food was awesome, and always is, but the service and management were very underwhelming. We were then approached by the manager to rate them on yelp, so here I am. I hope next time I come back that my experience will be like it was the first time.

BbyykyahmuYV2ZLmpmVLVQ.text: I finally tried this restaurant after driving by it for over a month.  It was such a delicious delight.  The menu has so many options & the BYO Bloody Mary Bar is a must!

q45eEywSbs7w3PmCXgxjew.text: Mimosa flights and Lona made our breakfast! Breakfast bruschetta was great! Recommend.

XwfAGstjdLJfrOO0edv44g.text: Alec our waiter was GREAT! He made recommendations that were spot on! I had the carnitas hash -fantastic! My hubby had the flat iron steak hash and LOVED it!  We'll be back on our next visit to Scottsdale!

09Ry8qG1VD4uwBC9n_vXxw.text: Very pleased with this spot.  Had no idea it existed until a fried suggested it.  I must admit, it is hard to screw up breakfast food, even I can cook breakfast...but their food was really good, 5 star good to be exact.  The Bloody Mary bar, was perfect as well and the staff was more than happy to help a guy in need who has never really built a real Bloody Mary.  I work so much, I rarely get to enjoy breakfast spots, but I will come back again.

Wf-5T7OBU4DQJyIxZXzLYw.text: This place is awesome. I'm so happy we found this spot while we stay a week In Scottsdale we will definitely be here every morning and can probably have something different every time! The restaurant is well designed and the owner is a very very nice woman. The staff is also extremely friendly and thorough with telling you about the items on the menu. Also they have some really great music playing. I'd definitely recommend this place to a friend!

bmqPSZ_uPy7D99YQvUeg6A.text: BEST brunch in Scottsdale ! Always recommend to visitors in Arizona and my favorite go to place!

0LnebDnCsXc3YgYmCaDQVw.text: Our food and service were great. We were there on a Sunday morning and it was really noisy, so it wasn't good for conversation. The staff was very friendly. I wouldn't get the Bloody Mary bar again tho, it wasn't worth it.

-iWdA2M6O8NT0MmzlmcVpw.text: I don't usually write reviews, but the people and food at Hash Kitchen deserve one.  Long wait? There's a reason.  The menu is eclectic...from the hash dishes to the Benedicts, all outstanding. The servers personable, the Bloody Mary bar is a showstopper, and the hostess, Bonnie, is so friendly you want her to join your table... thanks for a great experience!

flSr8rSRVateTkr8aQN29Q.text: I love this place! I've been here a couple time and I have never been disappointed. Ryan has been our server the past few times, he is the greatest. He is sweet and helpful. It's in a nice plaza with lots of parking. It has an upscale feel, but with great prices. The food is DELICIOUS! Not to mention, their bottomless mimosas which are a win! I have recommended this place to so many of my friends and they always love it as well. I found my new favorite brunch spot! :)

-f2_mYKGUDWNXq6eJ-DxoA.text: The Hash Kitchen has the most amazing breakfast in The Valley. We always have a wonderful experience and the vibes are fantastic. The hostess, Bonnie really makes the place shine. She is always dressed beautifully and is such a kind, bubbly woman. We love to come see her. A must dine in scottsdale!

gfrpfDNhxE9GGZGHT4jL_w.text: Honest review. Waited way to F'in long. Food was good but the atmosphere was ugh. Music with tvs going and a large open room. What ever. NEXT!

n_BfxVVraZCye2Rq9k07jA.text: Jen was a great waitress.  She was attentive and did a fabulous job.  The food was ok.  The service exceptional.

kQMW_SXdfJfHz4iECgXzYA.text: Service was great. Not that much of a wait time if you arrive before 10am. Greeter Dominic was friendly and accommodated our needs as we waited. Food was amazing and the environment is lit!

JTy3U8IbVr8oSs7-SN58mA.text: What more can I say about Hash Kitchen? A group of 5 of us ladies came for boozy brunch to celebrate a Bachelorette and had a great experience. From the service (thanks for everything Bonnie!) to the delicious food & bottomless mimosas. Our favorites were the Carnitas Hash, chicken & Waffles, & lump crab hash but everything was exceptionally good. Looking forward to coming back the next time I'm back on the west coast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles Carnitas Hash Seasonal berries Mimosa

GUW1eOe2U_kKMhRy4uJ_Yg.text: Based off of the reviews and menu online, we were super excited to try this place. Arrived at 11:30 on a Saturday and had to wait 25 minutes for a table--no biggie. They had a DJ who was BLASTING music, so we sat outside. I find it hard to believe that people want to feel like they're at the club when they're eating brunch, but perhaps I'm not hip enough.   We ordered scramblers, chocolate chip pancakes, and steel cut oats. The scramblers were fine, but I thought the portion was a little small for the cost. They came with potatoes on the side that were undercooked to the point where they could not be saved by ketchup. There was also a buttermilk biscuit that was the best biscuit I've ever had, and the main reason why I gave them two stars instead of one. The oats were fine--would have been better with brown sugar, but our waitress never brought it after multiple asks. The chocolate chip pancakes were horrible. After being brought plain buttermilk pancakes, we received our correct order only to find that they were undercooked. They took them off of the bill, but at that point we just decided to cut our losses and get my daughter breakfast somewhere else.   Also, they advertise their juices as "fresh" but it definitely was from concentrate. I have no problem with that, but if I'm paying $5.25 for a glass of orange juice and it's described as "fresh" I would expect something slightly better...   Overall, mediocre food and spotty service. Really wanted to like this place, but I don't think we'll be returning.

TqGQru_uu5v3zYLa7yMicw.text: Love Hash Kitchen. Their bloody bar is second to none! Fun drinks and fabulous mimosas! The food is great and service is always accommodating. There can be a long wait on the weekend but it's because it's very vibrant and there is a DJ spinning tunes in the bar! Great place to go if you're visiting from out of town or, if you're local and have friends visiting!

fjY4Nm19mAgUfFmHZkTRzw.text: Currently eating and service top notch got our food quick shout out to the cooks and all the back staff for making delicious food. Showed up got our table order food and within 20 mins food was ready. The carnitas hash was so good if you aren't sure what to try i suggest that plate. Their mimosas are on point for thode early morning drinkers definitely should try em. Overall will be coming back our server was courteous and efficient with her tables.

6zgySMNFHQG0Cvwx4EPHWQ.text: I've been here many times and have never had a bad experience, the food is amazing, the staff is friendly, and I have never had to wait too long to get sat. They have a Bloody Mary and bar and the most delicious mimosas. This is my go to breakfast/brunch restaurant. I really wish I remembered the name of my waitress the has served me every time I've been their so I can give her some praise, but sadly I don't.

ZhUZ04KpioK-rXUENqyiEQ.text: The food here was really good! I had the American scramble and pancakes. Didn't like the pancakes but the scramble was great. Service was excellent.

LOPZCLbnVUVFOWsowbFMCg.text: We were greeted at the front door with a compliment!! We luv this place and we have not even gotten our food !!

-gWrKAtGDgDI312a5Dhz-g.text: This might be my favorite brunch place now.   It was busy but we got seated in less than they estimated and the service was great. My friends got the Bloody Mary bar which was impressive even though I don't like Bloody Marys. The bartender said he'd accommodate any special requests for garnishes. My friend joked he wanted an Oreo and a minute later the bartender came out with a plate of two Oreos. Gross on the Bloody Mary of course but I got a rumchata iced coffee and it was good with that.   I ordered the herb fried chicken with waffles and it was great. Everything on the menu looked really good and I can't wait to come back.

-XUViVcYxwrfSB_K0ow7nw.text: Great food and service.  Go for the bloody Mary it's the best.  Went to both locations this trip loved this place that much.

UCoi3AC8XJuoWMtnthtW0g.text: Very wonderful wonderful wonderful place ! The food was absolutely AMAZING  the whole atmosphere was fantastic from the moment I walked in to the moment I left . Bonnie is truly a gift from above . She made our dining experience just excellent . I had order the Americano Scrambler and it's to die . The bartender made my mimosa excellent . One of the managers ( she is Hispanic ) she also was a gift from above . Her and Bonnie are absolutely amazing and made everything A+ . I definitely will be coming back and I definitely would recommend this place to everyone .   * Thank You Bonnie so much * you are truly amazing sweetheart

hRAMFfUzQD2LWoOnBdNopQ.text: This place is AMAZING!  Delicious hashes, benedicts, and French toast.  Coffee is outstanding as well.  I don't drink, but the Bloody Mary bar looked pretty on-point.  I had the carnitas hash when we visited, and it was ridiculous.  My party also had the corn tamale Benedict, lump crab and sweet potato hash, and banana split French toast.  Everybody loves their choices.  Also a fun atmosphere, with a live DJ providing the soundtrack.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash

uVcvM5Wy6GMwCU422DpzeA.text: My squad/tribe/fav group of women to hang out with visited this Hash Kitchen location last Sunday. What a wonderful experience! We try to find new places to gather but I think we've found our new meeting spot.  The restaurant was packed but the environment and service was worth the wait. Our waiter, Evan, was fantastic and kept us laughing the whole time. Service was amazing and we definitely enjoyed the brunch & mimosas! I had to include a special review on Bonnie. SHE BRINGS HASH KITCHEN TO LIFE!!! Bonnie was wonderful with EVERYONE that entered the restaurant. She was outside moving tables around to accommodate guests, she helped with clearing and was constantly in motion. I noticed that she always had time to leave a kind word, she took a moment to dance to the music and genuinely seemed to enjoy "work" in the same way we were enjoying "play." Thank you to Bonnie, Evan & the entire Hash Kitchen staff. We'll absolutely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7dNiqUdFZYnrCM9dJpMw6A.text: Great breakfast spot. Cool different takes on classic dishes and an awesome Bloody Mary bar with all the fixings. Service was a bit slow but the food was dynamite.

ifXc0l-FYPOVyKIENpCEEA.text: Went here for my girlfriend's bridal brunch and it was absolutely perfect! Great balance between classy and casual, really nice vibe. Our server was Lona who was absolutely AMAZING and took such great care of the party. (If you get the chance, request her!) The grapefruit mimosa is to die for! I also tried the "build your own Bloody Mary" bar and they have just about everything you can think of. Like, 5 types of vodkas and everything from bacon to baby corn. Over all, great atmosphere and ambiance, great food and drinks, and amazing service! Definitely recommend!

1yOaBbPjBTEhulpqEmzkZw.text: it's  sunday....  you are in a fantastic area of scottsdale.. the dj and music is utterly disgusting..diabolical.. it's hard to believe such an establishment allows this!! maybe you should serve earplugs with your menu's.. let's cater to your local crowd...

rpbXF82K8fBcxx0mGljytQ.text: BONNIE IS THE BEST!! She totally makes Hash Kitchen and it wouldn't be the same without her! Go to Hash and party it up with Bonnie, WE LOVE HER!

gs2UHpjlgURSmpoGzMh7dw.text: Am I missing something? I love breakfast food, and I don't think I have really high standards - I just felt this place was mediocre. Maybe we ordered wrong? Service was fine, nothing spectacular. Had the coffee, which was good. Tried two different frittatas, both were just mediocre, definitely needed more salt or something because they were just bland, and didn't have a ton of veggies/cheese. The potato hash was SO greasy! It is kind of sad if the biscuit is the best part of your breakfast ... Like I said, just an overall mediocre experience, overpriced, and mediocre service. Maybe people in this area don't mind overpaying, but I think there is much better breakfast food around and better deals to be found!

A9sRgT8d_OSEXHC3ysHcSA.text: Amazing food - highly recommend the mimosa flight and bloody mary bar!

XxJ3n6TPsCKnSlPlpXyYxA.text: This place is amazing! The food is delicious. Great atmosphere and the prices are very reasonable. The service is great as well, everyone is very friendly! Bonnie is awesome! I recommend the carnitas hash.

dtvjmVT_uO8rxtidDgLMvw.text: This place is great.  I live in Scottsdale and we are surrounded by a lot of beautiful, high priced, OK food with server's who are just trying to get through the day.  Not "The Hash Kitchen".  Yes it's new, yes it's pretty and comfy and aesthetically pleasing, so pleasing I had a bloody mary at noon, but it's more.  The food is fresh and delicious but the people made the difference.  I would be pleased to meet a client there or have brunch.  Today,I was met by a lovely lady outside the front door welcoming me and letting me know my girlfriend was already there.  Then I met our server Chris.  Chris and his quick wit made it OK for us to drink in the middle of the day.  I appreciated that.  He led the way to the Bloody Mary Bar (BMB) and mixed up the basics for us 1st using one of their own infused vodkas.  Tina, aka Gina, and I had a vodka infused with cilantro and I added some habanero for a spicy kick.  He then waved his left hand out, palm up and to the side as if to say "ta da", inviting us to add over 20 side items to our drink.  2 thick pieces of bacon to start, oysters chilling on ice, horseradish which I stupidly added after the habanero, 3 kinds of olives, at least 3 kind of pickles, I think I saw a whole egg, maybe asparagus?, I'm not sure, I saw salami and Slim Jim's and was done.  SLIM JIM.  I'm not going to lie, I was real classy, I put 1 in my purse and gave it to my husband when I got home.  We also met fellow server Anthony and the proud owner Joey who between those 2 and Chris, I'd just go back for the comedy team.  I know what's going to happen.  People are going to catch on about how great this place is and I'll never get a breakfast seat again, maybe I'll get an honorary booth in the back.  I'm going back for chicken and waffles, bacon in the waffle yes please!, and Nutella and banana French toast.  Your fan, Keri aka Terry.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar and Slim Jim&#39;s.  What more could a girl want?  The Hash Kitchen in Gainey Village is blazing a trail into my happy heart.

MPznnhKRY_WUqWeJE2jVyA.text: Food was great, Gino our server was excellent. Not often do you get great service these days but that is what Gino delivered along with the awesome food

8K4tcGF5gL5-PZvCfyLx4A.text: My hubby and I are from Gilbert staying in Scottsdale for a staycation. We yelped this place and decided to try it out. So delicious. Food was amazing, with a great big portion. We would recommend the breakfast burrito hands down. The service was remarkable. The dj was an added plus. We will be back for sure.

GQl5f43bkWp9RdFnN3aqdg.text: Found this restaurant in the current Best of Phoenix magazine. Easy to get to location. Friendly staff. French Press coffee was delicious. The hash was excellent. I had the chrizo and mushrooms while my wife had herb chicken with fried leeks....the eggs were poached to perfection! We will be going back to try more selections and have already told our friends to check this place out.

aUGuKlroQuuJcU8NXxFuFg.text: Visiting from New Jersey and this was not only delicious but the best service we have had anywhere. The hostess was so friendly even with us having an infant with us and we can't say enough about our waiter Chris.  If you are in the area, I would highly recommend this wonderful restaurant

lRjpLdm-62wGwy02jwteig.text: I hesitated reviewing this restaurant until I read another review written today! Interesting experience. I was at this same restaurant this morning! Wait wasn't bad, and we were welcomed with a friendly face. Once we were seated with a young toddler, we had to seek out our server after more than 10 minutes. Good thing I packed some snacks! We never had our server refill coffee, apologize that it took almost 30 minutes to get a side of fruit for the little one or do much else. She did serve one person in our party, and the dish was incorrect. She didn't really seem to be interested in us at all. It became quite unpleasant to have people waiting to be seated within 2 feet of me. It was so stressful to worry about how long we could stick it out with a young child. There are other places to have breakfast that sincerely care and have excellent food in the area.

UC1ecep3R-6bN5KOzVPYdg.text: Definitly one of my favorite breakfast places! I had a pancake mishap last time I came but hash kitchen was so accomidating with the incident and took the time to apologize and even comp my next visit after I wrote my review. I would highly reccomend going on Sundays because there is a DJ playing great throwback songs and its very lively!!

ilDu4aqNFSDXq2MXL7VHfQ.text: Gotta say the Bloody Mary bar caught our attention, but -- as you might expect -- it's just a gimmick. The whole build-your-own thing to me says the restaurant isn't confident in their cocktail, but aside from that...the food was just OK, the place was incredibly loud, and the service was also just OK. Nah, we won't be back.

2fc9ANz0r30sI_ocqCfJHA.text: Delicious & a Dj for brunch. Endless mimosas & a Bloody Mary bar. I highly recommend the Croque Madame & the drinks. Service was excellent.

wtX8UcjqN_nzODQJijKCPQ.text: Had Sunday brunch. Great vibe.  Tasty food.  Friendly staff.  Will go again.

inzaAq1oTH24EFkPC0iJgQ.text: This place is awesome!!!! Everybody that works there is extremely nice, especially the owners and the bartender!! I drove 35 minutes just to get there and would have driven an hour if I had to, this food is amazing!! Best breakfast I've had in a really long time!! Will definitely be coming back over and over!! Keep up the good work!!

OytuJ_8cr2Iry7raGj_NBQ.text: Finally! Scottsdale needed a brunch spot like this! The build your own bloody mary bar is by far the best I've seen in the area. They have every topping you could imagine... something like 40 different options. And don't even get me started on their food! TO DIE FOR. I am a harsh critic of eggs bennies, and the three out of five I've tried so far were absolutely delicious. They really have everything you could possibly want for brunch. I could eat here every single day. Their hashes are sooooo good, they have fried chicken and waffles, french toast, red velvet pancakes... It's like I died and went to heaven. Needless to say, I am a huge fan of this spot. The overall vibe and atmosphere is just great and somewhere I'll probably take my friends weekly. I definitely recommend you check it out!

LjNdLD-3aZ6lKHxv5Q-JXw.text: YUMMY!!  I had the blackened shrimp roll.  It had just enough heat, lots of plump shrimp!  My friend had the caprese burger with sweet potato fries, which she couldn't finish.  My other friend had the Philly cheesesteak Panini with a side salad.  The service was outstanding!  Lot's of suggestions, which we appreciated.  We will go back for breakfast next time.  The decor was very relaxing,  nice and bright. Everything we saw being delivered to other patrons looked really good!  Can't wait to return!

jyOHW8DGG-7DblV7b8xCaA.text: Linda, Bonnie and Jessie made our day!  This place was amazing for brunch and the staff made it even better.

sRz50EwUIdGEouuLiueHyw.text: I went to The Hash Kitchen a few months ago and really enjoyed it.  Food was good and the service was excellent.

-dCaj5mOkTIawK6FuyV5BA.text: Bloody Mary bar was the bomb and made the time waiting to be seated this Sunday morning fly by in a flash. DJ was spinning vibrant tunes and we continued the Vitamin C fest with the Mimosa Sampler (OK, Grapefruit, Guava, Mango). Highly recommend the Buttermilk Herb Chicken Hash, Coconut Crusted French Toast and best Chilequiles I have had outside Mexico...Go..go now!

xFvEoOQoiOWKCT6kbSvYSw.text: My husband and I went to Hash Kitchen in Scottsdale for a quick lunch date. We love that it has breakfast and lunch options. Gino was our server and he was great! Very enthusiastic and attentive!

c97fUNiyzBhlPsNmT5-GYA.text: I ate breakfast at hash kitchen today and it was amazing.  I did not know what to eat and my server helped me pick something out.  Short rib Benedict served on a potato cake, yum.  The atmosphere is fun and I go there every weekend if I could!

dHt-bZQz5WyfcQv1oDNZKg.text: Amazing!!!!!! They accommodated our large (loud) group well. Amazing food. Great service. Next time I come to town, I can't wait to come back. Thank you from Booktini. And Bonnie is legit.

zbGstxnNwvg2vgQNrzQ0CQ.text: Such a wide array of creative dishes here! This is my second time here with my first time being about about two months ago with a friend. The food and service is excellent... I had to come back with my boyfriend. He enjoyed it as much as my friend and I did. Wonderful location and beautiful decor inside. Love the quote and artwork on the wall. The owner, Bonnie, has a vibrant personality and instantly make you feel welcomed.  If you love french toast as much as I do, treat yourself to the Coconut and Almond Crusted French Toast! You wont be disappointed. You know is dish is good stuff when it tastes just as good -- if not better-- straight out of the fridge on the next day.   My boyfriend and I will definitely be returning!!

osCyeWxVL43xqvjja1z91A.text: Kind of surprised by the great reviews The service was nice, coffee really good.  We got the berry pancakes and huevos rancheros  Pancakes very normal and huevos rancheros underwhelming.  The portions are large and filling. Totally shocked there was a 45 min wait.

mivVKxhRTh1_bVxOlI40pA.text: Great atmosphere. Outstanding food! Great service!! The maple syrup is some next level ish!!!! Don't be scared to try something new!

PIRRnqyXwuDGr4rQZoLo_Q.text: Loud & hot, loud from bad acoustics & dj music, felt like it was 85 degrees in there, the best way to communicate is by test, never going back

UGDWs9qXmRX58Y6WAm7e_Q.text: Not local to AZ. Found this gem of a breakfast spot in minimal distance to the hotel. I cannot recommend it enough! Delicious food! So many different and original breakfast hashes, eggs Benedict, and pancakes. Two words: Bloody Mary bar. There are fun mimosas too! If I'm back in Scottsdale definitely will return! Bonnie and her restaurant staff are so friendly and accommodating. A MUST!

njwvzuemyGXz-FM0sbRsVQ.text: The concept was great with the Bloody Mary's but the food was a little too eclectic. The Bloody Mary's themselves were a meal. Overall you will enjoy this place.

R3d28-Zxw0kxB-y2zEsMRw.text: I love good corned beef hash, but I'm usually disappointed when I order it and it looks like something scooped out of a can. Not the case at The Hash Kitchen. My biggest issue was deciding what to order since everything sounded amazing. I opted for the carnitas hash (carnitas being another of my loves), it was juicy, tender, and flavorful. Boyfriend ordered the huevos rancheros hash and loved it as well, and he is normally not a hash lover either! Although I did not partake, the Bloody Mary bar looked very interesting with a ton of options to personalize your drink (Bacon infused vodka? Sorry I missed it!)  But even with the great food, the service was even better. Bonnie, the lady who seated us, was a delight in particular, checking in with us often and chatting with us about what brought us to town and where we were from. She really went out of her way to be attentive and welcoming, and is the reason I'm taking the time to write this review. Thanks Bonnie!!

x7zsjZFtXcfJTauUTeJOLA.text: A must visit place in Scottsdale...Bonnie is amazing, the food and atmosphere are comfortable and inviting!!!

ZmH5uibW3wPvA1PsKyoNzw.text: First time here and it's awesome! I'll be coming back. Food was amazing! Dominque was an awesome server! It's a must!

aBtmFyRkBcrcn_ZfG1HUOg.text: Chris is absolutely amazing. We were visiting from out of town and Chris made us feel right at home! We came on a Friday and we fell in love with Chris so much that we came back on Sunday. It was packed but Chris got us drinks and Breakfast Popsicles while we waited! The food is so good but Chris made us want to come back again and again! Thanks bro, you rock! The Hash Kitchen is lucky to have you!

YAe0X-Ilt_8C_8k2BE1WkA.text: First time coming here and I was excited because I have heard so many good things. If I could give 0 stars I would, the server Tiana is rude and does not know anything about customer service. I will never be coming back and I will make sure to never recommend this place.

lBhd1PRgRHeRz_Mz3ZJ9Lg.text: I have been to HASH KITCHEN 3 times and am never disappointed!  This time I brought 6 friends from out of town and they could not believe the incredible, delicious food and the fabulous service.  They are world travelers and thought HASH KITCHEN rated amongst the best breakfast they had experienced!  High praise from them!  I couldn't agree more!  The owner BONNIE is gracious and helpful.  Our server EVAN could not have been better.  He had a great sense of humor and everything came out exactly as it was ordered!    Great place!  Great Food!

C8_75uaP3qkgGHVqjZJzwA.text: I love to eat breakfast here every time that Cars and Coffee is showing. Nice sit down and enjoy their great selection of food. I have been going consistently every month for the last year. The hostess is always so friendly and staff is on point! Excellent service!

h2YnlJIws7jUQ4su31Bw1w.text: Amazing food and service! Make sure to have a bloody mary and hang out with Bonnie!

j28QRATvKCq0KPuEVNF5Kg.text: Hands down the best brunch in Phoenix! Even  better staff, they accommodating my boyfriend and I plus 15 of our friend for a reunion brunch! We had such a fabulous time and the food was amazing! Our waiter was on point, we never waited for a refill on our mimosas! The Bloody Mary bar is epic, literally the coolest display of toppings I have ever seen! We were so pleased and will remember this day for long time! Thank you Hash Kitchen!

ohq0JoPtWVh4fYLzlxqoYg.text: Today was my first visit.  After all the great reviews I was looking forward to a great breakfast.  The Huevos Rancheros Hash was a complete dud.  The tortilla was so dry it couldn't even be cut with a knife.  I don't know what kind of meat was used but it was so tough it was impossible to chew.  I only ate the potatoes.  Get the picture?  What a total waste of money.  I wish I had sent it back.

9IpUPm4YYpnNbO9mXK_tEw.text: Really great food and super quick service. I'm definitely going to go back to try the Bloody Mary bar or the mimosa flights. The drip coffee was also fantastic, so I can only imagine how great their specialty drinks are. Definitely a place to go for a great breakfast!

ny69lkugvNGnXqDRb2GViw.text: Wow!  Just wow!  Without a doubt this is THE happening breakfast place. The biggest, baddest, bestest Bloody Mary bar I've ever seen!  And, bestest isn't even a word but it's the only descriptor you need to know.  Great food.  Upbeat vibe!  Morning tunes to get you going!

19poIQs8Fgux4EPd2umkHA.text: Best bloody Mary bar everrrrrrr!!!! Food is delicious! Only complaint is that the music is crazy loud on the weekends and when I took my parents and in laws here they seemed a little uncomfortable because they were screaming at one another when trying to communicate. Overall highly recommended - get a bloody!!!!!

azIfUs8V7WPbdtG4crCZoA.text: This is my second time to the restaurant so I took company along - here for the morning  And it was certainly disappointing - my husband ordered hash something and when it came to the table we all gasped - did not look edible and my friend Pam ordered something else that I would not have eaten either - everything seemed deep-fried very heavy and not breakfast like at all - I was so grateful I ordered the parfait and Pam's son ordered the French toast but didn't say too much about it Nobody said they were excited about their meal - we just had a conversation and finished  And the service was slow we waited a long time for breakfast and there weren't that many people in there - we arrived at 10:30 and left at 12:30 since we were having a little bit of a reunion I'm not impressed with the place - the front door was open so hot air was coming in all of the time  The receptionist blame women for breaking the door and said they were pushing out instead of pulling out which I thought was really a rude thing to say about the customers  I was glad we moved to the back of the restaurant  The place seems to have gone downhill just in the few months since I was there the first time with my tennis group

uBIHWFmBg2HZ-WuK3jcuWw.text: A great place for a hearty & leisurely brunch! The carnitas hash are moist and delicious! The Bloody Mary is like a meal in itself. The monkey bread is crispy and moist at the same time, really tasty but not too sticky.

9ru-TJfvSzHBhpm6Fdj25Q.text: This place is amazing! The Fried Chicken Hash is a must, as is the build your own Bloody Mary bar which has everything you could think to put in one. Bonnie has been there every time I've been in and she makes the place feel like you're having brunch at a friend's house. 5 stars for sure.

O3i90NBrU3-LJiaUUygdew.text: Food, service and ambiance was all average at best. Another Scottsdale breakfast Restaraunt that will simply do well because it's better than IHOP (but not by much).

slXvzp_UoSURdyJik3GkMw.text: I had never been to this restaurant before and am a huge breakfast food enthusiast. The cocktails were awesome especially if you have an affinity towards coco-puffs. Bonnie is a pleasure to talk to and adds to a fun environment with great music. There's also a beautiful bartender named Katie, who makes the possibly long wait not so bad. Definitely check the place out.

yB0AUNtBbZZU33Gb3Ui3EA.text: I absolutely love this place! The food is amazing, the drinks are delicious and the staff is THE BEST! Bonnie is so fun and energetic! Favorite brunch spot!

I814u2Fv8OH0sADqQQFXpQ.text: My sister and I are here on vacation and we went to hogs and hops last night for dinner. Linda, the general manager, recommended we come to The Hash Kitchen for breakfast this morning. (These two restaurants have the same owners). After she described their chicken and waffles and Bloody Mary bar we knew we had to! This morning we came in and were greeted by Linda immediately and Joe the owner. Wow that is some amazing customer service! The food was top notch and the chicken waffles definitely didn't disappoint!! This is a MUST stop for breakfast if you're in the area!

Y3b02JX-PBzJOsu5gEvRSw.text: GO TO THIS PLACE!    My hats off to Joey, the creator of this much needed new breakfast lunch place in central Scottsdale. The menu is unique, simple to understand and lots of great choices. The ambience is relaxing and the place jams with energy vibrating from the ground to the walls and hopefully through to the customers!  I have the Salmon Eggs Benedict.  EXCELLENT!  My date has some egg dish, which I can't recall the name of it, but they said it was awesome as well.  The French coffee was amazingly good too.

ZfWOHYYf3HXO1wQnciqa5g.text: YUMMY!!! This place is awesome!! The waffles are amazing! The bacon is so flavorful and thick. It was great! The staff was great! I'll have to try the bloody mary bar next time!

MvB8LyKLTcN1qlNvFJQK7w.text: I was visiting Arizona for spring training and decided to take our group of six here for brunch. We didn't make a reservation so the wait was 50 minutes but they sat us in 20 minutes. The place had a great ambiance with a DJ and TV screens. I ordered the chicken and waffles which were amazing! The fried leeks were a good touch and the chicken itself was a really good. Other menu items that people in my group tried were the huevos ranchero hash, lumb crab & sweet potato hash, oreo pancakes, lemon & ricotta pancakes and crab roll. Everyone enjoyed their meals!

RXay9HFj93wfbGA_5O1FBw.text: Great local breakfast place! Fabulous bloody mary bar. Probably the best I've ever seen. Their breakfast burrito is really good. The food is very fresh and delicious. I personally don't love the potatoes in the hash (soft, not crispy), but all my friends like it - so it must be me :)

p68SFHA8agtZpd05xHCMNA.text: Wow! Great breakfast! Great service. From the moment we walked in, everyone was so nice, despite being extremely busy. tm the place was jammed and they handled it well. We had to wait 30 minutes, but we didn't mind, we heard the food is fabulous.   When we were seated, service was friendly and efficient.  Our server, Jesus, was wonderful. I had a lovely bloody Mary from the do it yourself bloody Mary bar. What an impressive assortment! I ordered the red velvet pancakes, which were decadent and divine. My hubby had the brisket hash, which he loved. I tasted his hash and it was so flavorful and delicious. We both had a French press of Italian coffee, how thoughtful to have individual, fresh  French press style coffee! Delicious.   We were very impressed and love the atmosphere. The DJ on a Sunday morning was a cute touch and elevated the vibe of the whole place. He wasn't too loud at all, just right to have pleasant conversation. The owners were buzzing from table to table making sure everyone was enjoying their experience. What a nice couple.  I believe we just found our new regular weekend spot for early dining!

hHtV3R7U0TF9kpcw41Eujg.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere,  and  an amazing bloody marry bar.. Adrian is the bloody Mary Artis.

Wkfo-GDwMHIZ0FGeVHvHew.text: We where told the wait would be an hour and a half almost making us leave. Our buzzer went off in like 20 minutes after we got it. We where sat right away and our server was a young man. He seemed to busy with all the tables around and we felt like we where bothering him when we asked for things. Me and my boyfriend ordered and i asked for no onions and tomatoes in my dish and he assured me there was no tomatoes or onions in it and when i got it it had tomatoes and onions:( wasn't to happy about it but didn't complain. Not up to the hype it has on yelp wasn't that great!

7zxDY-LwWbaMSsVf2Zxgpw.text: Wow! Packed in the weekends so we had to come on Monday. Worth it. Party vibe in the weekends. Bring your dog!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French toast with fresh strawberries.

gvJPyZpib7IvemGcEegGjg.text: This was my 2nd time coming to Hash Kitchen, And once again I was not disappointed.   My only complaint is their wait system. They still do it old school and give out buzzers after signing up with the host. When the wait is over an hour long, you wish that you could go somewhere else in the meantime. Really hoping that they start to use NoWait so you can either get in line before hand or at least have the option to view your place in line and get a text when your table is ready.  Mimosa flight, amazing. Mine came with OG mimosa, peach, raspberry, and strawberry. I loved the peach and raspberry mimosas. Make sure to get a straw and mix them up to get the full flavor of the juice/muddled fruit! So delicious.  Breakfast/brunch are my favorite meals and I always have the hardest decision choosing between sweet or savory.   Luckily, my friends and I ordered the breakfast bruschetta to share. We loved both the banana and Nutella bruschetta and the strawberry and Brie.   For my entree, I ordered the hash chicken Benedict. The fried leeks are amazing and go so well with the fried chicken. Sometimes I have to stop myself from eating just the crispy leeks first because they're just that good. I have no idea what they bread their chicken with, but it's the perfect mix of savory and just blends so well with the leeks and biscuits.  Overall, I would definitely come back. The food and mimosa/bloody bar are 100% worth the wait.

viCHC-N9g_KUqp6XmLVtKQ.text: Services sucked dick!!! The waitress was horrible it was like we weren't worth her time! Had to ask for refills waited 2 hours to be seated to then be ignored! Honestly had to raise my hand for her to even come back! She didn't even bring syrup or any condiments! When we order waffles! Then no water refills until we asked! It's they only thing they cared about was being load and bar! Why serve food if you don't care to take care of people with basic needs!

ZPPIdT7EUc1IE7OO5DGaAw.text: On Sat, Mar 16, 2019 at 11:25 AM Enoch J Ledet wrote: Dear Sir, You might read attached and take notice of noise level above 85 db. Hearing protection is recommended, especially for employees for 8 hr exposure periods. Nine of us recently ate at the HK location on 877 Scottsdale Blvd and average db level measured by dbMeter was greater than 90 db average on 3/16/2019 at 10:00AM with Low 87db to high 107db. We politely voiced our concern and your location manager told us that he liked it loud and had been operating with this db level for the past 4 years without complaint. We informed several of your location employees that employees working with noise levels greater than 85 db for 8 hrs should be provided with hearing protection. Your manager dismissed and ignored our comments and walked away. We were informed by our waitress that a DJ set the sound level and it could not be adjusted. I asked who had responsibility for adjusting the sound volume db when DJs were not present but no one answered me. We liked your bar drinks, food menu selections, and service but respectfully request that you consider decreasing db sound to Average hearing/conversation levels (85db or less) so customers and staff don't have to shout across tables to be able to hear/understand conversations and waitress menu selections. Respectfully, EJ Ledet noisehelp.com/noise-dose... osha.gov/workers/index.h... Respectfully, EJ Ledet

VwxpDQq9-Ng25pbNLwngtg.text: We came for breakfast and were not disappointed.  The service was great in spite of it being a very busy Sunday morning.  The menu is expansive and the food was great.  Everyone else seemed to be having a good time too.    I didn't like all of the TVs on the wall, but maybe I'm just a Luddite.  I like to sit down and eat, and TVs are just too distracting in anything other than a sports bar.

KU8eH1wmfYVmwVlFPWG8Xg.text: Stopped by Saturday morning about 9:30 and had a 45 minute wait time.  Did a little shopping at Sprouts so not so bad. Ate outside, a really good thing because the DJ had the music blasting inside.  Impossible to hold a conversation, impossible to relax.  Obviously trying to be the hip place, but really does it need to be this loud? Larry ordered the carnitas hash.  Wow, huge bowl of all good things he said.  Pork hash, potatoes, 2 eggs, avocado, fried leek straws, corn, and cheese. I had a Belgian waffle with fresh fruit.  Light and tasty waffle, would have enjoyed a little more fruit, but a very satisfactory choice. Two ice coffees with 2 refills, coffee could have been a little stronger, but a good choice on a hot day. Our server was attentive and helpful with recommendations.   Plenty of parking, a plus. Definitely will be back, and will sit outside....

JnZqkY6IxkbjXpqNJFSD8Q.text: As a former employee I am biased to certain things. Plates come out way too hot more often than not (still have scars). But still a really interesting menu. Not something I would eat regularly. But I do love the Live DJ's and the intricate Bloody Mary bar. Definitely a spot I would recommend visiting at least once.

rSFyy8j98TKZPqw9rQExqA.text: This location was very very very loud & really busy for a weekday morning brunch. The wait was 40 mins. It was almost impossible to get the bartenders attention for a drink, she was slammed. Once seated our waitress was pushy & wanted a fast order. She acted like she had no time to waste. She rarely displayed a smile & acted very stressed. This is the first time going to this location. I normally frequent their North location, it's just a mile from my house. The food was still great. I'd personally recommend if you want a laid back, NOT crazy busy loud brunch, head to North location. Probably won't be back to this location.

Carne burrito lacked flavor and spice - we are from Texas and know our burritos.   Would not try a second time.

For some reason they feel that a DJ and music so loud you have to shout to be heard across the table is a pleasant experience. And we were outside on the patio, inside was unbearable. Pretty much ruined the experience. God save us from millennial hipster trendiness.  As far as the service went the waiter was attentive even though it was busy. As for the food I ordered Huevos Rancheros. Very greasy and the flavor was nothing special. My wife's food was bland at best. I guess the noise and the Bloody Mary bar are the attraction. Next...

Kgn094PTNO4BHwI9jBCSHw.text: Went to the HK location on Thompson Peak/FLW today and feel a review is necessary. I've been here before and always had a good meal and lovely service but today was the sad exception. I asked for the English muffin in my eggs Benedict to be over toasted and it wasn't toasted at all. It took forEVER to get our breakfasts and when they arrived the eggs were cold. I asked for more hot water for my tea TWICE and they never came back. We sat there for over thirty minutes before someone thought to come and refill our waters. In short, the meals were cold, not to order, and we felt fairly neglected. Normally I'd speak up while still at the restaurant but I was dining with s friend who'd never been there AND she was picking up the tab so I didn't want to embarrass her or make the experience awkward. Had this been my first time in I'd never return. Because I know they can do better I'll probably give them another chance but wow... truly awful today.

Some examples include over salted food and flat mimosas  (due to batch mixing well prior to serving). We have gone back for several weeks now hoping things would turn around but seen such a trend. The price differential compared to their competition no longer feels justified.

_RGM95I25SPXyOHO6B1lUA.text: Disappointed in the service. The restaurant refers to themselves as a creative breakfast experience, so with this in mind while ordering, I told my waiter I was vegan and asked for his recommendation. He responded "oh you're SOL, you'll have to sit and watch everyone eat. Our kitchen is all animal products." Thinking he was maybe joking and knowing I saw a fruit platter, oatmeal, and many veggies on the menu, I responded "so there's nothing I can eat?" He then replied that he can do grilled veggies. Very, very disappointed in the lack of thoughtfulness by our waiter. I ended up ordering potatoes with pico de gallo, avocado, and a side of fruit. The potatoes were fine, nothing better than your average breakfast spot. The side of fruit was weak-grapes, pineapple, and cantaloupe.   My food was fine, it filled me up but was nothing I would return for. The other guests in my party (non vegan) were very pleased with their meals, but agreed that our waiter was very rude and off-putting about my vegan request.  A few other negatives: there was a bug crawling around in our centerpiece, it was no big deal I just didn't want it on my table. I took the small centerpiece outside just to release the bug and two different individuals walked up to me in a panic as if I was stealing their cheesy centerpiece. I explained the bug situation and they allowed me to get rid of the bug, with no apology for a bug inside their restaurant... Then, there was an older lady (apparently the hostess) walking around shaking maracas. She appeared to be having a great time which was fun, and I'm sure the later day/drinking crowd might enjoy that, but mostly it was just odd for a breakfast... did not add to my experience. Others around didn't seem to be enjoying it either, and she was dancing all over them.   Positives: DJ

EaMy1Nrane452HlQvh2TzQ.text: This place is incredible! Such a cool place. Ok so there's this older lady who works here and she's so kind and fun, she has a heart of gold. RXbHZTy35DpmuNou0POyjA.text: I've been a few times and would highly recommend this place to anyone. The mimosa flights are my personal favorite and they have the best Bloody Mary bar!

72XYGB3yakmtG2_W-6tvbw.text: My new favorite breakfast/brunch spot in Scottsdale. The atmosphere and decor is comfortable & fun. They have a Bloody Mary bar, which I'm sure is very popular. The coffee was bold and wonderful! I had the coconut/almond French Toast and good god was it sent from heaven! He had the lemon ricotta pancakes (which sounded scary) but was amazinggggggg!!!   The best part was the friendly and attentive staff..service was prompt and Bonni, the hostess made us feel like old friends. She was seriously the cutest thing EVERRRRR...  To the owner, Joe...I literally cannot wait to come back this weekend to experience the weekend vibe! Great job guys!!!!

7Z9ErwpTjB6I6DNOfLSh7g.text: Pretty disappointing. So I've been to the Hash Kitchen on Frank Lloyd Wright about 3 times and while there is usually about a 30 min wait on the weekend, the food always makes up for it. However this experience at the Scottsdale Road location ruined my love for Hash Kitchen. What got me hooked originally was the chicken and waffle. It has consistently delighted me and was the reason why I chose Hash Kitchen above any other place to brunch this past Sunday. It was my boyfriends first time and although he was starving I convinced him the 45 min wait was so worth it. I wanted him to try it because Im always raving about the food particularly the chicken and waffle. However the food was a True let down to the point that I'm not really sure I want to waste money again at any Hash Kitchen. The chicken and waffle was a joke and I felt almost insulted after much anticipation. I started to cut up my food then I realized it was hardly chicken and a waffle. It was basically a waffle with one tiny chicken strip topped with a ridiculous mountain of fried leeks. I'm not sure if the kitchen had just run out of chicken or if this is now how this dish comes. It has always come topped with fried leeks but at least there was substance under those leeks. At least you felt like you were getting a normal amount of chicken for $14. This was just insulting and I wish I had taken a picture. I honestly wonder if they were just low on chicken and thought they could get by with selling one last order by putting a pathetic shrunken sized chicken strip on there and covering it up with a ridiculous mountain of the fried leeks and hoping that maybe I wouldn't notice. I really hope this is the case because if cutting down the amount of chicken and increasing the amount of fried leeks is now how the dish comes then they need to seriously reevaluate things. The second item we ordered was equally disappointing. I love fruity pebbles and I love pancakes but the fruity pebble pancakes were awful. I don't mind spending $12 on pancakes if they are worth it. These pancakes were a bit overdone on the bottom and just tasted like regular old pancakes but with a hint of sour milk. Nothing fruity pebble about it except maybe the color of the batter. Also having a DJ at brunch is fun and can add to the experience but the acoustics at this location are terrible. At least at the FLW location you can hear each other talk and don't have to scream across the table. This whole experience was disappointing and I probably should have said something while we were there but I just wanted to get out of there ASAP. I was so looking forward to showing my foodie boyfriend a great brunch spot but it was a total fail and waste of money and I'm sad my favorite dish is no longer. The end.

ZDCtMhzS-I0j4zGiBrPP4A.text: This place was nothing short of amazing! atmosphere with the dj and great service was unbeatable. Prices were competitive and the food was outstanding. Hands down best corned beef and hash and chicken chilaquiles ever.
