nx-DeneVUbzyblAhg7ynJg.text: One of my fav brunch spots in Scottsdale! I love the ambience the places gives off. The employees are super nice. The food is delicious, the place is cute, and I also love the music!

pxl4C3VNeb5CAzsFLikyXQ.text: I couldn't believe the buzz that was in this place for a brunch on a Sunday morning.  The wait wasn't too bad about 20 minutes, but more and more people kept checking in to wait for a table.  All of the items on their menu looked good and made me want to try everything.  I had a really hard time deciding on what to choose, but I went with their specialty dish Breakfast Lasagna. The dish sounded delicious and interesting, so i had to give it a try. My husband tried the Carnitas Hash.    The Breakfast Lasagna was creamy and satisfying, it definitely hit the spot. It was filled with breakfast favorites eggs, sausage, bacon as well as traditional lasagna ingredients such as ricotta and mozzarella. The Carnitas Hash was also delightful, the carnitas were very tender and flavorful. The dish arrived on a skillet still bubbling on the side with gooey cheese. We'd love to try other dishes here and will definitely go back the next time we're in phoenix!  Parking can be an issue, when we visited there was construction in a nearby store so part of the parking lot was blocked off and limited the number of parking spaces.

45FJJNGcP0TZ9eV958K4HA.text: We went here on my husband's birthday and that was a mistake. His breakfast was horrible. Not only was his sausage completely undercooked, but the "hash" potatoes were cold and soggy. We had such high expectations for this place. The sausage was returned to the kitchen where they apparently cooked it some more, however it did not look any different when they returned to the table with it. It was inedible. We told the waitress and she agreed, but handed us a bill for the entire thing, including his meal! We asked to speak with a manager - who then did the right thing & took my husband's meal off of our bill. We will not be returning to this place unless we have to.

f5TJRJZaJMI0uxPqYIHLAw.text: The food here is amazing and so unique! Love the atmosphere with the live DJ that played fun kid friendly music!

GWFivagb40Ly4WpDQd5DYg.text: Amazing service, from the minute I walked in. Lona & her staff are phenomenal! The best Bloody Mary bar I've experienced, and I travel around the country often for business and pleasure. Top shelf, everything!

-NRgnKyq0JQLE1Pa19W47w.text: Sunday morning brunch + Bloody Mary bar + mimosa flights? Count me in!!! The Hash Kitchen is one of my favorite Weekend brunch spots! The food / service is always awesome! Love me some Bonnie! She rocks!!! Every time we visit we're greeted by our first names which I love! I've gotten to explore the menu and try different cuisines after visiting on several occasions! Their Lemon Ricotta pancakes topped with whipped mascarpone / warm maple reduction is literally to die!!! Their smoked salmon eggs Benedict + their brunch bruschetta + berry pancakes are also super delicious! Fiance loves the banana split French toast! I'll typically get the mimosa flight if I'm with some girlfriends and we're having a girls day! All the flavors are excellent. I can't wait to explore more of their menu & go for more Sunday morning brunches

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mWHDC621WNOfaWBPPFKbIA.text: The hash kitchen is so good and the owners are really nice. The owners of the hash kitchen also bought my house! The breakfast there is 10/10  I would go there all day everyday

fL_tw2EUpRoNXtt-QWSBYg.text: Service is always slow at the bar. And when it is, no management anywhere in site to assist. Food is decent but pricey

_YI8Dvdr7SAkaIzSKLzZkg.text: Great brunch spot. Bloody Mary bar is absolutely crazy good. Great crowd and fun atmosphere. Food was fantastic and they handled a party of 20 without blinking. Bonnie is a doll!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2X9G5eTs9S3EIANNG-7xMQ.text: We had s very easy time getting in and they were able to accommodate my daughter's special needs stroller! The lady with grey hair is super amazing and wonderful! She loved my girls and was very friendly!  Great service!

5toE4iKo7GN4Q2_Yvszn1A.text: Gimmicky bloody mary bar. Long wait. Enticing menu. Amazing pork hash w green chile, + smore french toast. Bacon potato omelet was not tasty. Live DJ at brunch playing pop hits. All in all a hit!

84oeZPUb_ieroOAUerYM_A.text: Absolutely amazing!  I could go for the Bloody Mary bar alone, but the food is just too good to pass up. Very cool vibe and the place is packed, so that speaks to its appeal. Service was quick and friendly. This is a great way to enjoy a Sunday breakfast/brunch.  Will definitely be back soon. Thinking it might be a weekend go-to...

gwsBf81yAzvFtu76Or582w.text: I'm from Pennsylvania visiting a friend here in Arizona and we came to Hash Kitchen for brunch. We got the 25 oz strawberry mimosa drink which was amazing! It even came with cotton candy and a pinwheel. I also suggest the cereal shooters, the fruity pebbles one was delicious! I even bought a t-shirt as my one souvenir from Arizona. Kaity was absolutely amazing and took the best care of us while we were here. When I make a trip back to Arizona, this place will be the first place I come to visit because of her and her amazing service.

lK_4eK2jg5kEGJTBas8xYg.text: Our hash kitchen server Patrick was soo nice and friendly and made our time here very enjoyable!!

2CsvMthYY43XwdGmfyJEeA.text: Food was amazing and the portions were HUGE! Be sure to get the Bloody Mary bar or a mimosa flight. Ask for Lona, she does not disappoint!

hem06jbHiZ2dexGJHkKXSw.text: Lona was amazing! Very attentive and engages with the customers. Knows the menu well and recommended the tamale cakes. They were to die for! Next time you go ask for Lona, she's hilarious!!

Riku5L7HxqEruhnk58jG0w.text: Waited over thirty minutes for me food only to learn the server never entered my order.

yYvZtejKOcGXlQ9riC8laQ.text: My favorite brunch spot ever!! Bloody Mary bar is amazing and the atmosphere is a lot of fun.

qvQ2b1asj_UBN8Lyh3-0CQ.text: Ooooo this place was such a good brunch! Lots to select from, the drinks were great too.

kKuzCM7kpGqCUe3iDjtrQA.text: I love this brunch place!!! All the food was really delicious, the service is so friendly and the overall feel of the place just screams "fun"!! We went on a Saturday morning around 11, and we were seated promptly. There was a DJ playing, and the music selection was great! We immediately ordered the bloody mary (I'm usually not a huge fan of bloody Mary's, however the make your own bloody mary bar seemed too good to pass up). I got the cilantro vodka and medium spicy (definitely spicy enough - would not be able to have any more spice to it). The bar had such a great selection - bacon, salami, pickled celery, asparagus, mango, eggs, and oysters. The pickled eggs were surprisingly delicious - it was the first time I had tried it.   For food, everything we ordered was great. There were a bit too many potatoes in the huevos ranchero hash, but that's a personal issue. I'm not the biggest fan of potatoes. It was flavorful and there was plentiful.   The service was excellent! Our waiter was extremely friendly, great with food recommendations and enjoyable small talk! I really enjoyed my experience here! Will definitely be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Make your own Bloody Mary bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary - yum yum yum

vJQFu744cERJI_c9OMtRPg.text: It's ok...nothing special....I have had much better for a less price.  Plus the music on a Sunday was so LOUD--I prefer my loud music at the local night club not  Sunday dining.  Chances are we will not go back.

pdSHtT-Aqz-DLKifsKrpOg.text: This is a cute place, with a lot of novelty appeal, great to try once but not worth the long wait and slow service to go back a second time.

BJm9O9_nYWHuxWFAr8g8kw.text: Mediocre food, mediocre service, too loud, little pricey....Bloody Bar only reason to go.  Better make some adjustments before neighbors from the North start coming....they'll spend their money at Butters, Butterfields, Paradise Bakery, etc.  No wonder this location keeps evolving...haven't nailed the food yet............

Uva_mR-QHKR515VbxdEOhQ.text: Why must creativity trump execution excellence?  The menu reads well, but taste is disappointing.  The location had me doubtful, as the former cuttlefish was pretty slow and sad.  To my surprise this place was pretty happening, perhaps if food which is priority to a restaurant was made well, it can truly succeed.  Service wasn't all that either..  had high hopes as it seemed to get high marks.

hz4RsorjbOv-lz0x06VpXA.text: I really wish I could give a good review here. We were so excited to try this place. I know it's Easter sunday, but we showed up early and were told there would be a 25 minute wait. No problem, we expected that. So after sitting out front and enjoying the beautiful Arizona spring weather we were excited to hear our name called. Up we went and through the dining room we walked and further around a corner and to a back room which is apparently their secondary restaurant. I'm not complaining, however I really wasn't expecting to be seated in a secondary BBQ restaurant like an uninvited cousin. If this was the seating they were offering we most definitely should have been told when we put our name on the list.Things didn't really get much better from there. The food was average and overpriced. The service, while friendly, was scant and overworked. We couldn't hear the music in the nice part of the restaurant because we were seated in what amounts to the back room. We didn't even know about the bloody mary bar until we left. I can't even stress enough our disappointment in this visit. And sadly we won't be going back even though we live around the corner.

JAFuB-dwiipNK6IFo2DmSA.text: First time visiting this restaurant on Sunday and not impressed.  Wouldn't recommend.  The DJ had the music on too loud. Service was slow and waited 75 minutes for our food which wasn't great. There are many other breakfast restaurants that are better here in Scottsdale.

Yz0K8meLCEN_EmH8V1r_1w.text: Ok so I decided to give this place a second try and it was by far a better experience! It does get very busy so there is a wait on seating. We got our order to go again, but we will definitely have to try to eat in next time. Lona took my order and was very fast and efficient. She made sure my order was correct and got us drinks while we waited. The manager was very nice as well and very engaging with all the customers. I'd say the environment is very hip and fun. There is loud music playing, and it is very loud inside so if that's not your thing, I wouldn't recommend it. Today I ordered the Carne asada with eggs and waffles. The Carne asada was AMAZING. It was very tender and had just the right amount of seasoning. I let my husband have a bit and he was very envious. The hash potatoes were good as well, I like that it's really just diced potatoes because I've never cared for hashbrowns. Waffle was good as well. My son got the apple pie pancakes and Italian sausage. I took a taste of his pancakes and they were delicious! It really did remind me of apple pie, it also came with this apple cinnamon cream that topped it off. Italian sausage was good too. My husband go the americano eggs and said it was good but he definitely loved my food more. We can't wait to come back for more! Oh and they said that they did change the paper lining in their to go boxes. They gave us plastic containers for our to go meals this time so there was no lining.

GjJ-u41yf2iR8rtfLPEj2w.text: So delicious!!!! Been here a couple times and everything I've had is really good. The portions are huge so be hungry, service is always really nice. Definitely would recommend one of the Hash's if it's your first time there.

zcm9lgaoMBLonbaweV8LfA.text: The place was clean and the staff friendly. The food however was a different story. I ordered the corned beef hash and it was awful. The potatoes were cut too large and the meat was simply cooked brisket (perhaps from the BBQ) next door. The bloody mary bar that greets you when you enter is just plain weird. The decor is sterile and unappealing. Never again unless you like surreal experiences.

NeEctzXPQno091dRyUXc_g.text: By far one of the best brunches I've had ever! The place was very packed and there was a wait, but seeing that we had 3 kids with us the staff was excellent in finding us a table rather quick. Our waitress was Dominique and she was awesome! The food was off the hook and great proportions. The DJ there played great music as well. And I want to shout out Bonnie for being an extra help for myself and my family. She was quite personable and made the experience that much greater. We will absolutely be back. Great job guys!!

wZiA27jAXQn5zwaaT8i2wg.text: I've read many great reviews....so was excited to try it today.  The Bloody Mary bar is awesome and a fun experience.  Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for the food.  We ordered the Smoked Brisket breakfast and the Corned Beef Hash.  Both were bland with no flavoring.  No salt, pepper or herb/spice on either.  Even the fresh baked biscuit was bland. The Corn Bread Hash was uninspired and mushy.   Very sorry to say but We were very disappointed.

gd9SZRUrKQgyOVQ7b1mD5Q.text: New favorite......I love when you find a breakfast place with something different and unique.  There are so many options and I love that you get a biscuit with your scrambles. The biscuits are really good and a nice change from toast.  I also like that you can chose items to put in your scrambles. The eggs and veggies in my scramble were fresh and cooked perfect. Little cup of their potatoes that comes with it had good flavor. The service was fast and our waiter was great. I went with my mother and we both really liked the music in the background.  Fun, upbeat atmosphere, which may be the reason we just had to have a Bloody Mary!  We  had the house one, which was really good!  Next time will be more daring and try the Bloody Mary bar.  Can't wait to take my out of town guest here next week.

44URvwQYpH6cAYf1CojdXg.text: Have had a Saturday morning breakfast here about five or six times over as many months. Service has been great, never an empty coffee cup and rarely a hiccup in the kitchen with missed orders or bad execution.  The only disappointments have been the chicken/waffles due the use of rather bland chicken breast and times when the dice potato in the hashes are under and way al dente for a breakfast.  We have also asked about the morning DJ sound level and were told that he has final say on the knob setting. The work around is to dine earlier in the morning.  Really like the fact that the menu changes slightly nearly every month, with a new dish or two appearing, while some other items get dropped off.  Put something other than chicken breasts on those dishes and I'll give it another try.

MVgnhlDzt-Vs9knYheJtiQ.text: I am the CEO of Snooze Eatery (a breakfast place) and had the pleasure of eating at The Hash Kitchen this morning. You have to give credit where credit is due and the Hash Kitchen is awesome. The atmosphere is upscale and vibrant - a great way to start the day. The staff was incredible, from being greeted the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left. And the food - first rate in every way. The menu is diverse and the quality is through the roof. Congratulations to Hash Kitchen!

Ve5BeX_XThEGBxJwAVv1Lg.text: My Book club came here and the service and food was excellent.  I truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the music was great. Bonnie is the hostess with mostest.

VfVs_Rh6GnCPTh09zOMxgA.text: I really love the vibe in this place, everyone's very friendly, the DJ was a welcome surprise. However if you're wanting to go there and have a conversation it is extremely loud, even the servers and bartenders have to yell to be heard.  I went in on a Sunday late morning with a friend and we sat at the bar. Neither of us had a cocktail but I could see that the booze was flowing and the bloody Mary bar looked great. I ordered a bacon scramble and my friend ordered some sort of eggs Benedict. My scrambled eggs were over cooked to the point that they were brown and dried out . The cubed fried potatoes were greasy but the buttermilk biscuit was perfect, flaky and moist. Even though my plate was still three quarters full when the bartender took it away she still never asked me how my food was.  All she asked me was if I was finished? Going forward I think I'll stick to Butterfields,I may have to wait 20 minutes to get a table but it's always worth it!

AHR2CPZV4RXajOS-72txRA.text: The most fun I have ever had a breakfast place.  The atmosphere was vibrant and happy and the staff were cheerful and energetic.  The build your own Bloody Mary Bar is enough reason to visit but the food is dynamite.  We couldn't decided if the Nutella and banana French Toast, red velvet pancakes or brisket hash was the best at our table.  Our son has two severe food allergies and our server and the owner went out of their way to be sure that it was safe for him to eat.  They brought the ingredient list out to show me!  You rarely get restaurants to understand how important a food allergy is and never get that kind of service.  The customer service is the best we have experienced.  I see why the place is so busy.  Great prices for families!

cnuQwDybL3j3htjAkLQGBQ.text: So many wonderful things to say about this establishment. We arrived and there was a 30 minute wait. Realistically, I wouldn't wait that long at most places. However, this restaurant has a "build your own" Bloody Mary bar (which doubles as pre-breakfast food) and has a very nice owner? (she has some upper position at The Hash Kitchen) named Bonnie. She was communicative about our wait time and upcoming table, hilarious, and fun! The whole experience was worth the wait. I haven't even talked about the food. We got a regular hash and French toast. It. Was. AMAZING. It is 3 pm and I am still full. They play with flavors in a great way (I.e. Churro pancakes) and you leave wishing you could have this restaurant every morning. They have "flights" of Mimosas... strawberry, blueberry, gruava, and orange... amazing. In conclusion: go here and make sure to call ahead and get a reservation (if you can), if you can't... still go! You won't be sad!

pZANR4D7oj5ig6Zbs3rK2g.text: Love trying new breakfast joints and The Hash Kitchen did not disappoint! Great food, great service! Need I say more!

BGhE6lgaQb7ffg3jx3KOcg.text: I've been here twice with my fiance and both times were quite good. We've split several of the hashes and the Benedict's. I have to say that the smoked brisket was the winner out of all the dishes I've tried. The cornbread was just sweet enough to counter the smoke and salt of the brisket and also to balance out the green chili. Another favorite was the fried chicken hash although was a little over cooked and overall ate a little dry. The eggs Benedict was just ok and not overly impressed with the hollandaise. Lastly we had the crab skillet with old bay aioli which again was just ok. Crab was good but could have been fresher. The sauce sold the dish, delicious. Lastly, the Bloody Mary bar... Big fan. Any excuse to stick as much goodness into a morning cockatail as I can fit!  The flavored vodkas were delicious, especially the cilantro lime and they don't skimp on it;). Also tried a bloody without the bells and whistles of the buffet style build it your way and it was still equally delicious and less work. I highly recommend Hash kitchen if only for a morning cocktail and some good hangover chow.

kmMkc7xWCfK5qvA1clz85g.text: Hash kitchen greeter is awesome! Manager Adrian was friendly and customer oriented. Made my day by keeping my wife happy with visiting her favorite breakfast establishment in the area.

dYVQLj6LaxWqgLJHBba4qw.text: pretty place, very good food, awesome service !  we don't often go out for breakfast, but this was a special day. LEO, our server, made our experience very special !  He suggested the French press coffee, and showed up at just the right time to "press and pour". He recommended a fruit plate while we looked over the menu, which was perfect for a leisurely style brunch experience.  Leo seemed very knowledgeable about the menu and encouraged us to ask ANY questions; we chose the smoked salmon eggs benedict and the Brisket and Eggs, based on his recommendations, BOTH were filling and flavorful, and just as he described . Too full for dessert, but he said he made a "killer mocha" which we shared, our only mistake not getting two; we will be back, great brunch experience !

bZ2K00fAUclgyG85zEsSQw.text: Great fun! The food was awesome. I'd recommend the banana split french toast and chicken w/waffles. Bloody mary bar was pretty extensive and service was great!

Fa7unWPJxqZJua-vIMwoyQ.text: First time eating at Hash Kitchen.  Everything was great.  Tyler was great, the food was great.

CA3YZY72VDlf2tNo1ue4tA.text: Excellent Breakfast venue. We celebrated a couple birthdays today and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The hostess Bonnie was charming and super attentive. We will be back!

t4H9M6R6IEgE2NHgQTNDOg.text: BEST brunch!!! I absolutely love this place. Amazing food and service. The Bloody Mary bar is a must try as well as the lemon ricotta pancakes. The owner, Bonnie is a sweetheart! I happened to leave my wallet outside on the bench by mistake and she searched the entire restaurant to find me. I can't thank her enough as that would have been a terrible start to the day, thank you Bonnie!!

4KgoZ-efprH9K0ZqhxqanQ.text: Amazing!! This place was across the street from our hotel. Decided to try it since it was close by and they had great Yelp reviews. We hit the jackpot!! Huge menu and the food was incredible. Will be back again before the week is up. Can't wait.

8Cyk4R7o4vfULX81DXm7GQ.text: Amazing breakfast/brunch!!! Nothing else like it in Phoenix or Scottsdale. Most creative menu items for brunch I've ever seen. Great food, service and vibe!!!

DuDgZSQBgJvMhJhU2Th-qw.text: I got the Flat Iron Steak and Corn Bread Hash, and it was the best breakfast I've ever had!!!

K3CaBbDHH7zKeulvCMiK3A.text: This place is amazing !!! Great food !!! Great service !!!! The best place to eat in Scottsdale!!!!

1Pby3TJzcf6yPTz77cIeog.text: I was very pleased with The Hash Kitchen!! Great atmosphere, phenomenal service and amazing Bloody Mary bar.

-q_ChZe59xAv-yTe8T8WqQ.text: Tried this place while on a staycation in Scottsdale. Food was delicious! I had the chorizo and mushroom hash with a biscuit on the side. Eggs on top were cooked perfectly. French press coffee was sooooo good and a definite must try. Staff was great and super attentive and nice. The bloody mary bar looked great and such a cool concept when you want to build your own bloody mary. Overall great place for breakfast and lunch.

DuqkaPXCcfzVPpJIqUvwIQ.text: Great food! I had one of French toasts, amazing! Bloody Mary bar is great, if you like bacon flavored vodka. I'm sure you can get with other vodkas, but that's what it comes with. Good, but too strong of a bacon flavor for me.

wkeWIRxk2yXHIH9fFaNbMQ.text: We ordered the thk hash herb chicken and lump crab. The herb chicken was my fav.! The had leek strip that was lightly battered and glazed with honey. Delicious. The lump crab was good but I felt like it was missing something.  Maybe a gravy of some sort? The server recommend the hollandaise with it. We also tried their original bloody mary. It was VERY spicy so we asked them to dilute it with a little more tomato juice but otherwise good. The best part of this experience was the customer service. At first we thought the wait was going to be long. The lady in the front was telling the group ahead of us 30mins to an hr and we were going to leave. But she cleared a high top for us so we could be seated immediately. The server and manager was equally nice, stopping over to make small talk and joke with us. I love how every person there is working; management and all. That's how a restaurant is suppose to operate.  Not just management pointing fingers for other people to do work. They were busy and they all help clear tables and bus. Keep up the great work guys! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab and herb chicken the hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The original bloody mary. Careful, it&#39;s spicy!

LWD7CyLmN0x6oiYA1DVOPg.text: Nice place way to noisy on a Saturday morning. Very pricey

Vd3VIpU1Noviyjcx-SEJeA.text: Excellent breakfast. Loved the mimosa flight! Bonnie and Lona were so welcoming as we come from Buffalo, NY

j4vNWjefNb0hPVNN4I7J2A.text: Great service! Great food! Reasonably priced for the amount of food served. They have a Bloody Mary bar where you can build your own drink. Items are grown locally and vodka is made in house too. I had the breakfast burrito and my friends had lemon pancakes and chicken/waffles. They even brought out a dessert after to help celebrate my friend's birthday. A definite must if you're looking for an awesome breakfast experience.

FFdMuWSVIFre8ur8cUCEJQ.text: Delish! I love the atmosphere. What a fun way to spend a Saturday afternoon! I had the Lump Crab Benedict and it was amazing! One of those dishes I'll crave! Others I was with had Smoked Salmon Benedict and the Black Forrest Ham Scramble and both were delicious! Ask for Chris. He was the best!

eBUUhC8A-jMagvzsVZPdWA.text: What a great experience.  Great food and drinks, great music and great service.  Bonnie and our server Caleb made it so fun!  If you are in Scottsdale go and see for yourself. You will not be disappointed.

BdtBJPhxclYBSSPhTcPWsQ.text: The breakfast here is delicious. I've gone a few times with friends so I've tried many items and am always impressed by how good the food is. They have amazing bloody Mary's and mimosas as well. Much better than the typical IHOP or good egg fast food type breakfast. Your meal is actually individually made to order which is hard to find these days. Being from the east coast where we have diners everywhere, it has been hard to find a place to get a delicious breakfast here. Its also nice to have a classier place to go for breakfast, not many options for something like that. I've had Rachel and Ryan as servers when I go and they're both attentive, friendly and helpful about choosing menu items. I look forward to more delicious meals and drinks here!

TV9T7hwNIyogNKuh6G2Zqw.text: I'll write another review next time I visit if need be.  I went there in a Sunday.  Wasn't feeling great so I didn't get what I would normally get for breakfast.  It was OK but the menu probably leaned more towards hash type stuff than the stuff I like.  I know, it's the Hash Kitchen....of course it does. My girlfriend loved her Hash though.  My complaint isn't really with the service, but when we were done eating, the "get these people outta here and open up the table" crew was in force. Constant peeks around the corner and asking if there's something else we want, etc. Even picked up the paid bill a second time and asked 'mistakenly' if we wanted to pay our bill. It was like the outlaw getting kicked out of a bar in the old west.  Doors swing open....we land on our butts.  I get turning our table is money...but wow.  Don't get me wrong...nobody was outwardly rude.  Just very passive aggressive.    I'll give them another shot and change my review if justified.

m7hMWMfM0CmagAIPw5qD6A.text: Love the variety in the food is of the best quality! Look forward to all my trips there!

qGB_Y2gU_Y383AUzY4S-Fw.text: This was our first visit, and I cannot say enough about this place.  My husband was craving smoked brisket and eggs so he did a Google search and found The Hash Kitchen.  He started with a Berry Memosa and I had a Mocha Coffee with a side shot of Kaluhua to add as I drank it. It is incredibly delicious, (not to mention the waitress gave me a generous amount of Kaluhua in the shot).   My husband had the smoked brisket, eggs over medium, hash potatoes and a side of pancakes. It was exactly what he was hoping it would be and so much more. The smoked brisket was bursting with flavor and came with a side of warm barbeque sauce that was sweet and tasty.  We shared the pancakes which were delicious as well. The reduced maple syrup is amazing!  I had the Lump Crab Eggs Benedict. It is two perfectly poached eggs on a split biscuit covered in a Bay Hollandaise and a generous amount of crab. Mine also included hash potatoes. The crab Benedict was the best thing to grace my taste buds in a long time. The hollandaise sauce had flawless consistency and flavor that paired perfectly with the thick custardardy yolk of the eggs, and decadent richness of the crab. The potatoes are okay, but not as flavorful.   The service was wonderful as well. Our waitress,  Sara, was very friendly and on point. We will definitely be back. In fact this may become our regular Saturday morning breakfast hang out. There are many more items on the menu I cannot wait to try. I was going to take a photo of our plates, but I was so excited when the food came that I just dug right in and forgot all about the photo... LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I had the mocha coffee with a side shot of Kaluha. It was an amazing start to an outstanding meal.

9UAnIn5cxgaWBw_bENoSuA.text: This place always has the best service and amazing drinks and food!!! Lona has awesome customer service!!! We will be back!

SDUoh5f5cS6xg6q-93bdIw.text: Good food ,great coffee. I don't drink but it looks like people were enjoying beautiful semi exotic drinks on a Sunday morning.   I have to say something about the service: it was amazing. they're extremely attentive and genuinely enjoy making your meal a really great thing.

2DxlbOIo5DusNarmgtirgw.text: We met the server, Derek, at their sister restaurant,   Sicilian Butcher, yesterday evening.  He is such a great guy and our meal there was such a wonderful time (The Affogato must be experienced!), that we decided to come here for breakfast.  What an excellent decision!  My Chicken and Waffles were sooo good: waffles with bacon in the batter and crispy leeks on top.  They thought of it all.  I've tried chicken and waffles at many restaurants, and this is by far, one of the best!  I tasted Cole's Eggs Benedict and loved their take on it.  The sweet corn cake, instead of the traditional English muffin, was a twist that made the dish next-level good!

CSRdXBjbhye32xVrSgfZYw.text: 4.5/5  WOW OH WOW OH WOW!!!  They do not play around with their breakfast/brunch menu. I got the chiliquiles and I loved it. we also ordered sides of pancakes and those babies are very dense!! The eggs Benedict was also yummy. What i absolutely enjoyed the most about this spot is their accommodating and very attentive staff! we came in with a large party of 11, 3 of which were 4 years old and under and they came to our needs whenever we needed anything for the kiddos. the portions are ginormous and the kids ate all of their food!  There is not a particular dish that stood out to me but I really did enjoy Hash Kitchen and I would totally recommend people coming here.

2L9ao-nmnPu01ZLFVGOctw.text: What a lovely experience we had at Hash! We had a party of about 10 girls, in a bachelorette party, and you would think as we were walking in, the restaurant just went "oh great". But no, they welcomed our post-hike sweatiness and loud chatter with open arms.   The food was really good. Per a recommendation from our waiter, I got the carnitas hash as well as the hash monkey for the table, and was not disappointed with either. It seems you really cant go wrong with anything on their menu.  As the food was good, what stood above and beyond was the service - specifically our server CJ who knocked our whole experience out of the park. I really believe he is probably top 5 waiters I have ever had. He was so sweet, knowledgable, accommodating and fun!  He made our experience so awesome, and without him, I probably wouldn't even have written a review, but I just have to give him major public kudos. Thank you, CJ!

Iwz7hOPgjoOnmu_iUwqA3Q.text: Just had an amazing brunch. Enjoyed every minute. Everything was very flavorful and filling. Service was attentive and right on point. Price point was average for the surrounding area. We will definitely be returning.

YtJd6nRlnwFBAFBxEJjQ_A.text: I was in Scottsdale for a bachlorette party and we came her for brunch on Sunday. The BEST brunch experience EVER! From the Bloody Mary bar, food, and the hosts who is my spirit animal. Great atmosphere and they take reservations with is a huge plus (especially for 9 girls) I don't think I've heard so many of my friends fall in love with a brunch location. I can't wait to come back next time I'm in town! Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own Bloody Mary! Amazing Bloody Mary bar
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana split brioche French toast

wnB39z11111uUBrOQKOCuQ.text: I had the chilaquiles, they were amazing. My husband had the breakfast paella, not spicy at all but later found out they would spice it up if requested.  Amazing bloody Mary bar and several mimosa flavors to choose from.  Inside was a bit noisy but the patio was perfect for a quiet meal.

gRjbwT_3tqHYosNJxr0rpA.text: I went here for brunch Sunday. I loved the atmosphere - loud music and just really fun overall. I got the mimosa flight which was awesome! For my meal I got a scrambler and side of sweet potato hash. No complaints about the food, it was delicious. The only think I would point out is be ready to wait a long time to get a table if you go on the weekend, we got there around noon and it was almost 1 by the time we got seated - it's super busy for weekend brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. mimosa flight

HESZXxPGY8tNGKpkMmutBg.text: WORTH THE WAIT. This is the brunch version of a hip night club, including a DJ playing good tunes.  One of the highlights was the Bloody Mary bar with every condiment you can think of and then some. Hubs ordered crab eggs bene, 11YO had chicken fingers and I had the salmon frittata, all nicely played and superb flavor. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kids chicken fingers and fries
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab eggs bene, dabomb
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon frittata YUM

7ZhDG3NrktUt24xoxaUSPQ.text: Great food and got use seated very quickly, 7 adults and a baby. The one thing we did not expect was the DJ and the club like music. A bit loud for some in our group since it's inside.

rhkDP8WshP1d_WNI85VaSw.text: Doesn't get any more delicious then Hash Kitchen! Such a fun, sleek, breakfast spot! Seriously, there's nothing like this place anywhere. Wish we could bring this breakfast food home to Cali with us!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Donut Cannoli&#39;s!

UMHrOBStk-Ld1dl2Ft7t4Q.text: We try to do a new place with our non-meating friends every so often. They had tried this place before and invited us to join them.   It's in the old Cuttlefish building in North Scottsdale. Decor is modern farm to table...trendy. The menu is severely meat friendly. But there are some shrimp and salmon options, as well as the waffles and pancakes. And the every ubiquitous bacon bandwagon.   The coffee was strong and very tasty. But my cup was left empty several times and I actually had to get up and get it myself 2 times. Which is odd because when we needed service, it wasn't there, however, when we were still eating, bus boys kept trying to take our plates away...without asking. We had to verbally stop them 3 times total "No, I'm not finished eating yet!". Same with the water glasses, always empty.   I ordered the artichoke fritata. Very dry and flavorless and came to the table not hot, not warm, but kind of on the room temperature side. I rarely put salt on any food I order, so when I have to salt my food, I feel like there's no inherent flavor to enjoy. And several of the artichoke bites were the chewy stem parts so i had a little side pile of artichoke chew and spit outs.   Felt rushed with sub par food.

9xel2tQYQcS1jHJZfN0PJQ.text: The only con is the wait time, especially if you try and go on the weekend. But they have an awesome Bloody Mary bad, which I didn't try so I can't speak on the taste, but looked awesome. The mimosa flight is fantastic though!! Don't be silly and skip out on an appetizer. The breakfast bruschetta board is probably one of my FAVORITE items I have ever had (and I brunch a lot...). The chilaquiles were sooo good as well! The older lady who is the host is a sweetheart and she looked like she was so fun dancing around the restaurant. Great brunch vibes.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta board and mimosa flight. A MUST have

p6p6S60tOPxz9ZaTMkRVmg.text: Hash kitchen was spectacular. Lona was an amazing and friendly server, and the pastrami sandwich and huevos rancheros hash were absolutely delicious. Would definitely come back, many times. Thanks for a great breakfast!

ANp_fPL59NjZe-AiUYYDHg.text: Wow. After a less than stellar first visit, I have to say I was blown away today by my 2nd visit. The restaurant reached out and asked us to visit again, and I obliged. This was my first opportunity to come back, due to business travel, and I brought my boyfriend and brother.   We had the most amazing meal today. We clearly caught them on an off day on our last visit - and I'm so glad we came back! Linda and Bonnie were so welcoming and warm and took such wonderful care of us. Linda was a gem, so lovely and enthusiastic and clearly passionate about the restaurant and its service. Our waiter, Zach, was wonderful! He was friendly, attentive, and a superstar. What a huge difference from last time.   We had the most delicious food. I had the herb fried chicken and waffles, my boyfriend had the lump crab frittata and my brother had the Oreo pancakes. We also had, mimosas, iced coffees, and cannoli donuts.  Everything was so excellent. Portions were massive, well cooked, and serious delicious.  I'm thrilled with our experience here, and as a side note, my brother is in a wheelchair and I was SO pleased to see they not only have a family restroom but also the disabled access door buttons on both bathrooms (those are not cheap, and are not required by law). I appreciate that as a patron with a loved one confined to a wheelchair.   Definitely will be coming back, and I'm super excited about their new location on my street! (Frank Lloyd Wright)  Thank you Bonnie, Joey, Linda and Zach!!! You definitely changed my mind about this great restaurant!

MjFJqrj6Hz8KGaHM4wXffg.text: I'm torn in writing my review because the food isn't good, but the bloody mary bar is nothing short of fantastic.   My first visit to the Hash Kitchen, I had an omelet and was very underwhelmed. The potatoes accompanying it seemed soggy and the omelet was mediocre at best. However, I eyed the bloody mary bar while I was there and decided I needed to come back. I went back again and tried the bloody mary bar and ordered a specialized egg benedict. The bloody mary bar is amazing, they had everything from olives to beef jerky to meet balls to put in your drink. It was so much fun and delicious! I would 100% come back again for a drink. That being said, my eggs benedict was even worse than my omelet. The eggs came out hard boiled, not poached, with the same gross potatoes and way too much sauce. The lox on my benedict was fishy and I couldn't even swallow it.   At the end of the day, come here for a drink before breakfast, but don't come here just for breakfast.

yAcsvttTTgXkiqVziTSKqA.text: Yum yum yum.  Very good food, almost gave them five stars, and on some days they deserve it, but there have been enough times where the yummy food isn't enough to overcome the pain of dealing with inattentive and absent service.

36U2G7pBGhjRRL0-Q23wtQ.text: No complaints. Good food, good service. Prices were adequate. Although I didn't get a chance to try it, their bar seemed well stocked to handle any morning Mimosa or Bloody Mary.

6H26P-Lrg8eqIhFi8W5-pw.text: Food and service was very good bit be prepared for LOUD DJ music on. Weekends!   Friendly service and delicious food with a great bloody mary bar.

wBtNEpWnd52E-uKhRV_D0g.text: This is my new favorite breakfast spot in Scottsdale!!  Great breakfast entree's and the make awesome Bloody Mary's!!!   I had chicken and waffles it was great.  Service was very good for or table of seven.   This will be a place we visit every time we come home!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles!!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YjJ5-XkWufShJcnDoVG_Tw.text: It's a family favorite! The portions are pretty decent (aka large enough to share) and the flavor matches the atmosphere - lively, open space, options for everyone and great music. We can't wait for the other locations to open! Closer to us means we will go more often! Although this is def a family friendly place, I'd go for brunch for some day drinking.

IXPkNu_Jqw6R0hJeh7phjQ.text: Very impressed with this place! The service was great and there was virtually no wait time even on a Sunday at 10:30. The Bloody Mary bar was top notch and so much fun. (Some advice for newbies: don't choose every single topping like I did! Self control is key here! I was full before my food even came! Oops.)   I also ordered the French toast with coconut and almond! It was really good! The only thing I wish is that they didn't already put syrup on it. The description said it came on the side and it was a little soggy with all the syrup. They should let the customer put that on. I will definitely be back to this place many more times!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own Bloody Mary bar with all fixings. They even have infused vodkas!

_seWWqmNB_X39kMQaT255w.text: Good food, great service, awesome bacon!!!  Went with my mom and brother and we all had different hashes and the all were great.  Food came out quick and or waiter was very attentive.

EsGqHB48y0EA4gCHXNIiwg.text: Favorite upbeat brunch spot in The area!  DJ, Bloody Mary bar, signature drinks, decent crowd, great service, and the meals...all made with extra attention and flair!!  I had the lump crab frittata with fruity pebble pancakes.  Thoroughly enjoyed everything and will return!

xgBIXkqKQzPTHGmpmSfoaQ.text: Excellent food (too much of it?!). Good for kids too! We had brunch there and the service was great. Would definitely recommend!

fWnTb6hP0AhD8k9bCng7sA.text: Five star service. Bartender served us and was on point. Food was great, same as the other two locations. The GM, I think his name is Jeff, is always on top of it all and made sure we were good.

z3aG-lJZqgtqI_tEg6Y_aA.text: Came here for brunch on a Friday. Beautiful decor. Waitstaff was super nice and attentive. They have an amazing build your own Bloody Mary Bar and oysters. I ordered the endless mimosas. They have 5different flavor a to choose from. I had 3 of them. My friend and I split the donut appetizer. It was perfect with the cream. I ordered the chorizo hash and my friend ordered the herb chicken eggs Benedict. My chorizo hash was pretty! Came with fried onions on top. Overall, this place was tasty! Recommend for a cute breakfast outing or a rowdy girls morning!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chorizo hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb Chicken eggs Benedict

mdWb-PxsWEiTHp1eas6NvA.text: This was the best breakfast I've ever had.  And it's not just the Bloody Mary bar talking, either. I had the flat iron steak and eggs.

LSpupnQPB0exAnhbT2FkNQ.text: This place is amazing for brunch.  Great food with a different twist on the breakfast menu that made everything unique.  The cannoli donuts are the bomb!  The service was fantastic as well.  Highly recommend.

VjLp-GVlQz0kW_ScK8_xVQ.text: This place is popping! Not only do they have a blood Mary bar, but there is a dj right when you walk in. I can see how it might be a little too loud sitting on the inside,but outside was perfect The blood Mary bar is awesome; not only can you pick your own flavored vodka, but there are a ton of toppings. We sat at the patio bar, it was a little chilly, but I can see on a nice day it would be perfect! Manager, Brent, helped us out and make sure that we had everything we needed. The bar is super clean. The food serving was more than enough and delicious. Great customer service. I would definitely come back when we are in town. This place is popping.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava mimosa
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blood mary
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

GqIq-kLwTa7f4jaj8iiNGQ.text: A couple weeks ago, my hiking group came her to nosh after doing a trail run at Tom's Thumb even if it was a bit of a drive from there. They have a long but narrow patio and they were so gracious to accommodate my black lab, Arya, who came with us. She was too big to bring over the patio fence and there was no way I'd ask to walk her through the restaurant but our waitress brought iced water to her throughout our meal. Arya luckily was able try some of the flaky biscuits they brought to us and she "tells" me they were great!  The lump crab hash over sweet potatoes was very, very good! I'm a sucker for crab and there was plenty of crab in this dish. I enjoyed the food with an espresso and a house Bloody Mary. One of my friends really enjoyed the Bloody Mary bar which obviously gives you the opportunity to personalize how you like you cocktail.   I definitely miss Cuttlefish, and I know it's the same owner but Hash will definitely be a go-to for weekend and post hike brunches from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab sweet potato hash
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab sweet potato hash

C3v-j6pPuvuKciQUDt_OzQ.text: The food was awesome- our sever was awesome and looked like Jason Momoa so how could it not have been great

nVD8kGUy9eCSQo-43-vnrA.text: The Banana Split Brioche French Toast looks busy when you 1st see it but it was tasty & the Lemon & Ricotta pancakes although really dry were flavorful. The Italian Sausage wasn't very flavorful but the turkey bacon was good. The place is nice for Brunch it you can get pass the music which is very loud and you have to speak somewhat loudly to have a conversation. Also the pretentiousness of the bloody mary bar...people made themselves the cocktail & took pictures but I didn't see any of the them actually drink it. We were there for a while because although the waitress was courteous she was slow & took a while to do refills & bring requested items. We waited about 30 minutes to get in initially. The staff was friendly & professional.

9PSqeoTqFA58oyTjGIOh_A.text: Apparently you don't get fresh vegetables in the Bloody Mary Bar on Wednesdays! My celery, carrots and beans all curled over the glass like last weeks noodles...  The hashbrowns were very lackluster as well.  Nice location and service too. But the food does not deserve a return visit.

P8wBqyHWHHf-QjpmEVjLzg.text: Briana was amazing!! Avacodo Toast is GARGANTUAN and fantastic.  Blood Marys, Mango Mimosas, Pancakes, clean, sports... What else can you ask for?  :)

aqiFZK3ut8aaWdC9c2LYwQ.text: I love this place for the food and I would have given it 5 on that alone but the DJ and heart pounding music on the weekends is just a little much for us. If that's your scene then you'll love it but I like my weekends chill and relaxing, not with ear splitting beats. Weekdays are the way to go for me...

ILkNTXWf7_0KcIbzHkjKxg.text: It's my first time here. The wait was worth it! The food was good. I'd ordered blueberries pancakes and the berries was very fresh. Definitely will be back again.

SvlILIyeBxKcKcaAFVVD8A.text: The ultimate breakfast/brunch place! I had the salmon eggs benedict, which were hands-down the best I've ever had (the food was extinct before a picture could even be taken, I apologize). I also ordered a flight of mimosas which were each chugged, I mean, delicately drank in a very short period of time. Finally, I got to build a Bloody Mary with maple-flavored vodka, meatballs the size of my head, and RAVIOLI!!! (among other things). EVERYONE SHOULD TRY THIS PLACE, LIKE YESTERDAY.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My only complaint is that there were not more mimosas to drink.

xRA_cFTaqb4EedykqFuYsA.text: This place is a fun time for brunch. I had the huevos rancheros. My favorite part was the crunchy tortilla. Blueberry mimosa was my favorite flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos ranchero was so good. The crispy tortilla is my favorite bc I love the crunch. My favorite flavor for mimosa was the blueberry.

kzOCmRlYpmGuYQ-sKZ0AsA.text: Came in for brunch on a Thursday morning, helped by Lo who was such a gracious, friendly, and funny host.   We got the alcoholic cereal flight 4/5  Worth it if you I've cereal and a fun twist on brunch flights  Cannoli Donuts 3.5/5 Very creative and yummy, but were very thick and heavy and filed you up quick but still good  Pretzel egg Benedict's with beer cheese 4/5 Overall delicious and savory   Overall the experience and ambiance was great. Service was great! Food was good and satisfying. Would recommend and come again

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thanks for the service Lo!!!   Alcoholic cereal flight, cannoli doughnuts, and beer cheese pretzel eggs Benedict

nJs-dtHNvAP3Zc8nOC0HMg.text: Bloody Mary bar is the best ! Music is great ! Service is great. Food is great ! It's my happy place

k8664liWIMJyO2N3irs6eQ.text: Loved this place! Wide variety of menu options. We went with the traditional "hash" dishes (the carnitas and the huevos rancheros), both of which were excellent and very filling! My wife loves bloody Mary's and so she was in heaven with the Bloody Mary bar. She made her own and they had a ton of really cool toppings. Definitely worth a visit! We went on a Tuesday morning and it was the searing and service was super fast (weekends are probably crazy, I assume).

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hash specialties - &#34;carnitas&#34; and &#34;huevos rancheros&#34;

e4NQC2Qj_3VZiFOsOY13pw.text: One of the best brunch places I've been to. Never seen a Bloody Mary bar, very clever.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8dy2SYQlNSf-hj_AqNEhxg.text: I go here at least once a week! Carnitas Hash never disappoints! Always my first choice when my co workers ask what's for breakfast.

kiczbCQAYPsjQ7iGkGKb1A.text: Food and drinks are great. Interesting items that you won't find anywhere else.  We've been 4 times now and live close by. The only reason not 5 stars, as they never seem to have enough staff on board and lines are too long on the weekend.  We go on the weekdays, but still the staffing seems to be a problem.

BylQhEBVNLbb93ftUd8aYg.text: What a fun atmosphere! I loved the bright lights, energetic people, and the bloody mary bar right in the middle of the restaurant. They even brought a DJ in on a Sunday morning, which was interesting. However, the food was not interesting. I'm hoping that it was simply that I ordered the wrong thing. I got the Dr. Art Mollen vegetable frittata which was not tasty. It was very bland. I should have done the bloody mary bar and gotten all the toppings as my breakfast. If I go again, I'll just order differently. No egg dishes, though. Just pancakes or the bar.

dgkEdFR7pgyYcvglIeVD8Q.text: It was ok. The concept is super-cool and the food all looked incredible. The dj and drinks were both great. We waited 90 minutes after being told 50 and my hash was in desperate need of moisture of some sort. My parents tell me that the location in North Scottsdale is more consistent...

9XtcxPglW7iA9eJZMHG4nw.text: Hip,trendy, fun vibe this is what this place is A new hot spot with a cool menu, Instagram worthy Drinks and even a Dj!!! It's also super busy .  Now why three stars? The food not bad I had avocado toast huge portion decent tasting , and a side of Potatoes which were not great . My mimosa was decent . The service not at a level it should be I would say because of being soo busy that you won't get great service not sure if they stretch them to thin or what . I would give this place another try though because I did like most of my food .  I just wish we didn't have such long waits with service we had to ask for water it took forever if we needed something again they are super crowded so maybe next time I'll go on weekday get better service !!!

4nZM0jjiWhiT6Bz91lmkuA.text: Breakfast/lunch with friends! Probably 3.5 stars to be honest, I found the decor pleasant enough nothing over the top. Service was fairly standard Scottsdale no notable complaints. Extensive menu with a lot of cool choices. For me I had the tamale cakes (who doesn't love tamales?) sweet corn tamale, green chili pork, poached eggs, green chili hollandaise sauce. The egg poached PERFECTLY and I am insanely picky about my eggs, the green chili pork I found watery and lacking flavor, the hollandaise was okay I expected more of a kick. I guess I was expecting a good balance of savory and sweet and I just didn't get it. For whatever reason it was served with a corn muffin that tasted a lot like the foundation of the tamale hmmm. My friend had the frittata I believe it was the chicken tinga, nice peppers and he liked the chicken it did taste better than my pork. The potatoes slightly underdone for all of our tastes. Bacon and egg burger with hollandaise and Leeks was very good (I had a few bites as my friend had a small appetite) kudos for the fried leeks definitely need that on more menus. The fries that accompanied it were fantastic, thicker than regular fries thinner than steak fries a nice compromise.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tamale cakes
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon and eggs burger with leeks

4pJT0HjvX84pg_bxwahfGw.text: WOW! I don't write reviews often, but Hash Kitchen was more than a meal - it was an experience.  The manager, Keri, set the tone with her exceptional customer service, but that was only the beginning. Food = creative and excellent!  Bloody Mary bar = foodie paradise and a meal in itself!  Ambience = DJ Frietz ROCKS!!  Now, the fun and volume of the place is definitely not for people looking for a quiet weekend brunch, but for something upbeat and totally memorable, Hash Kitchen delivered!

alPmuzt9KbmpKf4Ns9w-TA.text: This place is a nightclub where you eat food. I walked in and couldn't even speak to the host because the music was so damn loud. I don't know when I got old, but apparently I am and this definitely wasn't the place for me. Good luck trying to have a conversation with your table mates here.

A-k6dd9vg82Jzf2-6S_bbg.text: Our team came here and they were awesome! Our service by Lina was spot on as well. She was AMAZING! Food wonderful, service wonderful..great experience.

as6-3_rn3Z9UDUb4NR2jxA.text: Tried Hash Kitchen for the first time this past Thursday. This place is located in a strip-mall parking lot and offers convenient parking and an easy-to-navigate entrance.  We arrived around 10:00am and tables were readily available. The hostess was polite. We were nestled in a corner, quiet with a nice window view.  The waitress left much to be desired. She was more absent than present and seeming disinterested in being there.  We both ordered a breakfast benedict. Mine the salmon, hers the shrimp. Hollandaise on the side with a side of pancakes to split.  Food arrived, the eggs were poached hard. Potatoes with the meal were cold. Pancakes were fine but served with a very limited amount of syrup.   It took nearly 15 minutes to have our eggs remade. At first, they only replaced the eggs of my breakfast-date and not mine... I had to specifically ask to have mine remade. The manager did stop by and apologize for the mistake.   The restaurant is nice and fairly clean - nice ambiance and despite some larger groups, not too loud. The big windows allow for great light. We appreciated the large selection on the menu.  Pros: convenient location, good light / ambiance, despite being cold -  food flavor was ok, nice hostess.  Cons: absent server, cold / incorrect food, not much of an effort to correct by staff.  I'd give this a solid 2.5/5 star rating. Next time, I'll try somewhere else.

CnfEOuH6RIFKCi9EgCrHag.text: Breakfast is definitely my favorite meal of the day and this one was pretty good, but I can't say that it was great. The selection was interesting but everything sounded a little bit better that it actually tasted. The only exception was the filling that came with one of the French toast dishes. Tasted like cannoli cream or something similar and it was yummy!  Portion sizes on two of our three dishes were small, and they were fine, if not memorable. Really just an average breakfast establishment. They do offer a cute "Make your own Bloody Mary" bar, but I did not indulge. I will say that our server was very good, and we tipped accordingly.  BIG turn off... The straws are not wrapped and everybody's just grabbing them to stick them in my drink. Hey Hash Kitchen, that is gross!

w6OQrJ2kIRKvd5RudRPKCQ.text: Great for brunch. Service was a little slow, but the food was great. Had the fried chicken hash, hubby had the tamale cake Benedict. The potatoes were heavy on rosemary, but everything had good flavor. Worth a repeat trip just to try the bloody Mary bar!

E1AEUEe0sO3MNVHh2-Xlvw.text: Pros: The French toast is incredible!! Hands down, the best I've had!   Cons:  The service is awful. We hardly saw our waiter after we ordered. Our food was delivered by someone else & my drink was never refilled.   The hash was just okay. It tasted like frozen potatoes you'd buy at the grocery store and my "medium rare" steak was extremely well done.   The music is VERY loud inside. Definitely eat on the patio if you intend on having any sort of conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I expected a lot more from my &#34;hash&#34; given the name of this restaurant. My &#34;medium rare&#34; steak was tough and over done.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The French toast was fluffy and delicious!

ViLlJnsVwzKKJoHUfuNLtA.text: This was our first visit here. The food was amazing and we absolutely LOVED the hostess Bonnie! She was absolutely amazing and heightened the experience . The music was great also. Just loved the DJ on the turntable! We will definitely be back!

fWqV1q9x43uKr6BUeQP4lA.text: First time visiting (I live just 5 minutes north). Had a lovely late breakfast with a friend. Our Server was so knowledgeable and helped me modify my dish for my dietary restrictions (and was super creative about it). The portions were a nice, healthy size, the coffee was outstanding. I wish we could have had a drink, because the Bloody Mary bar looked AMAZING!! The space is lovely and our Hostess, Bonnie was so warm and welcoming. This will be my go-to space for breakfast and lunch from now on!!

aOMuOu0KMA_t2wuueZFgKA.text: It was good for people watching, and the food was good as well. Just a little noisy.

i8nrG1yyV9mAj7GW3b8vDg.text: Delicious! Super friendly good service. Unique and delicious food. Different plates too than you may find in other places.  Prices are reasonable. Cute decor, comfortable and cozy but nice.

nLonJZyTa1D5fFMjv9-2VA.text: Went here for breakfast with family and had a great experience. As you walk through the entrance, you are instantly greeted with a pleasant atmosphere. The service was great and we felt the waitress and staff were very attentive. We ordered many of the restaurant favorites and they didn't disappoint. The Cannoli Donuts were delicious and a great way to start the meal. One note to make was that the bacon was a little over done. I would recommend explaining exactly how you would like it to be done when they ask if you want it crisp. Overall, this is a great restaurant and would definitely recommend to others!

LU5Wa4jwmvukA3hyROgtzw.text: In Scottsdale from out of town. We had brunch on Sunday - 5 adults and one child.  Nice ambiance and the Bloody Mary bar was FUN and you can build quite a drink for $10.  We got some laughs out of comparing our creations - mine had smoked salmon-infused vodka, bacon salt rim, topped with a raw oyster on the half shell, lots of different olives, bacon, pickled carrots, a pickled egg, and fried oysters.  Very yum!  We had an order of cannoli stop share - creamy and cinnamon-spiced; more like donuts, but delicious.  The food was just adequate for the price - I had the recommended crab and sweet potato hash ($24) and it was good, topped with 2 poached eggs, but not awesome as some reported.  It was served dry (odd) and I had to ask for hollandaise to pour over.  The biscuit with good quality soft butter and some delicious berry jam.  My vegetarian son-in-law had a lot to choose from; I think he had a frittata.  Everyone enjoyed their meals, but didn't think the food was better than other places.  My grandson had breakfast Popsicles and he loved those - how unique is that?  The service was great and they took our reservation, which we appreciated.  I don't think we would go back, with so many choices, though the drink bar was phenom.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary creation!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big drink - breakfast on its own!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Popsicles - big hit!

oSCUHJurJtzvbATas1Uq7A.text: Live DJ and a Bloody Mary bar! Excellent wait. It's busy so be prepared to wait. I had the Nutella and banana French toast and they were delicious . Their coffee is really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome way to start your day!

1J0oO4lUYm8M3_KFT_DQ8Q.text: Love this relatively new spot in North Scottsdale.  The menu is full of some of the standards you'd expect to see on the muni but all with a twist.  Many variations of hash dishes and the Bloody Mary bar and flights of mimosas are a nice add.  I was glad that my wait was brief given the great menu and vibe of the restaurant.  Can't wait for my next visit!

An78tnGKBARy2sG4XGh4yA.text: The place was fun had a Dj playing music and vibe was cool however the food was average.

lt-UPAWXiCksICx5WCUWdA.text: Went for breakfast,  breakfast burrito, biscuits, bacon,  pancakes were very good, with some cool items like the chilequiles, although the egg breakfast for 9 year old was not enough food, but by far the worst was the music.  I think the owners wanted it to be a hip-hop dance club vs a restaurant and far too loud which was surprising since it was in a wealthy neighborhood.   Most wealthy people I know prefer their loud hip-hop nusic to stay in the clubs or a ball game, but not at a nice restaurant.   Unfortunately,  we wont be back simply because of the music.

d3_qTQdfYoayEKWuCY0UqQ.text: Great place. Had my daughters 16th bday there and the staff was fabulous! The food was great too.

d8qb-RQZ72DKGP03uxDosA.text: Love this place!! Awesome food,  fantastic drinks and exceptionally attentive and fun waitstaff. I just wish it was open 24hours!!! Who doesn't love breakfast any time of the day? Reasonably priced.

a38L9TVP0GM7wIiCGuS-ew.text: Outstanding food, good service but the musical shitfest on weekend mornings makes it nearly unbearable. Do you enjoy thumping techno being blasted into your face and bass rattling your brain while you're trying to talk? Have I got a place for you. I looked around the restaurant and the only people showing any enjoyment of the auto tuned musical anthrax were staff members bobbing their heads like rejects from Night at the Roxbury. Takeout would be a good option, at least you wouldn't have to feel like you were inside an MRI machine to which a jackhammer was being enthusiastically applied.

5tYdco0us0MGgnuF1zFVsw.text: The food is very tasty. However, this is a very very loud restaurant. Not the best acoustics for a lunch where you want to actually chat with your companion. But, the menu is interesting and very tasty.

ze52Sj0LP2MwEWOt8WqqWQ.text: Bloody Mary bar is amazing and don't miss the sweet potato /lump crab meat hash.   Yum!!!

Xtl329y5GoDhWQ5zqgaYHg.text: Food  was amazing the service was great the problem was with the dishes the glasses seems like they have been washed by a wet dog there was a foul odor either the water was dirty or the towel used to dry them was filthy

BOCieLctIIaVfcj38WCQqw.text: Amazing service! Lona is the absolute best! Food was great, presentation of food and drinks was excellent! Definitely recommend!

LSRo6knDlCPnNw0XfldLzg.text: The Hash Kitchen is a fun, modern environment, with great food, drinks, and servers. We had Chris as our server and he was energetic and paid attention to detail. Our glasses were always filled and our food came out in a timely manner. I would recommend this breakfast joint to everyone. The bar is a nice added treat as well. Thanks for the food!

W-2-_Xy2AIz6JOFWmSvEqw.text: I want to start off and say I don't post a lot, obviously. But this place deserves some props. We went on Sunday and it was packed! We had to wait but it was worth it. As soon as we sat down our server Matthew greeted us. We were a large party and usually when we go out there is a mishap. Not today. Order was perfect food came out hot and glasses were never empty. I will definitely recommend to my friends. A+ service and food.

n1ZHaummllFjP4z6sgHexA.text: Love this place. Ordered the chicken hash with no chicken...sub avocado. Veggie here!  It was to die for. The Limoncello beverage is completely refreshing and a great fix after a night on the town..

alIbEXd6JBxqnKNXi1YTNg.text: So worth the 5 mile drive we made this morning. The French toast and lemon pancakes were amazing. Didn't get a chance to partake in bloody Mary bar, but it looked great. Maybe next time.

ZGGeFfkgfVYtnZK3xLEilQ.text: The food was so delicious we came two days in a row. Great vibes and customer service was A+. Bonnie is the greatest and makes your experience entertaining:-). If you are in the area I recommend coming for a taste bud tingling culinary experience.

7mXwe9v1bRX_aE5sCidVgw.text: I'm always up for trying anew brunch place, I really wanted to like this place, but...I just didn't. I came by here for Saturday brunch after a run with my honey. First, we felt out of place because this place is fancier than the name suggests: hostesses in very nice dresses, dj, bartender, etc. Then, we were shocked by the prices. Maybe there should be another way to rate prices for breakfast places, but paying $12-$15 a plate for breakfast is more than we expected for eggs benedict or a hash dish. Although the food was fairly good, it just wasn't as mind-blowingly good as I had heard it would be or as I would hope it would be for the price. Overall, I have to say that the service was great. The servers and hostesses were attentive and helpful. Everyone around me seemed to be enjoying their meals. This place just wasn't for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab and sweet potato hash

no8p-qqDI3l15rbUS2vdcQ.text: BONNIE is awesome.. she was literally the best. You guys have to come here on a Saturday morning :)

Yw82tBlqfbVnZ7em5z9u2w.text: This place was so wonderful!! From the atmosphere, to the service, to the food! I cannot wait to go back. For those who like Bloody Mary's (not a personal fan) they have the most extensive Bloody Mary bar I have ever seen!!! They have every garnish you could ever think of! Definitely try to go before 10am on the weekend, that's when the crowds really hit! I just can't say enough about this place!  New favorite for sure!

naMr2vOmfLG53TWASpD8Ag.text: Nummy food! Amazing bloody mary bar! Great breakfast experience for our party of 5! Wonderful friendly service all around - especially the joyful "bar tender"! And I didn't even have a bloody mary. We'll definitely come back next time we're in town and this time I'll have a bloody mary for sure!

qm_X0QORZHPh3GeLR6GOPQ.text: LOve HK...great times, food and BloodyMary bar.

JUtW2kbVDUitsZ7EpGjwOg.text: Seriously one of the most fun places for brunch.  Amazing Bloody Mary bar. Fun and delicious food options. DJ adds a nice touch for an upbeat morning with friends and family

J_-7sHNhvIpxJh3-0Mpy3w.text: Not only is the food delicious, the customer service was excellent! I visited Scottsdale on my bachelorette trip with about 12 other girls! I called ahead (a week or so) and made a reservation! Upon arrival we were seated and treated like belles of the ball! Everyone was so friendly! The vibe of the restaurant was awesome with great music and a BYO Bloody Mary Bar! All my friends were happy and thoroughly enjoyed the place! Can't wait to visit again!

opsntXDo2JDI5jDKbjBmXA.text: I've hosted many a Girls Brunch here on a weekend. Always fast to be seated and accommodating. Although the Bloody Mary Bar is great- I've gone for the many mimosa flavors.  The atmosphere is loud but festive with the DJ but you can still talk. Fun to sit at the Bar or get a large table.  Stand outs are the Herb Chicken Hash, Breakfast Lasagna, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and we always start with the nutella doughnuts.  A very welcome addition to Gainey Village. !!!

Uu8uY-niC1bH6X1_F_LqPA.text: The service was friendly and professional. The egg scramble was just ok. And I was disappointed they didn't have wifi.

veUrWiq8QoGou4uTBVlymw.text: Simply put,good good! The mimosa is the best I've had thus far. Definitely worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. (What was....) The mango mimosa. Recommended by the waiter, and it was probably one of the best thus far.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kDTKTfFC7zaGHU6Ci0lAgg.text: I had the Lump Crab Hash- the sweet potatoes and caramelized onions were great a combo.  The hostess is darling and so friendly- and a great wait staff.  My date had the breakfast burrito- which was huge topped with a beautiful avocado.

nInJFRWP8vWvb0mtO1GeWQ.text: My corned beef was made with love!  The freshness and flavor was fabulous!

AuswxeRoxSDWqe_2t-Psmw.text: The service was incredible, it was an extraordinary wait but well worth it. Good food good service. The blueberry mimosa was so delightful. The bloody mary bar is a brand new experience for me, loved it slim Jim's, pickled pineapple, pickled mango.  I loved that Bonnie was everywhere cleaning up and looking great. Her hospitality was top notch! I can appreciate an owner/ upper management getting dirty ensuring that patron mess is taken care of. It makes everything flow so much better.

57ervLN0mvTTHmASFhTKkA.text: Visited Hash Kitchen for the first time today. It had great ratings so we had to try it. We had the smoke salmon hash and the lump crab frittata. The smoke salmon hash was very good. I expected the lump  crab to be mixed in with the tomatoes and asparagus frittata but it was still tasty.  The lump crab was placed on top of the frittata. We also tried the mimosas, red grapefruit and guava.  Both were good, not too sweet.  The service was great and very helpful with suggestions.  Lots of good choices. We will return so we can try the other menu items.

OQIxEWqEvMzDqprXey-ZiA.text: Went in with Lisa and Hannah looking for a healthy lunch. We didn't just get a healthy and delicious lunch but I had an out of my mind and by far the best Bloody Mary I have ever tasted!!!! The service was awesome... Chris gets all 5 s!  Looking forward to have a delicious breakfast before leaving town today.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jalapañeno infused vodka in mild tomato juice! OMG how do we get of of these restaurants in LA!

kIVqVkbp_pXWBdMDjCy2Rg.text: Found 3 decent size pieces of avocado peel in my cesar salad, which my salad didn't even have avocado in the first place. Manager just took them from my hand when I showed them to her, looked confused obviously, then went to the kitchen and never came back. Never offered to re-make the salad or anything, a little disappointing service.

1EMrNXVSVHraSN__lUKHhg.text: Wonderful service and sweetest staff especially Bonnie. She say our 25 family group in less then 5 min on a busy Friday morning! We had the best food and the decor is adorbs!

rHE5rkPXpsOTcw0iZozXjA.text: Seriously cutest place you can get brunch any day of the week. The build your own Bloody Mary bar is fantastic and can suit the needs of anyone. If you don't like Bloody Mary's then their mimosa flights are perfect for finding your specific flavor. Lona is one of the sweetest and funniest servers here that helps you figure out what you want to eat. (Ask to sit in her section!) this is always my go to spot for brunch!

1X7iC3MsNrRmD6Ypt_NYjw.text: I had a great brunch experience here! The wait was short even for a busy Saturday. Our server Evan was funny and very attentive. Never had to ask for my water glass to be filled, Evan was on it! Would definitely recommend the create your own Bloody Mary bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash

4fSdcxQWawwfIrQfa23L0Q.text: The food and service was so good! Our server, Patrick, was super nice and accommodating. We had a group of 6 girls and we originally sat outside on the patio. We ended up getting too hot, so Patrick helped us relocate to a new table inside and didn't seem annoyed about it at all. He was fun and friendly! I would definitely recommend this place and make sure you ask for Patrick as your server!

lveu-4Ij_cdt5OxO_bjE_A.text: What a lovely little place this is! Uber friendly service too. Not only was our waitress very kind and accomodating but several of the other staff members as well as the owner greeted us throughout our meal to ensure all was well. I'm super impressed! Love the decor and the music they play. Not too hipster, but just hip enough.  The lemon ricotta pancakes were the absolute highlight of my brunch visit. So scrumptious!   I will be trying the cannoli ones next!

Ab-NYIItozzrIo94LPNxlQ.text: I've been here once. It gets 4 stars because Im a Bloody Mary snob and I wasn't blown away. I went for the Bloody Mary bar experience, which is pretty cool. For $10 you pick your vodka, rim flavor and have an assortment of 30 goodies to add in your bloody, like bacon, olives, cheese. My boyfriend liked it and wants to go back, I'm debatable.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kI6jVlJr7DmO3por2lsdbw.text: I enjoy Hash Sunday Brunch but my husband didn't like the music was so loud. Service was excellent and the food fresh .   We went on a day during the week we both were happy .  That Bloody Mary was a meal by itself!

RUcZm_uYZEufw3ThyS3Q6A.text: The bacon here was bombdiggity. Great place to have brunch with friends. Came in from out of town looking for bacon. Boyyyy did I find it.

9LcCy09KGVHJmlKgfkqSRg.text: Had the chicken and waffles which was very good, especially the fried leeks had a good flavor. Overall good experience.

kMhXAgLYjtWMu653FTYLnQ.text: The first time I went to hash kitchen I had the best experience. My server was Patrick and he was fantastic, so attentive and checked on us frequently. This last time I went I asked to be seated in Patrick's section and found out that he no longer worked there (had been fired). The server we ended up with was not great. He checked on us maybe 1 time the whole time we were there and was very rude. The food is okay and the service isn't great.

SUYe7bAFPfvGrXPnY6lw7Q.text: First of all we love Bonnie! She's the best and really takes great care of her customers! The food was great and the service even better! My friends and I enjoyed hash kitchen so much we came back again while on our mini vacay in Scottsdale.

roxhoE7_2gpBNhsWhQ5JbA.text: Researched brunch places prior to going to Arizona. The pictures on Yelp sold me!  Went in on a Monday around noon. I already knew I wanted the lump crab sweet potato hash but the menu is definitely worth browsing through. The lump crab sweet potato hash exceeded my expectation (my expectations were pretty high) and I was able to split my dish in half and save the leftovers for a second meal. I had 3 cups of their French pressed coffee and a cup to go. Boy was I wired! But it was too delicious to stop drinking.  Great experience with this place, highly recommend dining here. Hey, you might even run into Charles Barkley since he likes to frequent this place. If it's good enough for Chuck, it's good enough for me!
