xHHr7y0Es6Esy44miHSZUQ.text: Amazing avocado toast ! So much food. And the mega bomb mimosa is over the top. So much food for just the right amount. Definitely going to come back again when I am back in town. LONA WAS AMAZING

O3SIE_6FUmfiDcs2PcyTxg.text: Bad service. Bland food. It seemed like their very large wait staff was annoyed they had any customers at all. Potatoes tasted like they came from a frozen bag. Biscuit was covered in sugar. Eggs were fine, but overall this is what I would expect to eat from a buffet breakfast included in a hotel stay. The look of the restaurant is that as well. Plain. Boring.

I1lkLKoz7sKrvL4ECtYweQ.text: This was our first stop for the bachelorette party we came in town for. The mimosa flights were awesome !! The food was outstanding. Our waitress Lona was fantastic!!!! She was spot on with the service. I would recommend this place absolutely!!!!

oe3Few5eMQ0StVqzfSdcnw.text: Nothing better than a scratch kitchen. This place has amazing food. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good breakfast/brunch spot.

DiDjddH6aWfaKq1RK4jf5g.text: I have been here a few times and never leave disappointed. The food is delicious but note the portions are pretty big. Nothing tops the bloody mary bar!! Different vodkas, mixes and plenty of garnish options. Plus, the live entertainment is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Deliciousness from a different angle.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loaded bloody mary including bacon, hard boiled eggs, pickle, peppers, ravioli and a meatball. Yummmmm

2pWLEvSjjJ7fbVPMP7Q8JA.text: Linda our gracious host and her fabulous team took such excellent care of me and my ladies for my 24th birthday celebration! We tried just about everything on the menu and our favorites were Lump Crab and sweet potato hash, the steel cut oats, biscuits and gravy, Quinoa Burger, and the herb chicken hash. Everything was fresh, came out hot, had excellent taste, and left us wanting more! We particularly enjoyed the build your own Bloody Mary bar ( endless bacon and beef jerky, can you say heaven!?) and the crisp mimosas. The service was OUTSTANDING I have never had such attentive staff. We love the Hash kitchen and all its employees!! Thank you Linda!!!  P.S. The atmosphere is amazing with a live jazz band, DJ, and modern decor. We felt very comfortable and quite high class. Pricing is very affordable and we were pleasantly surprised by the menu options :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Had an amazing time celebrating my 24th birthday with the help of our favorite lady Linda! Hash Kitchen ranks supreme.

62B4fAqQ1Z_sObfHvyjShw.text: My second time here and loved as much as the first time.  Thank you so much Pam and Bonnie for making my group feel at home.  Came with a group of friends to celebrate my daughter moving back to IL. Thank you to the Hash Kitchen staff for a great time!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smiles after a great meal!!!

nqn2PDPxpXOvdF1bP4XI-g.text: I've eaten something different on every visit. Today, I finally had the hash. Alright, it was not corned beef hash (it was flat iron steak) but it was not wonderful.

dY_m5a0-YvM-w3lGhm0cew.text: Excellent! We got here around noon time on Saint Patrick's Day and it was an amazing experience! We were seated promptly, served waters and asked for drink/food orders and everything turned out great! From good music to excellent food and awesome customer service, this place is a must go to in the Phoenix area! It was truly a pleasure.   I'm sure everything on the menu is great but we loved the Heuvos Ranchero Hash and the mimosa flights!! This place won't disappoint - enjoy!

mRuYkC5db4-11EfRCiMUfg.text: The Hash Kitchen is so adorable and the food is so fresh and delicious. The inside is modern and they have a live DJ! Great for brunch, fairly priced, and mimosas (need I say more??) We will definitely be back!

GFjpbHaz-Cf4JGN5CKgBbA.text: Hash Kitchen provides creative, delicious breakfast food in a fun atmosphere.  The food is amazing and they never disappoint.  The only problem is that word has gotten out - and there is often a line.  A fun, great place to go for breakfast and an outlandish Bloody Mary!

Z5-p5UjiKlfh0FDfKHJ8Vg.text: First off, the Bloody Mary bar is phenomenal. So many different infused vodkas, so many different toppings to add on or in.  Food is amazing, I got the chicken and waffle which was amazing. The lump crab and sweet potato hash was also very very good.  My girlfriend and I both shared a mimosa flight which came with guava, orange, grapefruit, and mango. All these flavors were great, especially the mango and guava!!  Lastly, the service is great our server Deanna was great and very helpful with suggestions! Very pleased with my brunch experience here at Hash kitchen!! Will be back...tomorrow!!!!!

BKT5KWyX5noMGBSmvWCs2w.text: Good atmosphere and portion size!! Ordered the mimosa flights, pancakes (enough for 4 people)!

gXhubZgYzGAbqdTnagceyg.text: Ordered the fruity pebble pancakes (because I'm a man child) which was a VERY generous portion and delicious! Girlfriend ordered fried chicken hash and could only eat a fourth there was so much. Great food and will definitely be coming back for that mimosa flight! Also came at 8:30am on a Sunday, no wait!

yLWEfv1qhCfbSQnAewChxg.text: Right so I was pretty excited to try this place but had bad service before we could even order. The waiter took care of every table before giving us water (we had been sitting down for 10 minutes and had our order ready). When he did give us water he said he'd be back for our drink order. He then immediately went to a table that had just sat down and then proceeded to take their orders for food and drink for four people. We got up and left.

8d3vvMUBPQxiBc2fweSghw.text: A very popular joint loaded with people.  Come and try some of their popular brunch entrees.   This is a great place for tourists with tons of energy.  I liked that the dishes were not too huge or too salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The carnitas hash. A very popular dish.

F57_S4KOoxaBoPibkwG_3w.text: Great place for breakfast or brunch. Bloody Mary options were awesome. Had the carnitas hash. So good and large portions. Bring your appetite, or a close friend

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0Tg5e_B6vnpeXbIpdCWFdQ.text: I drive out of my way anytime I'm craving a Bloody Mary, which was today.  Let's be real, cons of this place is the wait. After the wait, everything is awesome. We had Gino serve us today and he was fast friendly and attentive. I normally get the lemon ricotta pancakes..... because duh, why wouldn't you. I tried the hash skillet today and it was ok but a little over cooked on the eggs. (Asked for over medium, received hard eggs) I did take the leftovers home.   Regardless, this is a great restaurant and I will keep returning for the happiness I feel every time I'm here. Mmmmmm.

lxbOHUqHEwBgwW4mo0zMfQ.text: Good breakfast place . If you a very hungry because plates are huge and they do not offer 1/2 orders to bad

r4MSHrAKHzZYnZw7i0IcmQ.text: The best brunch spot in Phoenix! I would definitely go again to this place! The make your own bloody Mary bar is a little intimidating at first but it was something unique. There were a lot of options to create the perfect drink but I feel like there should have been a little more guidance and help offered. Other than that the food was absolutely amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nutella and strawberries!

ESr8_aOLnw7f-ITlUbkVGw.text: Huge portions, good food and great service.  Mimosa flight and breakfast was awesome.  Super busy but still had fantastic service

kbEhk3M2jHDLz4M-0SyI4w.text: Excellent Food and Service !!!  And did I Mention the Bloody Mary Bar ... A Must try for Breakfast ..Lunch ... Or just for the Bloody Mary's !!!!

jv1MaMsxF2J8iElX2K34_Q.text: Service was great.  Amazing Bloody Mary w/ Bacon from the Bloody Mary Bar.  Would recommend this place to anyone visiting the Scottsdale area.  Good place if you have or don't have kids Also Tvs if you need your sports fix

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary Bar.

IctP-cLquosQWJUP_QiP6w.text: I love Hash's vibe and drinks. They have the best Bloody Mary bar in town with the best meatballs (meatballs are weekends only). Today I have the SBLT and my friend had the salmon salad. Don't do it, their salmon is awful. I literally ate one bite and couldn't eat anymore. My server asked if I would like a box and I said no thank you, I didn't really care for it. Her response was 'ok' and took it away. If that were me and my restaurant, I would ask if my guest would like anything else instead and would def remove from the bill. I ended up paying $15 for something that was gross and I didn't eat. And for that reason, 3 stars.

u3LGs2qz6uvgCYBldFQtVw.text: Went with family.   Extraordinarily breakfast place with Ferrari Lamborghini and masarati parked outside. Patio was nice with spring training in town therefore packed.   Genuine one of a kind Bloody Mary bar with every pickle known to mankind. Food was excellent!

TeoGzkWE2ahpG1nLQhiRww.text: Can I just say best experience ever!!!   Service:  I walked in the door and looked a little lost because someone wasn't at their post...but I turned around and seconds later Bonnie walked up to me and apologized and went into welcoming me to The Hash Kitchen. She asked me questions about myself, our trip and where I was visiting while I was in AZ! I felt like a mini celebrity, she complimented, and asked if the bar was okay or if I wanted to sit at a table.  Table please...I sat down and we had an excellent server. (I shouldn't have waited to write this review because I forgot her name, I actually should've gave her a better tip, but I only had a little cash and wanted to tip the Bloody Mary bartender as well (which I did), and another person. This is just how good the service was)   Food:  We had the mini donuts, the sweet potato and crab hash, and the herb fried chicken waffles. Everything was tasty but I did have to add salt in the crab hash, I also wish I could've tasted the herb in the chicken. The chicken was perfectly fried and thick, we definitely were full afterward but not too groggy. Now the Bloody Mary bar was the True highlight, sorry! This was my first Bloody Mary and it will not be my last. At the bar you have the options of which flavored vodka to get, plus you choose your flavored juice, I got lemon infused vodka, and a spicy tomato juice...then the bartender told me to pile it high, as you can't go back, so that's what I did lemons, oysters, bacon and so much more. It took me about 9 minutes to put a perfectly put Bloody Mary together and 18 minutes to drink it. It tasted perfect! Not too strong and not too weak, it was just right!  After everything, I asked to speak with the manager and the young girl looked frazzled. She came up with an alluring and great attitude and asked what she could help me with..I stated this is the best service I've received on any trip, we travel a lot, plus we eat at fine restaurants and this didn't even compare. She gave me a smile and stated a saying and gave/asked* me for a hug! It was 10 stars from there. So you MUST go there. If not for the blood Mary or hash...go for the experience because it will be one!   *I wish I could've taken a picture with everyone, I asked my husband if that would've been weird...I guess you know his answer from me not taking it lol :)  *Go see Bonnie!!!!

aFCasGhGWZWgiKPLlYzoqA.text: Maybe I caught them on an off day, but I found this place to be just ok. The service was great, people were very friendly and food came out quickly. Where I was disappointed was the food, I ordered the lump crab and sweet potato hash, which was a popular item. I love a good hash and the best part is crispy potatoes with soft potato inside. This hash had shredded potatoes with absolutely no crisp On them. The crab I will say was quite tasty and the eggs were all poached. The biscuit it came with was pretty underwhelming as well. I didn't care for The grains of sugar on top and there was no flakiness too it or soft inside. Just kind of a dry rock of a bread item. I don't normally eat bread so when I do I expect it to be worth it. So overall it was a descent meal idea and ingredient wise, but I think the execution was lacking the refinements that take it from mediocre to delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab and sweet potato hash

KJZ5e4dKItWdgNmnecIOuw.text: Just came back to the Hash and had the herb chicken & waffles and the chorizo hash.  The herb chicken & waffle is to die for! The fried leeks taste amazing covered in a great batter. The waffle has bacon in it. I would definitely order it again!!!  Previous review:  Best breakfast I've had in Arizona!  Love the decoration and ambiance.   I especially enjoyed their corn beef hash! Would come again

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chorizo hash, Herb Chicken Waffle + a side of fruit

-cG4M-ExR7jHdVUS0hT47A.text: Had a birthday brunch here with girlfriends and the service was excellent, in spite of it being sooo very busy...food was good but not the "best"..I had the banana French Toast and one friend had the Coconut one  the other a regular "egg and.." breakfast..I found it lacking in a lot of flavor..but WOULD have another try another time..

XvUkutBivlNN0A0IiAH9sQ.text: We went in last Sunday expecting to find a new go to spot. Boy were we wrong!   We were not drinking as we had lots of running around to do but they do have a great Bloody Mary bar and the drinks did look great. My daughters chili Benedict's were creative, different and quite good. I had a scramble which was fine. Nothing special, just eggs cheese and raw onions and bell peppers thrown in but I was in the mood for plain so it was just fine but nothing special which again was fine.  The service is what amazed me! Horrific! We waited about 10 mins b4 even asked for drinks, food took quite a long time but maybe that's because it's a drinking spot and the encouragement is to have people drink more. I was in the industry so this may be a thing there. After 40 mins of sitting at our table we got our food and couldn't find the waitress. I sat for quite a while looking around trying to find her to get the condiments I needed for my good while it got cold. Oh and also I'd drank my coffee, actually ended up putting it at end of table to show it was out and I needed another. Never got one. We saw her once at a table next to use, waited till they were done speaking with her and they were in same position I was and not happy. She literally never looked at me, I tried desperately to get her attention and she would have none of it. I noticed she never looked at her table, even a glance, tunnel vision. U can't do that as a waitress. U should always be glancing at your tables when on the floor. Anyway we had to grab other people to eat what we needed. The girl I grabbed was so sweet. The guy I grabbed to get condiments was highly annoyed as he was running his tush off for his tables but he did stop and get us what we needed. I'd be mad if I were him and busy as well but my good was getting cold. She finally came over to the table at the end of the meal, I just wanted out as we'd been there an hour and a half combined. She dropped bill and then suddenly became attentive. Nothing ticks me off more then a waitress who ruins your meal then after dropping the check starts to ask if u need anything. By the way, never noticed the coffee being empty and at the edge of the table, even still!  My daughter begged me not to say anything and to just leave and we did. I did however leave a note of the back of bill that it was the worst service ever and I left the worst tip of my life. I always over tip even for crud service having done this job and for the first time I basically stuffed the girl which I hate but that is how horrific the service was.   I did think the manager was gonna ask at one time how we were. He was at the next table facing us talking to them. At the time I was unable to eat my food yet and figured I could get his attention and ask him, I was staring right at him, he looked up almost made eye contact with me, looked away and walked off to sit by the Bloody Mary bar and chat with staff as he had been doing the entire time mostly. If I were drunk the poor service would've been fine and luckily for them most people in there are drinking but for a sober person who just wants to eat and have decent service, that's not the place to go!   We expected from the reviews to have a great experience, were actually shocked it was so horrific. A waste of valuable time and money! If u wanna drink and catch a buzz where u don't care if u have horrible service then this may be a good place but if u wanna eat and have a decent experience without booze, don't go!

lc6pWr9B45hQzUvzU8Po7Q.text: Get there early.Cool concept - nightclub atmosphere - for breakfast. LOL. Don't go if you're hungover, you won't enjoy the DJ, but if you're not... sit at the bar and order yourself a Mimosa flight or cereal shooter flight. So tasty and delicious!  Bloody Mary bar might keep you there longer than you planned to stay. LOL. Service was okay, felt a 'turn and burn' from the server. It was my daughter's 21st birthday, disappointed they didn't do a LITTLE something. Manager kindly offered to take flower bouquets to her office while we dined. Large portions. Several variety of pancakes, but seemed like the pancakes were all the same, other than the topping. The skillet was mostly potatoes, we ordered another egg. I need to give them one more shot.

SHt7ay0uQy29cUVQLEMGhQ.text: This place is amazing! Great atmosphere and the vib is cool. Food is insane food. You have to try their skillets.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rA3eCNQaK3Gx9C4veFbygA.text: Yelp folks, don't get me wrong about Hash Kitchen. Food was good, service good. Nice place for breakfast, indoor and outdoor dining.  What ruined a nice "relaxing" breakfast was when a DJ (??) chimed in and started BLASTING HIGH BASEY RAP MUSIC!! WTF???  Sunday morning breakfast to this??  Sorry but not at all expected. Asked manager if they could at least tone it down. Nope, it's "the charm" of the place.  Won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1TOTwSyMkIG1AkklV6VqAw.text: Great experience here. We enjoyed the Build-your-own-Bloody bar and the flight of Mimosas was a great choice. Try the Avocado Toast, Lolo, recommended it and she was spot on. Hint: It's good as your whole meal or to be shared by four as an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Nuy274sLvNXS6Fe40Lu_IQ.text: Since I really enjoyed their other location, I was really looking forward to coming here for brunch.  I make sure to visit here with a friend just to try their mimosa flight. $16 mimosa flight comes with 4 regular serving of mimosa. My favorite this time was cherry. All others were just okay. I still like their strawberry when they have one.  On Sunday, expect at least 30 mins to 45 mins wait. They will quote you approximately how long the wait, they have chairs and water outside to help you wait.  I tried lump crab Benedict. I had their lump hash before and wanted to try benedict this time. I would have preferred if they have more hollandaise sauce and just a bit more crab. Not really well balanced, at least more sauce would have been better.   If you arrive late, they might run out of some of the dishes. I wanted to try their famous breakfast lasagna but I guess I need to start my day a bit early to try that next time.  Service here is always good. Despite of being really busy, they do well

hTwJYRlf-AXXzh4fbXPc3g.text: Update March 13, 2018: On March 2, 2018, owner, Joey, reached out to me via direct message about my underwhelming first experience which was a nice gesture; however, he did not follow through with his words. He offered to compensate me with a coupon for my next visit which I was not expecting- but I guess I was never going to receive it anyways as I never heard back from him after his initial message. A phony move for lack of better words.   I'm not looking any hands out. I don't need the coupon; I'm not even sure if I would've gone back to use it. But I've read many similar reviews to mine about lack of quality, overpriced subpar food, with an unorganized system at the host stand. Hopefully the owner gains some integrity and finds better structure as he leads the success of his business.

10HBPrhtZYw1qYyX2Y9iOw.text: This was a really fun atmospheric Resturant.. its loud and the people are having a good breakfast along with good bloody Mary's and mimosas! We will definitely be back!

Lol  It was a Saturday when we came for brunch, it was busy but we got seated pretty quickly. I ordered the corn beef hash and the fruity pebbles cocktail. The corned beef was good, although I felt it should've been cooked a little longer. It's a prettty big portion too. Omg the fruity pebbles cocktail was amazing! They definitely don't mess around with their drinks here. I loved it!!  I'll definitely be back to try some more of their specialty drinks and some other food items!

pOS5vCHFMP_sfxKHm_7i4A.text: This was my first time here and it was delicious!! I got the Chilaquiles with chorizo instead of chicken and I added avocado. The avocado wasn't ripe so it was very hard. My brother ordered chicken and waffles and he said it was pretty good just the chicken was a little dry. My mom ordered the carnitas hash and that was very tasty!! I also ordered orange juice which was $5.29....the reason for the 4 stars is because it's overpriced. Almost $6 for orange juice is ridiculous and I paid extra to add avocado and it wasn't even ripe. Overall this is a very nice restaurant and it's delicious!!

bOkF5NQTmCqxJRn5UpvTjg.text: What a disappointment. Read several very positive reviews about this place but sadly we do not agree. I had the lump crab hash (highly recommended by our server) and hubby had fried chicken & waffles.  Neither were very good - ok but not good.  The crab hash lacked taste; the waffle had a large, round, pounded piece of deep fried chicken breast topped with thin deep fried green onion rings.  We must have chosen poorly..   Oh, the selection of beer was minimal: Corona or Lagunitas IPA.

mPBQOzSiFOxrIYkg5SSMKQ.text: The first couple times I attempted to eat here the wait was 1.5 hours, so I was pleasantly surprised to find NO wait this morning at 10:30 a.m.  As many of the reviews stated, there is a DJ playing and a large bloody mary bar and it was a full house. However it's not overbearing, you can still have a conversation without yelling. Great vibe, lovely decor and friendly service.  My favorite dish was the fruit, it was almost too pretty to eat. Emphasis on the almost. Prices are average and food quality is high. Gotta try the mimosa flight!  tip- check in on yelp for discount on check

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. fruit plate
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. nom nom nom

mpZhiKHXvhkYIgWaK0gc8Q.text: Ok, after a few bad items at the Hash Kitchen, we finally found a dish that elevated the place to five stars. It was the November special called the Turkey Stuffing Waffle. This was actually a waffle with stuffing inside topped with mashed potatoes, real turkey, gravy and fried leeks. A total homerun indeed at about $14. We also enjoyed the banana brioched French toast, but I wish November would last longer, so I could go back and try this again. Props to the kitchen on this Thanksgiving winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. November waffle heaven

ASqt1ehGH_rhYPgyrnj93g.text: Omg this is the best breakfast/brunch concept I have ever seen! I loved it so much I came back the next day. The vibe, food and service is amazing! They need to open one of these in Los Angeles!   Things to try...their hash skillets, scrambles, and eggs Benedict. If you're a boozy bruncher, than the Build Your Own Bloody Mary Bar is cool or the Mimosa Flights is tasty. They also have breakfast cereal shooters, coconut milk infused with vodka or rum and different cereals. Sooooooo yummy!!!   Ohhh and they have a DJ playing great music the whole time!!!   I'm telling you, you gotta come here if you're in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.

h4xnzald52j_cJLr3t1Aow.text: Have been wanting to visit this spot for a long time, went here on a Thursday morning and didn't have to wait! Great service and lots of menu choices. The lemon ricotta pancakes were excellent as well as a made to order frittata. My dad and uncle both ordered hashes (lump crab and carnitas) and unfortunately both were underwhelmed.

uvte25QrwJq9s5VT6RvJVA.text: Great breakfast place and really impressive Bloody Mary bar. Service was excellent and food was delicious. Definitely try it!

7G3tY1gEMJ4QBsfHRtuuTg.text: I have been to the Gainey Ranch location numerous times and I would give all 5 stars!!!  The Bloody Mary Bar is amazing!  If you expect a long wait, on weekends, then you will have an amazing experience!  I am excited to try their new Indian School location in Arcadia.

4RCk_MmIS2izmeWvNksQRg.text: Fabulous brunch ... very lively... there's a DJ... great food and drinks!  Great for A girls day out, family, or a date.  Don't miss out on this great spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fabulous mimosa&#39;s

bzsRwLz_Ehvx0LD5skJRag.text: Went here on a weekday for breakfast. Super friendly staff. Menu has tons of great sounding options. I couldn't resist and got the pancakes with mascarpone and berries. WOW. They were delicious. My friend got the huevos rancheros hash dish - and she very much liked it. Definitely will be back!

T-i4pjDMMbezlc7pdxTueQ.text: 3.5 stars!  I miss all of the staff that I'd known for years.  Everyone who works here now, with the exception of perhaps two people, are new hires and will be moving to their respective Hash Kitchen locations once they've opened (Chandler and Phoenix).  I've decided to update my review, since I am not able to update any new photos (the link to add is, currently, permanently grey and won't let me post).  As regular HK patrons know, the menu usually has a few new items added.  I spotted "Benedict Fries" on my latest visit, so I decided to try it.  It's basically French fries with toppings of what you'd typically find in a Benedict: poached eggs, sliced ham, peppered bacon bits, and hollandaise sauce.  Delicious, and the poached eggs were the best eggs I've ever had that that weren't my mother's perfected scrambles!  I usually try to avoid eating as much egg whites as I can (I order a two-egg scramble prepared with one full egg and an extra egg yolk, for example), but I could eat these poached eggs in their entirety!  My only complaint was that these thin French fries were too soggy AND greasy for my liking.    My all-time favorite Coconut-almond encrusted French toast are almost-always perfect, since someone in the kitchen knows just the way I like them prepared.  I will do my very best to follow him wherever he may land!    Will return in a couple of days to try another new menu item!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I will always be loyal to HK&#39;s Coconut-almond French toast!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Benedict Fries- delicious, but fries were soggy.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French Toast Bread Pudding- you shall soon be mine!  ;)

c7jG_nfr_MrNWsL8S4SSyg.text: Food and ambience was 10/10 I would come here every week if I could. Mimosa flights are strong fair warning, me and my boyfriend split them and both caught a buzz. My boyfriend ordered the tamales benedict and I ordered the carnitas hash with carne asada instead of pork. Both were amazing! We will be back next time we are in town. Next time we might try the bloody mary bar it looks great especially for the price!

0Jt88k_5Zwwi0TmsZM7g8w.text: I'm not sure who is in control of the waitlist for this establishment - the employees at Hash Kitchen or the people at Yelp. Whoever it is, they need to get do a better job. The waitlist on the Yelp app said the current wait time was "0 mins" all the way up until we parked. We get inside and the wait is an hour - Whoa.  Let's also add the 45 minutes it took for our friends to get here from the other side of town. I guess it's a good thing drinks are easily accessible. Otherwise, I don't think we would have waited.  Another disappointment: They got rid of the lump crab eggs benedict. Please bring it back.  The prosecco smash drinks were yummy. Essentially prosecco, berry puree, blueberries and strawberries.   My fiance and I shared the breakfast sandwich and the fried chicken eggs benedict. I would get the fried chicken eggs benedict again because the chicken was pretty good. The sandwich was just okay - nothing spectacular.

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich with fries

ZmY7VOIpS51c95vtCteNag.text: Came here on a busy Father's Day morning for breakfast and it was packed. Luckily, my wife and I were seated right away at a two person table. I noticed there was lemonade outside for those waiting. The ambience here is great with music playing and how the restaurant is setup.   To drink, we ordered water and coffee. Coffee was tasty and fresh. For food, wife ordered a half order of Oreo pancakes and eggs over easy. I ordered the most popular item on the menu per our waitress, the Carnitas Hash. Wife thought Oreo pancakes were average. I tasted and I agree with her. Although they were good, there's better places for pancakes. Batter probably mixed with water. I enjoyed the Carnitas hash. They gave me a lot of carnitas which is very cool. The fried onions (think of Frenchies) is not a good addition per my taste buds as it sweetened the dish which I wasn't looking for. I took the fried onions off and the dish was much better.   We will come back as the service is great, the coffee is tasty and the food was tasty. I'm looking forward to trying different items next time like the bread pudding French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside the Carnitas hash skillet
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside the Oreo pancake
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas

PrQSx5BQ2OYSDDA5Vb8gyg.text: We flew into PHX from Cleveland and wanted to stop for brunch before our drive to Sedona. We were seated right away and of course the super cool Bloody Mary bar caught our attention. My husband got a bacon-infused vodka Bloody Mary and I had a strawberry mimosa - both were soo good. The menu is awesome - everything from sweet to savory and so much to choose from. I thoroughly enjoyed the Hash McMuffin although I could only eat half! My husband had the carnitas hash which was recommended by our server, who did a great job giving us suggestions since we are first-timers! In addition to the fresh, fun atmosphere and wonderful food and drinks, the manager Dominic was so kind and we truly enjoyed talking to him. What a great guy and an outstanding example of how a restaurant manager should engage with patrons. It made our experience that much more enjoyable. We did come on a Friday and heard this place is PACKED on Saturday/Sunday, so expect a wait! They have cool misters outside though :) Will definitely return next time we are in town!

_T3ib37MrYRuSSLBqPWlyw.text: This place is amazing. Just be prepared to come super hungry or share with whoever you are going with. I made the mistake of trying to order "healthy" by getting the avocado toast. While they did warn me that it's not the toast I'm probably used to getting at a breakfast place, I was still skeptical and chose to get it anyway. It was so good and so filling. I came nowhere near close to finishing it. I want to come back and try their Bloody Mary bar. I'd go here again and again. The hostess isn't always attentive but the food makes up for it luckily.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado toast

R55nLLaS-6wQKbbMqZxmRw.text: I was here last weekend with some girlfriends for brunch. We loved the food! I ordered Cristina's Tamale Cakes and we had a Brunch Bruschetta for the table. Both were great!   The tamale cakes were such a unique twist on an eggs benedict dish. The sweet corn base was light and flavorful, and the green chili pork was SO tender and good. I think this dish was worth every penny, and wasn't too much food to leave me feeling like I'd overeaten!  The bruschetta was fun to eat. Three different types, each sweet and perfect to share. If it weren't so far from where I live, I'd be back more often! Although the restaurant was packed, we still had  reliable service. Looking forward to sitting inside next time, rather than outside in the desert summer air. For an extremely warm day, I was surprised that there weren't any misters on our side of the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cristina&#39;s Tamale Cakes, $14
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brunch Bruschetta, $10
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cristina&#39;s Tamale Cakes, $14

afOLk8gAimc1pzJyCLyfxA.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I decided to go this restaurant for my birthday brunch. I had a bad experience and was told "sorry corporate has given us strict instructions you'll have to take it up with them". Problem #1, they did nothing to fix the situation while I was physically in the restaurant and told me to contact corporate. So, I came home and found the contact information for corporate and sent an email. Waited 3 days... crickets... no follow up. Sent a follow up email...crickets... no response. What kind of customer service completely ignores a customers concern. The least they could have done was responded to the email! I am astonished at how horrible their customer service is and will never come back to this restaurant. I gave them multiple opportunities to make the situation right and they chose to do nothing. WOW!

QqJJ2RYSeYMRnJA1u6onKw.text: I really dug this place. Amazingly enough, my cousin ordered a dish with the hash and it was nothing amazing, but his omelette was (NYC omelette with sausage peppers and caramelized onions. I got the brunch burger and OMG, the accommodated my requests to make it keto friendly and it came with Hollandaise to pour over my burger, bacon and over medium egg. Delish! I'm not a big drinker but they had lots to choose from and they looked like fun. The bloody Mary's looked amazing and had SO Many toppings. This place is one I'll return to!

Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Close up
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. NYC scramble with Italian sausage

pRe6jzSQqTtG7t7e7omOqA.text: I came here with my family and let me tell you the ambiance is on point! Fresh DJ playing all of your favorite classics (both new and old school) Large bloody Mary bar (if you're into that sort of drink) definitely 4 stars for place.  Pros: service was prompt, mimosas were delectable, upbeat vibe all around Cons: the music was loud. Now if I'm coming to party that's one thing, but as a brunch option to catch up with out of town family this was not the place to have conversations. My voice was hoarse by the end of the meal. The food left much to be desired. I got the salmon eggs Benedict which needed more flavor. My husband got the chicken and waffles. It was a nice big piece of chicken but the waffle was an afterthought.

A2DYgxt2e0SPBR8u5yIPxw.text: Build your own Bloody Marys, mimosa flights, cereal shots. What more can you ask for? The huevos rancheros hash skillet was great and so were the pancakes! The biscuits were dense and dry which was disappointing but we'll be back to try more items!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

q9ZBoH31xAhO0KsFqovexA.text: WOW WOW WOW  Came here for brunch on a Sunday after reading all the rave reviews on Yelp and I'm so glad I did!! One of the best brunches I've ever had -- ready for them to open a location in Atlanta so I can go all the time!!  I had read reviews saying that the place starts to pack up around 10 because that's when the DJ shows up so we got the restaurant around 9:40. We had a 15/20 minute wait which was totally fine because it gave us time to look over the menu and at different foods as they came out of the kitchen! When we were leaving though around 11 the place was completely packed and there were so many people waiting outside -- not sure how long the wait was but it had to be at least an hour based on how many people were waiting. Once seated service was decent, but since it was so packed I understand why service wasn't great especially towards the end.   They have a giant Bloody Mary bar with over 67 toppings, but since my boyfriend and I don't like bloody marys we opted for mimosas instead. They have four of five different flavors to choose from, along with a mimosa flight option! Since we couldn't decide what we wanted we ordered way too much but got to try a bunch of things. First we ordered the canoli donuts and they were INCREDIBLE!!!! So thick and sweet, perfectly made and delicious. 100% would order again. Next we got the bacon board which was really good to. They served the bacon with this jam that was wonderful! For our meals we ordered the carnitas hash and salmon fritata. The hash was also very good -- huge portion so definitely can share between people if ordering other appetizers and full of flavor. The salmon fritata wasn't very good and I probably wouldn't order again. However since the other foods we got were so good they totally made up for it. There's so many things to try on the menu though we definitely had a hard time ordering! Everything sounds amazing!  Love this place and wish I lived in Scottsdale so I could go again!

OwTYzWlnDAh1Bnymkn7FUA.text: They typically get my food wrong but when it's right, it's amazing.  Terrible trade-off... I know

VInoFkZyBAKMgNUvbLThVw.text: Second time here this week.  Incredible service. Great food.  Awesome atmosphere.   A huuuuu
