Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French Toast

ZlwIKByYOEFQZRNC-HzJRw.text: Great atmosphere--very bright and trendy looking. I like that they have a dog friendly patio.   Positives: our waitress was nice and they had a really cool Bloody Mary bar with all of the accoutrements that you could hope for. The gravy on the biscuits and gravy was very flavorful. Our eggs were cooked perfectly.   Negatives:  My bacon was chewy like jerky and the biscuits were very dry and dense.  The potatoes were tiny little boring cubes. While our waitress was nice, she was not attentive at all, and actually never came back to the table after dropping our food until it was time to bring the bill.   Overall I would probably not return here but my husband said he would give it one more try.

CK8aCRba-iZbUWficUyLkw.text: Absolutely delicious a must if your going to Scottsdale & want a great brunch with an awesome ambience.

zg0Fri_jFvTkMcaqqLnYFA.text: Stumbled upon this place while visiting Arizona and man I wish California had one of these!!  The Bloody Mary build your own bar is crazy fun and delicious with over 40 options to choose from. Charlie was running the Bloody Mary bar and once I told him it was my first time he was super helpful and kind!! This place has a nice selection of Hashes as well Hence the name.  I had the Herb fried chicken Hash which was moist and packed with flavor.  Service was fast, kind and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-2S6E3CTvtE0xjv2C6pB4A.text: Hash Kitchen is one of the best brunch places in the area and I have been to quite a few. If you like Bloody mary's or mimosas, this is your place to visit. Their Bloody Mary bar is huge and has a wide variety of toppings to add to your customized drink! They have different infused vodkas and different spice levels for the mix. It's so fun to design your own drink! The food is also amazing! I came with my family the day after Thanksgiving and we all shared and enjoyed the food we ordered. I would, however, advise that if you're decided between a scramble or a has, that you pick the hash. The scrambler is less integrated as a dish and I felt as though there was a lot less food. There are so many hash options, but my favorites are definitely the fried chicken and carnitas. The fried chicken and waffle was delicious as well. The waffle is made Belgium style, so the outside is crispy and the inside is soft!  My boyfriend ordered the s'mores French toast and it was the perfect sweet treat. There was marshmallow fluff both on top and between the two slices of French toast!  I will definitely be back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores French toast
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corned beef benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BYOBM

Z0MhTefbq_TsmXyj5J-NFA.text: Food is outstanding. The service is friendly and competent. The hostess dresses to the nines and is very friendly and helpful. They have the best coffee.

9MSSVkZt68lnFzKtbct16A.text: After reading the reviews, I thought I'd try their breakfast.  I'm so happy that I did. I had the Nutella and banana French toast along with a side of their potatoes.  I highly recommend both.  The French toast 4 big slices of bread with Nutella and bananas in the middle. The portion was a good size. The potatoes had carmelized chopped onions and red peppers. They were delicious.   The service was good and the food was more than I expected. I'm happy I gave this place a try!

doS1PJYQYeTKYREdx7o--g.text: Aaahh, the bloody mary bar...I'll never forget you! :) Oh, and the food was fantastic too!

zPavLvdthy-KrOJdAi47gw.text: Our Mothers Day brunch was a disaster. We got there a few minutes before our reservation time of 1 o'clock to find out that they were running 45 minutes to an hour late on their reservations. We finally got seated at 2:15. An hour after taking our orders they came back to say that they had run out of some things. Then they brought out several wrong orders. We had to send back more than half of our food. The biscuits on my salmon beni were raw inside. The salmon was dry. The doughnuts were hard on the outside and still raw doughy on the inside. We left at 4 and went out to our favorite sushi restaurant instead. This truly was the worse Mothers Day meal ever.

mydxrw-UDaXBW4Lf2YXgdw.text: Fun environment with a DJ on Saturday morning but the food was just okay. Breakfast burrito sounded great but was very bland. The Bloody Mary bar was good but no cheese toppings! Need cheese!

B-1bciTBb7rLqqujYIviSQ.text: My sister and I spent a few days celebrating my bday and a friend recommended Hash Kitchen. We had a blast!!!! The DJ was amazing and kept us dancing the whole time. Bonnie...LOVE HER!!! The food is all that and the staff too...will def go back!

UPHJuGGjc3IFt_2m7_XIpw.text: I was excited to come here for the waffles, as my mom just loves it here.  I came with high expectations and was not disappointed!  The customer service was amazing, Alec our server came to check on us often and gave us as many refills of coffee as we wanted.  When the waffles came, they were hot and freshly made just for us.  It was delicious, and I soon found out that I needed more butter and syrup for this huge waffle.  Bonnie came over and asked if we wanted anything, and I asked for both.  She brought it over quickly and it made the experience extra tasty and worth going off my "healthy eating" for one meal!  I will definitely come here again, I want to try more items on their menu.  I should also mention the Bloody Mary Bar, where there is a huge assortment to make your own Bloody Mary.  That looked interesting and worth trying, as well!

XLZ7eMGNKR746s_lnBxxSQ.text: So I lucked out hardcore on the breakfast food places that yelp gave me this morning. The hash kitchen was worth the 20 minute drive from Glendale because everything was perfect! From our server Loma to the amazing spiked coffee beverages and especially the phenomenal food!!! The almond coconut encrusted French toast is breakfast made for the gods!! As for the carnitas skillet it couldn't be anymore delicious! Juicy tender pork with a perfect combo of chilies onions and eggs. It was to die for!! I recommend this place to anyone!! Oh ya if you like bloody Mary's their Mary bar is impressive!

IObx4uKuutqbeRGe3t5qmA.text: Decided to break tradition and head to Hash for breakfast. Normally i head to Breakfast Club but had heard good things about this place. Service was good, our waiter forgot a few things, and had to be reminded of some things, but i honestly don't blame him. This place is crazy packed. Our food was delicious, and the mimosa flight was great! Will give another shot so i can try the build your own Bloody Mary bar!

Xd7Yh8NI_9KfoQQFX6g8nA.text: Terrible hostess service and very unorganized. I really wish I could give a review of what looks like great food, but I wouldn't know seeing as the hostesses forgot about us after we had been waiting for a little more than an hour to eat. We arrived expecting 6 people to show up, but as soon as we knew there'd be less we let the hostesses know there'd be 4 instead. Our buzzer went off right as we went up to change it again to add one more and she said she'd reset it for us when they would have a bigger table available. We were very upfront and flexible as we knew the number of our group was being unpredictable against our will. We were very present and proactive about this. So you wouldn't think we'd be easily forgotten. So we sat and sat and sat. Soon we noticed that a large group who was there after us got seated outside. The tables were even pushed together for them. We were told that that wasn't possible. We brought that to the attention of both women and noticed that our name had already been crossed off and other large groups were put before us. The women proclaimed that they never said that we couldn't sit outside and that they would never say it to begin with. We received no apology and they never admitted a fault. We left right away and went and had fantastic crepes and French cuisine right across the parking lot instead.  Also, don't expect to socialize comfortably with family etc as the music on Sunday mornings is obnoxiously loud and unnecessary. If that's your thing, then more power to you.

DDWokT0OgC3uzhfSRy49bA.text: Very little flavor.  Carrot cake pancakes were a disappointment.  The cakes were tough and flavorless.  The only thing qualifying it as carrot cake was shreds of carrot.   The syrup tasted  like Mrs Butterworth...not real maple syrup.  The cream cheese was the only good thing.  The Christinas Tamale cakes (a benedict) was boring ... no spice to the green chile.  The side of potatoes were ouly and flavorless.  It looks like the real draw to this place is the bloody mary bar.  Not impressed.

Uyr8ltdtGGrEMmI6l4y88Q.text: 5 stars because my son "LOVED"  his breakfast sandwich!  Everything we ordered was delicious from biscuits to corned beef hash to french toast. Extensive menu. Wanted to stay and try It all. It just kept getting better with super nice staff and great service. Elaborate bloody Mary bar. DJ playing great upbeat music. Happiness!

fwbA_FL8dBLqqiwL7pEOJQ.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast when I'm in AZ!! The owners are so welcoming and accommodating and work just as hard as the rest of the staff. Everything I've tried off the menu has been delicious, but my favorite is the carnitas hash. They have such a fun vibe and even a DJ on the weekends. It's the perfect brunch spot!

prbdZPx0nBbIncXG3LV9TA.text: They have a real problem Tried to have breakfast there and was told there was a 30 minute wait although there were several open tables they said kitchen was running slow I am not impressed they are going to need to step it up if they plan to succeed as for me I will not return

j3-W7OVAtz3QEBVl5iy0Mg.text: Place is great, amazing food and customer service. The bar staff and Alisa at the build your own Bloody Mary bar was awesome, very friendly and helpful!

G4loUgSw3l0Q3KXKtNOYmw.text: I wish that I'd had the great experience that other reviewers had.   No watermelon mimosas, which was a reason we chose this place. Ordered a regular mimosa, nearly all juice and not much bigger than a shot glass. 11:30 on a Sunday, out of gravy, so no biscuits and gravy.  Quinoa just "wasn't coming out" so I settled for a waffle. Friend ordered a breakfast sandwich and ended up with a burger sandwich ("bun"made of tater tots).  She was hungry and after settling for this because of the lack of gravy, so she bit her lip and just kept it. Our server, Brian, was good, so there's that.   Not sure I can muster the patience to give them a second chance.

2sC_3WTTacXIW5SN5XC8eA.text: Fantastic make your own Bloody Mary bar with a ton of topping options.  Lona was a great waitress and the menu had so many great looking options. Food was great!

mzDZNL42SnQ2Gi3uJrxI3A.text: This is a great business concept .  Breakfast, Brunch and Bloody Mary's!  We stopped into the Scottsdale Blvd store for breakfast.  It was nearly packed at 10:30 on a Friday morning.  Excellent breakfast menu, great coffee, great service.  The only disappointment for this New Mexican was I had the Chilequillas, which were very good, but were advertised as made with Green Chile sauce. The sauce turned out to be Tomatillo Salsa, not green chile.

v2CqYGg921OTEj_eyZOq6A.text: I love a good breakfast/brunch spot and Hash Kitchen check off all the requirements for a staple spot! I love the food and the servings are huge! You know the food is good when it tastes better or just as good the next day/reheated! No really, it does! I always get the almond/coconut encrusted French toast and because there is no way I can eat it all in one sitting, I always have leftovers and look forward to enjoying it the next day.  Whenever I have visitors, I am sure to take them to Hash Kitchen and everyone has always left full and satisfied! Oh, an extra bonus, is the very friendly manager/owner who is super sweet!  I would definitely recommend this place!

gJJ-aa0ts0Rcprq1VVhsYw.text: Good quality breakfasts, with a lot of variety to choose from. A lot less greasy/fatty than you would expect given the types of foods they are cooking. Everyone in my party got something different, and was happy and didn't go home hungry, or overstuffed.  Drinks were excellent, especially the house bloody mary's. Going to be my go-to brunch in Scottsdale

Son_O4YGSWHM2NEYWLc-Dw.text: Made a reservation for Mother's Day.  Got there a few minutes early, and the hostess said the wait (despite the reservation) would be at least 30 min.  Won't be back!!

UTpnW_rSqGDXVS8C2JKhAg.text: The only reason I give this 4 instead of 5 is because it's a bit pricey for breakfast and I prefer the diner-type breakfasts.   But this place is GREAT if you're looking for lots of variety and very good food.  I will definitely return to try more of the many items that sound delicious.

_MDzYGU8ApjO3s1ptXN_Gg.text: The food was amazing. The atmosphere was loud but nice. The customer service was great. We loved this place. We definitely would come back.

akBQ-MNUAbQxtiISmp62-Q.text: What a fun place to visit on vacation!   If it were closer, I would be there all the time! 3 people in our group had the Bloody Mary bar and it was so fun to see their creations!  I had the blueberry mimosa (x2 because it was the best ever). Our food was very good. The Bloody Mary's were pretty filling and so a couple people split their food.  The hostess was very sweet.  The service was speedy and attentive. The music was not too loud. We were able to watch Iowa State football as well.

5RAqzebd0HeB1BrlkwpoEw.text: I start by saying I am VERY particular on my brunch. If you're looking for a fun, hip, lively place with incredible food and creative drinks, you won't find a better spot! We first met Bonnie when we walked in. She greeted us with a smile and a whole lot of great personality. The food, was insanely delicious. Honestly was hard to narrow down what to get. We ordered the hash chicken and lemon ricotta pancakes. Then the drinks... if your a fan of bloody Mary's they have a whole make your own bar with great selections to choose from. We tried the flight mimosa and the strawberry was awesome! Do yourself a favor and check this place out!!

eq-9FTx_eVwZ9wVxITz0kw.text: I just enjoyed the most marvelous Easter brunch with my family here at Hash Kitchen. The service was impeccable and they greeted us with warm smiles from the start. We were able to enjoy an impressive Bloody Mary bar (yumm!) while we waited to be seated. The restaurant was filled with laughter, conversation, and upbeat music. My 4 year old was beyond excited when she saw... wait for it.... The Easter Bunny himself!! We were seated in Jen's section and our service couldn't have been any better! She was attentive and friendly. I was recommended the French toast, and let me just say that I am sure glad that I listened! We were a party of 10, and we all agreed that it was one of (if not) the BEST breakfast food that we had ever had. Upon our departure we were thanked by Annie and Bonnie with the sweetest hugs and smiles! We live about 30 miles from the restaurant, but I promise that we will be back! Thank you all from the bottom of my heart for making this special occasion with my family so memorable!

oADihaXfR3N2uJM8tQk4ow.text: Brought in our family visiting from NYC...this is our favorite brunch place...thank you to Bonnie and our wonderful server for their impeccable service...definitely a place to go to  - Chris

BOnjEH5a52qupxCpDJgwqg.text: 2 1/2 maybe.  Would I try again, yes.  The atmosphere and even the music is all good.  However, you guys rave like this is the best breakfast spot in Phoenix and Scottsdale.  It's not.  Tons of others places that are better just look on Yelp.  Every edge of the valley from Matt's downtown to the Farmhouse in Gilbert.  The service is terrible.  We saw our server when he took our order and when we got the check.  That's it and it was clear that he couldn't have cared less.  We wanted an OJ and mimosa plus an egg added to our tab but we couldn't get anyone to pay attention and stop for two seconds.  Now the food.  The chicken and waffles are overrated.  I liked the waffle but the chicken is actually very sweet.  Look, you already get maple syrup on the plate so no need to be excessive with the sugar angle.  The contrast is what makes chicken and waffles great.  Also, maybe use a slightly heartier piece of chicken instead of it being pounded so thin or whatever it is you're doing.  Chilaquiles, spelling?, actually pretty good but not close to traditional but everybody has their take on a dish so it is what it is.  Maybe less chicken over the top.  Now the Bloody Mary bar.  Boy, this must be your profit center.  What a waste of money.  Low quality vodka with either a mild or spicy tomato base and profile.  Lots of crap you can add for garnish but you're missing one key element.  A great Bloody Mary is about the spices and flavors in the mix and yours is bland at best.  This is not a Bloody Mary bar as much as it is a garnish bar.  Throw some garlic powder, onion powder, a couple hot sauces etc up there so you can change the taste of the base because it needs help. The place is packed and it's a good  location but two breakfasts, two drinks, an OJ and we are at $75.  Look at my reviews and you'll see that I have actually never mentioned price because I am happy to spend money on a great meal and experience.  This was not worth it.  Plus, I eat at great breakfast joints all over the west coast.  Also, my reviews are a majority excellent reviews not bad ones,  I feel it's important to not only complain about a bad experience but give people credit when they do a good job.  Go for yourself but gotta tell you that we are in no rush to go back here.

AuYAfoG-_oSDzMiDm37WfA.text: Awesome atmosphere and the food is amazing. Definitely the spot to start your day!! They have a live dj and the service was on point.

UsvfOSxtZMcslXS9kavRDA.text: This is one of those restraunts you see on Dinners, Drive In's, and Dives and say I wish we had a restaurant like that to go to.  The food is great, the atmosphere is fun, and the Mimosa's are awesome!!!

feXyQNCGxcDOm7lJiN28vA.text: Incredible food. Amazing Bloody Mary bar. But most important, the customer service from Anthony was absolutely stellar. Greeted with a complimentary mimosa while we waited to be seated. Quick seating, fast service, quality food. You can tell it's family owned and they made us feel like part of the fam. Will definitely be back!!

VXfnVeupRBtfjoaT051qYA.text: What the what!!! Ok! So I pride myself in good food and good drink! Let's just start by saying this is my new favorite brunch spot... In Arizona!!! Let's start with the BYOB Bloody Mary bar. A choice of like 5 infused vodkas. I, of course, choice the bacon vodka. They have garnishes from bacon to oysters to capresse skewers to beets to Gouda. All to say.... Amazing! Then there is the food that is not found in my beverage...I got the brisket hash that was made by the bbq place next store, which hash also owns. Green chilies, brisket, cornbread potato hash with poached eggs. Yum!!! The manager, Linda, who is now on my top 10 favorite people ever, brought over some homemade bbq sauce to eat use on my hash... Some of the best bbq sauce I have ever had and this means something from someone who basically bleeds bbq! My hash came with a fresh biscuit that I ended up eating even though I was so full! My mom got the corned beef hash which was everything God intended it to be! The food at Hash Kitchen goes above and beyond your exceptional brunch. Not only is the food here amazing and every bite delusions, but the people here take it that extra step! We greeted by 2 lovely woman that were genuinely excited we were there! The manager sat us and brought us water and also introduced us to the restaurant and the menu. She was warm and knowledgeable. Linda. Linda is the manager as well as the giver of sauce! She is the one who hooked me up with the bbq sauce. The bartender who helped me with the Bloody Mary bar was incredible! We gave me samples and walked me through every step of creating my personal Bloody Mary. Our waitress was adorable and very helpful. Love this place so much that I will be back here on Friday and probably Sunday too... Thank you Hash Kitchen, not for the bigger pants size that I will now have to attain, but for reminding me what Sunday brunch should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar!

Y4hJQKfYjVbyPDUOluN2HQ.text: Came here to meet a friend in town from CA for spring training. Our waiter Chris was awesome. He knew them from when they came for lunch the day before. ANYWAY...let's start with the bloody Mary bar...I'm a sucker for a good bloody Mary..this place does not disappoint! I went through myself the first time and tried the jalapeno vodka and added celery salt and a pickle and piece of bacon etc and loved my drink. While I was enjoying my drink and knew I may run out, breakfast was served.  I went back to the bloody Mary bar and while I was in line our waiter  came up to me and said "go back to your table, I will make your drink so you can eat without your food getting cold and bring it to your table." He then asked for my drink choices and garnishments and I have to say, he nailed it and I had two of the best Bloody Mary's of my life here. So, on the food front...I later went to urgent care the same day and was told I had a sinus infection, so the fact that I felt like the food I ate was some of best ever on like like 33% of my taste buds is saying something. I'm a sucker for short ribs, so I ordered the Benedict with the short ribs and I have to say it was one of the best things I have ever eaten. My companions were confused as to whether I was disgusted or in delight...I can assure you I was in delight. Seriously yummy! I only wish they were on my side of town, but according  to our waiter they have a Chandler location opening soon! I hope so!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Bloody Mary bar ever...
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short ribs and benedict? Yes please!

q1V90quxOtbIw-mmb45Iww.text: 50 STARS!!!! Probably my new favorite restaurant!!! The space is soooooooo beautiful, AMAZING food, and real great service. Stumbled in here for a late Thursday birthday brunch and had amazing time. Must try fried chicken egg Benedict, croque Madame, BACON, oh and did I mention build your own Bloody Mary bar??? Holy god, delicious. Make sure you ask for Chris for your server, he was so great, personable and fun. He uplifted our entire experience and is a huge asset to this restaurant! So great, we came back the next day. This is a must try spot, so get in here!!!

hhL3Ov9ZxwXVH-DaE_GZhg.text: Very nice atmosphere, Bonnie was very delightful and the food was good. We went for brunch and enjoyed the time we spent there.

nAwhO8-mIuVn8d2VPuXuBA.text: Oh my, the food here is amazing! Only 2nd to the great service by Anthony. The Coconut Encrusted French toast is amazing. Today I had the Pastrami and it was so good. My husband had the Chicken Benedict and he said it was the best thing on the menu. We made a special trip from the west side just to eat here. Definately worth the drive!

axeTN5XyT5TSFR6tEc3RhA.text: The Hash Kitchen Has become one of our favorite breakfast/brunch choices.  There's a wide variety on the menu and everything we had was delicious which included the corn beef hash, the coconut and Almond French toast, and the eggs Benedict. The waitstaff was attentive and coffee was frequently refilled.  I recommend this place to many friends who always rave about it. We enjoy this place so much, we scheduled a wedding brunch there. Enjoy!!

V-PgPokEeiEVaGSfydCQog.text: This place has great food and great service. Thanks Anthony, We will be back for sure.

BFCSrrSylvy9x3zoG3LLJw.text: The ambiance is great and trendy.  Even with reservations it still took 15 minutes to sit us.  My husband ordered a bloodymary and the bar didn't restock anything.  The sausage/meatballs were cold even though they were in the warmers.  He didn't care for the bloodymary at all.  .   Food overall was good.  Not as many vegetarian options and the quantities are big enough to share.  Our waitor kept disappearing and I had requested to have a salad made vegetarian but the chef supposely said no they couldnt do that. They did not have any vegetarian protein options either in their menu.  Their online menu was different as well.  It's overpriced but not bad.

dJ5TfpBtbVC2cPctSy9suw.text: The venue was fresh and artistic. The music makes you feel younger again. The food and service outstanding ! Chris and Linda wonderfully friendly attentive and engaging! What a wonderful find on our trip from San Francisco to spring training.

bCsSMF4ZGquAx2_hueZBpQ.text: Our first time and definitely will not be our last!  Creative food (without it being weird--some places are just weird!) that was served fresh, hot and tasted great!  Fun, AM cocktails, mimosas and a super clean, great looking Bloody Mary bar in the middle of the place.  We arrived at 8:20am--by 9:00am it was packed!  The food was great, the portion sizes big enough to fill you up without stuffing you, attentive, quality staff (Matthew, our waiter, was excellent), great coffee!  Can't wait to take my girlfriends here for brunch.  It is about time the Phoenix area had an exceptional and creative breakfast place!  Hash Kitchen is a total hit in my book!

dFW5zvfwafdZ16gNQngmAA.text: A business breakfast could not have been more enjoyable.  Whoa.  An awesome menu.  Get out of the same old same old rut and try this place.  Table of 4 had all different things.   This is a go to place.

xe9jeK5tJuzEy9y_4N4xHA.text: What an incredible experience! Our waiter was so nice and totally accommodating and welcoming. Love love this place! I don't remember our waiter's name but he had black framed glasses and was such a great asset to this restaurant! Wish they had this restaurant in California!

SadX70u7rX11BY1B_ns71g.text: LOVE this breakfast spot- so modern and fun, as well as great tasting food. Will defiantly be back!

_hMDFGIHwd13X-7lvdCrRQ.text: Food is good, service is mediocre and it is loud, so if you are into that this is the spot! Awesome Mimosa flight and bloody mary bar- Hash was delicious.

Px_xNC5bJD7ubhpyReTFMg.text: Awesome Food, Bloody Mary Bar and DJ Craig was Killer! It is a Sunday Funday favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. fresh juice greyhounds!

r8J4lozWcks3NNFy3TEBHw.text: Fun location, looking for a identity. The food and service were great, the Bloody Mary bar was fabulous. The DJ in my opinion was a little out of place but just an opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EoHztC7r87pZXxYuAiJvrw.text: Ok here it is. Went today for the first time, just driving by. To start- the friendliest people in the world. Then we had the bloody  Mary bar, killer. I've had this at like 4 other places but this is the best ever!  Mimosas - out of this world.   Food, I had a skillet, someone had eggs Benedict, chicken and waffles and a croch monsure (spelling. ??) - everything was out of this world. This kitchen is killing it!!!!   But it gets down to the staff, some of the nicest I have ever met in a restaurant.   Go and enjoy!   Thank you for a great meal.

4DLKLqf18ccgKBE_tdHvbA.text: Insanely good sweet potato and crab hash, followed by some delish and turbo charged coffee. Service was outstanding and the Sunday morning DJ topped off a gear experience!

Wk1hgwEJ-dgW3owEQc4tIg.text: Food was good. Atmosphere is good. And the manager was so sweet and helpful! Loved the DJ and the mimosas!

M0Dh5yS5ht3MEsk2qdsR_g.text: A good friend recommended we try hash kitchen! Sooo glad we did! Amazing food,amazing service and amazing atmosphere ! Bloody Mary bar ... Off the charts! Our daughter just moved to Scottsdale for work and hash kitchen will definitely be a spot we always will come to when visiting! Customers for life! Joey the owner .... Also full of hospitality!

AQEAGtkGqddCgmy4Qx7tMg.text: My husband and I stopped in with our little girl for brunch. The atmosphere is so cheery and the service was amazing. I had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with a side of bacon. It was all delicious! We would definitely recommend it as a must stop for anyone in the area. The Bloody Mary Bar was intriguing. Maybe next time we will give it a try!

-P6jo0GFH2S00-lMEhF3qw.text: I am baffled and I do mean BAFFLED there are multiple locations of this disaster zone. I have been there twice and both times it has been completely inedible. The last time I was there was for a business meeting and when they put the plate down in front of me I could smell the salmon in the eggs Benedict was completely rancid. Rancid! It was a Herculean feat not to puke while the putrid fish sat on the plate in front of me. So as not to offend my host I attempted to eat around the fish but everything else was covered in mounds of raw onions. Bless the hundred-year-old coffee server lady for filling my cup every 37 seconds otherwise I would've starved to death that day.

9KzrOQ8y3ESkcxZ3FIOSTw.text: Perfect spot for breakfast. Great service. Friendly atmosphere. Bloody Mary Bar is a must. I'm not a Bloody Mary drinker, but well worth the experience. The Lump Crab and Sweet Potato Hash was tasty as was the build your own Frittata  Try salmon, artichokes with mushrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab &amp; sweet potato hash.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My BYOBM Bar creation.

M88ddWBDlObAPEzugKOHnw.text: The sweet potato hash is the best! The service was also amazing, I highly recommend this spot for breakfast!

Z1qkXZbogbbObakVaRZodg.text: My friend and I went to lunch today and decided to try The Hash Kitchen. After looking at the menu we decided to try their amazing breakfast menu.   We were so not disappointed. The herb crusted chicken and waffles were amazing as was the coconut French toast with bananas and sauce.  The service was great. Thanks Dominique for your suggestions and wonderful service. Also, shout out to Bonnie as a great hostess and made sure we were taken care of.  Pam and I have already decided we will be back to try the lunch menu.

tcvZZ3DHCTG0dHXTbOXRCw.text: Love, love, love Hash Kitchen. The food, decor, vibe. The wait was a little long (it was a Sunday morning) but they gave us mimosas while we waited so we were happy. The food was delicious - so many flavors. I had the salmon BLT and my girlfriends had the chicken and waffles. Fresh and quality ingredients! Next time I'm trying the Bloody Mary bar - I don't normally like them but I got to sample and it was delicious. They make their own tomato juice which is why it was so good (instead of that thick canned stuff). We will be back!

fAFkq3HAwr1HjFVxKK-enw.text: This place is AMAZING!!! from the BYOBM to every item we ordered from the menu.  Dishes are full of flavor and they are just the right amount of food to get satisfied.  The music is great and the service is exceptional! Kudos to our waitress Deanna! She was great and all her recommendations were on point.  We are definitely coming back!

akekXvzbuGY3ee465_fw5Q.text: The basic Cornbeef Hash lacks flavor, over easy eggs came out with hard yokes. Music was good selection but volume could be brought down. Establishment attempt to create party atmosphere falls short during a Saturday breakfast.

de5kEQRi87W6A6v4DpYvsQ.text: Oops it looked so good that I forgot to take a picture. Today I had a new offering - the aphrodisiac oyster hash. Very good but the eggs Benedict with crab meat is still my #1 favorite. This place is so good for breakfast that I will have to make a point of trying lunch here.  Oh FYI they brew a great pot of coffee too

eiymWCtmsJEyinlRKNGBkQ.text: Bonnie and the rest of the team are AMAZING! You want a restaurant in Scottsdale that makes you feel welcome, like you're part of the family and serves excellent food? Hash Kitchen is your spot! Breakfast is bomb for brunch with the family too!

ol9e_uY8NJPh5GFoR2KC3A.text: Brought my family here for Xmas and it was hands down my new favorite breakfast spot! Big portions and totally reasonable prices! Everyone loved their dishes and we were even able to accommodate my daughter who is vegan. Our attentive server Colton and the managers were on active duty to ensure our holiday breakfast was to perfection! They delivered and we all said -- we must YELP this bunch. I apologize for not remembering everyone's names. I had a shrimp eggs benedict with asparagus but what looked the most amazing choice was the huge, meaty pastrami sandwich! Everyone was very happy with their meals! The bloody mary bar is a must! We piled on jalepeno poppers, meatballs, bacon, celery, veggies, pickles into a fine art form of wonder! There was some confusion as to who our server was  at first and they apologized to us with some creamy donut deliciousness appetizer on the house! This is a well run, attention to the details kind of place! Keep up the customer service and incredible food. We sat out on the patio enjoying a sunny, 70's Christmas day that was divine. Thank you Hash Kitchen and to all your staff-- even the bartender at the Bloody Mary bar was personable!

6b-W0Klt-ViRnLL-NrtEvA.text: It was my first time here and I loved the atmosphere. The food was great and the staff was very welcoming. The Bloody Mary bar was amazing and there are so many different options to choose from. Definitely will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight

98_lohSPoxa9Fzu9ocE0tg.text: Great service, great food, and the atmosphere is unbeatable. Check out the bloody mary bar!

Qzzqdhu7qOy6K8opbLcBrA.text: Delicious food and I really loved the Bloody Mary! The server was a little impatient with my daughter when she was trying to decide what she wanted to order (just the look of annoyance on her face). Other than that, I would have definitely given a 5 star review.

aho0AS2sU42Z8tDPQB7B5g.text: Just had the Chorizo Frittata and it was "just ok" lacked flavor. I was expecting way more from this place and it did not deliver. Coffee was very good (lavazza). Service was ok but noting inviting. The server just delivered the check and did not ask if I wanted anything else. They have donuts! Oh boy! Think outside the box! Lol   Basically I wouldn't come back to this place and I don't recommend, unless you like tasteless food and donuts! Lol don't waste your time, plenty more to choose from. I like the concept but they fail at implementing it. High priced Denny's. You got one star for coffee...

tWMJW5NwucN15U0eFaR-8w.text: Great service from Jen! Breakfast was yummy. We had the chorizo hash and traditional corned beef hash. Jen was helpful and made suggestions and kept our coffee cups full!

7634cynYlf5YfWUc2sMVOw.text: We would give 6 out of 5 stars if we could.  This is our new go-to brunch restaurant in the east valley.  The chicken and waffles entree is absolutely amazing. The entire staff is friendly and very quick.  We highly recommend dining here!

k7r0KfzQCoMGCPFj8O4yPQ.text: Love this place. If you like Bloody Marys, they have a great Bloody Mary bar where you can build your own with all kinds of treats. It is a meal in itself.

95ZOOBzfYBUmesO8Is6O9Q.text: What a great/fun place with a fantastic Bloody Mary Bar, the service is excellent, the food is excellent, and...Bonnie made our experience so enjoyable, you can truly tell she loves what she does!!!

oA9Z5XRAZy4G9w_QnFPuNA.text: This place was absolutely delicious! The lemon ricotta pancakes were amazing. Amy and Jen were wonderful!

K0a1pFn-goopMwEMHNfj9w.text: Good food that's worth the wait. They don't take reservations for small groups, so get there early. DJ's are really my thing, but they make it work.  Service from Jen was great!

ggoFqQDdyBAChd2kz9jA2A.text: Love the mimosa flight and the various "hash" options--one of our favorite breakfast spots. If you come on a Saturday be prepared for a little wait. :)

PysY3yZnjR81n3cBSvK5KQ.text: Came on a Tues at 11 for brunch. Service was very slow. Waiter never stopped by to refill my coffee. Had crab Benedict and chicken and waffles which were just ok. For the price and the service you receive, you're better off going to Butterfields down the street. I wouldn't recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

l_pwZBkn4vuf2pjNFzOXYQ.text: My wife and I chose The Hash Kitchen in part because of previous reviews and in part because they serve French press coffee.   I had the lump crab &  sweet potato hash.   It was excellent.   My wife had the Spanish fritata.   She said it was good,  but not great.   The French press coffee was really good and an ample serving.   Service was very good.   Candice was pleasant and attentive.   Recommended for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab &amp; sweet potato hash. Excellent.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French press coffee.   Very good.

f5gPUGtkUliHGmwOneN5Tg.text: Ugh. The note below is probably why your restaurants are always empty.  You did NOT understand the situation. You asked me no questions about why we were getting frustrated and did not give your hostess a chance to explain the situation to you. You merely interjected when he came up to the counter upset and then you dismissed us with zero apology. What kind of customer service is that? I might have expected that from a shift manager, which is what I thought you were based on your behavior, but never a restaurant owner.   What my boyfriend said to your hostess was "she didn't even offer to put our name down." Valid complaint. Was his tone the best? Probably not. But we expected basic service which you didn't deliver. You, Mrs. Restaurant owner, are the one to blame for not training your staff well. Your actions were ruder than both my boyfriends and your hostesses actions. Unacceptable.   We were willing to wait. Like I said, we were excited to come try out your restaurant, but we were not even given the opportunity to wait. Where was the wait time? Neither you nor your hostess gave me that until I had to ask several times.   The fact that you had two similar instances within the matter of a few days should tell you that there is a problem with your service. Larry probably wanted to wait as well but was not given a chance. Service complaints are so easily rectifiable. Your hostess has had three similar complaints on here in the last two weeks. Train your staff.  Finally, way to go and get your friend, Yvonne, to write a review about your restaurant to counter mine. Very professional. Just like your response. Zero friends, two reviews, the other one for your failed restaurant, Cuttlefish? Nice try.  People - don't waste your time here. You can get a better Bloody Mary cart at The Henry. A better breakfast at Butterfields. And better service anywhere else. This plaza for example: Soi 4, Chez Vous Crepe, POMO, Naya... hell, I will even go to Pei Wei. You're in a spot with a lot of competition, lady. Step it up.   Again. One star, well deserved.

w4e_xCHZIM2JQm9Oz0qe0w.text: I was not nearly as bowled over by this place as I wanted to be....  Met up with a dear friend on Sunday for hash...one of my favorite dishes in the world.  I arrived early and got seated immediately.  Our server gave me water, then ignored me for the next 20 minutes.  Luckily the owner's wife came by and got me some coffee, which was great.  My friend arrived and we ordered as our server had miraculously appeared.  He seemed to have a limited knowledge of the menu as he could make few recommendations and told my friend that the restaurant didn't make something that was clearly on the menu.  We both ordered hash...mine was crab with sweet potato and my friend's was traditional.  Mine was bland and flavorless; I ordered a side of hollandaise to spice it up but it had no flavor either.  Both of us agreed that texture also played a big part in our overall dissatisfaction as well.  As the queen of brunch, I fully expected to be able add Hash Kitchen to the restaurant rotation but am not thinking so now.  Bummer.

KSmvEp8G7h9SID9vqLsOXw.text: Love this place! So exciting, fun, and delicious! The people that work here are so positive and kind! The wait can be long but it's understandable for a great breakfast place! They have a variety of delicious options and flirty drinks for everyone to try! I even saw a member of the staff walking people out as they were leaving to thank them for coming and ask how the experience was! Great place! Thanks!

zJ27irxYU3q5n83yZzmXIA.text: This place is excellent for breakfast. I had the brisket corn bread hash; the brisket was apparently smoked for 12 hours, and it showed. The corn bread was sweet and the potatoes were savory. It was the best thing I've eaten in a long time. The coffee is very good. My wife had the lemon ricotta pancakes, which were sweet and light.   I'd wholeheartedly recommend this place. They have two small outdoor patios that look like a nice place to eat breakfast. The atmosphere inside was a little formal for breakfast and the music was strange (greatest hits of the 90s for some weird reason). But the staff made up for it with excellent service and the food was spectacular. I'll be back for sure.

vU7dupEXe1Pr4lj0iKtJCg.text: Very impressed, and that isn't an easy thing to do. No dining experience is ever prefect, but this was close.  The decorations and ambience inside are very upbeat and led me to believe the process were going to be much higher than the $$ rating on yelp, but they weren't.  We were a party of six adults and two children under five.  The hostess (possibly management or owner) came over immediately to offer crayons and high chairs and chatted with us and the kids which made everyone feel right at home.  The waitress was very attentive and suggested the bloody Mary bar which four of us tried and it was well worth it. Great selection and even had a virgin option at a reduced rate for the pregnant lady in our group.  Only one person had an issue with their meal; biscuits in their biscuits and gravy were a bit doughy but we didn't complain because everything else was so good.  When the waitress was handling the checks she noticed the b&g had barely been touched so she asked if they tasted ok.  We explained the biscuits were a little undercooked and that it wasn't a big deal.  The waitress apologized and left to get the checks.  When we paid I realized they completely removed that item from the bill - without saying anything about it.  That is service like we rarely see these days.  It's obvious they really care about your experience at their establishment and they take ownership over their guests' level of satisfaction.    I would've been excited over a small discount on the meal - it wasn't ruined because the vast majority (including another order of b&g that came out fine) of the meal came out perfect - but they insisted on making it prefect.  Bravo.  I'll be back if I'm ever in the area again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito.  I highly recommend it!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QLw-gkdQ1aRUMszNut0BaQ.text: Absolutely an A++ for ambience!! The black and white decor coupled with the attention to design and detail is so captivating and creates for an upscale brunch environment throughout the week.  Food: The Banana Foster French toast was definitely a Devine dish. It was cool to perfection and the added Nutella and cream was scrumptious.  The pancakes and fries were also tasty.  The coffee was not my favorite yet the presentation was nice. The pineapple orange mimosa was yummy.  I have found the servers to be accommodating but not quite friendly.  This is surely a place to visit if you are in the Arizona area.

_NrxWi3LizhwItQbEBzKag.text: A must if your in the area   We were welcomed by Gino the manager and he treated us like family. The Bloody Mary all you can toppings bar was amazing !!! Definitely try this feature out   My wife and I shared the chicken and waffles and would recommend it to anyone who likes that dish.   Another great spot in Arizona !!

YtZ2sCHoupYm0aDKiwifGA.text: I'm not usually one to complain but what a horrible experience with Geno! We had a large party (which we had reservations for) & he treated each of of us (20 people!) awful & disrespectful. What happened to customer service? He told us "you are negatively affecting my business" when we asked for additional chairs so each person could have a seat. None of us will ever go back again after being treated rudely over & over by Geno. What a disappointment!

0aeE1yk5-I-FXckP_IB7KA.text: I was here for spring training and the atmosphere was absolutely unreal. DJ playing music, line out the door. Clearly a happening place.  I got the cornbread hash and my gf got one of the scrambles. Both absolutely delicious. Plus, who doesn't love a make your own Bloody Mary Bar?  Also orders the cereal shooter flight. I was originally bummed that they only cane in flights, since I wasn't sure I'd like the fruity pebble or cinnamon toast shooters. But they were all insanely delicious!!!

vjqEhlaupCzu4QS1y0HPLQ.text: Let me start by saying how great the customer service here was ! From the time we sat down at the bar they were so nice and accommodating! They found out we were from Texas and they told us all the unique places to see, eat and do in Sedona! They recommended some great food at their restaurant and we were impressed ! We ordered the classic French toast, it was so soft and fluffy. It had the perfect amount of powdered sugar and warm syrup that is very important lol. The potatoes were excellent and the bacon was everything. The highlight was the mimosa flights. For 16 bucks we were definitely tipsy. This is my first time having such unique mimosas. The flight includes a strawberry, kiwi, blueberry and orange mimosas. The restaurant was so cute inside as well a must try !!

9oiMAtlKDCfP5TCUzk_wIg.text: Got here during prime time on a Saturday morning at 10:15 and faced a 20-30 minute wait.  They have a refreshing orange water outside for patrons waiting, benches with partial shade and misters that helped offset the warmth.  We got seated in about 20 minutes. The place has a DJ on the weekends and the music is pumping which makes it feel like you just rolled out of the club into daylight and you're definitely ready for a Bloody Mary and some skillets, egg benedict or waffles, which are all available!!  I had an AH MAZING Carnitas hash skillet which I could barely eat half of. It was amazingly delicious!   I attached a photo which is all that's needed to describe it! The coffe came in a carafe, was unlimited and served in big cozy mugs.  I can't wait to come back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas hash skillet. I asked for a box immediately!

pZr6TXz-iLhxJ0Buf7rezg.text: Great place for brunch. Fun atmosphere with DJ present lighting up the restaurant. Started with the original bloody Mary. A little too overwhelmed at the make your own bar. Next time for sure though. The original was delicious though. The mix was great with the perfect amount of spice. The sweet corn Benedict was amazing and my husband had the poutine scramble which was great and even better with a smattering of Cholula. The service was great  the restaurant was fun and the food excellent. We will definitely be back.

yJi76hsrL-8plIcu_eoiWw.text: Food was amazing.  Bloody Mary Bar- very elegant  Music was nice Mimosa's flights  Menu is well thought out, and did I already say flavors hitting all cylinders. #AZFoodie #F&BGuy #HospitalityWife

HfX5y3q3DsiK2jli-6Bc1Q.text: Such a clean friendly place with excellent food in Gainey village. Large portions and the nicest waiter Lenny. Split your order unless you are starving or have a cooler with you. The avocado hash toastwas so delicious. The bread is great and fluffy and thick and the meat is tender. The bacon was perfect along with the egg on top. The bacon jam completed the dish into perfection. Service was great and attentive. The ice tea was strong and good just the way I like it. I cannot wait to try the lemon ricotta pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado hash toast amazing! This is one order that we split

mkLXLOJurvTMDeVlND1M_w.text: Just go to Hash Kitchen. If the build your own Bloody Mary bar doesn't get you in the door, go for the INCREDIBLE food! My mom and I had brunch yesterday and our meal was so good, and the vibe of the restaurant was so fun, it left me yearning to go back soon!   Ambiance: -The decor is bright and fresh, and they even have a disco ball hanging above the live DJ booth  -I don't mind it much, but the music is pretty loud. You'll have to strain a bit to carry a conversation, but it keeps you from hearing all the conversations around you so that's a plus in my book -The dining area lends very well to documenting your cute brunch for instagram or other social media platforms. Even the mugs are cute!  -There is outdoor seating, and they have a dog friendly patio!  Of course, the Food: -Their drip coffee is actually excellent and I love that they leave the pot with you so you don't have to ask for refills every time, and the coffee mugs are HUGE! Little things like that provide a more welcoming environment and I appreciate that -The Avocado Toast: AMAZING! Thick cut brioche, avocado, pulled pork, crispy bacon, and so many yummy crunchy toppings!! The portion was HUGE and I couldn't even finish one toast before I was stuffed! Such a great value for the price, and the flavors build so well!  -Christina's Tamale Cakes: My mom's favorite dish on the menu! She was raving about it as soon as we opened our menus and not even 2 minutes later, our waiter came over and recommended the tamale cakes which are like an eggs Benedict but with a Mexican flair. Obviously this is a popular menu item, and rightfully so! The texture, the flavors, are all spot on! This is a must order!  Service: -For the life of me I can't remember our server's name, but he was excellent! Very attentive, always greeted us with a smile, and took care of any requests we had in a timely manner. For how busy the dining room was when we arrived, he handled everything extremely well, and we felt well cared for.  -I forgot to mention my 5% off coupon for checking in on yelp during our meal, and the server had to revise the check for us, but he was so kind and accommodating about it!   Overall, our meal at Hash Kitchen was incredible and we can't wait for our next brunch here!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado toast

wf7cdW8cPo8K2B423tfAQQ.text: We had high hopes and were excited to try a new brunch place for our anniversary. It's a beautiful, clean place. The service was good and everyone was very friendly. The low score was for the food. I ordered a frittata. The eggs were so over cooked it was rubbery and the bottom was DARK brown, as in burnt. The potatoes tasted like when you try to re-heat French fries.  My husband ordered the corned beef hash after all,  the place is called "Hash" Kitchen.  I would hate to think it was canned(?) but it was mushy and didn't appear to have been put on a grill at all....rather just mushy and warm.  The Bloody Mary bar is a thumbs up! I wish could give a higher rating, but w/ both our orders being so disappointing I can't.....

DpJ08O9cTEUAuNSzgfsdlA.text: Such a wonderful brunch place!  I wanted a good mimosa and this place was recommended.  They did not disappoint!!  I got the mimosa flight and what a great assortment.  I went on a Wednesday morning so it was not super crowded.  The waitstaff was very friendly and very attentive.  The vegetable scrambler was also delicious.  I am excited to go back and try something else off of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegetable scrambler

AvAJn8XFN0Yt5_EFIwLSMA.text: This was the second time I have visited this location. Once last January on a Sunday morning for brunch and then during the week (Thursday morning) for brunch. When we visited in January of 2018, it was very busy and we waited for a great meal. This time we visited on a Thursday, they were also very busy but there was no wait. We were quickly seated in the bar area. My daughter and I shared three things: a Mimosa flight, a carnitas hash, and ricotta lemon pancakes.   So, to begin, the Mimosa flight had four different mimosas-classic, kiwi, blueberry, and strawberry. All were good. The flights have a generous serving and I am sure if I drank the whole flight I would have been tipsy.   The carnitas skillet was good. There was a sufficient amount of meat in the skillet and the potatoes were cooked well---not overdone as sometimes happens with hash when you order out. My only complaint about the skillet was the eggs were ordered over easy and they were closer to over well. When I broke the yolk, there was very little creamy yolk. The top of the skillet was covered with freshly fried onion strings. The lemon ricotta pancakes were light and fluffy and very good.   When we ordered the mimosa flight, the server checked my daughter's ID and saw she had turned 21 three days earlier so she brought her a birthday dessert (not that dessert was necessary after all we had eaten). What came out was a cannoli donut--it was amazing--warm dough filled with traditional cannoli cream and dusted with powdered sugar. It is listed on the menu as a starter. Would recommend.   The menu here is creative and there are a lot of different choices. Even picky eaters could find something to enjoy. Will be back when we are in this neck of woods.

CQZeWpCdE-nNNt53id_jNw.text: Wow! For such a non-foodie city, Hash definitely came as a surprise to me. I came here with a group of 8 for brunch over a bachelorette weekend and this was a perfect addition to the weekend. We had a bit of a wait since they don't take reservations ahead of time but the DJ and bloody mary bar really made the wait seem like nothing. The ambiance of the place was fantastic. If you are in the area and have the time - I highly recommend this place.   The portions are huge and the music is loud but both of those were a plus for me.

B4cTEMTiTdMtBl-E9ib2Gw.text: If you need a hearty wake up in the AM/early PM, head to Hash Kitchen- it's definitely a brunch party! I let a friend visiting AZ pick a spot for us after giving her a few options including HK and super glad she did! It's been on my "to eat" Yelp list for awhile. We arrived mid-morning in hopes there wouldn't be a long way... in fact there was no wait for us at all shockingly! The hostess was killing it with her dance moves to the music their Sunday DJ was pumping and paused momentarily to greet us and escort us to our two-top. #hashhashbaby  Music, cold brew coffee and hot food are just what we needed. Oh and mimosas! Get the mimosa flight! We split it (without asking for particular flavors) and I could've had an entire one to myself, but we were responsible. The cold brew coffee had a nice perk and wasn't burnt tasting like a particular national coffee I frequent. If I liked drinking liquid tomato and booze, I would've hit up their massive Bloody Mary bar. Their sides for it are killer, enough for a meal in of itself!    We took forever to decide what to order to actually eat because all of the HK Hashes sound appetizing. I went with the Carnitas as our waitress told me to (#noragrats). Couldn't finish it because it's so much food! My friend ordered another massive plate that she too could not finish. Glad we could chit-chat and enjoy together the Sunday vibes of Hash Kitchen.

GebxoSWHFoRd64E-1l-NXQ.text: Loud ambiance. Friendly staff. Perfect size menu to chose from. Got to try the hash dishes. I had huevos rancheros and my boyfriend had the carnitas. Carnitas were better. Meat was yummy  Ask for a side of whip cream. We also tried the mimosa flight. It was decent. Nothing crazy. The cocktail bar is where it's at.

(Skip the pickled pineapple that one is not so tasty) but all the rest is to die for!   Coconut almond French toast is massive - two huge cuts of bread- 3 people could easily share this, seriously huge!   Carmel nonfat latte- keep me coming!
