m--K99o_EnwXBtshFgq39w.text: Everything on the menu looked awesome. I ended up getting the avocado toast and was sadly disappointed. The portions are HUGE but there was a pathetic amount of avocado for it to even be called avocado toast. It was more of a thin spread with a bunch of other stuff on top. The bread is unnecessarily thick. And it is served on a board that is basically the exact size of Your meal making it IMPOSSIBLE to neatly eat

OZrNO1Qm6LsP20ZN5ZwNjA.text: Our party was 7 adults and 2 children and everyone's meal was delicious!! The meals are big though so we all had leftovers to take home. Service was great too. We arrived at 7:30am on a Sunday with plenty of open seating available, but by 8:30am, most of the tables inside were filled. The next time we're in Scottsdale, we'll definitely eat there again.

sBfiSE1iKfS5FEHrOHVtsA.text: Our first time here: busy Sunday morning, crowds of people waiting to get in. Luckily we were seated right away on their patio. Outdoor seating is a must if you don't want to be stuck inside listening to their loud DJ blasting music.. Server was friendly but annoyed. Didn't have the patience for us newcomers who didn't know the menu.   We ordered 2 entries and a gluten free waffle. When they brought out the entrees, they gave us the wrong one at first and fixed their mistake within minutes..  Huevos rancheros hash was good, balanced flavors and the cilantro seared steak was tender.  Sage fried chicken hash was greasy, flavorless, and had too much leeks.  Gluten free waffle was delicious, best part of the meal. I would come back to eat it again.   Side Note:  * The biscuits are great, worth the extra calories! Moist, buttery goodness. * The ladies that work up in the front are kind and energetic. They did a good job keeping up with the rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten free waffle with berries! Great!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros Hash and the waffle in the back.

qKkKTfGfwV9_9uTTseRvew.text: Great food! Great atmosphere! The best bloody mary bar! Ask for Sasha to be your server, she is bubbly and fabulous!

mVj8oTMnv9I2_yrSyFNjYQ.text: Hash kitchen was AMAZING!!!!!!  my first time to Scottsdale and won't be my last...  so I can come here!!! They're cocktails are a thing of BEAUTY!  Jessica was AMAZING! Thank you!!!!

IvaVjcNMT2IG30iYnm18HA.text: This was my first time being in Arizona so of course i didn't know where to find the good foods. So I did want any real foodie would do and fired up my yelp. That's how I fell happily into Hash Kitchen. As soon as i walked in my excitement started to grow even more than it did when reading the great yelp reviews. The delicious breakfast smells started to hit my nose and i knew i had arrived. I hurried to my table and order the Herb Fried Chicken and Waffle. Everything about that dish was good the chicken was fried to perfection while remaining juicy also the their maple syrup reduction really brought everything together. It was a perfect mix of savory and sweet. The next time i find myself in Arizona i will definitely hit Hash Kitchen again.

TmP1ZF4dCn0d0aovzElE9w.text: The hostess hospitality is quite possibly some of the best I have ever seen.  Like something out of a 1960s high class Sinatra lounge.  What a great way to be greeted and welcomed before a meal.  That's five stars by itself.    I find the cuisine here to be on point.  Never any issue with substitutions or side orders and the like.  Wait staff is always sympathetic to dietary preferences and I have much appreciation for that.  Busy mornings and the service is still quite good, quick and never rushed.

jwLK5KXLgmMvvxsN1WtYXA.text: Went with a group of friends for the first time and had an absolute blast! There was a DJ booth and Bloody Mary bar to keep us entertained while we waited to be seated. Service was great and the workers all seemed to enjoy working there. Only thing that wasn't so great was the hour wait but that was to be expected when we didn't have reservations on a Saturday morning for brunch. Overall great time and great food/ drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Saturday morning DJ booth
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa flights

DM41aKYT6UxycE7hbohRdw.text: I loved it! I got the cereal shooters, strawberry mimosa & hash! I would 10/10 recommend it to anyone looking for a fun, brunch spot. Loved all the wall work too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wVKCtJud9YakHvnI8I_pMQ.text: So I missed out on the Arizona Breakfast Week and had seen the reviews and really had been wanting to come here, yet I wanted to make it more of a spontaneous place to grab food after a long bike ride.  Well we shelved the training ride and came to the Hash Kitchen.  Why else would you come here but to have Hash at the Hash Kitchen.  Ordered two coffees and went from there, there's too many things on this menu that I would find extraordinarily divine.  It's really too bad I'm a man with but one stomach.  I found it hard deciding which Hash to go for but settled on the Rancheros Hash.  This isn't your normal Huevos Rancheros with some papas added in.  Oh no.  So let's break it down from the bottom to the top: Papas, Tortilla, Fried Eggs, Black Beans, Carne Asada, Chile Suace, and Cotija...if that doesn't knock you out I don't know what does.  My girlfriend ordered the Tomaso's Italian Sausange Frittata and it was perfect.  Yum.  Something was off though, I'm not sure, but it would push this over the top.  I shall investigate and re-assess.  Or maybe it was the 2.75 coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros Skillet
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frittata
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oi47kQhao9xpTW-MRx6mhw.text: Fantastic breakfast and wonderful Bloody Mary bar. Really fun place for brunch and they even have a dj on the weekends. Fun environment, great service. I have gone back many times !

1C7sgmLtEBoEpyOIKMvRgA.text: Visiting from out of town and came here based off of yelp reviews....TOTALLY didn't disappoint!!! Food was great....Bloody Mary's were AMAZING, and the service was fantastic. Lona was AWESOME!! Highly recommend this place for breakfast/brunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EWlZp8_wJFIQxh9F9ieDmw.text: I've been wanting to try Hash Kitchen for SO long, so as soon as we had a free weekend morning to go, we tried it out! The restaurant itself is in a nice location and very pretty. I love the sayings they have written on the wall and the patio is awesome! We got a great table (and were seated right away on a Sunday morning, even though they were pretty busy!) that was right on the edge of the patio, so we still got the sun but it was a little bit cooler.   A huge part of why I wanted to come to Hash Kitchen was for the mimosa flights, but the reason I'll go back is for the waffles :) I just got the classic waffle, but it was amazing! Perfectly filling and sweet and buttery and delicious. The best I've had in a long time for sure. The mimosa flight was tasty too, and you get very good-sized glasses. Today the flight was original, guava, strawberry and mango - normally I don't even like mango that much, but it was definitely my favorite! I'd highly recommend it.   My boyfriend did a make-your-own scramble and had it with cheese, zucchini and black beans and he really enjoyed it as well. It comes with a great biscuit too. We also each had the HK potatoes on the side, which were nothing special, but good! You also get a lot of them considering they're a reasonably priced side. He also got a Bloody Mary (just the classic) and said it was the best he'd had in a while!   I think next time we come we'll skip the drinks because it makes for an expensive breakfast, but I can't wait to go back for the waffle :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic Waffle with a mimosa flight - mango, original, strawberry and guava :)

mMqoUUjHvVcVvc6yn85SkQ.text: We went on a WED morning and it was packed. We were seated right away and a the service was excellent! On the other hand the food is just average.I had Huevos Rancheros Hash ($16) which was just ok - the meat was tough with no flavor but there were plenty of crispy hash potatoes and my partner had the Avocado Toast ($15) which is basically and large brioche and very little of anything else!

BBruhfUzkbEuJMNFwrwBsw.text: Corned beef hash is my favorite breakfast dish here. They also have good variety of alcoholic drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iSsL78TP7ubzVhO-yW03RA.text: Here for brunch the day after xmas! and had an amazing time, wait was short and the area around was nice to walk around! ordered the fried chicken benni and the salmon and fried chicken sandwich, all were awesome!!  Lona was our waitress and she took great care of us! fast service, great recommendations, and super friendly!! will definitely be back next i'm in phoenix!!

ztN_tfO-Wtzdz4w5LtAudA.text: Hands down one of the best places for brunch!!! Food is amazing. Drinks are amazing. Staff is amazing.

pzTXEWtfbVHApub7V_Lo-Q.text: The food was so good and the service was amazing . Matthew was so pleasant and patient . When we come back to Scottsdale , this will be our first stop !

9r5AGEp1D0GmgESLTF-X9w.text: It's official, Hash Kitchen is my favorite brunch spot!  I've visited both locations and the service is stellar, the food is delicious, the drinks are heavenly, the DJ played some jams that kept us moving or talking, the vibe is insane!  A damn good time for sure!  This was second time visiting with a large group.  The staff was some accommodating both visits and very attentive to the entire group.  We never had to ask for everything.  Either the server or management were so on it with drink refills, ketchup request, jam request, anything!  They were awesome.  I can't remember our server name (a really tall, nice, soft spoken guy) but Amy and Bonnie were exceptional.  Bonnie is a hoot!  She's a really good time ... you can tell by the pictures.   I can't remember if the other location features a Bloody Mary Bar but this one does for sure.  I don't drink Bloody Mary's but my goodness they were soooo many toppings and fixings for your Bloody Mary.  I noticed bacon strips, meatballs or sausages (Not sure), celery, carrots, cucumbers, fruit, so many things.  The fact that there were so many fixings for your Bloody Mary made me want to try it for the heck of it but I chickened out.  Next time maybe.  I really like the "unknown" variety of mimosas.  I'm saying unknown because you have no idea of what kind of mimosa will be featured for the day.  This past Sunday it was the classic, kiwi, blueberry and mango.  Blueberry and Mango were our favorites.  On my last visit, it was the classic, pomegranate, guava, and mango.  So, I'm sure each visit you'll get to try something new.   It was 10 of us in my party.  We ordered a variety of dishes.  The Carnita Hash dish came highly recommended.  4 of the 10 ordered and LOVED it.  We also ordered the Blackened Shrimp Hash (looks and taste delicious), the Corned Beef Hash (a classic and my personal favorite), Veggie Scramble, Waffles, and Breakfast Cannoli (my goodness ... so damn good).  Everything, everything was tasty.   Our reservations were for 10:30am.  I got there around 10:15 and I heard the wait was about 30 mins or so I would highly recommend reservations if possible.  We'll give it a few Sundays but we're definitely heading back to Hash Kitchen VERY soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Such a damn good time!!

umpdcdLwiFa7qR--JZvqJQ.text: This was that BEST breakfast I've had in a long time! So DELICIOUS. I was out of town visiting Arizona for the first time and I'll definitely be back. I met our waitor Derek at the Sicilian Butcher, an amazing restaurant I went to the night before. He suggested that I check out The Hash and I'm so glad I did.  Service was so prompt and the manager even greeted us at the table. I ordered a half order of the lemon ricotta pancakes and Cristina's Tamale Cakes, an eggs Benedict on a sweet corn cake with green chile and pork. My mother ordered the chicken and waffles.   The pancakes were light and fluffy with the perfect amount if citrus and sweetness from the mascarpone. You don't even need the syrup. I want to give Christina the biggest hug because that was the best eggs Benedict I've ever had in my life. Omg! This place is so awesome and I can't wait to visit in the future.

mPxE2DY4AfxhuO9a6OemDw.text: Highly suggest bringing your whole crew here :) Be sure to try the beef hash, and create your own juicy Bloody Mary.

FxsK_V_3BDvuERtJQQG_Jg.text: Really good place to bike to for a Sunday morning breakfast.  Great staff , wonderful food. I had the americano scramble and my guy had the machaca hash . Wow that beef was amazing.  We will be back

oPWXPf03L6S9ijrb8PsaFg.text: Great breakfast... huge coffee cups (which are awesome)... but the place had a strange smell when we walked in.  Very odd.   Anyway, chicken and waffles were a hit, corned beef hash was good.

s1m7YdZc22-QYHfRyKweOQ.text: Not sure what the big brouhaha is about this place....I've been x 3 and felt it average, at best.  The last time there waitstaff acted as if she could not wait for us to exit so she could cash out or whatever she needed to do at end of shift.   My sandwich was huge and fell apart before I could take a bit--modify servings and pricing....not a fan but would give another chance--maybe ; -)

odF1AWx3O-r1eSywa4BxIw.text: I highly recommend stopping for some breakfast classics or some new favorites! The Boring Benedict was fantastic and so was the Huevos Rancheros Hash. Definitely coming back!

CbwD3_H43lqI2IA8ztrYxQ.text: Loved, loved The Hash Kitchen!!! This review is a bit late but I just had to review for this amazing brunch spot.  I was out in Scottsdale in November for my friend's bachelorette party and was recommended this place by a friend.  The reviews also made me want to come here.  So on Sunday we headed over & surprisingly didn't have a long wait!  We were told over an hour but it ended up only being 30 mins or less.  Great service!!  Bonnie was such a great hostess making sure everyone was having a great time.  Our waiter was also super nice.  We all ordered mimosas and then realized let's switch it to a sampler since we ordered different flavors.  I found our waiter & he had already done that for us.  Talk about customer service!   The Bloody Mary bar looked amazing too.  It's actually a bar with someone behind the counter giving you your preferred choice of alcohol.  Then you walk around the bar and add your toppings.  A couple of us ended up getting one to share & it was tasty.  Although having a bartender make the drink always tastes better!   I can't remember what I ordered but it was delicious!  We had the booth seat near the DJ and I loved his cap; it said #Hash !! Although I expected more of a party style place it was still a great experience. Bonnie was definitely entertaining & friendly!

972lz4WkSypHbpkaDMvvGA.text: Just ate brunch here, Lona was such a great server! She was hilarious and made our day!!! I love the patio and the music. Enjoyed the Bloody Mary bar a little too much ;) hehehe

buTNKyVBVRgBdLyPy6JspQ.text: Italian family owned and operated, each location has lovely Italian women seating, managing and making sure everything is going smoothly and everyone is having a great time.  This kitchen is one of my favorite "go to" restaurants when I'm craving great affordable food with a nice atmosphere.   Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bloody Mary bar makes us happy!

ka_8peAFcx8Kwzck2PRPZw.text: This restaurant is very UNREMARKABLE. The food was good but not memorable. Maybe it's just me. I hate to diss a place for just being average-good. Give it a try

OSYcJjhlDm9RM5kwycMgIQ.text: Atmosphere was nice. Food was average, first time there.  Not sure I would go back .  Bloody Bar looked amazing,

-c_KfTcprrdDm1NZz1dO-g.text: Service was not great - 2 of the 4 meals were good, the other 2 average. Seems like the place is trying too hard to be a daytime club!!

7_Dk7MrjHm1nKaowbp544Q.text: Came here for my bachelorette brunch last Friday and it was really fun! The only complaints I have are that it's quite pricey and the Bloody Mary bar is basically a one-time refill kinda deal. They warn you about this when you go up there so it's not a surprise in that sense, but I've been to other build-your-own Bloody Mary bars that let you refill your drink with toppings as often as you like so this stood out to me.  As for my own order, I had the sweet potato-lump crab hash. It was very flavorful and light, so I didn't feel too full after I finished it. I also had the mimosa flight, which was delicious! I loved the guava the most and really liked how they put a slice of strawberry on the rim of the glass of strawberry mimosa, same thing for orange.   The service was fast, efficient, and our waiter was friendly. They take reservations which is a plus since our group was quite big (8). Overall, it's a fun place for a nice brunch (:

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mhNo9bMR0bpm9SbJu3v17Q.text: Best Bloody Mary bar I've ever seen! They had everything you could possibly want, including toasted raviolis and meatballs! The cannoli donuts were delicious! The dog friendly patio was awesome for the beautiful spring weather.

0qGhd74522jStSkoZtCwJw.text: My kiddo surprised me on Mother's Day with brunch here and what a surprise. It was jam packed up in here, up in here. We did have to wait an hour after our reservation time because of it. But I hit up the Bloody Mary bar and let me say I was giggling like a school girl who got her first makeover! Yummm  Then there was Ms. B... onnie. Hostess with the damn mostest! Honteyyyyy childddd. She is freaking AWESOME! She was dancing around and greeting folks. I was like heyyyy now get it girrrl. She had me cracking up. I wanna be like you when I grow up. Such a beautiful soul!   Ok on to the food. I had the French toast, bacon and stole some of my sisters French fries. The rest of my group had omelettes, lump crab something with poached eggs, pancakes and grilled cheese. Everything was delicious and everyone seemed to enjoy what they ordered.I wld def visit again just prob not on a holiday or weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oh Mary Mary how I adored you so...
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So it begannnn...what do I add to this creation?

n533MNDEAk57vcivUnaXuQ.text: You have the try the espresso martini! Holy smokes it was amazing. Be prepared for all alcohol and complete deliciousness! Fantastic service and awesome lighting! Hard to decide on what to eat, everything sounds soooo good! The drink in front of me is a white sangria, made my Weston. He definitely is a delight!! Bonnie was so sweet and helpful, also her whole appearance was so bright and cheerful. Loved the entire experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You have the try the espresso martini! Holy smokes it was amazing.

5bqS4N2GEDAMS7sgby-VWg.text: Went here for #girlsbrunch on a Sunday. Was served by Danielle, who gave us exceptional service! She recommended the Steak burrito and it was excellent. Bloody Mary bar is amazing. Comes with all the toppings plus more. Also got the carnitas hash and the corned beef hash. Incredible :) THANK YOU Hash Kitchen.

1F2oEJuJmoTRW7igyNKlzQ.text: One of my absolute favorite places in Scottsdale to eat breakfast .  Atmosphere is lively , food is so unique and flavorful and the host Bonnie is the absolute best .  The Bloody Marry Bar is a must !!

20fOdzOefPHQHR_XAlySpA.text: Yummy! My friend and I had brunch here and ordered two of their hash dishes. Both were delicious. I ate all of mine and my friend took it to the condo and finished it the next day.   The only criticism, we sat outside not realizing it was a dog friendly patio. Some lady sat close to us with an untrained aggressive large German Shepard that she 'corrected' in a baby voice. This dog was not only aggressive towards the other dogs in the patio but jumped and growled at a number of unsuspecting people who were walking past or trying to get into the restaurant (there was a wall by where she sat so anyone walking down the sidewalk could not see her or the dog). I believe that the staff should've asked this lady and her dog to leave but they didn't. So the whole time we sat there eating, the dog barked and growled, meanwhile the owner was talking to it in baby tones saying it was being silly for barking but not taking any responsibility that it scared several older customers who were trying to get into the restaurant.

UcTKEy5_wmVIn2tQp__Lgg.text: Super cute and very good food. The atmosphere is a bit loud at brunch time in the morning (they have a DJ and it seems a little club-y). It's a fun place to start the morning though the the blue doy Mary bar is amazing. This place would really benefit from adding some vegan options or more healthy choices in general, I had the oatmeal, which wasn't bad, but t was oatmeal. The chicken and waffles and the s'mores French toast looked pretty tasty, too.

8azmJm4mssvLjvZy4U4poA.text: Great place to hang out and have drinks but the food was pretty bland, not very flavorful . Great environment and friendly service .

DMJzLYYD5Np5zOMldWOW4A.text: Breakfast was delicious and the vibe was very welcoming. They have an awesome playlist that wakes you up in the morning! Our server Jen was very sweet too. Def coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QiVmwK3mf_GZ_dp5d5tNJA.text: The service always makes a place that much better! Fabulous food and drinks and of course thank you Lola for making our experience better! We loved your energy and your vibe!

JIsVjoxh4cNgv_oEOYu_Jg.text: Lona is most amazing bar tender. She took such great care of us. She even memorized our birthdays from the first time she asked for ID's so that no one had to ask again the rest of the day. Highly recommend sitting at the bar so you can have her as your bartender! She made sure our food came out extremely fast!

bfm_MppSSBqGJGWvLJMSIA.text: Outstanding! After an extremely unfortunate experience at Flemings Steakhouse, we waited two hours and didn't even get out entrees. We were very frustrated on Easter Sunday trying to find somewhere to eat at the last minute.  I stumbled upon this place perusing Yelp and boy were we pleasantly surprised. The wait was only about five minutes for our table outside, Amy was kind enough to get us a perfect table.  Our waitress, Jeanette, was a doll. Very welcoming and genuine.  My mom ordered a BYOBM and the bartender at the counter, Alesia, was so helpful! She made my mom one of the best Blood Mary's she has ever had.  We ordered the Cannoli donuts for the table, pleasant flavor, a little thick but good. I ordered the chicken and waffles and wow, it was delicious. Great portion and the bacon is mixed in the batter. Next time I would get the chicken on the side, I think it made the waffle a bit soggy but still an amazing flavor. My mom ordered the carnitas hash and her boyfriend shrimp hash and they both loved them.  Overall this was an amazing experience. The day started off on a bad note and ended wonderful. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles! My favorite.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli donuts!
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary bar! Alesia is the best!

cl9HAOkP0RBrRIdHhnS2ew.text: This is a great place! First time coming here and Lona is one of the best servers I've ever had! I highly recommend the mimosas!

IvSSAB-ibRM3LoRDV4739g.text: Hash kitchen was so delicious, we can't wait to go back. Gino was our server and he made some great recommendations including their Bloody Mary bar. They have several options for mixes and vodkas and 40 options of veggies and such to add in! So, of course we had to get some bloody Marys. We also got the cannoli donuts, fried chicken Benedict, and the Mexicana omlet. Everything was so good! I highly recommend for breakfast or brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli donuts and Bloody Mary!

uOXOXIZ0dHKh27d4ldIrHw.text: The best brunch place hands down!!! Lona was our server and she was so sweet! The Bloody Mary bar was so awesome, it was the best one I've ever had!

fdkaFRciAp-xZNmmo7pKfg.text: What a great place. Don't get discourage when you pull in and it looks packed. The staff is super nice and our wait was 20 min shorter than what they told us.   We had chicken and waffles, skillets and best of all the Bloody Mary bar. I had it with their house infused bacon vodka with bacon salt and you get to add all the goods. Tip, put the celery stalk on first and then you can build on that and get more stuff.   Defiantly bringing friends back when they visit.

c5IJ7wG1UIq66ZTkcM0sUg.text: This place never disappoints! Amazing food, cocktails, ambiance & the hostess Bonnie (you'll know when you see her because her outfits are ALWAYS on point ) Highly recommend!!

DZqR6NcH0n8UkvkzW_hWZQ.text: Omg. What a great place to eat. Hash Kitchen is my go-to brunch. I highly recommend their chicken and waffles. It is perfectly balanced (sweet & savory), I myself, like to sub out the fried topping for diced Jalepenos. I find it gives a spicy presence to the savory blend.   I always enjoy the atmosphere and the chalk walls. This place is perfect for dates or just casual eating with your friends. The prices are fair for Scottsdale, and their service is peak.   If you're into bloody mary's this place nails their bloody bar. I highly recommend giving it a shot.

z3Cs1ByhAL44xw6K_J0jVw.text: Wow ,my first day in town and my niece and we drove right over here.  The place has a  creative design and concept . Friendly staff as well . Try the scramblers  they come with homemade biscuits omg!  I've got to work out extra today.  We will be back can't wait to try the mimosa bar next time

ryXerQpKjZg0bJLefbSKUQ.text: It was my second time here and enjoyed it just as much (if not more) as the first time here. A big difference was that my first time here was on a busy sunday morning... It is definitely worth the long wait and I must say the bloody mary bar helps quite a bit!!!! I brought a friend here on monday and she loved it. We enjoyed two bloody mary's, french toast and a breakfast sandwich. Our server was so nice and made us feel very welcomed from the moment we arrived. I'll definitely be back, cannot wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I forgot to take a picture before I started munching on it... But getting the bloody mary bar lets you pick all of the toppings you&#39;d like!

N7PsRPM8DHU0fH7oQZoEgA.text: Excellent ! Love the Bloody Mary bar as well.  The owner lady is super nice and friendly and everyone was great there. The food was top notch and the menu has a lot of variety.

jddLmUr8ub1fKUw58poZwQ.text: Go for the wonderful food and service and try to leave with a beautiful lady (and fail).   Bacon infused vodka in your Bloody Mary? No problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Always nice to meet the person that makes it happen.

end5AMdOjeWwFEgWaXVaTw.text: Great brunch experience - mimosa flights + a Bloody Mary bar for drinks; there's a DJ; service (by our server Lola) was top notch; order their hash!!

q94O0z6q-laucRyMMXOsCw.text: Rockstar breakfast complete w seasoned owner-dancer in a sequin dress and live dj. Healthy veggie scramble, French press coffee, light tasty biscuits and a pretty fruit presentation. Bloody mary bar w over 50 toppings gives adult guests a fun craft. No wonder this place is packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ANVZLEn6WYvgOLL33BZf-g.text: Being from out of town; I saw the high ratings and decided to drive 35 minutes to have breakfast here. I'm so glad I did! The service was exceptional. The ambiance was nice and beautiful, cute blood Mary bar if you like. (Not my kinda thing).  We came on a Friday around 10:30am and were seated immediately. The prices was reasonable all staff was very friendly, will definitely come back. Especially for the lump crab benedict and the chicken and waffles. My gf had the croque Madame and was in love with that. No complaints at all, similarly reminds me of Hash House in SD and Vegas, but the prices is lower and the quantity was gods, they didn't tower the whole plate with too much. Thank you guys, I'll be back next time I'm in AZ!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lump crab Benedict
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Croque Madame

-jUBR36ndjI2WVR5e9DiPw.text: Fun, great food, great service, big portions.  You will not feel cheated when you leave the restaurant.

Ea2B61QW9ifUuJK5OWYXOA.text: I can't believe I waited 45 min for this place. For being a Hash House they should at least master a crispy potato. I could duplicate the potato's I received by taking a frozen bag of Oreida breakfast potatoes and throwing them in the microwave. And then the breakfast lasagna.... yuck! Giant clunky dish with barley warmed mush with noodles. It was pretty terrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The breakfast potato from Hash House...... terrible
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is the Breakfast lasagna....... yuck!

apc45fdigmf9I4Rg4MpwFQ.text: This place is awesome! First off, the Bloody Mary bar is amazing and has everything you can possibly want to garnish your drink! They also have house-infused vodkas...cilantro lime is awesome! We ordered the banana split brioche French toast and the tamale cakes Benedict. Both were amazing but if you only order one thing here get the French toast....the caramelized bananas in the middle...I mean come on. So good

80_IXvjpl09anXXSCQwwgA.text: We are staying at the Hyatt down the road from Hash Kitchen and decided to try it this morning with our kids. It was delicious! The Bloody Mary bar was a fun treat and even without all the olives and bacon, the drink was perfectly seasoned. I had the crab Benedict and my husband had the chilaquiles. Both were flavorful and worth every calorie. The kids devoured their pancakes. The service and hostess were very friendly , so all in all, this was a great dining experience and we would definitely come back here the next time we are in Arizona.

6ga0UGb-WJoGLUQ5rN4ABA.text: We visited Hash Kitchen this week and WOW, we will be making it a regular brunch spot. The food was delicious and so many choices! The staff was superb...Chad, Bonnie and Lona welcomed us and made us feel at home. It's a definite MUST TRY. Can't wait to try the bloody marys!

XBTrWIwM7NmyNOq6zLA0_A.text: We have been visiting from Ohio approximately 5 or 6 times a year for 25 years and always enjoy trying new restaurants. We've eaten at Hash Kitchen several times for brunch and are never disappointed! The breakfast lasagna is awesome! I've tried the flights of mimosas that are different each time and others in our group love the Bloody Mary bar and extensive array of things to add into your drink.

SrZMPc8UcGp5vbOTR23nXQ.text: A fun weekend brunch! I enjoy this as a couple or with friends but not so great with our kids. The music is fun, bloody Mary's are awesome and I appreciate the detail in the drinks. Get there early & have a mimosa while waiting because there is always a line!

EzSSL2qdg3wqujmAhH_DUQ.text: Coming in from out of town and this is a great breakfast and brunch spot. HIGHLY recommend sitting at the bar. Lona was amazing and the vibes were so awesome. People and staff were so friendly and conversational! Will definitely come back next visit!

9IZo2g7SxMjS4jwfUrz1iQ.text: HASH kitchen is literally the BEST place I have EVER had brunch at! All of the employees are so carrying and friendly. I highly highly highly recommend you make it a priority to hit up hash kitchen!!! And if you don't, you're SERIOUSLY missing out!!!! 5 stars isn't even enough

1nzAo0zIhXJE-7-cNmQWEw.text: The variety in breakfast cocktails is impressive. The Bloody Mary bar and rumchata iced coffee are definitely my favorites! Your usual variety of breakfast items but with more creative twists. I've loved everything I have tried so far! Try the croque madam if you're in the mood for an indulgent breakfast! Always good service.

SFNHLEHuaMdVclAgwHCgPQ.text: Came here for my daughter's birthday. Best breakfast in town, it even has a Bloody Mary bar! Jesus was awesome, ask for him every time.

TvRV85ZNsPG62YwplUMGEA.text: Sad to admit we did this--but we actually first went to another high ranking b-fast restaurant in the PHX area. Even sat down. And then one look around, at the decor, the menu, the "bakery case", and we knew we had to plan our escape. Blamed the kid, said something about family issue, and ran. So so happy we tried Hash next.  Whet to begin. Clean. Bright. Modern. Apple Store + brunch spot = their style.  I've seen a Bloody Mary bar before...  But one with fresh raw oysters, pickled mango or bacon infused vodka??  Stop what you are doing--come here now. BTW, came on a Monday morning, but the whole deal was on display just like a weekend. I also ordered corned beef hash and biscuits & gravy.  Hash was excellent, gravy was one of the best, and biscuit was fresh if not just a touch too sweetened for biscuits/gravy delivery system. Probably perfect w butter & honey.  No more reading. You. Here. Now.

IV5PGYR_VLCBpLBhMlKv7A.text: Omg hands down best service, everytime go in and ask for Chris the best most handsome waiter . he's on it. we come.here for him and the amazing food and atmosphere . Chris is the most personable attaintive go getter. love hash thanks chris for introducing it us

EQIdXP6yIr5Tdaa8DXGpIw.text: The Hash Kitchen is awesome.  The food is delicious, the service is outstanding, the Bloody Mary bar is crazy-good!  We stopped here on a whim on Thanksgiving morning as we had arrived via a very early flight from Colorado.  Thank goodness they were open!  We were absolutely delighted with the entire experience.  We would've loved to come back during our visit to AZ, but unfortunately our schedule would not allow it!  These photos of our food just don't do it justice!  Can't wait to come back in a future visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet potato hash with a side of hollandaise sauce and a homemade biscuit with raspberry preserves.  Yum!!!!

SIKbu6EP9WGbu_Yt-39PIw.text: My children and I visit Hash Kitchen on the weekends for breakfast. Most breakfast places in  Scottsdale have a 30+minute wait, but each time we come to Hash Kitchen we are seated immediately. The food is tasty and the service is spectacular. The manager (?) always greets us on our visit and chats with us to make sure everything was to our liking. The food is a bit pricy; breakfast for three including juice and coffee builds a tab of about $50-$60.

B9Ig_xvsw4PGzgXH1hGSJg.text: Interesting place a little too trendy for us had a DJ playing dance tunes at11? A bloody Mary bar and local sourced food.pricey but it is probably par for Scottsdale Arizona.

xFJRUpMbb9QcUzeLAY5dig.text: I've called the Scottsdale Hash Kitchen multiple times and have waited about 5 minutes to even talk to someone after being on hold each time I - not to mention the phone rang for longer than minute before I got placed on hold. I'm now ordering Togo from another restaurant since this one obviously could care less about it's Togo customers

cjXyNOblZbKEN7hS0wiCRg.text: This place is terrible for the wait and the lousy service. It's not a place I would come back to. 20 min wait for table. Currently at 30+ min for food

YcyNENrLKaNW5oKQ1VczEQ.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere! A DJ in the lobby! Bloody bar, w/Slim Jims for condiments and more! Jessie at the bar is great too!

a-uY3v6k1SicrrxH0pB_1g.text: You would think a restaurant that is only open for breakfast and lunch would  be prepared. Not today at Hash Kitchen at Gainey. More than half of the items on the Bloody Mary bar were empty, and the items not refilled. Tacky. One of my friends ordered the flight of mimosas, and was told sorry, we are out of champagne. Unacceptable for a Sunday brunch place. The service was slow, and the food mediocre. French Toast was raw inside, scrambled eggs were non-descript. Our coffee wasn't refilled. All in all, not a great experience. Another Hash Kitchen is coming to my neighborhood at 44th St and Indian School. I hope the manager of the new location has their act more together.

fElg1t9knFktvQZVk2UrKA.text: Walked in to club music with a DJ and turntable. A lively, fun atmosphere. Call me a grouch, but I'm not looking for a ton of fun with my breakfast. I really like the menu and it has everything you want. I got the choose your own frittata, which I haven't seen before. Mine had smoke salmon, spinach, and tomatoes. It was good although when I think lox, I think smoke salmon. Here it is just cooked salmon which is smoked because they own the BBQ place next door. Hashbrowns are just diced potatoes in a cup, they were ordinary. The fruit cup instead of the biscuit cost $2. The clincher, which I have read in other reviews is I couldn't get more coffee. Maybe I should have been dancing,  waving my empty coffee cup.

7aL7Wv_byQXiO3v8Ey_jRQ.text: Yumo!  We came here on a Sunday for brunch.  The wait was only five minutes.  Started off with Hash cocktails, espresso and rum, need I say more?  The husband had a burrito and pancakes and I had the veggie scramble.  Both we good but the Mr. said his burrito was a little dry.  They have a DJ but the music isn't that loud.  If you are hungry and in area try it out.

n33q_pAl7RA0NdWZxeFYqA.text: Had the chance to try this brunch spot for the first time today.  The food was excellent and the atmosphere was equally impressive.  We chose breakfast items from a creative menu.  What set the experience apart was the fantastic service from an attentive waitstaff.  Welcoming and friendly, they go the extra mile.  Anthony at the bar will take care of you!    As a side note, the make your own Bloody Mary bar is not to be missed.  This newer restaurant in Gainey won't disappoint!  I highly recommend The Hash Kitchen.

nQ0NLSjs-Ri6O1KXNn5g0g.text: We came here on a Saturday and had a nice meal. Our server was sort of an ass, but the food was delicious and the Bloody Mary bar a lot of fun. We really liked the DJ spinning house and old school. There is always a wait so just be prepared. I suggest bringing a flask and ordering a Virgin Mary to save some scratch!!

K-a5VL__w777AG5zjZ3JpA.text: first time customer and VERY disappointed after hearing how wonderful the food is. extremely average quality for what is not an inexpensive price tag. service was fine, but the quality of the food was a major let down. have had far better on Singapore Airlines without doubt! the surroundings looked and felt like a hospital cafeteria. quite surprised based on all of the nice things i heard.

KXzzkSjqdJC9dkfYagfisA.text: Bonnie and the rest of the staff were very attentive especially for a party of 12 and the food/drinks were excellent! Definitely coming back!

AA1RxGrqPAs_myrBEFWYjg.text: It was a Saturday and the sun was out. Everything was perfect then the food came out and bammm, it was Sooo good good times with a friend

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MqUo6v0PgaK-98GDyyWE6A.text: Amazing food and even better bloody mary bar. The two woman that helped us were very nice and were  having a great time,

wrN4RZswg_uwFFBoAO1TfQ.text: Must visit Bonnie, peeps. She is the essence of Hash Kitchen! The food is fabulous - bloody mary bar, mimosa flights, live DJ - really can't find much that's comparable.

lStTyMyZ7g4Akl2nN7ZV5A.text: Food is delicious, slightly expensive ($$) but a great atmosphere. Serves alcohol in the AM which is a plus for those looking to booze and brunch (no unlimited mimosas/bloody marys however)!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

a3zd60gfHMJIc6JM35rbwQ.text: Love the different kind of bfast foods. Nothing is worse then the same old eggs, bacon, taters slapped on a plate that you can get anywhere. Went back a 2nd time a couple weeks later. Will be going back to try more

8u6BO2zOElpi7_RVApyQBA.text: What a poor experience!  Overpowering, loud disco music for breakfast!  I could not wait to get out of the place.  Food was good, service was slow.  Certainly not a place to go if there is any expectation of visiting with those with you.  Ugh!

cj-0Gx-T-8UCH4Pd3M35Zw.text: *** Update *** I was contacted by the owner and they wanted to make it right. I think that in itself earns them another star, simply because I am here visiting and don't have the chance to try them again. I'm updating the rating to 3/5. *** Update ***  Again, I'm disappointed by my fellow Yelpers. The Herbed Chicken Benedict, which was highly recommended, can be described by the following: - Crumbling dry biscuit - Chewy, dry chicken breast - Tasteless herbs - Lack of seasonings  The two stars accounted for the following: - Eggs were cooked well - Service was great - French toast was good

VMoaXO1JCwe_D1P2HBH8cQ.text: Great food (seriously is really good). However, our server was a kind of rude. She rushed through the orders and didn't have the patience to explain the items. Also, she answered the questions with just one or two words and never smiled. I'll totally come back if I wouldn't get the same server.

JfYhdr9pBlaciGtLKti50w.text: Can't say enough good things about Bonnie! I hosted my daughters birthday brunch for 12 of her friends and they had the best time! The food is always delicious and fresh. Be prepared to WAIT! It gets busy especially during spring training.  The chillachillas and salmon BLT are sooo good!!

p9y1LPoK2iXVLC00b-r3Ag.text: excellent food and service! steak hash was amazing. drinks were cute and everything we saw looked great. lona was great. highly recommend

GpkUr3DJ906j37mgpUaeKg.text: Hey, Ms. Bonnie!  You are an amazing woman with an exciting, hip restaurant!  The menu has so many delicious options, it was hard to choose:). I had the sweet potato and lump crab hash and my hubby had the breakfast burrito.  You want to talk about somethin' good?!  Everything was delicious and our server was very attentive and professional.  We are visiting from San Diego, but will be back very soon!!!

AI99noECXRxDhB_FJSKuBQ.text: Food was phenomenal. Service was a little slow but it was a busy Sunday morning, and we were given complimentary donuts, which definitely made up for it. The staff was very friendly--Bonnie was a sweetheart. Excellent bloody mary bar. Wonderful music. Great atmosphere. For sure would come again.

Xq1OS03zaFkS3-20HwZLEQ.text: Bonnie. Bonnie. Bonnie. She is Awesome!!!!!! A perfect atmosphere for breakfast .  The food was amazing & the mimosa flight!! Can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mimosa Flight
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb fried chicken&amp;Waffles | Carnitas Hash | Mimosa Flight

2ShKxYR2pD4xd7gM3cGnQA.text: OMG you have to experience this restaurant sooooo much fun, great service, food is off the chain.  The build your own Bloody Mary bar is amazing with so many choices at your finger tips.  A special shout out to Bonnie the hostess at Hash Kitchen you a ball of fire and we will definitely be back and if you haven't tried this place you are missing out!!!

px1f08msDlZJYA05wZeXkQ.text: I love this place on the weekends. It's my favorite. I would NOT come back on a weekday at all! Kaity with the blonde streaks and nose ring was our waitress. We saw her when she took our order (20 mins after we sat down) when she checked on us  (after 15 mins of waiting I had to ask someone for some extra condiments) and when she brought the check. There was even a party of 6 that was seated 15 minutes after us and left 20 before us. I will definitely go back on a weekend, but NEVER on a weekday  UPDATE: I quickly got a lovely response from management addressing my concerns and inviting me back to either location. That's the Hash Kitchen I know and love

H-fdDYjUFjwCf6uQLOULzQ.text: I regularly come here . The food is always good. And the menu is awesome . It has something for everyone . For the hacklers who complain about the wait on the weekend the food it's well worth it . You will thank me later . Kaity is one of my favorite , she knows what I get every time and when I walk through the door she already knows what I'm drinking , it's ready at my table and remembers what I get meticulously. I'm a picky eater and I've never had anyone remember my order. She's very easy to talk to and makes you feel at home .This example though is to high light they remember their customers . Your not just some Joe coming in regularly and they won't acknowledge it like most of jag off places in Scottsdale . Go! I will say it again you will be happy with the service and food !

mmoTv02PbKsRWZLO2b7Qeg.text: I had brunch here a few weeks ago and was happy I did.  There was not anything out of the ordinary, but it was yummy and I would definitely return.

fRWAreFu-eUuDfk4NR6iDg.text: We visited this restaurant from out of town after some research on Yelp and loved it! They are known for their Bloody Mary bar and that alone was pretty cool- so many options and infused vodka choices as your base!  My family got the below dishes and each were delish and unique (after much deliberation over the fun menu). Our favorites were the fried chicken Benedict, fried chicken hash and the biscuits and gravy.  Our waiter Patrick was very friendly and attentive also!   Visit this place next time your in town and it won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Biscuit and Gravy
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried Chicken Hash

hqeAtQKQzu2yy9SYBk--mg.text: This was a great brunch on a quick trip house hunting. I really enjoyed my hash. Unique flavors and cool restaurant. Weird thing - they kept turning up the music and it was deafening loud. For 10:30 in the morning I thought it was a little much!

hHz2fbB7tSPvahIG0Dxing.text: I've only eaten at Hash Kitchen twice, but both times have been very enjoyable. I enjoyed their flight of mimosas as well as their unique Bloody Mary's. I recommend stopping in when you're hungry and when you're recovering from a hangover! Z

uPsWrU7zOu5KD7wAcUAV6Q.text: The food was amazing.  They have a BUILD YOUR OWN BLOODY MARY BAR!!! it was epic you could have a meal just from all the toppings.  I had the cristina's tamales cakes.  It had green chilli pork and the cakes were delightfully sweet to complement the green chilli sauce.  It was really noisy and the music was loud.  But I say right next to the DJ.  It was packed on mothers day of course.  Took 5 minutes to get a seat at the bar.  And no kidding 5 minutes for my food to come.  As soon as I sat down after making my bloody Mary the hot plate was placed in front of me almost immediately after that.  Very impressed.  I'll be back when it's now a holiday.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cristina&#39;s tamales cakes.  Green chilli pork
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Christian&#39;s tamale cakes eggs Benedict.  Green chilli pork

MeCnp4TvnZL13stL3IidRA.text: We went early (8 am) on a Sunday and sat right away.  The Bloody Mary bar looked awesome, tons of fixings to choose from.  They also had some funky looking cereal cocktails and a mimosa tasting.  All looked good.  The menu is big, lots of awesome choices. The cannoli doughnuts looked delicious, but probably should be shared by a lot of people.  I had the corncake "Benedict" a great combination of the sweet corn, spicy sauce, meat and eggs.  We also ordered the Sicilian hash.  Sausage mixed in with the potatoes and veggies for the hash, too with Italian sausage links and eggs.  Very tasty.    Portions were good sized, not too large and the service was great.  Coffee and tea served in large mugs was a great touch.

EYFskHpU5Ejgk0dlMwBLOw.text: Never waiting too long, great service, and the waitstaff is usually just so fun and outgoing. Thanks for making breakfast & brunch so enjoyable!

wWbwxB01nDVDEuCEp3Ll0A.text: Always my favorite brunch place when I'm in town! The mimosas are soo good and the best bloody Mary bar ever. The staff is friendly and the food awesome.

YV2CwrHSAQZYYMogQRa5uw.text: Had a nice brunch here on a weekday. The best part was the cheap mimosas! The service was great too, really attentive but not annoying.   I had the Huevos Ranchero Hash. I was actually really excited for this dish, it sounded kind of unique and tasty. But it was pretty plain actually, I wouldn't order it again. Really the biggest missing piece her was some sort of sauce or cream, even sour cream would've made a difference. It was just super dry, which made it hard to enjoy the dish.   Overall this was a cute space, with a nice deck. I would maybe go back and order something else that explicitly includes sauce!

ZI_R7quNQhfsadMs-q-emw.text: Cool spot and great food.  The hash version of avacado toast with green chili hollandaise was legittt and our server Lona was awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ilfcdTxV-jutDHIS5DTUbw.text: Excellent breakfast and service.... the Lemon & Ricotta pancakes were mouth watering. Dominic and Gabe provided the best service. We had 10 people and never felt neglected.   I highly recommend

-KNLj8k9nsBg70mAcivS3w.text: Loved the banana split brioche french toast! Divine. The smores pancakes were a little too sweet for us but otherwise delicious. Went on a weekday to avoid a crowd.

PvfhitknMu7x1i5i059ErA.text: Always a good pick. I am obsessed with the French toast. It's shareable for sure. The Bloody Mary bar is fun but for a high extra cost but you get a lot. If you like it spicy I would say start at a 7 to get any spice. The only complaint is high prices.

wlE2ZG6WJKaaX9rr5k2baQ.text: Hash kitchen has a youthful vibe. They have an on-site DJ, blasting music.  We did not find this a pleasant environment.  The menu looks tremendous, but unfortunately did not meet expectations. The corned beef hash was dry: the menu described it as over crispy hash brown potatoes. But the potatoes were neither crispy nor hash browned. Instead, the potatoes were cubed, and there was too much potato in proportion to the corned beef, resulting in a dry dish.   Our son had the banana split French toast, which he enjoyed. The French toast was tasty, but was delivered with an entire ice cream cone full of butter, which our son found offputting.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. DJ, interior photo

p7yUKncLBJcCfGqAOpmrqw.text: Great ambiance, they have a do playing happy tunes. reasonable prices for a lot of amazing food I wish we had this restaurant in California. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is: my amazing avocado toast was too dry. The eggs were not runny and I had to ask for extra 2 hollandaise sauces and the Bellinis were extremely sweet  I do highly recommended it never the less

R-gh7XKz-iT0ZT51MYpONQ.text: We had an amazing breakfast at Hash Kitchen! Our lovely server Briana made us feel welcome, gave us great advice about the menu, and took terrific care of us! The hash, Benedict, and oatmeal meals we ordered were yummy...mimosa flights were refreshing and the coffee never stopped flowing. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5sSdASAZp38AWdmjpnxHEQ.text: I came here after one of my friends recommended this place as a good brunch restaurant. They also sold me on their bloody marys that are customizable and amazing open faced sandwiches.  I had the open faced avocado BLT, it was to die for. I'm so glad that I got it. The toast was thick, the pulled pork was plenty and the fried potatoes that were onion gave it a nice touch. My friends got the drink sampler and they looked so cute. Definitely a must If you want to take nice foodie pics. I came on St Patrick's day and I'm not joking when I'm saying it was packed. Many people had the same idea as us that day. We waited for about 1hr 45min to get our table. We wished that they took reservations. There was outside seating as well as indoor seating. It wasn't easy to have a conversation with my friends due to the fact that the DJ was playing some loud music. I'm not sure if that is a normal occurrence but keep this in mind if you want to have a meetup with a new friend you haven't seen in awhile   All in all, I'll definitely come back to try more of their menu (preferably not on a holiday).

plobon9hDE28goGOYF94kw.text: Cute little hidden gem. Great food and great service. Kid friendly. I ordered the skirt steak and eggs...I'd do it again. Try!

f7RRhhjsRqDWAnqRbt6c6A.text: Kinda wish I could do 3.5 stars. I stopped by for breakfast a few weeks ago and thought it was so pretty inside, food was excellent! So Saturday I went back with my husband and OMG/LOL it was crazy! It was like a nightclub in there! The hip hop was pounding loudly, it was packed with people trying to talk over the music. LOL Honestly, it was like a club in Old Town on a Saturday night!  Luckily there was a table open on the patio and we were able to enjoy their terrific food and service. Hey, we're True Arizonians, eating alfresco at 101 degrees with misters is perfectly comfortable. Way more comfortable than the 'scene' indoors.  I guess that's their thing. It's breakfast... isn't it supposed to be relaxing? lol. Apparantly people like it, it was consistantly packed in there! We'll be going back during the week when there is no D.J. blasting. #oldpeople #youkidsgetoffmylawn #thatsnotmusic

dJdfC6PgeXbFLhJEXGC3NQ.text: Love The Vibe! My food was prepared to perfection. Service was great, the food came out fast considering how crowded they were.  I love the creative menu, something for everyone.  Very hip!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and Eggs

IYULb1XCGI2xRDquIgOWHg.text: Stopped in this mornings and was very impressed! Gino and Lona were amazing and made sure we had a great meal! I highly recommend this place! Mimosas, bloody marys, cannoli donuts... yum!

hzDOA-Y2g5P-b753aNjRHg.text: Loved this locations. The brunch bruschetta board is my absolute favorite. The mimosas can be hit or miss sometimes but otherwise it's a great place to go for brunch.

ANzJOfiikipdG8m0gwHLYA.text: Second time we have been to the Hash Kitchen. This time we started with the Donut Treo. Kinda a bummer. The donuts were not very good. I know, how is that possible. They almost tasted like day old donuts?  But, rebounded back with the awesome Bloody Mary Bar. There is so much stuff at the bar, it could be a meal. And the Bloody Mary was great. I ordered the Carnitas Hash. It was huge with good flavors. It had a lot going on and a lot of the flavor were lost in the pile of food. My wife ordered the Breakfast Sandwich. Again, it was huge with good flavors. This is a good restaurant with good flavors and huge portions. A perfect place to take the boys to breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huge Breakfast Sandwich.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Carnitas Hash. Very good.
Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome Bloody Mary Bar.

HtuNd7JAqIDKZgza7OJHbA.text: We have gone to Hash kitchen a few times. We have tried a couple of their locations. The food is ok. The place is usually very crowded on the weekends when we go. The music is played so loud you feel like you are at a night club on a Saturday or Sunday morning.  To be honest we have stopped going on the weekends because it's so loud you can't hear anything when you are sitting at the table with your friends and family.

WWV09dVWnjmvTZ7yy7vyKg.text: I had the BEST freaking breakfast experience here this morning. Luckily we got there early (by 9ish) and the place was already hopping. They told us 25 minute wait which seemed reasonable. (It became much more reasonable when I found my way to the build your own badass Bloody Mary bar.) The bartender was super sweet and helpful. She guided us newbies through the drill and gave us tips like getting a celery stalk and using it as a cork board for a gazillion skewers of goodness. This made tasting every single item on the bar a breeze and I didn't need an assistant to carry anything. Who doesn't love gigantic meatballs, olives, pickled asparagus, mango jalapenos, slim jims, clams, cauliflower, onions and green beans in their Bloody Mary??? The shizz was UN.BELIEVABLE!! I'm pretty sure I'll dream about the drinks for the next few weeks, but that's a whole nother story!  Food was off the chain. I got the veggie scramble and it was fabulous. The BF got some coconut banana pancake thing that he inhaled in 2 seconds. My buddy ordered the chilaquiles and loved them.  The final touch that made breakfast so cool was the DJ. He was spinning radical tunes all through the meal. The service was excellent.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out. You can thank me later

lmNdzt7qD1zz8H59S3yDSA.text: Great service from Steph! We love dining here for the experience and delicious brunch. The Bloody Mary bar is insane. We were recommended to order the carnitas hash, perfect choice.

pEE9TMhf2zTn0fbLFrrlRA.text: Great atmosphere and amazing food! Check this place out if you haven't yet. The cannoli doughnuts are on another level of goodness.

sPYljeD4h7vEBrCJ8eAHnQ.text: Hash kitchen is amazing. From the bloody Mary bar to the Fried chicken hash this place can't be beat highly recommended

Lxm7CeuAmBCLnaJTijSL3Q.text: This review is for 2.5 stars.  I really wish the service was better.  Coming to Hash Kitchen, it had everything I could ask for in brunch - mimosa varieties, bloody mary bar, tons of dishes, and dog friendly-patios.  Once we arrived on New Year's Day, and the line was about 20 groups deep at 12:30pm, then we knew were in for a morning.    We finally got seated about 30 minutes later.  Outside as we had requested.  So far so good.  Upon seating, it took 20 minutes and 2 separate times of requesting service just to get our water glasses.  10 minutes later a waiter comes out to serve us.  We get our meal in and we're off.  Solid mimosa flight comes out immediately so we can at least get boozing.  Daily selection of 4 fruits, with the blueberry and kiwi standouts.  30 more minutes pass until our food comes.  I ordered a hash skillet with corned beef and side of sausage.  I had requested sweet potato hash, but apparently our waiter said that the chef 'couldn't find' the sweet potato hash so no go.  Undercooked corned beef hash and overcooked sausage let to a below average meal.  The frittata the person I dined with was hefty and loaded with egg, but not much more than a hungry man breakfast.  Although, the biscuits are a must if you do happen to go to Hash Kitchen after this review.  We finally got our check and left after almost 1:45 meal time.  The best part was that everybody in our section was complaining one after another.  In the entire time we were there, we saw 4 different waiters serve a total of 5 tables outside.  One couple left after a few bites as they were so fed up.  Another table complained at least 4 or 5 times before a waiter finally served them.  And then there was a larger couple of about 15 that waited for the entirety of our meal just to be seated, with almost a dozen tables opened, yet unbussed, inside.  All the while the manager is sitting at the podium, definitely not managing this comedy of errors.  A fiasco of a brunch with just average, hit or miss food.  The drinks were good and the atmosphere of Hash Kitchen was so good coming in, but the service was just so mediocre that it leaves a bad taste in your mouth for any chance of dining in the future.

ArfH9ozITPF0WAOukA8TUQ.text: We stopped in for brunch while on vacation. It's a very lively atmosphere. Lots of great options on the menu with hash dishes of course being the speciality. I had the Herb Fried Chicken Hash which runs around $14 and consists of potato hash / poached eggs / fried leeks / warm maple reduction and a boneless fried chicken breast. I asked that my eggs be scrambled with cheese. It was pretty yummy and honestly I probably could have shared based on the size. My friend let me taste her Corned Beef Hash and I enjoyed it. If you find yourself in the area, it's certainly worth a try. Overall I had a very positive first experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Herb Fried Chicken Hash

QOrNePkuBN75Y_ZJPa9k_A.text: Eaten here before and it was good, today was a disaster. Food was cold, mushy, and not even the correct order, on ALL orders at our table. Waitress was rude and only talked to us I think twice the entire time we were there, not to mention the fact that I saw her go to the table next to us probably 10 times. Will not be back, save your money and time (took FOREVER) and go somewhere else

gxkoJtl7coNX86PTgYWM1g.text: Hash Kitchen is soooooo delicious! On the weekend they have a DJ and the Bloody Mary bar is amazing, , This is not your regular bloody Mary bar it has everything from horseradish to oysters to bacon and every type of condiment in between. If you don't like bloody Mary's they also have mimosa flights which looked amazing. I had the huevos rancheros hash which was served with over medium eggs and Carne Asada! The service was great, food was out fast.

IEpz9-64RGWqM_CjILEEzQ.text: This place has a great Bloody Mary bar and the food is so so for certain things and great for others. The buttermilk biscuits are great and the corned beef hash is yummy. The steak and egg hash was meh.. steak overdone and hardly any seasoning on the potatoes. The service was great and quick.

xPkWerHTWE_UzAJmns5OTw.text: We originally were going to The Breakfast Club, the wait was one and a half hour. So we got onto Yelp and saw this place. Rated super high with over 800 reviews, we left TBC. We were happy to find such a great place! The variety of food makes it hard to choose but you won't go wrong with any dish you get! You have to start with the breakfast bruschetta! You won't regret it! My husband was in heaven when he discovered the Bloody Mary bar  we will definitely be back.

agc0tKRJyzOs5oOvkbLtZw.text: Great brunch place and has the options I need!  I wanted something tasty and GF which has been a bit difficult.  My server Stephanie gave suggestions which I appreciated since the menu can be overwhelming with so many tasty options.  I ended up ordering a frittata with my own options, and it was quite satisfying.  My friend ordered the carnitas hash and raved about it.  Tasty goodness and portions are on the large side so if you're into leftovers, you may have some if you can avoid devouring the whole thing in one seating!

llI8GjBnsj1NapJp3gMobg.text: I have been here twice. This place has really unique breakfast selections, and the food does not disappoint. The atmosphere is fun and the DJ brings upbeat music. I have loved it each time I have gone. 5 Star review for sure

zBEzQYxC5X7O4VF7LdtCaw.text: Unnecessarily pretentious crowd for brunch. Long wait. Music was WAY too loud - too loud to carry a conversation at our table, couldn't hear the waiter clarifying our order. Restroom was filthy. Food was ok.

0eYHqPxPjNJaDoj2G7X3lg.text: This place is amazing. It's not your typical breakfast diner. Even tho the pricing are extremely reasonable, the quality of ingredients, sauces, cocktails, presentation, etc are chef driven. Great value and culinary acumen unlike a typical chain. The shrimp sandwich is great! My hubby loved the banana foster French toast. I hate bananas but that French toast was indeed tasty! The chicken and waffles were amazing. The portions are large so you can share an entree!  The SERVICE was fantastic! Jesus was our server and he did an exceptional job. He exceeding expectations! He handled a party of 4 adults plus a toddler during the Brunch rush like a real professional! When we come back in March, we will be visiting Hash Kitchen again and asking for Jesus!  The bloody Mary bar is super cool too!

_GMrN6_dnizI8mVfk8Zk3g.text: Such a fun Brunch Spot! Great food and the make your own Bloody Marys are fantastic!! Friendly and fast service makes this the perfect place for any occasion!

1vybMhMvQB76_zCitRyodQ.text: A friend of mine is living in Phoenix temporarily and she suggested we try this place. There was a long wait which is apparently pretty standard especially on a Saturday for a party of 6. But we waited and it was worth it.   I went with the lump crab hash was amazing. I usually don't try crab just anywhere as I'm from Maryland and we have some of the best crab ever but I decided to try it here and I'm happy I did. Anywho, the hash comes with sweet potatoes and two eggs any style and is topped with a hollandaise sauce. I loved it!  Also, go for the mimosa flight. You get four nice sized mimosas in different flavors and they're delicious!

oX2s6uJ3HajE8B2OaUZSPQ.text: Would not recommend coming during Saturday or Sunday days as the service isn't up to standard. Food delays were at 30mins, and our frittata came out burnt. They remedied the frittata 10 mins after the fact, and the rest of the food wasn't terrible, but like I said, wouldn't recommend on weekends unless you want a party scene

arCHVm6t78YfdaIakMsAiA.text: I moved to Scottsdale from New York a little over a year ago. Since then, I have been trying new brunch places every weekend. I have to say that Hash Kitchen has been my go-to place when I don't feel like deciding. The service here is always amazing, not to mention Bonnie always comes to my table asking how everything is and complimenting me! She truly is a sweet person. I always order the Boring Bene which is your typical eggs Benedict and I LOVE it. It is my favorite out of all the places I've tried in this area. The atmosphere here is fun and classy. If you like Bloody Mary's, there is a build your own bloody bar. It has everything you could imagine adding to your drink.   With that being said, if you are picking between two places for brunch, THIS is your spot! You'll be sure to love it.

W4E6H4ixkjTwYvjyCvJbjQ.text: We've been looking for a great brunch restaurant with a good Bloody Mary for a while now and I definitely think we've found it!  My husband, our 1 year old son, myself and our best friends with their 2 small children all went there around 11 am on Sunday. The wait was long, but it was expected! The AMAZING Bloody Mary bar definitely makes the wait worth it! Our buzzer went off and they must have forgotten we had the kids because the table they offered us was a high top and we needed high chairs but everyone worked so well to accommodate our party and make it work! Bonnie was so great to make sure the kids were all ready and settled and that we were all comfortable in our new table!  The ambiance was amazing and the d.j on Sunday was so much fun!  That same girlfriend and I just went back for lunch today and the experience was just as great, and the Bloody Mary's were just as good! ;)  Both times we have been there the service was great, the food was better, and Bonnie was there with a smile on her face, dressed to the nines, and making our experience so perfect!  We will definitely be back to our new favorite brunch spot!

CUak_BR7urhNzl1Dm_-rvA.text: I've been here three times and have never been disappointed. I've had the breakfast lasagna and two of the hash dishes. They're always fresh and made-to-order and are perfectly seasoned. The service is fantastic. I'm not much of a bloody mary person but I'll tell you they sure know how to make it appetizing! You literally and take a piece of freshly cooked sausage and put it in your Bloody Mary if that's what you want. Really clean and seems organized. Plenty of parking. It's definitely kind of trendy but welcoming. I can't wait to go back

6sOxERwRf2L95UZzkCWLCA.text: Happy New Year my peeps! Make sure to grab your bestie , your boo and bring in the new year with this gem ... "The Hash Kitchen " I promise it won't disappoint . Mouth watering freshly made food, killer atmosphere, stellar staff of employees, fully equipped Bloody Mary Bar!  The menu has something for everyone if you go let me know! Enjoy

AV16ssqxkpJcTBjYdv6saQ.text: Super breakfast!  Friendly staff.  Awesome Bloody Mary bar. Would go there again. Great location!

PTIdALLIuiZ-chUykfmgoA.text: This place was such an amazing place to have me and my girlfriend bday brunch. Bonnie was such a pleasure she was so lively and fun. The host were so sweet and amazing. Will definitely be back to visit. Great mimosa and Dj !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hash Kitchen - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bNsOPlGuwhxnMXFrWGlP_A.text: Not bad, but I wonder if more hype then substance.  The hashes are mostly potatoes and onions with a little protein and a couple eggs.  Stay away from the blue crab or smoked salmon hashes, both are very fishy and dry.  Was hoping it was lox type salmon but sadly it is not.  Bloody Mary bar is cool idea, but a bit of a process just to be able to get your drink.  Was a long wait at the BMary bar.    Be prepared for LOUD environment, especially after the dj starts.

wtdYu-f-frDHl4EkAAgZgg.text: Great spot for brunch. The food is solid and fun. DJ and a huge bloody Mary bar. Get there early or be prepared to wait.
